title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Work where every moment matters.
Every day, almost 20,000 Hartford HealthCare employees come to work with one thing in common: Pride in what we do, knowing every moment matters here. We invite you to become part of Connecticut's most comprehensive healthcare network.
The creation of the HHC System Support Office recognizes the work of a large and growing group of employees whose responsibilities are continually evolving so that we and our departments now work on behalf of the system as a whole, rather than a single member organization.
With the creation of our new umbrella organization we now have our own identity with a unique payroll, benefits, performance management system, service recognition programs and other common practices across the system.

Department Description

The ITS Analytics department is responsible for the development and support of analytic solutions aimed at improving outcomes, efficiencies, costs and the patient experience.
The Business Intelligence Advisory team implements analytic tools and solutions, focused on understanding and meeting consumers' data needs across the enterprise.
The team works directly with other ITS Analytics teams, ITS departments, HHC's acute and ambulatory facilities, and key stakeholders throughout the system on key initiatives and daily support needs.

Position Summary

Assesses customer analytic needs and in partnership with ITS Business Partners, provides guidance on best possible course of action to address. Familiar with end-users workflows and well-versed in the complete catalog of ITS Analytics tools; able to align the customers business requirement with the analytic solutions most appropriate for meaningful, actionable intelligence.
Implements training and documentation solutions that enable business stakeholders to get the most out of self-service analytics tools.

Position Responsibilities
Work with businesses, process owners, and teammates to understand and drive solutions which solve business problems. This may include gathering requirements, prototyping potential solutions, or modifying existing work to meet new or changing needs through the use of development standards, processes, and available tools.
Consults with customers across HHC to understand business issues and develop reports and analyses that lead to actionable insights.
Runs audit reports and routines to understand customers' current analytics utilization, identifying opportunities to improve usage and leverage existing solutions where available.
Partners with ITS Training division to educate customers on best use of reports & dashboard solutions.
Maintains thorough understanding of healthcare and hospital terminology and industry trends and ideas for data analysis.
Provides support to troubleshoot any issues on Business Intelligence, Analytics and reporting solutions.
Bachelor's Degree required, Master's Degree in Business, IT, Healthcare Admin or related field preferred.
Minimum 5-7 years of experience in hospital or healthcare setting developing reports using Epic Reporting tools, MS SQL, Oracle, QlikView, Tableau or related tool.
Excellent interpersonal skills including written communication.
Highly analytical with ability to translate complex information into simpler terms and concepts.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.
Highly effective time management and organizational skills.
Must be committed to high performance and superb customer service.
Strong computer skills and knowledge. Highly proficient in Excel, Access, SQL, QlikView.
Must be self-motivated and self-directed.
Team player with ability to collaborate with others.
We take great care of careers.
With locations around the state, Hartford HealthCare offers exciting opportunities for career development and growth. Here, you are part of an organization on the cutting edge - helping to bring new technologies, breakthrough treatments and community education to countless men, women and children. We know that a thriving organization starts with thriving employees-- we provide a competitive benefits program designed to ensure work/life balance. Every moment matters. And this is your moment.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Description

KORE1, a nationwide provider of staffing and recruiting solutions, has an immediate opening for "Business Intelligence Analyst".

The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst within our IT/Data division is responsible for the data strategy, decisions and analytics to deliver accelerated growth and monetization through enhanced customer experiences with our products. We partner across multiple groups on digital product, advertising, and content to better engage our audiences across all devices and platforms. Through the solutions we deliver, our business can more effectively personalize content, direct marketing, and target advertising to consumers on tv, mobile, desktop, and streaming devices.

Duties Include, But Are Not Limited To

Manage daily/weekly/monthly analytics reporting to enable the business to operate transparently and efficiently while capitalizing on insights to track revenue success/opportunities

Support the preparation of weekly, monthly & quarterly reports for the different businesses & divisions, including consolidating KPIs and metrics across all of the businesses

Help design executive dashboards for data-informed decision making

Support BI Director in overall media strategy initiatives, including creation of comprehensive and cohesive presentations for senior-level review

Communication

Present findings to all appropriate audiences on a consistent basis via email, verbal, in-person, and other communication methods as deemed appropriate

Education/Experience

Bachelors Degree in Economics, Computer Science, Math, Physics, Engineering, or related quantitative field

Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities

Experience with Adobe Analytics, Business Intelligence Tools

Experience in conducting analyses to drive revenue impact and / or in strategic finance, corporate development, investment banking or consulting

Requirements

Experience with Tableau or other data visualization software

About Kore1

Specializing in creative and technical recruiting, KORE1 is committed to supporting top IT and Creative professionals in their career paths. We build deep relationships with leading companies, connecting them to exceptional talent every day. With extensive industry expertise and unmatched opportunities, our goal is to provide a unique experience for our contractors and consultants as they prepare for their next role. We are passionate about matching the right people with the right companies.

Kore1 provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Kore1 complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Kore1 expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status.Improper interference with the ability of Kore1's employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Responsibilities
Gathering and compiling data from various functional areas across the enterprise
Developing and maintaining metrics repository.
Report and dashboard creation and updating
Analyzing the information and building insights into root cause and impact.
Providing analysis on the information with a business mindset of “why”, “how” and “what”
Performing quality reviews on information (data/ report/ dashboard/ scorecard) built.
The Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible to improve the reporting process through automation and building of visual analytics.
Provide support for other functional areas related to ad-hoc requests, specific projects and initiatives.

Automation of consumption of non-standard source files like Excel, Access Database using Visual Basic and or Python
Development of Visualization Dashboards using Tableau
Ability to write advanced SQL
Understanding and awareness and prior experience of testing their developed Dashboards/ Automation
Three to five years of experience, preferably in business, analytics or operations
Three years of experience in Macro building, automation using Visual Basic / Access Database/ Excel.
Three years of experience with Business Intelligence tool (Tableau) or any open source reporting/ analytics tool).
One year of experience with developing worksheets, dashboards and stories in Tableau
Three years of experience in Macro building, automation using Visual Basic / Access Database/ Excel.
Ability to perform data and business analysis and translate analysis into operations and business impact.


Note: Qualified candidates will be contacted within 2 business days of application. If an applicant does not meet the above criteria, we will keep your resume on file for future opportunities and may contact you for further discussion.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
A business intelligence analyst is under the supervision of the CFO and will work closely with CIO and COO to perform data analysis, data design strategies, and standards for operations to inform management of the status of the business goals and business forecasting. Assists managers in making informed business decisions in order to sustain or improve business operations through pattern and trend analysis.. Performs detailed complex data analysis and extensive data research work providing results, monitoring and implementing data analysis to render a true picture of the Clinic’s performance and industry standing. The analyst will develop processes and design reports to accurately reflect the current business state of the Clinic. Supports proactive strategic planning.
Works with IT, Finance, and Operations to determine data base requirements by analyzing business operations, business objectives, and preparing data for business forecasting. Analyzes the Clinic's data and collection systems to identify performance gaps and problems with data quality. Provides engagement in problems solving, root cause analysis, and expedites implementation of high priority interventions.
Develops processes, assists with complicated problems; provides innovative solutions for improved business measures. Shares and communicates ideas and knowledge to members of the Senior Management team. Works closely with IT to initiate data base changes to develop and implement data models for new projects, grants to ensure new designs conform to the Clinic’s expectations, project/grant guidelines, and provide a current picture of Clinic’s operations.
Collects past and present data to establish trends in the Clinic’s operation. Data is analyzed and used with statistical tools to develop a projection on the outcome of implementing certain business strategies based on historical data helping identify the Clinic's strengths, weaknesses, threats and opportunities surrounding the Clinic. Continuously reviews, analyzes, and communicates operational measures to chart progress, patterns, and trends consistent with Clinic objectives.
Prepares concise, comprehensive technical reports to present and interpret data, identify alternatives, and make and justify recommendations on data revisions. Assists in developing data quality measures, analyzing data quality results and ensuring data quality improvement.
Responsible for their own safety as well as the safety of others.
Graduation from an accredited four year college or university with major coursework in data science, business analytics, computer science, computer information systems, accounting, statistics, and economics with 5 years’ experience in data analysis, research, compilation, and reporting data preference in the healthcare industry. Masters preferred with a minimum of three years’ experience as above

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
(We are not sponsoring for this role now or in the future)

People are at the core of Fareportal. We are one of the fastest growing travel technology companies in the world; our portfolio of travel brands, including flagship product CheapOair, receives over 100 million visitors annually.

We are seeking an Business Intelligence Analyst to extract and present meaningful data in order to understand our customers and drive opportunities to enhance customer experience and drive conversion. The ideal candidate will be responsible for performing data analysis and reporting to support strategic objectives. The right person will have a proven history of proactively addressing unasked questions through data and presenting solutions to top management in order to improve systems and processes.

Responsibilities
Analyze customer data from a variety of sources using database querying tools
Visualize data and generate insights to help improve the business
Support a wide variety of departments and product teams
Collaborate with the Product Owner to identify data sources of truth to support business decisions
Interface with entire IT Chapter (data science, BI, IT operations, IT engineering, IT Security)
Efficiently manage the backlog and delivery of analytical projects
Establish processes and SLA for Development & IT Chapters
Create and monitor real-time performance dashboards for key business metrics
Implement alerting systems to quickly identify issues, notify stakeholders, and coordinate to resolve the issues.
Requirement
BA degree, Computer Science, Information, engineering
Minimum 2-3 years' work or internship experience with business or data analysis
Data modeling, Statistical Analysis, Sensitivity analysis (Mathematical modeling)
Critical thinking and problem solving skills
Understanding of database structure, design, query languages (e.g. SQL), Advance Excel Skills
Relational databases and querying such as Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle Database, or MySQL
Experience with visualization and dashboard tools such as Power BI or Tableau
A Plus
Strong PowerPoint presentation skills
Experience with BI Reporting tools such as Tableau, PowerBi, Business Objects, and/or Microstrategy
Understanding of Google Analytics
Experience with Python or R

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Business Intelligence Analyst: 

Description

We build exciting data products and then we market them with passion. We're a fast-growing company that balances the culture of a startup with the stability of being an established, profitable company. We want to work with people that strive to be in the top .01% of their field. We understand that getting to the top takes hard work, constant improvement, and data-driven decision making. It's an exciting time to join the team, as we're expanding our product offerings in exciting new ways, driving innovation through data, marketing, and web & app development.

We believe in diversity and hiring people from all backgrounds and walks of life for the added perspective it gives our company (it also makes our company parties more exciting!). You must be energetic, inventive, a team player and looking to help build and grow the company each and every day. You must have an inner desire to win and the idea of losing is a non-starter. Please note, if you need direct supervision or constant instructions on what to do next, this position probably isn't for you. However, if you are looking for a position that allows you to work with a group of smart and dedicated people who will support you but still provide the autonomy you need to execute your strategy, then you should apply as soon as you're done reading this!

About the Job
We have an immediate opening for a business savvy BI Analyst who speaks the language of stakeholders and who can translate that vision into detailed reports with actionable plans. You will attack complex business questions with curiosity, diving deep to find the root cause and developing hypotheses to improve performance. You will provide data-driven decision support and business intelligence that is timely, accurate, and actionable. You can effectively communicate insights and results across the organization, at all levels. You will be expected to challenge the status quo and help steer the business towards innovative solutions. Our team is driven, passionate, creative, energetic, and fun. We love to challenge each other and ask hard questions, then figure out the answer and solve the problem together.

What You’ll Get to Do
Build and maintain operating models based on statistical analysis that drives our most important decisions
Produce dashboards and reports for various constituents
Perform analysis on large datasets to help answer a wide range of business questions
Monitor and track actual performance relative to projections
Draw conclusions from analyses and translate that into actionable business initiatives
Prepare presentations to management, board members, and investors
Ongoing competitive benchmarking
Partner with team members to understand and develop metrics relevant to each business segment
Identify areas for improvement and provide recommendations backed by data
Support special projects as needed

What You Bring to the Table
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, or similar quantitative field
2+ years of relevant work experience, ideally as an analyst at a management consulting firm or investment bank
Strong general business judgment and interest
High attention to detail and strong multi-tasking abilities
Ability to communicate and present findings in a clear and understandable way
Comfortable with ambiguity while balancing competing priorities
Understanding of subscription businesses and/or marketing driven businesses
Interest in working with large data sets
Strong knowledge of SQL and advanced Excel skills
Prior experience with Looker or other BI tools is a nice to have

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Business Intelligence Specialist
description:
Data Warehouse/Business Intelligence Specialist II

Our Data Warehouse (BI) Specialist II will be responsible for working in a small Agile BI team to develop top-to-bottom BI system solutions, with a specialty in ETL development and support using Microsoft SSIS and T-SQL. You will perform all development tasks for ETLs, including gathering ETL requirements; doing ETL design, coding, and testing; creating any necessary documentation; performing ETL deployments; and supporting live ETLs. You will also work with other BI specialists on the agile team, including analysts, BI architects, and front-end tool/report developers.

The role involves working directly with business stakeholders to create and gather BI requirements and negotiate BI solutions, while focusing on putting working reporting and stimulating solutions into the hands of our stakeholders.

A Successful Data Warehouse (BI) Specialist II Will

Work directly with business stakeholders and other agile IT team members, to create/gather BI requirements and negotiate BI solutions.
Design and develop complex BI solutions in an mid-size enterprise IT environment, from back-end components and processes, through-and-including front-end user-interaction components.
Work with other IT specialists as necessary, including other IT analysts, developers, database architects, and systems engineers.
Work with other BI architects and enterprise architects, to develop an overall BI technical strategy.
Perform thorough analysis of database, service, and file-based data sources, as a critical input to ETL design.
Create and modify SQL Server database artifacts, including tables, views, indexes, and stored procedures, using DDL. Create deployment scripts.
Create, manage, monitor, and optimize SSIS ETL packages. Manage and monitor job schedules.
Record BI requirements and design, utilizing industry-standard documentation techniques such as modeling.
Support live BI processes, including: a) creating/changing BI process schedules, and b) monitoring and troubleshooting BI processes, such as data loads, transformations, rollups, and reorganizations.

Required Experience Includes

Design and implement complex, multi-step ETLs using SSIS, pulling from multiple source systems and source types
Perform data profiling, data mapping, and data quality validation
Monitor live ETLs; tune and optimize ETL performance
Write SQL and develop stored procedures rapidly, using T-SQL
Troubleshoot and correct SSIS packages
Knowledge of data warehouse design concepts such as star and snowflake schema design, and slowly-changing dimensions
Utilize 3rd party products to facilitate ETL analysis and monitoring (preferred)

Professional Knowledge and Skills
Ability to clearly explain both business and technical concepts related to business intelligence management, verbally and in written and/or diagrammed form; strong motivation to negotiate, design, and implement practical BI solutions for all stakeholders
Ability to effectively manage BI work assorted with multiple projects going on in parallel, including working with many individuals in both varying technical and business roles; strong ability to work productively and happily in a typically stressful, modern corporate environment

Education/Experience
-Bachelor's degree, with a minimum of 5 years' industry experience in IT systems development.
-3 years of ETL development and support experience with SQL Server
-Multiple iterations of ETL, data store, and data cube development.
fMDdcFDagb

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
About Us

Venmo was founded on the principles of breaking down the intimidating barriers around financial transactions to make them intuitive, friendly, and even fun. And it worked: people love sending money with Venmo, and we’re growing by leaps and bounds!

But we’re only just getting started. We want to take that magic of sending money with Venmo and cascade it into every place where people use money. That means connecting people to their money in the most intuitive and fun way possible, then connecting people with each other. Users already love Venmo, but we know there are lots of things we haven’t thought of to make the experience of using Venmo even more delightful and valuable. All that’s going to take a lot of figuring out. Let’s figure it out together!

Business Intelligence at Venmo

We are looking for a BI Analyst who is responsible for processing data, developing reports and extracting actionable intelligence. He or she will work closely with the Business & Finance to build & optimize reports, & make drive informed / actionable insight to change the business trajectory. The ability to recognize and understand trends, collaborate with cross-functional teams and solve complex problems are key to success within this role.

Responsibilities
Collaborate with Senior Management to understand business intelligence needs, translating strategic business questions into resource/data requirements
Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions
Take dashboard requirements and transfer into rapidly developed prototypes and working solutions
Write Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) jobs to calculate business metrics
Own & manage Venmo’s BI tool & relationship with the 3p provider
Develop detailed data mapping and end-to-end process flows
Remain detail-oriented while working across a wide variety of projects
Collaborate with Data Analytics and Data Warehouse around data and table structures to optimize for KPI reporting
Be part of a great team, but be capable of operating independently - managing relationships, deliverables and expectations with your business partners


Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, or equivalent work experience
3+ years of relevant work experience in analytics, data engineering, business intelligence or related field
Experience using, writing and optimizing SQL queries in a business environment
Experience in business intelligence software (Tableau, Looker, Qlikview, MicroStrategy) and ETL software
Knowledge of data warehouse technical architecture, infrastructure components, ETL and reporting/analytic tools and environments


Preferred Qualifications
5+ years of experience using Looker
5+ years of experience in data visualization
Expert in data extraction using SQL
Strong analytical, problem solving and critical thinking paired with Intellectual curiosity and aptitude in picking up new technical skills
Ability to execute fast-paced and dynamic projects in a highly organized manner on a tight schedule
Work collaboratively across different functions and effectively influence senior business partners
Degree in Computer Science, IT, Math, Physics, Statistics, Engineering or quantitative field
Proficient with SQL(Postgres, MySQL, Redshift, Snowflake), Python
3+ years of relevant work experience in analytics, data engineering, business intelligence or related field
Strong communication and presentation skills necessary to build effective working relationships and positively influence decision making
Strong business acumen
Coding proficiency Python
Experience with AWS technologies including Redshift, RDS, S3, EMR

We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don't hesitate to apply.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Summary

Do you have a strong interest in digging into data to understand trends, tell the story and make recommendations? Safe Fleet is looking for a person who conceptualizes, designs, and produces visually compelling business intelligence (BI) analytics and reporting solutions using reporting tools, applications, and queries or scripts. These applications provide leaders and associates with business insights for critical decision making. If you are technically-minded, highly detailed and strive for data accuracy, then this position is for you.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities
Monitor historical and real-time performances of key metrics to detect report anomalies.
Review and analyze large datasets from multiple ERP Sources to understand drivers and outliers while maintaining context of big picture.
Identifies critical connections and patterns in information/data.
Draws logical conclusions based on in-depth analysis of information.
Develop and modify reports, verify information integrity and designs BI dashboards, scorecards, charts/graphs, drill-downs, and dynamic reports to meet new information needs.
Collaborate regularly with various teams, including Finance, Accounting, and Purchasing.
Review and validate customer and vendor data as it is collected.
Oversee the deployment of data to the data warehouse and develop policies and procedures for the collection and utilization of data.
Display strong communication skills to solicit the requirements and communicate with non-technical business stakeholders effectively.
Expand knowledge of Business Intelligence to provide ongoing refinement of processes to improve operations while creating training material for the reporting tools.
Educate and train users on best practices.
Own responsibility for the governance (standards and documentation) of solutions developed.
Understand the business stakeholders' objectives, the metrics that are most important to them, and how they measure their performance.
What makes you a great fit?
Let's talk about your data mining experience. Let's discuss the types of reports you've run and what you did with that valuable data.

Preferred Requirements
Experience with Tableau and SQL, creating and altering views, functions and stored procedures, is preferred but not required.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Management, Economics, MIS, Statistics, Computer Science, or similar field.
Experience with business intelligence tools such as Tableau.
Experience with business system analysis or data analytics/business intelligence requirements gathering.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to simplify complex concepts and messages to the essential components and deliver effective messages to a wide range of audiences.
Strong desire to learn and continuously grow the impact of the role.
Self-starter, well organized, extremely detail-oriented and a highly collaborative team member.
Experience writing specifications and/or user stories utilizing graphical user interface concepts and process maps that are clear, concise and well organized.
Highly effective time and project management skills, including ability to coordinate development, testing and implementation.
Able to thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
Experience documenting technical processes.
Physical Demands
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, sit or walk and occasionally lift up to 25lbs. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Work Environment
The noise level in the work environment is usually low or moderate.
Safe Fleet does not discriminate in hiring or employment on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, marital status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, disability, ancestry veteran status or any other status protected by law.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
ASRC Federal Mission Services' focus is on technical and complex, mission-oriented services with contracts supporting federal government agencies. Our team of scientists and professional management personnel allows us to bring real-world experience to meet the growing demand for solutions to some of the most complex problems in aviation, IT management, and Earth and Space sciences. We are seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to support a government contract in Arlington, VA.

Responsibilities
Use data to assess market and business trends to improve efficiency in IT and customer support services
Disseminate information regarding tools, reports, or metadata enhancements
Conduct or coordinate tests to ensure intelligence is consistent with defined needs
Synthesize current business intelligence or trend data to support recommendations for action
Manage timely flow of business intelligence information to users
Identify and analyze industry or geographic trends with business strategy implications
Maintain a library of model documents, templates, or other reusable business assets
Define configuration specifications and business analysis requirements
Perform quality assurance
Own and develop relationship with partners, working with them to optimize and enhance our integration
Help design, document and maintain system processes
Communicate key insights and findings to product team
Constantly be on the lookout for ways to improve monitoring, discover issues and deliver better value to the customer


Requirements

Qualifications:
Previous experience in Business / Systems Analysis or Quality Assurance
Proven experience in eliciting requirements and testing
Experience in analyzing data to draw business-relevant conclusions and in data visualization techniques and tools
Solid experience in writing SQL queries
Basic knowledge in generating process documentation
Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills


Education

A BS/BA or equivalent, and at least six (6) years' experience in the field.

Minimum Public Trust Required.

Must be a US Citizen to meet contract requirements.

ASRC Federal and its Subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

description:

Vinings, GA 30339
3-month Contract-to-Hire

As a BI Analyst, you'll be responsible for developing data solutions in conjunction with key initiatives driven by the different business groups within the organization. You'll be working directly with SQL and Tableau, as well as other tools that are being used in conjunction to make data understandable to non-IT colleagues.
  Requirements:
Minimum of 1 year of advanced SQL development and troubleshooting experience.

  Objectives:

Functions as a liaison between the client, community, and internal IT and/or external software vendors to develop system solutions to processing systems or business problems.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
FiveBy is a high-end anti-fraud and online security consultancy headquartered in Seattle with operations across the United States.

We are a motivated group of specialized professionals united under the mission to provide the programs, services, and expertise our clients need to protect their products and customers. With the ever-increasing risk of security breaches, identity fraud, espionage, online attacks, and other nefarious activities by bad actors, there has never been a better time to join the fight against online crime.

We're on the search for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our ranks. This position will embed with our existing client-site team in Menlo Park and will be responsible for supporting anti-fraud operations by identifying, cleaning, and extracting data to provide insightful reports on patterns and trends within the fraud space. If you're looking for the opportunity to work in a collaborative environment within the anti-fraud space, this could be just the right opportunity for you!

This role is seated with our client in Menlo Park. This is not a remote or work-from-home position.

This Position Will Be Responsible For
Identifying appropriate datasets needed for decision making
Building processes for data extraction, cleaning, analysis, and visualization
Building effective and insightful dashboards and reports for decision makers across business groups
Collecting, analyzing, and reporting on complex and often disparate data
Complex problem solving, including the ability to see connections between available data and user behavior
Formulating recommendations based on findings and expertise, and communicating with decision makers across seniority levels

Requirements For This Role Include
A Bachelor's Degree or higher
4+ years of full-time work experience in business analytics
High level of proficiency in SQL and Python
High level of proficiency in Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, or similar
Prior experience in large data enterprise environments
Familiar with data pipeline and assessment of data integrity

Preferred Qualifications
Experience in the anti-fraud/anti-piracy space

Successful FiveBy Consultants Also Have
Adaptable communication skills
An entrepreneurial spirit
A passion for collaborative problem solving, continuous learning, and team success
FiveBy is an equal opportunity employer.

All employment decisions – including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge – are based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Work environment and physical demands

In order to perform this role, the selected employee must be able to operate within a standard office environment, with or without reasonable accommodation. This includes the ability to withstand long periods of staring at a computer screen, exposure to fluorescent lights, and repetitive motion associated with writing and/or continuous computer use. This role requires the ability to stand or sit for long periods of time, communicate with others via speech or text, and use hands or other tools to operate a computer and keyboard. Light to moderate lifting may be required. Due to the nature of our work, employees must be able to uphold the stress of traveling to client sites as well as adapt (within reason) to the conditions of client sites. Regular, predictable attendance is required, as is the ability to work outside of standard business hours as business needs dictate.

Accommodation

If you require accommodation due to a documented disability covered under the Americans Disability Act, click here to submit your accommodation request. To be eligible for accommodation under the ADA, applicants must meet the minimum qualifications of the position for which they are applying.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
We Are Hiring

Business Intelligence Analyst

Ministry Service Center - Indianapolis, IN

Why Join Ascension?

The Ascension Ministry Service Center (MSC) provides business services for all of Ascension so that front-line associates can focus on what matters most - caring for patients. Some of the services include payroll, benefits, accounts payable and accounting. Over the years, the Ministry Service Center has matured into a central hub of teams providing innovative support to associates across Ascension. Teams at the MSC are often the go-to source for complex transformations, enterprise-wide projects, new services and other work that involves understanding the complexities of a large multi-state organization.

Ascension is a faith-based healthcare organization dedicated to transformation through innovation across the continuum of care. As one of the leading non-profit and Catholic health systems in the U.S., Ascension is committed to delivering compassionate, personalized care to all, especially to those most in need. In FY2018, Ascension provided nearly $2 billion in care of persons living in poverty and other community benefit programs.

What You Will Do

As an Associate with Ascension, you will have the opportunity to analyze data sets using BI tools to identify and document opportunities for improvements within the Ministry Service Center (MSC).

Responsibilities
Develop and deliver business intelligence content in Tableau and SQL Server Reporting Services
Translate business needs into complex SQL statements to extract data
Analyzes large business data sets to understand past, current and future trends and communicate in a format explainable to end user to help make business decisions.
Creates and executes scheduled and ad hoc queries, reports, and dashboards.
Works with MSC business areas to understand and explain business and technical issues by mining unfamiliar data and providing or recommending viable solutions.
Serves as a resource for the MSC to document, recommend, design, create and implement solutions for small to complex business issues.
Applies continuous improvement and project management processes, policies, procedures and internal control standards.
Maintains work instructions for all defined activities within the analytics team.

What You Will Need

Education:
High school diploma/GED with 2 years of experience, or Associate's degree, or Bachelor's degree required.

Experience
Working experience of SQL Server and writing T/PL SQL preferred
Working experience building Tableau visualizations and dashboards preferred
Python and/or R knowledge a plus
Experience with large ERP system such as PeopleSoft, SAP or Lawson preferred

Equal Employment Opportunity

Ascension Ministry Service Center is an EEO/AA employer: M/F/Disabled/Vet.

For further information regarding your EEO rights, click on the following link to the “EEO is the Law” poster:

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Livly is transforming the multi-family living experience via connected digital products. This means we are generating and analyzing more data in this industry than ever before.

We are seeking a Business IntelligenceBusiness Intelligence Analyst to join our team and lead our efforts to be a cohesive source of knowledge for the organization. Livly has an expansive product portfolio as well as a diverse set of teams. Data will sit in the center of all of these products and teams to unite the business under an umbrella of knowledge, insights, and recommendations. This is a rare opportunity to influence and shape the data analytics foundation for an early-stage startup.

The ideal person for this role can apply an analytical framework to any problem, and is driven to solve those problems via experimentation, data collection, and prediction. This person is motivated to drive business and product outcomes via actionable and convincing data.

Who we are: Livly is an operating system for all digital and physical experiences in buildings across the world. Our mission is to create joy through great technology and services - one building, person and digital experience at a time.

What You'll Do In This Role
Work with the Product team to identify opportunities to improve and enhance our technology products.
Be responsible for an organizational data framework that creates a single source of truth to serve multiple internal clients.
Use statistical and inferential methods to derive insights from quantitative data.
Work with stakeholders to formulate quantitative and measurable objectives that have an impact on the business.
Formulate and refine questions, and explore data to discover meaningful relationships or insights.
Develop experimentation methodology; and launch, monitor, and evaluate experiments and A/B tests.
Create and maintain dashboards and reports to aid in product monitoring and optimization.


You'll Love This Role If You're
A problem solver. You have the ability to break down complex business needs to formulate actional insight for our senior managers to act upon.
A strong communicator. You have exceptional written and verbal communication skills with the ability to effectively negotiate with internal and external business partners.
Organized and detail oriented. You have great follow through on tasks and superior organization skills. You have incredible time management skills and don't get overwhelmed easily.


What You Bring To This Role
3+ years of experience (5+ preferred) in quantitative analysis or data science
Strong problem solving skills, with experience breaking down a large problem into smaller, solvable components
Strong skills in data extraction and transformation with SQL
Strong skills in reporting and answering data questions with Excel
Familiar with data exploration, analysis, and visualization with Python or R
Familiar with BI and data visualization tools like Looker, Chartio, or Tableau
Experience with behavioral analytics for software products using tools like Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Localytics, Amplitude
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; with the ability to communicate the results of your work in convincing ways
Strong collaboration skills with both technical and non-technical groups
Ability to initiate and own projects from inception to delivery


What Livly Offers You
The opportunity to be creative, make an impact, and grow professionally while working in a collaborative, high-energy environment.
Competitive salary and great benefits. We cover 80% of Medical Premiums, and offer dental, vision, and commuter benefits.
Fun perks like snacks in office, wellness initiatives, team events, and Livly gear.

As Business Intelligence Analyst, you will have a high degree of ownership and responsibility to inform some of the company's biggest decisions. You will be a change agent who is passionate about data, analytics, and communicating insights to bring hidden narratives and ideas to life.

You will mine and analyze data from our platform (including user interactions, search habits, product usage, marketplace, and transaction data), customer attributes, and marketing campaigns, and use our BI system to build dashboards, conduct analyses, and summarize insights to drive decisions. Your work will span the organization, working with teams such as Marketing, Customer Success, Sales, and Product Management. Success in this role will come from being a creative, highly quantitative, and details-obsessed person who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.

Core Responsibilities
Acquire, compile, and use data from a variety of sources to influence strategy and inform decisions across the company.
Lead analytics for the Marketing team through reporting, dashboards, and statistical analyses, and capture insights from marketing campaign data.
Support Sales and Customer Success by studying product usage patterns, proactively identifying customers who may be under-utilizing products or functionality, and identifying new customers.
Support Product Management team by collecting and analyzing data on user behavior to uncover value drivers and recommend product improvement opportunities.
Help define metrics/KPIs for new product features and build automated dashboards that can display those KPIs for internal stakeholders.
Steer the functionality of our data and analytics product.
Help ideate and analyze A/B testing experiments to increase efficiency with marketing campaigns and improve user experience within our products
Go beyond the data and analysis to propose concrete business decisions and next steps, and coordinate this across departments with strong interpersonal skills, and an ability to portray complicated subjects to a variety of audiences.

Core Requirements / Capabilities
Powerful SQL skills. Much of the data on our platform is accessible in our SQL environment.
Data exploration skills. You will need to be able create your own data sets, run queries, and look for insights within very different types of data.
Ability to build automated dashboards. Delivering key metrics is core to this role, along with the ability to learn a business intelligence platform and work within it.
Strong communication skills. Communicating your insights to teams across the company the key deliverable of this role.
Basic business acumen. Understanding the bigger picture is critical to asking the right questions before an analysis and providing insights afterwards.
High degree of ownership, initiative, and independence. You will have freedom to explore and run with the ball in this role and will often be asked to independently execute on projects.
2+ years in an analytical role. Having prior experience within marketing or business intelligence will greatly accelerate your success in this role.
Bachelor's Degree. Preferably in a quantitative field, with track record of high achievement.
Data visualization skills. Experience with Sisense, Power BI, Tableau, Looker, or similar visualization tools, and the ability to transform the results of SQL queries into results that non-technical people can understand.
Data manipulation skills using Python/R. We will have some projects that SQL/Excel can't handle.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Business Intelligence Analyst

United States>New Jersey>Jersey City
Introduction

American Express Global Business Travel (GBT) is a global leader in business travel and meetings management committed to helping business succeed through cost-effective program management, world-class customer service, and enhanced traveller productivity support worldwide. Global Business Consulting (GBC) brings the talent, tools, and management consulting acumen needed to help manage companies’ T&E spend and maximize the return on their investments in employee travel and other areas of indirect cost. Specialized expertise includes: T&E policy, sourcing and supplier management, change management and compliance management, business intelligence, on-going travel category management, payment and expense reimbursement management, and related business process outsourcing (BPO) best practices.

Job Summary

Business Intelligence Analyst is a role for executing BI projects across GBC Client base. With its modern, interactive Tableau based BI platform, this person will be responsible for implementation of new projects within timeline stipulated, communication on project status, providing training and support, develop new features and troubleshooting any issues faced by users internally or on client side.

The BI Analystwill be an integral part of the GBC Business Intelligence focused on supporting the data and analytical needs. The BI analystmust have the ability to understand complex data, create analysis and visualization using Tableau.

Primary Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To
Implementation of new BI projects on GBC online platform,
Execute multiple parallel projects ensuring appropriate prioritization to meet stipulated timeline
Develop insightful and action orientated dashboards using Tableau
Internal / client user training and support including technical support on dashboards / website
Provide suggestions to enhance current reporting capability to meet future business needs
Develop documentation for new projects


Qualifications Include
3 years minimum professional experience
Bachelor’s degree in statistics, data analytics or similar discipline
Experience in executing multiple client deliverables in parallel within strict timelines
Experience developing dashboards with complex and large dataset using BI tools
Tableau (mandatory) – minimum 2 years developing dashboards
Alteryx (desirable)
Birst (added advantage)
Power BI (added advantage)
Ability to understand current processes and make appropriate recommendations for changes
Excellent written / verbal communication skills and strong business communication skills.
Must be results driven, taking the lead with little supervision as well as working closely with multiple teams
Ability to work against tight deadlines with colleagues in a global team environment
Strong analytical and project management skills with demonstrated ability to prioritize track and deliver results.

Location
United States>New Jersey>Jersey City
It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals based on job-related qualifications and ability to perform a job, without regard to age, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, creed, national origin, disability, genetic information, veteran status, citizenship or marital status, and to maintain a non-discriminatory environment free from intimidation, harassment or bias based upon these grounds.

Posted 30+ Days Ago Full time J-42115

American Express Global Business Travel (GBT) is the world’s leading business partner for managed travel. We help companies and employees prosper by making sure travelers are present where and when it matters. We keep global business moving with the powerful backing of 16,000 travel professionals in more than 140 countries. Companies of all sizes, and in all places, rely on GBT to provide travel management services, organize meetings and events, and deliver business travel consulting.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Description

Work where every moment matters.

Every day, almost 20,000 Hartford HealthCare employees come to work with one thing in common: Pride in what we do, knowing every moment matters here. We invite you to become part of Connecticut’s most comprehensive healthcare network.

The creation of the HHC System Support Office recognizes the work of a large and growing group of employees whose responsibilities are continually evolving so that we and our departments now work on behalf of the system as a whole, rather than a single member organization.

With the creation of our new umbrella organization we now have our own identity with a unique payroll, benefits, performance management system, service recognition programs and other common practices across the system.

Department Description

The ITS Analytics department is responsible for the development and support of analytic solutions aimed at improving outcomes, efficiencies, costs and the patient experience.

The Business Intelligence Advisory team implements analytic tools and solutions, focused on understanding and meeting consumers’ data needs across the enterprise.

The team works directly with other ITS Analytics teams, ITS departments, HHC’s acute and ambulatory facilities, and key stakeholders throughout the system on key initiatives and daily support needs.

Position Summary

Assesses customer analytic needs and in partnership with ITS Business Partners, provides guidance on best possible course of action to address. Familiar with end-users workflows and well-versed in the complete catalog of ITS Analytics tools; able to align the customers business requirement with the analytic solutions most appropriate for meaningful, actionable intelligence.
Implements training and documentation solutions that enable business stakeholders to get the most out of self-service analytics tools.

Position Responsibilities

Work with businesses, process owners, and teammates to understand and drive solutions which solve business problems. This may include gathering requirements, prototyping potential solutions, or modifying existing work to meet new or changing needs through the use of development standards, processes, and available tools.
Consults with customers across HHC to understand business issues and develop reports and analyses that lead to actionable insights.
Runs audit reports and routines to understand customers’ current analytics utilization, identifying opportunities to improve usage and leverage existing solutions where available.
Partners with ITS Training division to educate customers on best use of reports & dashboard solutions.
Maintains thorough understanding of healthcare and hospital terminology and industry trends and ideas for data analysis.
Provides support to troubleshoot any issues on Business Intelligence, Analytics and reporting solutions.

Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree required, Master’s Degree in Business, IT, Healthcare Admin or related field preferred.
Minimum 5-7 years of experience in hospital or healthcare setting developing reports using Epic Reporting tools, MS SQL, Oracle, QlikView, Tableau or related tool.
Excellent interpersonal skills including written communication.
Highly analytical with ability to translate complex information into simpler terms and concepts.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.
Highly effective time management and organizational skills.
Must be committed to high performance and superb customer service.
Strong computer skills and knowledge. Highly proficient in Excel, Access, SQL, QlikView.
Must be self-motivated and self-directed.
Team player with ability to collaborate with others.
We take great care of careers.

With locations around the state, Hartford HealthCare offers exciting opportunities for career development and growth. Here, you are part of an organization on the cutting edge – helping to bring new technologies, breakthrough treatments and community education to countless men, women and children. We know that a thriving organization starts with thriving employees-- we provide a competitive benefits program designed to ensure work/life balance. Every moment matters. And this is your moment.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Kinsley Power Systems is seeking a Business Intelligence Anaylst/Application Developer. Candidates will be expected to create process improvement in all departments in conjunction with the responsible department individuals through the creation of meaningful and actionable visualizations using Microsoft’s suite of BI and database tools. This includes design, development, testing, maintenance and support of all company applications with focus on ERP and CRM. This position is also responsible for the support and maintenance of legacy .net and C# applications. As a member of a small team, this individual will be a critical technical resource supporting all levels and departments within the company.
 Duties and Responsibilities:
 Application Support 25%
Administer production databases and processes including maintenance related tasks and activities.
Administer Microsoft Dynamics 365 for Sales including user setup and support, workflow setup and customization maintenance.
Work within the data team to strive for greater functionality and efficiency in the company’s data systems.
Participate in after-hours maintenance to update, change, and install various systems as needed.
Create, update and contribute to technical and self-help documents that are maintained in the IT Knowledgebase.
Effectively communicate and interact with business and technical stakeholders to solve complex data related business and technical problems.
 Application Development 20%
Test and develop new application tools / releases.
Design SQL views, stored procedures and functions as needed.
Query data from source databases using SQL and develop and maintain automated data processes for daily/weekly/monthly reporting.
 Business Intelligence (BI) 45%
Build analytics tools to provide actionable insights into key business performance metrics using Power BI.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders to deliver clear and well-thought out dashboards and data visualizations.
Analyze BI system-related problems and opportunities.
Work with developers of the BI system.
Train business users on best practices for leveraging reports and dashboards.
Continue to improve visualization development skills and perpetually seek training and additional knowledge.
 Other Support 10%
Work on a collaborative team to support information technology throughout the company.
Provide mentoring and support to end users.
Be open and willing to sharing knowledge with the rest of the team.
Attend departmental meetings and present findings and data.
Periodically travel to branch sites to provide user support.
All other duties as assigned.
  Qualifications:

Required Skills
3 Years of experience with Microsoft Business Intelligence (BI) Stack (experience with similar BI tools considered).
3 years of experience with Microsoft SQL Server development (2008 thru 2016).
2 years of experience developing within Microsoft Office applications, namely Excel or Access.
2 years of experience developing with C#.
2 years of experience developing with .net.

Desired Skills
Experience with XML, Web Services, HTML, VB.NET, VB Script, VBA or similar programming language.
Experience with Dynamics GP ERP.
Experience with Dynamics 365 for Sales.
  Education:
Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or related major.
  Examples of Projects – Measures of Success:
 A/R Analysis – Provide business stakeholders and customer relationship managers real-time visibility in to the accounts receivable to minimize A/R volume/age and maximize cash flow. Create connections to raw data and assist users with analytical methodologies available in Power BI.
 Job Cost Analysis – Empower sales team to analyze job costing by providing a base BI file with initial query and assisting with visualizations.

Operations efficiency management – Assist Operations Director and Managers with access to ERP data necessary to manage the day to day management of technicians and service jobs. Convert information formerly obtained through smartlist into BI accessible visualizations.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Business Intelligence Analyst
Job Type: Full-Time, Part-Time
Job Level: Entry - Senior
Travel: Varies by role

Location 920 Frostwood,Houston,TX 77024 Facility Medical Plaza North Category Nursing Type Full time Requisition 100087537

At Memorial Hermann, we’re about creating exceptional experiences for both our patients and our employees. Our goal is to provide opportunities for our diverse employee population that develop and grow careers in a team-oriented environment focused on patient care.

Every employee, at every level, begins their journey at Memorial Hermann learning about the history of the organization and its established culture built on trust and integrity. Our employees drive this culture, and we want you to be a part of it.

Job Summary

This role will provide Memorial Hermann Health System (MHSS) executives and Service line leaders the information and tools required to make efficient data-based decisions on identified challenges. These challenges include but are not limited to population health, clinical outcomes, consumer experience, and operational effectiveness. This role will be tasked to become competent about the business of the respective Service Line while transforming data and information into actionable insights that answer complex business questions. The role will aid service line leaders to discover opportunities as well as conceive and implement new metrics for parts of the respective service line.
This role will be responsible for understanding the respective service line, collating, organizing, normalizing and visualizing service line data from disparate sources and performing descriptive/diagnostic analytics as well as some statistical analysis.

Job Description

Minimum Qualifications

Education:Bachelor’s or Advanced degree (Industrial Psychology, Data Sciences, Computer Science, Business Administration, Statistics or Anthropology) required.

Licenses/Certifications: Associate Certified Analytics Professional (aCAP) or another vendor-neutral analytics certification preferred

Experience / Knowledge / Skills
Three (3) years of professional experience collaborating with customers on the creation and execution of an analytics and business intelligence vision and roadmap
Experience in building analytic reports, dashboards and tools for end-customer, self-service decision-making and action metric monitoring
Demonstrated experience working in a dynamic, matrixed organization with executive exposure
Advanced proficiency with the following tools: MS Office Suite: Excel (Pivot tables, VBA, Macros), Word, PowerPoint, Visio, Access; Visualization tools – Tableau (preferred), Sisense, Qlik or Microsoft PowerBI; Statistical tools - R Studio, SAS or other statistical tools for data analysis.
Creative problem solver mentality with an ability to influence without authority
Analytic mindset able to draw conclusions from raw data and summarize results efficiently using logic and reasoning to identify approaches to problems
Exceptional time management skills and attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, specifically an ability to communicate effectively across multiple management levels
Proven ability to work independently and as part of a team under established deadlines to drive critical outcomes.
Create a positive work environment that fosters successful team performance.
Strong customer service, interpersonal and relationship-building skills
Demonstrates commitment to the Partners-in-Caring process by integrating our culture in all internal and external customer interactions; delivers on our brand promise of “we advance health” through innovation, accountability, empowerment, collaboration, compassion and results while ensuring one Memorial Hermann.

Principal Accountabilities
Ongoing interactions with domain experts within the organization to enhance own knowledge of business and clinical processes and applications utilized by the respective service line clients
Partner with respective clinical and operational service line clients to design, develop and implement the roadmap for analytics and reporting to provide actionable operational, strategic and tactical metrics for optimal service line management
In Partnership with the Enterprise Analytics team, determine the strategy to evolve MHHS Analytics maturity level from descriptive to diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive outcomes
Collaborate with the Information System Division to develop the data architecture strategy, implementation plan and customer-delivered toolset
Active participant of the MHHS Data Governance Stewardship process
Perform regular and ad-hoc analysis to produce user-friendly reports and visualizations for executive and client review
Continuous improvement of existing processes to detect data anomalies as well as analyze and distribute information by incorporating new techniques, initiatives and technologies
Provide support from problem analysis through resolution to correct deficiencies within analytic, reporting and visualization applications
Attend national conferences and further training to build skill sets and analytic proficiency to ensure MHHS remains on the cutting edge of the Healthcare industry
Key member of the project team responsible for training new analytic professionals to meet the established standard
Ensures safe care to patients, staff and visitors; adheres to all Memorial Hermann policies, procedures, and standards within budgetary specifications including time management, supply management, productivity and quality of service
Promotes individual professional growth and development by meeting requirements for mandatory/continuing education and skills competency; supports department-based goals which contribute to the success of the organization; serves as preceptor, mentor and resource to less experienced staff
Other duties as assigned

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
CheckAlt is seeking to hire a Business Intelligence Analyst in our Valley Cottage, New York location.

The Business Intelligence Analyst Will
Provide support to senior executive decision makers by analyzing pricing, completing routine business reviews and developing various dashboards and reports.
Compile and analyze data and present trending results for leadership to develop action plans for solution implementation
Analyze client metrics to evaluate billing accuracy. Measure, benchmark and evaluate service and product utilization, margins and profitability
Create or develop standard business intelligence tools, systems, methodologies and procedures for data and information collection and outputs
Create adhoc analytics projects to support leadership where required
Work extensively in Quickbooks to assist in a variety of functions, including reporting and analytics
Be comfortable using Salesforce to design and improve upon workflows

Requirements

Requirements
Experience with Power BI or other business intelligence software a must
Experience working with MS Excel utilizing pivot tables, macros, formulas and report formatting
Experience working with a CRM (Salesforce experience is a plus)
Experience working with Quickbooks a plus
Experience working with large data sets, data modeling and creating reports and dashboards
An analytical mind and inclination for problem solving
Minimum 2 years of experience with an emphasis on business analytics, business intelligence, financial analysis or similar business functions
You must be able to commute to this location.
Only US citizens or those eligible to work in the US will be considered for this position.

About Us

CheckAlt is the largest independent provider of treasury and receivables management solutions in the country. Our client base includes hundreds of financial institutions, including top tier banks, regional and local banks and credit unions.

CheckAlt assists financial institutions in more efficiently processing their deposit items from all capture points within the bank, credit union or fromt their corporate clients. We enable banks to attract and retain business customers with innovative white label payment solutions. Additionally, we offer easy-to-integrate APIs for mobile and web developers that want to accept customer payments. Products include eChecks, Item Processing, Remote Deposit Capture (RDC), Mobile Capture, Mobile Payments, eCommerce, Lockbox Services, Bill Payments, Duplicate Detection, Statement Rendering, and Electronic Bill Presentment.

CheckAlt acquired the ERAS subsidiary from Diebold, Inc. in 2014 and Klik Technologies, Corp. from MUFG Union Bank in 2016. CheckAlt is headquartered in Los Angeles, CA with regional headquarters in New York and Florida, and has approximately 300 employees in about 14 locations nationwide.

We offer our eligible employees benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life, disability and 401K.

For more information, visit http://www.checkalt.com.

description:

Guitar Center embodies the world of creativity and music by encouraging our teammates to find their own individual sound. title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE 

The Business Intelligence Analyst applies an analytical mind to complex business problems and internal/external data to give insight to key decision-makers in Marketing and other teams. By interpreting data to discover patterns and identify trends, he/she will be able to create reports that will be used in strategic planning. 

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING  

Analyzes complex business problems and issues using data from internal and external sources to provide insight to decision-makers.
Identifies and interprets trends and patterns in datasets to locate influences.
Constructs forecasts, recommendations and strategic/tactical plans based on business data and market knowledge.
Creates specifications for reports and analysis based on business needs and required or available data elements.
May provide consultation to users and lead cross-functional teams to address business issues.
May directly produce datasets and reports for analysis using system reporting tools.
Developing professional expertise, he/she applies company policies and procedures to resolve a variety of issues.
Works on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors.
Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action.
Builds productive internal/external working relationships.

Qualifications:

Proficient SQL, R, Tableau or another BI tool skills 
Advanced degree in Data Analytics/Computer Science and/or prior work experience in Business Intelligence-type Finance function preferred.
Typically requires a Bachelor's degree and a minimum of 2 years of related experience; or an advanced degree without experience; or equivalent work experience.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Description

The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for the implementation of Business Intelligence solutions and data warehouse design. The position will play a key role in our growing IT department, providing access to high quality information that will allow the business to make relevant decisions.

Requirements
Designing and developing enterprise wide data analysis and reporting solutions.
Reviewing and analyzing data from multiple internal and external sources.
Communicating analysis results and making recommendations to senior management.
Developing data cleansing rules for the company.
Accountable for development and ongoing maintenance/enhancements of reports and business intelligence solutions.
Collaborates with key business resources on requirements gathering, solution design, configuration, testing, user acceptance, implementation, and documentation of business processes in multiple functional areas.
Define, document, design, code, test and deploy workflows, reports, integrations, customization, enhancements and forms primarily using specific tools for the required platform.
Ability to analyze business requirements, review existing systems, define the solution, and translate that into detailed programming designs.
Capable of effectively communicating with internal and external customers possessing various levels of technical knowledge. Ability to determine the underlying issue when presented with sometimes ambiguous and/or contradictory information; demonstrate good listening skills.
Ability to quickly solve/determine problems working with technical/non-technical groups in areas that may not be primary area of expertise.
Able to create use test scenarios to validate developments.
Capable of estimating development effort for timeline purposes.
Keeps up-to-date with new platform programming developments to ensure that functionality is implemented in the optimal manner.
Production support in multiple functional areas of the system involving expedient and effective communications with users, research/analysis, resolution - providing recommendations to management, customers and peers - and closing help tickets.
Ensure that tickets are closed according to SLA pre-defined.
Responsible for basic configuration of systems modules.
Responsible for root cause analysis and providing solutions for production and development issues.

Additional Tasks
Develop standard reports and functional dashboards
Maintain business intelligence models to design, develop and generate standard and ad-hoc reports
Generate reports for internal and external customers for business performance monitoring and business decision making.
Ensure the generation and delivery of quality reports to customers in timely and accurate manner.
Manage new report generation and report enhancement based on the change requests.
Perform data warehouse design and modelling according to established standards.
Determine business intelligence and data warehousing solutions to meet business needs.
Recommend improvements to provide optimum reporting solutions.
Stay updated with business operations and business intelligence processes.
Conduct training programs and knowledge transfer sessions to junior developers when needed.
Develop and update technical documentation.
Database design and development (Microsoft SQL Server)

Education, Skills And Experience
Bachelor degree in computer science, information systems or engineering.
Work experience with database queries, stored procedure writing, Online Analytical Processing (OLAP) and data cube technology.
Strong background in all aspects of database technology, with an emphasis on the use of analytical and reporting tools.
Minimum 5 years of experience as Business Intelligence Analyst. Good knowledge of integration between Bolton systems, SAP ERP system and Business Intelligence tools.
Experience with Business Intelligence software implementation (e.g. Microsoft Power BI, SAP BI,QlikView, Tableau).
General understanding of Software Development Life Cycle and Agile methodologies.
In-depth understanding of database management systems, online analytical processing (OLAP) and ETL (Extract, transform, load) framework.
Knowledge of SQL queries, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS).
Background with SAP partner applications and their integrations to SAP:
Experience in full development life cycle - all areas and phases of the SDLC.
Prefer experience with SAP Business Objects BI Suite.
Prefer experience with Crystal Reports and the SAP Integration Kit.
Deep understanding of business process flows in Sales & Distribution, Materials Management and Finance areas, including master data setup, and standard SAP order to cash processes in a distribution environment.
As part of the application process, please complete this short assessment (follow link or copy and paste in new browser window). Thank you! https://assess.predictiveindex.com/GWxLX

EEO Statement
Arlon is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other protected status in accordance with all applicable laws.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
About Us

Slingshot is a Utah based start-up recently recognized by Inc Magazine as one of America's fastest growing companies (#146!!!). Our headquarters is located in Orem, Utah, with At Home Slingers located across Utah as well as select surrounding states. We believe in a world where conversations matter, where technology enhances human interaction instead of replacing it, and where people can effortlessly connect with service providers that help home feel like home.

Learn More At

The gig:

Slingshot is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to support finance, operations, sales, marketing & company leadership teams with insights gained from analyzing company data. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization. They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with leaders to improve business outcomes.

Requirements

What you'll do:
Work with leaders throughout the organization to identify requirements and opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions and ensuring the validation and verification of data used.
Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques, financial models and business strategies.
Provide support to end users on standardized and ad hoc reports.
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
Use predictive modelling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes.
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.


What You Need To Have
Bachelors degree in a business related discipline or mathematics
2+ years of experience in an analytical role and experience with large data sets
At least one year of experience in architecting, building, and maintaining BI environments
Expert SQL query writing, especially across multiple databases and servers
Experience with setting up and maintaining BI analytics tools, such as Tableau, Power BI, Domo, Klipfolio, Qlik, etc
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Significant work experience with SQL and report building
Advanced Excel skills
Strong communication skills


Benefits

What you’ll gain :
Experience in a fun, fast-paced startup environment.
A generous PTO allotment gives you the freedom to build the underground crime empire you’ve always dreamed of.
Health Care: Hang-gliding accident? Flesh-eating bacteria? We got you covered.
Data-Driven Workplace: Dashboards. Pie graphs. Acronyms. We’ve got it all.
Growth Opportunities: We’re growing. Like a fungus. You can be a fungus too.
401(k) Match: We’ll help you prepare for your future with the manic energy of a squirrel caching acorns.
Gym Membership & On-site Gym: Let Slingshot subsidize your quest to get fit/swole/jacked/yolked.
Fast-Paced Environment: Set up shop at the corner of amazing growth and exquisite chaos.
Stocked Breakroom, Cafeteria on-site: Never an excuse to be hangry here.

title: Business Intelligence Developer
description:
