title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Company Overview

Oticon's People First philosophy is more than a mission statement. It is a way of thinking and doing business that stems from the company's historical roots and has made Oticon a leader in the hearing industry. We hire people who share our commitment to putting the needs of people with hearing loss first. The exceptional quality of our workforce has enabled Oticon to bring many technology and audiological "firsts" to market and to continue to meet the needs of hearing care professionals and the people with hearing loss that they serve. Our modern office complex and state-of-the-art production facilities provide an environment that enables our multi-disciplinary teams to continue to learn, find new ways to do things better and bring new solutions, features and professional support to market. This position is located in our Corporate Headquarters in Somerset NJ.

Position Overview

Embedded in the functional area he/she supports, the Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst position empowers the business areas by providing data visualization and analysis. This position works with stakeholders at different levels of the organization to ensure transparency and collaboration between BI and the business. He/she provides diplomatic and timely communication in a dynamic environment and helps his/her functional area improve their processes
Monitors and proactively identifies trends, successes and areas for improvement within the area he/she supports.
Analyzes data and provides conclusions and/or suggested actions.
Manages key (internal) customer relationships.
Facilitates requirement gathering and specification development for BI projects and requests.
Acts as a liaison between the business users and the BI report development team and is responsible for the delivery of front-end BI solutions to the business.
Performs thorough testing of all solutions delivered to his/her functional area, adhering to the QA standards of the BI department.
Ensures that all solutions delivered to his/her functional area are to specification (any required deviations should be proactively communicated to the requestor).
Supports continuous improvement projects by providing data and BI insight.
Owns and maintains library of dashboards and reports for his/her team.
Fulfills ad-hoc reporting/data requests from management.
Develops and maintains tools for daily monitoring of KPI’s.
Prioritizes workload based on business need.
Maintains accurate accounting of time spent and status for all Remedy tasks where he/she is the assignee.
May perform miscellaneous trasks/projects as directed by manager

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Personal qualifications are as follows: Structured, analytical, technical, goal oriented, proactive, team player, clear and effective communicator (written and verbal).
A Bachelor’s Degree is required.
Function requires a minimum of 1 year of work experience in data analysis and/or report development.
Proficiency in BI tools and building queries using MSSQL, Microsoft Access or a similar querying tool as well as familiarity with the advanced features of Microsoft Excel is required. Familiarity with SSAS, SSRS and Power BI are desired.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Business Wire, a Berkshire Hathaway company, is the global market leader in press release distribution and regulatory disclosure. We are on a mission to redefine how organizations connect with their audiences - and that’s just the beginning!

Organizations, big and small, depend on us to accurately publicize market-moving news and multimedia, host online newsrooms and investor relations websites, and generate social engagements that continuously develop interactions with their target audience.

About The Role

The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for working closely with our Business Wire leadership to define the required reporting and analytical needs for the organization. The BI Analyst is responsible for enhancing data-driven decision making by delivering critical reporting and insightful analysis that help guide business strategy. The BI Analyst will work closely with cross-functional teams and other members of the BI team to develop solutions that improve systems, processes, reporting and policies in support of the organization’s key initiatives.

The BI Analyst will create both standard and custom reporting solutions, conduct quantitative and qualitative analyses and provide associated reporting support for internal operations. The BI Analyst will also be instrumental in defining and tracking Key Performance Indicators that are required to clarify the true pulse of the organization and improve our overall decision making.

The BI Analyst will be responsible to design and administer a self-service reporting program in order to support the entire Business Wire organization.

What You'll Need
BS/BA in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Management Information Systems or a related field
3+ years of professional experience in Business Intelligence/Advanced Business Analytics
Proficient in SQL and using databases in a business environment with big data technologies and large-scale, complex datasets
Experience in designing and building data infrastructure/automated reporting tools
Advanced data visualization skills with the ability to tell stories and make dashboards actionable
1-2 years of Tableau reporting, solutions infrastructure and knowledge

Preferred Qualifications
Experience with Business Objects is a plus
Experience with Snowflake, Redshift, Athena is a plus
High-level communication and presentation skills
Maintain a self-starter mindset to proactively anticipate and address business needs
At this time, Business Wire will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position.

Business Wire is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and other similar state laws and local ordinances, and its internal policy, Business Wire will also consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Overview

At Shinola, we’ve made a lasting commitment to making lasting things. World-class watches, beautiful leather goods, thoughtful gifts, and a hotel. If it’s made, we want to try to make it better. With relentless optimism, tenacity, humor, and humility, we help people shine in an understated way.

Because we’re a growing and evolving company, each employee is a key stakeholder, making decisions every day that directly impact our overall vision and direction. At Shinola, you’ll have the opportunity to make a significant contribution at the start of what we believe will become an iconic American brand.

Come be a part of what AdWeek called “America’s Coolest Brand”!

What You’ll Be Doing

We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to help drive business strategy by synthesizing performance metrics into actionable insights across key product categories and marketing channels. The position sits within our eCommerce team but works on projects spanning the entire organization (from product insights, to business insights, to multi-channel marketing optimization). You will use your innate curiosity & data manipulation know-how to dig into business dynamics and surface insights that materially impact our performance.

Job Highlights
Ensure regular reporting is running as scheduled, conveys needed information (for business owners) and drive uptake of the information by attending regular business meetings (go-to-market meeting, eComm stand-ups)
Dig into business results on a weekly basis, surfacing opportunities in eCommerce (mainly) and across the enterprise. Partner with eComm Director & DevOps/IT on site improvements, or digital / CRM on marketing deployments.
Work with the organization on creating new regular reports & dashboards (for ex. call center/customer service tracker)
Respond to Ad Hoc reporting requests from across the organization and assist in investigating business questions (product selling, customer analytics, marketing performance, etc.)
Manage audience selection / list pulling (build out customer segments in Marketing Cloud based on MC and joined Salesforce data) and push finished segments out to delivery channel
Provide data for post-mortem & ROI analysis on various projects/campaigns (including performing customer > transaction match-backs for catalog mailings)


What You’ll Bring
BA/BS in Business, Marketing, Mathematics, Statistics or related field (or equivalent experience)
Strong analytical/quantitative skills and ability to synthesize findings into tangible actions that drive business outcomes
SQL programming skills with an understanding of database capabilities and experience of integrating, structuring, and analyzing large amounts of data from diverse sources
Experience leveraging big data technologies and modern data visualization tools (Tableau, Klipfolio, etc.) to blend data from multiple sources to help answer multi-dimensional business questions
Experience using an enterprise-level digital analytics platform (e.g. GA360, Adobe Analytics)
Experience with statistical concepts and knowledge of Test/Control methodologies
Expert level understanding of Microsoft Office suite especially Excel
Strong organizational skills, a strong sense of ownership and accountability, and the ability to lead projects, communicate effectively, and be a self-starter
Ability to communicate technical material to a range of audiences and ‘tell a story’ that provides insight into the business
Excitement for tackling complex problems with a high degree of ambiguity


Even Better If You Have
A background in Retail and/or eCommerce
Experience with A/B and Multivariate test design and implementation
Working knowledge of Digital Marketing Channels (CPC Paid Search and Programmatic Display).
Bonus points for optimizing paid media channels through advanced Marketing and Ad Technology (i.e. Marin, Kenshoo, Google DoubleClick & Adwords, etc.)
Working understanding of attribution and the differences between rules-based last click attribution versus algorithmic multi-touch attribution. Exposure to Media Mix Modeling is a plus
Experience with Salesforce/Salesforce Marketing Cloud


Note: Shinola is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, or veteran status. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Essential Function:
As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will drive critical reporting and data analysis for the business.
Assist with the data warehousing efforts and develop/maintain ETL data feeds, BI reports, and dashboards.
Work closely with different senior department leaders, sales and operations to design, develop, and support data structures, reports, scorecards, and dashboards.
Utilize, update, and manage BI tools such as SQL Server, Power BI, PowerApps.
Play an active role in all IT projects to ensure the BI architecture continues to align with other systems as the overall IT architecture evolves.
This role liaises directly with several key members of the business and therefore has the opportunity to truly improve & transform how information is delivered.

Education & Experience:
5+ years in related role in addition to a Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Statistics, or related field.
3 years experience wokring in a warehouse and manufacturing environment, collaborating with the business to produce key business metrics, scorecards, and dashboards.
Microsoft SSIS, KingswaySoft
SSMS, Visual Studio
Power BI stack including: DB, Data Warehouse, ETL tools, and front-end BI tools
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work with all levels of personnel individually including senior leadership. Good communication skills, both verbal and written. 
Generate standard or custom reports summarizing business, financial, or economic data for review by executives, managers, and other stakeholders. 
Create business intelligence tools or systems, including design of related databases, spreadsheets, or outputs. 
Excellent project, organization change and financial management skills.
Manage timely flow of business intelligence information to users.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
The American Arbitration Association (AAA), the leading provider of alternative dispute resolution services, is seeking a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to serve as a key contributor in the AAA’s New York State Insurance Case Management Center (NYSI CMC), which designs, implements, and maintains the BI tools including: Data warehouse, Tableau and Predictive Analytics. The BI Analyst works closely with users, and all levels of the business to gather and analyze data to identify opportunities for efficiency, trends and actionable insights; provides data analysis and explains its business relevance; verifies accuracy of data and builds confidence in the analysis. This position is located in New York, NY.

Named as one of the 50 best nonprofits to work for by the Non-Profit Times, our employees enjoy rewarding careers in a fast-paced, results-driven environment. We offer a competitive compensation package, including incentives, and our employees also participate in a comprehensive benefits program that includes medical, dental, orthodontia, and vision coverage, a student loan repayment program, a 403(b) retirement plan with substantial company match, discounted pet insurance, and generous paid time-off benefits.

Primary Responsibilities Include The Following

The ideal candidate will possess a broad technology analytics skill set including general corporate, not for profit, or other organizational experience, with a demonstrated ability to interact and work with individuals at all levels internally and externally.
Interviews users to understand needs for new or enhanced reports/ad-hoc requests.
Monitors and assesses quality of data to ensure accuracy and integrity of data used in reporting and statistical analyses.
Studies underlying data, recommends analysis to improve management effectiveness, and validates data sources and analysis.
Applies analytical approaches to prepare comprehensive and accurate reports identifying trends, opportunities and organizational risks.
Serves as a subject matter expert and mentor around data analysis; develops and conducts training to educate staff on business intelligence initiatives.
Develops and executes data quality audit and data assessment plan; updates the program as the organizational structure and business strategies, opportunities and risks, of the AAA evolve.
Maintains log of all requests and their status.
Advocates for the benefits of BI analytics and sound data management.
Trains end-user community on how to understand and interpret data analysis, including predictive analysis.
Disseminates information regarding tools, reports, and metadata enhancements.
Creates ad-hoc reports and analysis using various tools such as Tableau, Access, Excel, and SQL.
Provides technical assistance and support to end users on business intelligence tools, databases, dashboards, and systems; maintains a library of model documents, templates, and other reusable knowledge assets.
Provides technical support for existing reports, dashboards, and other tools.
Identifies and analyzes industry or geographic trends with business strategy implications; prepares and presents statistical reports to end users.

Education & Experience: Bachelor’s degree in business or related discipline; 1-4 years prior work experience involving data analysis; or an equivalent combination of education and work experience.

Communications Abilities: (Verbal) Expresses oneself clearly in conversations and interactions with others; tailors speech to the level and experience of the audience; uses appropriate grammar and choice of words; expresses ideas in a concise, organized manner; maintains eye contact when speaking with others; (Written) Expresses oneself clearly and concisely in writing; tailors written communications to effectively reach an audience; uses graphics and other aids to clarify complex or technical information; spells correctly; writes using concrete, specific language; uses punctuation correctly; writes grammatically.

Computer Skills: Either already possess knowledge of SQL and Tableau, or have strong analytic abilities to quickly learn these skills. Intermediate proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel; working knowledge of web-based case management systems preferred.

Mathematical Skills: Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure using whole numbers, common fractions and decimals; ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs; and ability to understand and interpret statistical reports, data charts and graphs.

Travel: Ability to travel periodically (10%) to customers, training events, and other AAA offices and conferences.

description:

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Business Intelligence Analyst

Myriad Genetics Inc., is a leading personalized medicine company dedicated to being a trusted advisor transforming patient lives worldwide with pioneering molecular diagnostics. Myriad discovers and commercializes molecular diagnostic tests that: determine the risk of developing disease, accurately diagnose disease, assess the risk of disease progression, and guide treatment decisions across six major medical specialties where molecular diagnostics can significantly improve patient care and lower healthcare costs. Myriad is focused on three strategic imperatives: maintaining leadership in an expanding hereditary cancer market, diversifying its product portfolio through the introduction of new products and increasing the revenue contribution from international markets. For more information on how Myriad is making a difference, please visit the Company's website: www.myriad.com.

Job Overview

This Business Intelligence Analyst role is responsible for working closely with our business stakeholders to define the required reporting and analytical needs for the organization. Some of our Business Stakeholders include Billing, Finance, Payer Markets, HR, Legal, and Medical Affairs. The position will create both standard and custom reporting solutions, conduct quantitative and qualitative analysis and provide associated reporting support for internal operations. The individual will also be instrumental in defining and tracking Key Performance Indicators that are required to clarify the true pulse of the organization and improve our overall decision making.

The position works within the broader EDM (Enterprise Data Management) group to ensure the accurate capture and storage of required reporting data. This individual plays a key role to further the overall vision of the Enterprise Data Management, by driving standardized tools, methodologies and business processes that are aimed at improving data quality and operating efficiencies.

Primary Responsibilities
Work closely with the team and users to design and deliver comprehensive reporting solutions.
Outline and facilitate the collection of key data sources needed to drive business insights and direction
Design and administer a dashboards and a self-service reporting program in order to support the reporting needs of the organization
Assist in the analysis of information to understand various trends and related opportunities
Interpret reporting results and assist in the creation of action plans to drive our business objectives
Drive the creation and administration of Common Definitions leading to accuracy and trust of reporting
Assist leadership team to leverage our reporting to drive the business objectives
Translating technical and functional user requirements into a value driven solution

Required Knowledge/Skills/Abilities
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Finance, Business Administration or equivalent
2+ years’ experience in Business Intelligence, Consulting or equivalent
Proficient in SQL query development
General experience in the creation of dashboards using industry standard tools and techniques
Experience working with Billing, Finance, and HR a plus
Understanding of Data Analysis in relation to Business Process modeling
Proficient in Microsoft Excel
Experience with Qlikview/QlikSense a plus
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple concurrent tasks
Excellent time management, scheduling, and organizational skills
Ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Ability to work effectively under tight timelines and schedules
Strong communication, interpersonal and organizational skills
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit; talk; or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and stoop; kneel; or crouch The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision and depth perception.

Myriad Genetics Inc., is a leading personalized medicine company dedicated to being a trusted advisor transforming patient lives worldwide with pioneering molecular diagnostics. Myriad discovers and commercializes molecular diagnostic tests that: determine the risk of developing disease, accurately diagnose disease, assess the risk of disease progression, and guide treatment decisions across six major medical specialties where molecular diagnostics can significantly improve patient care and lower healthcare costs. Myriad is focused on three strategic imperatives: maintaining leadership in an expanding hereditary cancer market, diversifying its product portfolio through the introduction of new products and increasing the revenue contribution from international markets. For more information on how Myriad is making a difference, please visit the Company's website: www.myriad.com .

Myriad is an equal opportunity employer and as such, affirms in policy and practice to recruit, hire, train and promote, in all job classifications without regard to race, color, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status or status as a protected veteran.

Reasonable accommodation will be provided for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in job application procedures. We believe that diversity lends a regional, national, and global advantage to the clients we serve. Our workforce consists of dynamic individuals, with a range of backgrounds, talents, and skills.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
System1 is looking for a BI Analyst to join our Business Intelligence team. The Business Intelligence team is the horizontal layer that supports business intelligence, optimization, machine learning, and external & internal reporting. We process and report on hundreds of millions of events and user attributes per day, gathered from an extremely heterogeneous set of data streams.

As a BI Analyst in the Business Intelligence team, you will be working with engineering teams across System1 to ensure that we have the highest quality of data in and out of the platform. Attention to detail and a desire to learn are key to this position.

Our database systems include Snowflake, Postgres, Redshift, and MS SQL server. We also utilize a range of technologies including Kinesis, Spark, and Redis.

The Role You Will Have
Build/maintain dashboards and reports to track key metrics for cross-functional stakeholders and executives
Meet with stakeholders to gather requirements and follow up to ensure data needs are being met
Read data from multiple data sources and transform, enrich and aggregate data for an efficient presentation in an enterprise environment
Provide input into the architecture, design, and implementation of a business intelligence solution
Recommend improvements to streamline processes regarding data flow and data quality to improve data accuracy, usability, and value
Remain abreast of technology developments within fields relevant to current and future BI and Reporting initiatives
Assist the BI, Data Science, and Marketing teams with data investigations.

What You Will Bring
Bachelor’s Degree (technical or science) preferred.
Strong attention to detail.
3+ years working in SQL (Postgres / MySQL / MSSQL or similar) in a production environment
3+ years building dashboards and reports in Tableau (preferred), SRSS or similar BI platform
Strong sql query skills (CTE’s, stored procedures, multi-table joins, temp tables) with large data sets
Strong attention to detail
Able to function with imperfect data (strive to do things the right way, but able to accept some compromises along the way)

What We Have To Offer
Free Uber/Lyft to and from work every day!
Collegial and collaborative team with highly intelligent and motivated coworkers
Cross-team lunches and demos to foster learning
Unlimited Paid Sick Time, Competitive PTO and Benefits package
Daily catered meals and fully stocked kitchen
Bi-weekly happy hour at various bars, restaurants, and venues across Los Angeles
Bi-weekly onsite happy hour
Catered dinner on Tuesdays and Thursdays
Weekly fitness class with private trainer: high intensity training, yoga, beach volleyball, beach soccer, ultimate frisbee
Company parties and outings: Skyzone indoor skydiving, Medieval Times, Karaoke, etc.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
This Is What You’ll Do
Support daily Supply Chain business operations (Sourcing, Purchasing, Logistics, Quality and Program Management) through data/gap analytics, business systems implementation, administrative tasks, and report generation
Assist in database infrastructure layouts for Supply Chain geared toward data integrity and systematic information flow
Support implementation and integration of internal systems & applications to enhance business process, improve access to information and data normalization
Contribute to reporting activities within Supply Chain using Business Intelligence tools and monitor KPI’s to drive corrective action and maintain high performance
Develop Program Management tools through efficient automation and data cleansing while working closely with stakeholders to maintain rapid change management
This Is What You’ll Need
Problem solving: Display aptitude to analyze and identify key issues from among a broad range of alternatives and recommend optimal solutions for various situations
Critical thinking: Understand the details and nuance of a process and then design a robust solution for it
Self-starter: Identify and solve problems without clear instructions while exploring new technology/processes
Technical knowledge: Demonstrate ability to use (or learn quickly) modern tools/software (e.g. Tableau, SQL, Python, VBA, Microsoft Suite, etc.)
Organization: Exhibit strong attention to detail and quality while effectively managing multiple tasks/projects
Communication: Show excellent written and verbal skills
Education: Bachelor’s in relative field
Experience: 2 or more years of professional experience in related industry is preferred
This Is Where You’ll Work
Department: Supply Chain
Location: Plymouth, MI
Rivian Description

We Are Rivian
Rivian is building a new kind of car company. Starting from a clean sheet has allowed us to learn from and leverage what’s been done in the past while giving us the freedom to reimagine mobility from the ground up. Our vehicles and technology are designed and engineered to challenge what’s possible and to inspire people to explore the world in new ways.
We believe in the power of adventure. While a vehicle can’t make someone adventurous, it can nurture that fundamental desire in each of us to go places we’ve never been and do things we’ve never done — thoughtfully and sustainably. Science and invention depend on our innate curiosity and desire to explore the unknown.
Our development centers are located in Plymouth, MI, San Jose, CA, Irvine, CA and Surrey, England. In addition to these four locations, we have a modern manufacturing facility in Normal, IL and will begin production of our R1T and R1S in 2020.
The Adventure Is Just Beginning
Doing something different is never easy. It requires courage, optimism and grit. Core to delivering on our vision is building a team of curious individuals, determined to make a positive impact on the world. This means challenging ourselves, stretching beyond the bounds of conventional thinking, reframing old problems, seeking new solutions and operating comfortably in a space of uncertainty.
Our team has a diverse set of backgrounds— but at heart, we are adventurers on a mission to move the world in a new direction. We’re currently looking for thinkers and doers with a strong sense of adventure to join us on this journey.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst

title: Business Intelligence Manager
description:
Job # 531884

What You’ll Be Doing...

The Engineering Program Office Data Science Team has an immediate opening for a talented and experienced Geospatial Data Engineer with hands on expertise in creation and automation of complex spatial and data algorithms using Python Automation and Web Front End visualization using modern JavaScript frameworks experience. Besides a strong interest in understanding the Telecom business model in particular and a passion for data in general. The responsibility of the expert filling this role is to perform cross-disciplinary analysis and visualization of traditional and spatial data to help solve complex business problems. The successful candidate will help to develop analysis automation scripts as well as build web front ends and visualization frameworks to model business driven problems.
The candidate must be willing to work in an interdisciplinary field, together with computer scientists, business spocs, and telecom network engineers, and will require excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Integrating multiple data sources, models, and software tools with business line specific decision support and data analysis. This will include the use of distributed computing and utilization of both cloud internal computing resources.
Developing new automation methods to analyze and evaluate business strategies across various business geographies, technologies, drivers and scales.
Modeling complex systems by integrating large varied datasets of economic, demographic and telecom related information
Create and walk through executive presentations that explain the complex data and algorithms used in simple easy-to-understand visually striking layman terms that leave a residual impact on an executive audience.
Solve complex geospatial problems utilizing robust and repeatable solutions.
Keep current on the latest computing trends and analysis methodologies through tech journals and ongoing research.
Work will involve challenging existing constructs and business paradigms and creatively solving problems that result in a business transformation of a process or a program or a current approach.
Challenge existing thought processes and actively work in cross disciplinary groups and make a case using rich data and presentation.
Fail often, fast and learn from it for use in future iterations and experiments.

You'll Need To Have

What we’re looking for...
Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, informationa systems, analytics/business intelligence, engineering, mathematics, statistics, other related discipline or four or more years of work experience.
Six or more years of relevant work experience.
Experience with large-scale parallel computing in distributed environments and familiarity with GIS and spatial databases (e.g., Postgres / PostGIS, Oracle/ESRI sde) is preferred.
Demonstrated using of Python in automation of analytics tasks.
Experience using of / development of spatially enabled Web Front Ends (ArcGIS JavaScript API, React,).
Experience managing data in SQL and/or NoSQL databases (Postgres, Oracle, Teradata, Hadoop, Casandra, MongoDB).

Even Better If You Have
Masters of Science in GIS.
Preference will be given to candidates with programming experience in one or more programming languages (e.g., Python, JavaScript).
Experience in analysis of large spatial and non-spatial datasets.
Experience with a multitude of databases in general (Oracle, Postgres).
Knowledge of R, SPSS, or SAS for statistical analysis is preferred.
Demonstrated use of AWS for analytics.
Five to eight years of experience or equivalent relevant education/experience.
Demonstrates complete understanding and wide application of technical procedures, principles, theories and concepts in the Telecommunications field. General knowledge of other related disciplines.
Demonstrates leadership in one or more areas of team, task or project lead responsibilities.
Experience managing short and long term projects from start to finish.
Good interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to convey complex information to upper level execs.
Ability to adapt to quickly changing business environment and requests that come in related to upper level executive requests.
Experienced in Telco, Cable or other network related field (Electric, Wastewater, Gas/Oil, Urban planning).
VZNetworkEngineering&Ops

When you join Verizon...

You’ll have the power to go beyond - doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, join our team of the best and brightest. We offer great pay, amazing benefits and opportunity to learn and grow in every role. title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
S&P Global Market Intelligence

The Role: Business Intelligence Analyst, Research Network

Grade (relevant for internal applicants only): 09A

The Location: New York

The Team: The Research Network team is responsible for leading and supporting S&P Global Market Intelligence’s commercial engagements to win new business and retain existing clients.

The Impact: You will be an integral part of the team, serving as a key point of contact and responsible for supporting the needs of our sales team, clients, and third-party providers with a variety of impactful business intelligence activities.

What’s In It For You
Collaborative culture
Extraordinary benefits
Work/life balance
Opportunity for advancement

Responsibilities
Provide pre-sale analytics that drives continued growth of our research business, as well as post-sale analytics to support renewals.
Serve as product expert with clients, sales and contributors, providing frontline product support, including client product training, the development of effective marketing materials, and responding to detailed product inquiries.
Work with cross functional teams to engage clients, ensure accurate reporting and operational excellence, and proactively develop solutions to meet client and contributor requirements.
Provide specialty support and participate in various business development activities and client engagements (as directed)
Actively explore business development opportunities through data analysis, and execute on business development initiatives with clients and contributors directly as part of commercial or product campaigns.
Deepen relationships with S&P Global Commercial team and Global Research Network team to further enhance our data analysis, business intelligence tools and identify operational efficiencies.
Acquire a deep understanding of our research product and client requirements, and participate in product testing and release support.

Basic Qualifications

What We’re Looking For:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
1 to 3 years of relevant work experience, preferably in the financial industry
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, including demonstrated knowledge of MS Excel and attention to detail.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, including the ability to work on team-based projects, as well as work independently.
Integrity and accountability, and the desire to own projects until they are completed.
Ability to work on multiple projects with shifting priorities
Experience working with external clients and demonstrated service or sales abilities is a plus.

This program/position is limited to persons with indefinite right to work in the United States.

At S&P Global Market Intelligence, we know that not all information is important—some of it is vital. Accurate, deep and insightful. We integrate financial and industry data, research and news into tools that help track performance, generate alpha, identify investment ideas, understand competitive and industry dynamics, perform valuation and assess credit risk. Investment professionals, government agencies, corporations and universities globally can gain the intelligence essential to making business and financial decisions with conviction.

S&P Global Market Intelligence is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/marketintelligence.

S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status (including domestic partnerships and civil unions), sexual orientation, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.

The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
The Business Intelligence Analyst manages support functions essential to global sales force productivity and process optimization. Duties include developing and producing dashboards and reports that provide visibility across marketing and sales activities, perform scheduled and ad hoc analyses, identify and explain business results, trends or anomalies through data investigations, as well as sales and marketing activity effectiveness. This role is expected to provide management and analysis of sales data for use in decision making and organizational efficiency improvement initiatives enabling automation, scalability and productivity. Work with business owners to interpret data and identify business trends, conduct root cause analyses of business problems and provide strategic suggestions for improvement. In addition, the Analyst will aggregate and perform statistical analysis for various analytical projects based on cross functional requests from Regional Sales, Global markets, Events team, Recognition team, Product Marketing, Marketing, Senior Leadership, or other specialization/niche groups.

Integrate data from multiple data sources for increase of and improvements to regular reports, ensure data accuracy and integrity, and updates data as needed.
Design and deliver high-quality, professional business reports and dashboards at appropriate levels across the organization.
Develop standard reports for seasonal/temporary promotions and contests for specialization groups.
Explore and implement data solutions to improve efficiency, increase data visibility and self-service aspects of available business intelligence.
Identify abnormalities or inconsistencies in business data to improve data accuracy and validity.
Partner with IT to implement new sales dashboard reports for increased visibility to business performance based on multiple criteria.
Partner with Financial Planning and Analysis and assist the Sales Programs team with the development of promotional analysis and ROI projections for promotion approval and provide strategic recommendations for success.
Provide ongoing updates and analyses for programs, promotions and contests.
Handle routine to complex requests and work closely with management to accomplish certain tasks.
Provide direct support to team members on analysis requests and projects; step in to fill temporary sales data analysis assignments for Director of Sales Operations.
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution or equivalent experience.
3 years of experience in an operations or sales role, providing strategic guidance and analytical oversight.
Skilled with the use of Microsoft office software to include Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
Advanced user of Microsoft Excel - analysis services, macros, VBA code editing, dashboard creation, pivot tables, index/match, sumifs, countifs, etc.
Solid understanding of data, trends, forecasts, and ability to make recommendations.
Ability to effectively present material appropriate to the level of the audience including executive leadership.
Strong interpersonal skills, detail oriented and able to coordinate/manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Strong financial and analytical skills.
Knowledge of SQL programming language and MDX programming language.
Master’s degree from an accredited institution, preferably in Business Administration.
5 years of experience in an operations or sales role, providing strategic guidance and analytical oversight.
Professional experience in network marketing or health and wellness industry.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
job_location: Englewood Cliffs, New Jersey, United States
description:
Company Description

OwnBackup is a leading cloud-to-cloud backup & restore vendor. We provide secure, automated, daily backups of SaaS & PaaS data as well as sophisticated data compare & restore tools for disaster recovery. Our solution complements the SaaS vendor’s (e.g. Salesforce) built-in data-protection mechanisms by covering data loss & corruption caused by human errors, malicious intent, integration errors, and rogue applications. The solution also provides enterprises with the performance and reporting required to meet compliance regulations in a number of industries.
OwnBackup was co-founded by data-recovery, data-protection and information-security experts, each with over 15 years experience in their respective fields. We are a top-ranked backup & restore ISV on the Salesforce.com AppExchange, the 2018 Salesforce Appy award winner, and the winner of multiple Demo Jam awards.
We believe that every employee in the company can and should make an impact every day, and we empower them to do so. If you are self-motivated, like to take initiative and are a great team player you will love working here.

Job Description
Are you an analytical mind that has a firm understanding of business operations to back it up? OwnBackup is looking to apply your skills to a fast growing SaaS company that was recently selected as one of the best companies to work for in New Jersey!
We’re OwnBackup and looking for a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to assist in improving business efficiency. The Senior Business Analyst will provide strategic business analytics to business partners. The focus is to work closely with business units to gain an in-depth understanding of business, strategy, processes, services and roadmap and the context in which the business operates.

Responsibilities

Develop and maintain a robust reporting platform for internal stakeholders including Provider Engagement and Inbound/ Outbound Consumer Engagement groups
Design, build, and deliver requested reports, BI dashboards, and analyses
Manage multiple competing priorities and work with internal stakeholders to continuously prioritize requests
Continually improve project delivery timelines, accuracy, and workflows
Develop a deep understanding of functional area to anticipate BI reporting needs
Will work closely with other BI analysts providing feedback on deliverables and guidance as needed
Collaborate with Data Architect to design and implement new databases, data structures, and data processes to support Reporting and Analytic needs
Work with Data Architect and IT Operations to troubleshoot issues relating to Reporting and Analytics
 Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Business or related field
Highly proficient in SQL
5-7 years’ experience working in a production reporting environment;
Experience using the following tools (Tableau, Oracle Business Intelligence, QlikView, BusinessObejcts, Spotfire and/ or Looker in bother analytical and development capacity.
Advanced experience with Excel pivot tables and various excel functions

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Job # 534241

What You’ll Be Doing...

The Verizon Consumer Group (VCG) Systems of Insight (SOI) team delivers value to Verizon through analytics and reporting by driving insights to actions. This position is on the SOI team which is responsible for developing & enhancing the analytics practice within VCG through best practices to ensure future success.

The successful candidate will lead analytics efforts to identify insights and drive actions across channels while also driving self-service to reduce overall business expense and provide better customer experiences. This is a unique role to lead efforts to optimize experience, revenue, conversion and expense reduction across multiple channels in a Fortune 15 company.

Responsibilities Include
Perform advanced analysis on experiences, customer paths, design, creative /campaign performance to optimize conversion and increase revenue.
Identify actions/events/interactions that result in positive customer outcomes and provide actionable recommendations to enhance the digital experience and attain key business objectives.
Lead efforts to tie in offline data into digital analyses to cultivate a complete customer experience vantage.
Develop powerful presentations and present to key stakeholders/executives your actionable insights and recommendations.
Help formulate actionable reporting with data visualizations for business owners to gauge performance and assist with optimization decisions.

What We’re Looking For...

You have leadership experience and proven capability to drive results, positively influence change, and motivate others within a non-direct reporting structure to take action/execute. You are a critical thinker, creative problem solver, and decision-maker with the ability to work effectively in a highly collaborative and hyper-changing environment. You possess analytical skills and problem solving skills with the capability and experience to connect sales/operational/channel data between multiple online and offline data sources to develop queries, analyze data and generate insights.

You'll Need To Have
Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.
2-4 years of relevant work experience.
Experience using Adobe Analytics suite (Site Catalyst, Data Workbench, Discover), Tealeaf, and Microsoft Office, product suite (Access, Excel, PowerPoint, Word, SharePoint), etc.).

Even Better If You Have
Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, information systems, analytics/business intelligence, engineering, mathematics, statistics, or other relevant technical discipline.
MBA.
Certification for Adobe Analytics/Site Catalyst or another relevant platform.
Ability to forge strong relationships with both IT (web, ops, development, etc.) and business (Product Line Management, Marketing, Metrics/Analytics, Legal, Testing, etc.) teams.
Experience designing, developing, and implementing data visualization dashboards utilizing Tableau or other Business Intelligence tools that provide real-time visibility into performance results.
Ability to establish and articulate a vision, set goals, develop and execute strategy, as well as measure track performance results.
Verbal and written communication skills with ability to design, develop, and present executive-level (c-suite) PowerPoint Presentations and in clear and concise language/visuals across all-levels of the organization.
When you join Verizon...

You’ll have the power to go beyond - doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, join our team of the best and brightest. We offer great pay, amazing benefits and opportunity to learn and grow in every role. Together we’ll go far.

Equal Employment Opportunity

We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. Different makes us better.

title: Business Intelligence Manager
description:
What’s Our Dish

Announced in May 2018, Peapod Digital Labs (PDL) is an Ahold Delhaize USA company that powers the eCommerce and digital strategies for the Great Local Brands of Ahold Delhaize USA. Accelerating growth in digital and personalization capabilities, PDL is an innovation lab focused on meeting the changing needs of customers, regardless of when, where, and how consumers choose to shop.

Peapod continues to be a consumer-facing eCommerce brand, and is part of Peapod Digital Labs, focused on growing Peapod sales to consumers.

Recipe for Success - What's “in store” for the role
Develop CAD facility drawings (interior and exterior) translating the business requirements to support Home Shop Center Designs, including Warehouse, Transportation and Office needs.
Facilitate engineering requirements and permits for site plans (e.g. electrical, plumbing, refrigeration, fire protection, HVAC, etc.).
Partner with the Supply Chain Development to align core processes with overall HSC design, including MHE requirements (racks, forklifts, totes, etc.).
Continuous review of labor model to find areas for simplification, including the updates to operational strategies (e.g. waving and scheduling), processes, supplies and seasonal/weather related factors.
Identify and prioritize simplicity roadmap of productivity improvements based on activity based costing analysis by standardize work methods and performance to drive incremental productivity improvements.
Develop prioritized roadmap of productivity improvements based on activity based costing analysis and benchmarking across 25-40+ Peapod locations.
Provide recommendations for preferred Operational methods and labor management improvements.
Perform research in support of key operations management decisions related to process and service level management. Expert in workflow management and analysis of labor standards to ensure requirements are accounted for within the standards.
Provide insight on facility layout and work flow design. Provide appropriate analysis to support recommendations on changes and facility improvements.
Determine if other tools/technologies will support Peapod growth ambitions in terms of workforce management; develop business case and recommendations.
Develop and maintain labor standards utilizing the MOST predetermined time methodology.
Complete annual renewal / refresh of labor standards to ensure all business changes are considered and properly reflected in the labor model.
Maintain labor time studies to support execution of Labor Management programs in our facilities; including third party time study validations requested by Brands via PDL, Peapod.com or 3rd Parties (e.g. UFCW).

The Essentials In Your Cart - The Required Ingredients
Bachelor’s Degree (Industrial Engineer required)
Process focused
Engineered time studies
Advanced MS Access
Advanced MS Excel
25-50% Travel

Extra Spices - What you should bring to the table :
Strong analytical skills, including statistical analysis
Oral and written communication skills
Presentation skills
Customer focus
Initiative
Attention to detail

Join Us at Our Table

Peapod Digital Labs is a forward-thinking company with a strong legacy of innovation. We recognize who powers our progress – our people! We offer a great variety of benefits and perks to our employees, including: great health care options, including PPO and HSA plans (with company contributions), dental, vision, flexible spending accounts, a 401k with strong company match and immediate vesting, and generous and flexible paid time off.



We are an equal opportunity employer. We comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to sex, race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, marital status (including civil unions), military service, veteran status, pregnancy (including childbirth and related medical conditions), genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, legally recognized disability, domestic violence victim status or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
About HomeLight

HomeLight's vision is a world where every real estate transaction is simple, certain, and satisfying. We provide software and services to home buyers, sellers, and real estate agents including HomeLight Agent Matching, the investor matching platform Simple Sale, HomeLight Home Loans, and HomeLight Closing Services. Each year, HomeLight helps hundreds of thousands of clients connect with top real estate agents, and it facilitates billions of dollars of real estate on its platform.

What You'll Do
Analyze data, develop core dashboards report and dashboard tools
Use statistical analysis or data mining tools to analyze data, identify insightful trends, and convert data into meaningful recommendations for business owners and the executive team
Help to drive the data strategy across multiple channels (website and apps, surveys, testing, market research etc).
Support ad hoc data requests through either SQL query or quick report or dashboard and analyze large quantities of data using Python, VBA or R to drive growth strategies based on profitability, market potential and sales trends
Create new quantitative statistical models to reduce the overall operation cost of the business

You Have
BA/BS degree in a quantitative field, Masters in Analytics, Finance and Statistics preferred
2 years of experience in a business intelligence analyst role in an online real estate, ecommerce, or online business environment
2-4 years experience writing and tuning SQL queries and building reports/dashboards. This experience has allowed you to not only to drill down deeply into the data looking for insights but also to help others on the team gain access to more insightful data (e.g., dashboards). If you can supplement or mostly replace SQL with Python, that's a plus but not necessary.
Strong quantitative skills and a basic understanding of statistics (e.g., when you find an interesting pattern, you can figure out when it is just noise). We are not, however, looking for someone with an extensive background in machine learning and advanced statistics.
Mid-level expertise in advanced web analytics methodologies such as experimentation and testing, competitive analysis, surveys and market research preferred
Knowledge in Excel, VBA and other scripting languages (e.g., Python, R etc.) and experience in reporting systems like Tableau, Looker, and Periscope.
Excellent communication skills

The Perks
Medical, Vision, Dental
Parental Leave Benefits
401(k)
Commuter Benefits
Paid Time-Off
Volunteer Time-Off
Catered Lunches and Fully-Stocked Kitchen Onsite
Corporate Gym Membership
Company Events: Annual Retreat, Happy Hours, & More!

title: Business Intelligence Developer
description:
BI Developer
Contract-to-hire
Mountain Brook/Homewood, Alabama
  Our insurance client is seeking a Sr. Business Intelligence (BI) Developer to join their Enterprise Data Services team to assist with data integration work due to a large, recent acquisition. You will work alongside a team of other developers in the Enterprise Data Operations area of the EDS org to ensure data quality, perform integration work, troubleshoot escalated data-related issues, validate data and manage data; and you will act as a team player with the rest of this Agile organization. This is a great opportunity to get your foot in the door with a highly visible team that’s growing exponentially.
  The right person will have SQL and T-SQL experience, as well as exposure to the Microsoft BI Stack: SSIS, SSRS and/or SSAS. The ideal candidate will have been in a Data Operations and Data Support role previously, but this is not a requirement.
  Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience
1+ years as a Business Intelligence Developer (ETL, SSIS/SSRS, SQL)
Experience in an Agile environment
Experience developing in a project where data integration or data conversion is happening
Ability to work comfortably with others. This is NOT a heads-down role where you will not have to work as a team.
Team player attitude and high levels of emotional intelligence
  Selling Points
Highly visible project across the organization, outside of just technology
Constant challenge and change with a ton of team/organizational support
Continued learning and technology training opportunities
Accessible, approachable leadership within the EDS org
On-site café, coffee shop, 9-4 required work hours, option for work-from-home, free parking

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Summary

Metagenics is a global lifestyle medicine company, offering products and programs exclusively to health care practitioners. For over 30 years, we have been driven by a scientific concept: How the right nutrition can help people realize their best health possible. We don't compromise on safety, efficacy, or quality - to make sure that we deliver the best results possible. Time after time. Bottle after bottle. We carefully monitor all products to assure purity and safety, from formulation and ingredient selection all the way to the final product. We offer more educational support for health care professionals than anyone else in our field - keeping them in touch with the latest research and nutritional approaches to help manage today’s most common illnesses. Metagenics is dedicated to helping people live a happier, healthier life by realizing their genetic potential.

Responsibilities

Position overview:

Metagenics is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to support Metagenics with the development and improvement of reports and dashboards that provide reliable insights and visualization for in-context utilization by Users across marketing, sales and service. This role will help o ptimize the value of customer data for use in building direct customer relationships and delivering relevant customer experiences. As a central resource for company-wide customer data, you will partner with stakeholders across the company to collect, use and share data in support of business objectives.

What You’ll Do
Gather, organize and analyze data (structured/unstructured) to inform strategy, formulate insights and make actionable recommendations
Work with various departments such as Sales, Marketing, Operations, Logistics and Finance to understand, recommend, and develop KPIs, metrics and build data visualizations for analyzing them
Research and integrate data sources for target marketing purposes. Interpret, analyze and provide recommendations regarding data accuracy and data collection needs and processes.
Transform data into actionable insight through the use of business intelligence and analytics tools
Perform hands on analysis of marketing and sales data to develop insights and make recommendations on areas for optimization and strategy.
Develop predictive models to support effective targeting for customer acquisition and retention.
Analyze the financial implications of marketing strategies and translate them into reporting requirements and forecasts
Enable decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources to present it in digestible and actionable format
Analyze business data to clearly identify and communicate trends/root causes, draw conclusions, develop recommendations and drive decisions
Collaborate with Agile teams to deeply understand business objectives and build insightful reporting
Perform ad hoc analysis to quickly solve time sensitive operational issues and business cases
Manage multiple projects and proactively communicate issues, priorities, and objectives

You’ll Love This Job If You’re
The ideal teammate will be someone driven by curiosity.
You love to explore analytics, data trends, customer behavior all things influenced/impacted through analytics.
You ask critical questions, consistently seeking to find creative solutions to challenges.
You are growth focused – both personally and professionally.
You have experience connecting the dots between data and consumer insights to inform strategy, strong attention to detail, loves to tackle problems, is intellectually curious.

What You’ll Need
Bachelor’s degree with an emphasis on Computer Sciences, Information Systems, Operations Management, Statistical Analysis
3 years of proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
Technical expertise regarding data mining and segmentation techniques
Experience using industry-leading BI tools for reporting and visualization (e.g., Power BI)
Have the ability to organize, prioritize work, meet deadlines and work independently;
Be able to handle multiple projects and activities in a timely, organized manner;
Be a creative problem solver, flexible, proactive and ability to work in a fast paced, ever changing environment
Understanding data management, reporting tools and applications would be advantageous, along with analytical experience that includes methodology development, programming (SQL, SAS), and/or data visualization (PowerBI)

Physical Requirements/working Conditions
Sits at a computer station, meeting table or work desk for more than two-thirds of each day
Stands and walks to other stations and departments throughout the day
Uses hands and fingers to operate computers and office equipment most of the day
May stoop or crouch to access files or storage
Requires clear vision at 20 inches or less with or without corrective lenses
Hearing and speech within normal ranges and sufficient for clear communication face to face and especially via the telephone
Lifts up to 10 pounds regularly; lifts 25 pounds occasionally
Exposed to noise levels typical of office environments

Mental And Reasoning Requirements
Uses critical thinking skills to work with documents and spreadsheets and interpret information furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form. Able to review quantitative and qualitative work and identify questionable items
Expert data-analysis and problem solving skills
Able to set goals based on available information and to plan work in order to meet deadlines
Able to formulate appropriate responses to requests for data, services and information from internal or external customers with a wide range of personalities and demeanors
Able to project likely future occurrences based on current or historical data
Able to work independently and react quickly to changing priorities with a consistent sense of urgency
Metagenics, and its companies are committed to providing equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or any other protected status with respect to recruitment, hiring, promotion and other terms and conditions of employment. Metagenics takes affirmative action in support of this policy to employ and advance in employment individuals who are minorities, women, disabled, and veterans.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Company Description

Astreya is the leading IT solutions provider to deliver technology-enabled services and fuel digital transformation to some of the most exciting companies on the planet. We are at the cusp of a new way of working with our delivery model that helps our clients be positively productive by matching exceptional people to on-site teams delivering world-class IT service. With engineers in over 30 countries and 70 cities around the world, we are a global company working with the world's most recognizable and innovative organizations.

Job Description

We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst with SQL experience to analyze and implement code changes. In this position you will work with stakeholders and 3rd party representatives to troubleshoot and resolve data problems, create dashboards and spreadsheets, manage information and develop SQL code to analyze data.

Responsibilities:

Develop code changes based on functional requirements defined via business requirement documents (BRDs), functional Specification design documents (FSDs),Technical Design Documents (TDDs) written descriptions in bugs and verbally.
Own tasks through the entire software development life cycle from concept to release to production including: gathering business requirements, documenting development approach, implementing code changes, testing, gathering approvals and migrating code.
Conduct quantitative/ qualitative data analysis using tools and functions such as SQL, Dashboards, and Google spreadsheets.
Manage information and applicable supporting documents and dashboards.
Present reports monthly, quarterly and as requested with issues, observations or outcomes specified
Work with stakeholders, including 3rd party representatives, to troubleshoot and resolve data problems.
Work with client stakeholders to improve, automate and align data with current client processes.
Work on assigned projects. Providing routine project updates.
Curate and maintain related support documentation


Skills and Education Required:

8+ yrs working in a similar role.
Bachelor's Degree or higher (statistics preferred)
Excellent documentation, writing, organization and verbal communication skills.
SQL scripting and use knowledge.
Able to read and create technical documentation.
Experience using Tableau, and Excel or Google Sheets.
Excellent organization skills and ability to adapt to a rapidly changing work environment.
Experience with Tableau, and Hadoop or Big Query system management
Python knowledge.
Strong business acumen with experience in operations, analysis and project management.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Top 3 Reasons Our Employees Love Working At Omicron
We build cutting-edge technology that is literally changing how the world consumes online content.
We get to collaborate with really smart, interesting people every day.
Omicron rewards its team with really fun company events. Past events include food trucks on-site for lunch, private movie screenings, tickets to charity galas and more!

JOB SUMMARY: 
As BI Analyst, you will work with Business Intelligence, Marketing and Operations groups to help figure out the effectiveness of products and campaigns, and spot changes and trends. In addition to intelligently combining existing measures for insight and verification, you will also brainstorm, test and analyze new measures to grow knowledge, including both demographic and behavioral data. Help us know more about our customers than we do today, and build new services they will be interested in.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Develop actionable insights from existing datasets available throughout the company.
Run queries on data and perform analysis to support decision-making process.
Research information for marketing and operations teams.
Leverage Google Analytics and similar data sources to analyze and report on site visitor activities and identify areas for improvement.
Measure conversion rates, referrals and purchase patterns.
Familiarity with advanced statistical analysis and research methodologies, along with common computer programs.
 REQUIRED PERSONAL SKILLS:
Quantitative skills that will allow the successful measurement of market opportunity, sizing and metrics.
Understand quickly the complexities of the company’s retail products and markets.
 EXPERIENCE:
3+ years of professional experience in analytics, business analysis or comparable consumer analytics position
Microsoft Excel
Writing analytic queries in SQL
 ADDITIONAL SKILLS:
Tableau
Google Analytics
Python, R
 EDUCATION:
Bachelor's degree in Math, Engineering, Finance, Statistics or related discipline
 OTHER:

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Responsibilities
Partner with teams across the organization to understand their needs in analytics & to create dashboards and reporting tools that allow them to execute tasks more effectively
Work with business leaders to define key metrics and build reporting to monitor and understand performance along with those metrics
Build and maintain scalable ETL processes and pipelines to bring the data into our data warehouse
Work directly with internal partners and business/product/design/engineering audiences to understand the reporting needs and develop scalable solutions keeping reusability in mind.
Build, maintain and administer Looker as our BI tools and be the driving force behind the adoption and effective use of Looker within every team of the company
Maintain the data quality and data integrity of the data warehouse in partnership with our Data Engineers/Platform Engineers
Deep dive into large set of data sets to answer business questions, perform ad-hoc analysis
Reconcile data between various systems, find opportunities to innovate, and drive improvements


Requirements
4-5 years implementing & managing BI platforms and related analysis tools with large complex data sets from various sources, ideally with a focus on Finance and Tech.
Solid track record of collaboration with a variety of decision-makers to drive impact
Knowledge of relational Databases or Data warehouses
Confident with a scripting language (Python, Ruby, etc.) to build data models and ETLs
A creative approach based on in-depth knowledge of best practices in developing actionable analysis and guidance
Visualization subject matter expert with BI Technologies including Looker, Tableau, and/or another BI tool


Note: Qualified candidates will be contacted within 2 business days of application. If an applicant does not meet the above criteria, we will keep your resume on file for future opportunities and may contact you for further discussion.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
The Business Intelligence Analyst will apply their strategic and analytical skills to achieve a wide array of business objectives. The analyst will utilize big data software and tool to prepare a variety of reports and provide insight to management and enhance the decision-making process at both the organizational and departmental level ultimately improving efficiency, productivity and profitability.

Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To
Perform analysis based on large data sets to implement strategic decisions to business units.
Analyze and process data, building and maintaining models and report templates and develop dynamic data driven solutions.
Perform ad-hoc research and analysis to support overall business initiatives and reporting projects.
Support organization by assisting management in interpreting the data.
Partner with business managers to create holistic, department wide strategy, based on the statistical analysis of the data.
Ensure strategies are rooted in thorough analysis that is evaluated for up and down stream impacts.
Provide timely reports summarizing results and analyze the data to evaluate the impact and benefit of the project initiatives.
Create/prepare and present PowerPoint presentations to management as requested.
Ensure proper data governance framework surrounds critical data elements.
Innovate and challenge traditional practices with thoughtful and supported assertions.
Modernize business processes to empower employees and optimize resource allocation.
Requirements

Required Skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong analytical ability.
Ability to solve practical problems; ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram or scheduled form.
Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously with the ability to prioritize and organize assignments.
Proficient in Excel with the ability to create pivot tables and macros and use lookup and logic functions.
Ability to meet strict deadlines and compete projects effectively with little supervision.


Required Experience
Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, Data or Business Analytics and a minimum of 3 years' related analytical experience in banking or financial services.
Master's Degree in Data or Business Analytics or similar quantitative degree, experience with BI tools, preferably Microsoft's Power BI, or experience with SQL (Structured Query Language) preferred.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Overview

Medpace is a scientifically-driven, global, full-service clinical contract research organization (CRO) providing Phase I-IV clinical development services to the biotechnology, pharmaceutical and medical device industries. Medpace’s mission is to accelerate the global development of safe and effective medical therapeutics through its high-science and disciplined operating approach. We leverage local regulatory and deep therapeutic expertise across all major areas including oncology, cardiology, metabolic disease, endocrinology, central nervous system, anti-viral and anti-infective. Headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio, Medpace employs approximately 2,700 people across 36 countries.

Job Summary

Are you ready to make a difference?

Responsibilities

Medpace is a Clinical Research Organization that is rapidly growing across the globe. Due to our continued growth, we are in need of qualified and focused individuals, like yourself. This is a vital role in our Commercial Operations department whose success relies upon your finely tuned skills and background. If you are ready to make a difference, you must be able to accomplish these tasks:
Support in the development of processes for new group build out;
Interpret and analyze data from multiple sources;
Provide key analytics and reports for Sr. Leadership;
Provide Project management in support of key business initiatives;
Prepare necessary supporting analytics to assist departmental and business insights and decision making;
Maintain tracking database for key projects and departmental initiatives; and
Learn the Medpace pricing tool, system interdependencies and impact on daily activity.

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Accounting or related field;
3+ years of experience in business intelligence or analytics;
Excellent organization skills and the ability to multitask while efficiently completing high quality work;
Strong analytical and communication skills.

Why Medpace?

When you join Medpace, you become part of a team dedicated to supporting the development of ground breaking drugs and devices. Our employees provide hope for those living with debilitating diseases. We invite you to be a part of something that is impacting millions of people around the globe while enjoying a competitive total compensation and benefits package and internal growth opportunities.

Awards
Medpace Named a Top Cincinnati Workplace for 2015, 2016, 2017 and 2018 by the Cincinnati Enquirer
Winner of the ACRP-Avoca CRO Quality Award in 2018
Recognized with six CRO Leadership Awards from Life Science Leader magazine
Eagle Award winner - which recognizes outstanding leadership, professionalism, integrity, and dedication to advancing the clinical research profession through strong site partnerships

What To Expect Next

We look forward to receiving your application. A member of our recruitment team will review your qualifications and if interested, you will be contacted for an interview.

EO/AA Employer M/F/Disability/Vets

WARNING: Please beware of phishing scams that offer opportunities with Medpace in exchange for sending money. These scammers pose as legitimate employees from actual companies. Please be advised that a Medpace employee will never ask you for a credit card, send you a check, or ask you for any type of payment as part of consideration for a role with our company. All of our careers require that you first complete an online application and go through some sort of interview process.

Options

Apply for this job online Apply
