title: Business Intelligence Manager
description:
About The Team

The Business Intelligence (BI) team builds and maintains database solutions used for daily/weekly/monthly reporting. By designing dashboards, reporting structures, and data warehouse architecture, the BI team serves as the foundation for DoorDash’s decision-making.

About The Role

DoorDash is looking for a Business Intelligence Manager to act both as technical expert when scaling data infrastructure, and as an exceptional people manager. This manager will guide the greater BI team, analysts, data scientists, and DoorDash partners toward vital structured data and insights.

You’re excited about this opportunity because you will…
Offer expertise across data warehouse design and infrastructure maintenance that best supports a rapidly evolving set of products in partnership with our amazing data infrastructure engineering team
Collect, process, and clean data from different sources using SQL, Python, or other scripting languages
Work with cross-functional teams to automate reporting and build a strong reporting architecture
Provide technical mentorship and team management, engaging in recruitment processes across BI
Own and manage a portfolio of internal and external tools which empower analysts and data scientists across the company
Continuously optimize ETL jobs to hit performance targets
Build data governance with scalable processes, useful data definitions, and effective project planning


We’re Excited About You Because You Have…
5+ years experience working in business intelligence, analytics, data engineering, or a similar role
An ability to code complex SQL queries. Python a plus
Knowledge of relational databases (Snowflake, Redshift, PostgreSQL, etc.) as well as big data structures
Experience using and building solutions to support various reporting and data user tools (Chartio, Tableau, Looker, etc)
Experience implementing enterprise dashboarding tools a big plus
Experience with data generated by proprietary software systems as well as industrial solutions (SFDC and Segment a plus)
Experience with Git, Airflow, and Snowflake a plus
Excellent communication skills and experience working with teams to assess their data needs
A can-do attitude. You’re not afraid to roll up your sleeves as a hands-on leader and help the team internalize best practices by example

Why You’ll Love Working at DoorDash
We are leaders - Leadership is not limited to our management team. It’s something everyone at DoorDash embraces and embodies
We are doers - We believe the only way to predict the future is to build it. Creating solutions that will lead our company and our industry is what we do -- on every project, every day
We are learners - We’re not afraid to dig in and uncover the truth, even if it’s scary or inconvenient. Everyone here is continually learning on the job, no matter if we’ve been in a role for one year or one minute
We are customer obsessed - Our mission is to grow and empower local economies. We are committed to our customers, merchants, and dashers and believe in connecting people with possibility
We are all DoorDash - The magic of DoorDash is our people, together making our inspiring goals attainable and driving us to greater heights
We offer great compensation packages and comprehensive health benefits


About DoorDash

DoorDash is a technology company that connects customers with their favorite local and national businesses in over 4,000 cities and all 50 states across the United States and Canada. Founded in 2013, DoorDash empowers merchants to grow their businesses by offering on-demand delivery, data-driven insights, and better in-store efficiency, providing delightful experiences from door to door. By building the last-mile delivery infrastructure for local cities, DoorDash is bringing communities closer, one doorstep at a time. Read more on the DoorDash Engineering blog or at www.doordash.com.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of the best and brightest from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for developing automated, scalable reporting solutions for our organization. The Business Intelligence Analyst will help to work with database administrators to develop backend solutions, while also engaging with business users to understand data and reporting requirements.

Responsibilities:
Help design, development and implement Business Intelligence (BI) solutions and strategies to drive business decisions
Collaborate with the subject matter experts to define solution-based architectures in support of business intelligence reporting: this requires working with the various teams to design and develop data solutions which satisfy the BI requirements of the organization
Design, code, test, and document new or modified BI systems, applications and programs
Develop in-depth understanding of underlying data, data structures and business uses of data to provide clear data visualizations and analysis
Troubleshoot BI tools, systems, and software; performance-tune these applications as necessary
Proactively participate in requirements sessions and prototyping sessions with the business users

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (e.g. engineering, statistics, quantitative methods, or analytics) or equivalent
3+ years of business intelligence analyst or business/data analyst experience or equivalent
Experience in reporting techniques such as Drill-Through, Cross-Tabs, Summary Reports, Scheduled Reports, On-demand reports
Experience with Microsoft’s Power BI, Power Query and DAX
Experience with SQL Server, JSON, JQuery, PowerShell and/or Python
Strong understanding of database structures, theories, principles, and practices

Additional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: 
Ability to translate business questions into problems solvable using analytics tools, and enjoy converting the results of your analyses into visual narratives tailored to the needs of the audience
Strong written and verbal communication skills and have experience working on and communicating with fast-paced, dynamic teams
Ability to deal with ambiguity in a fast-paced environment
Ability to influence, collaborate and communicate ideas effectively
Ability to communicate effectively with peers, managers and internal or external clients
Experience with the Software Development Lifecycle
Experience with Scrum/Agile methodologies

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Core-Mark (Nasdaq CORE) www.core-mark.com
Core-Mark is a Fortune 300 company that continues to grow as an industry leader in fresh and broad-line solutions to the convenience retail industry. Our reputation of empowering customers, employees, and communities has allowed us to build over $16 Billion in revenue. Through our 32 distribution centers, we offer a full range of products, programs, and solutions to customers across the U.S. and Canada.
At Core-Mark, you will discover a culture that enables you to grow, challenges you to achieve, and embraces you as family. Show us your power and come explore your opportunities with Core-Mark. 
THE POWER OF ONE. STRENGTHENED BY ALL.

Position Summary:
This team is responsible for developing, designing, and maintaining databases and dashboards for the organization through Microsoft’s Power BI, Access, SQL Server, and in concert with our third party vendor. Must excel in the following areas:

·        Successfully balance and prioritize workload to ensure given projects are delivered on schedule
·        Use independent judgement and discretion to make sound decisions

Core-Mark Benefits:

At Core-Mark we are a family. We are committed to creating an environment that embraces and enables all to reach their full potential. It is through empowering every employee to bring their full self and full power to work that makes Core-Mark collectively stronger.
THE POWER OF ONE. STRENGTHENED BY ALL.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
#TeamNextdoor

Nextdoor is the neighborhood hub for trusted connections and the exchange of helpful information, goods, and services.

Building connections in the real world is a universal human need. That truth, and the reality that neighborhoods are one of the most important and useful communities in our lives have been guiding principles for Nextdoor. Today, neighbors rely on Nextdoor in neighborhoods around the world in the United States, the United Kingdom, Germany, France, the Netherlands, Italy, Spain, Sweden, Denmark, Australia and Canada, with many more to come

Meet your Future Neighbors

At Nextdoor, we believe in the transformative power of community. In the Business Intelligence team at Nextdoor, we believe in the transformative power of information, bringing together data from a wide variety of sources and making it digestable and actionable by everyone in the company. We are a lean but powerful team with diverse backgrounds and perspectives, because that’s what we seek out and respect in others. We collaborate cross-functionally to make the numbers available and clear, playing a key role in the company’s overall effort to foster stronger and healthier communities.

The Impact You’ll Make

As a Business Intelligence Analyst at Nextdoor, you’ll work to democratize data and reporting to drive strategy and measure performance against KPIs across the business. You’ll be responsible for understanding where the data comes from and making it available to stakeholders across the company via queries, tools, and dashboards. The ideal candidate is a tech-savvy strong communicator who understands how to make data understandable by everyone.

You should be excited to bring your experience and expertise every day in order to:

Partner with data science, sales operations, marketing, and engineering on business intelligence strategy to enable data-driven decision making across the company
Partner with key stakeholders on KPI development and tracking across the organization
Own reporting tools, pipelines, and dashboards to ensure consistent availability and accuracy of mission-critical data
Set expectations and SLAs on data availability, and own communications around SLA performance to the business
Drive self-service for our data platform by creating and documenting data structures and sets, SQL and data tools training, and dashboard development
Care deeply about data quality and empowering employees to leverage data to help them succeed in their careers and help Nextdoor grow and succeed

What You’ll Bring to The House

3+ years working in data or analytics
Expert knowledge of SQL
Strong communication skills with stakeholders at all levels on both technical and business issues
Strong command of Looker (preferred) or another BI/visualization tool
Experience working with ETL pipelines
Ability to understand, tackle, and solve problems from both technical and business perspectives
Experience effectively presenting insights and summarizing complex data to diverse audiences through visualizations and other means
Experience working with and delivering to stakeholders from multiple parts of the company

Bonus Points

Experience with writing and reviewing version controlled code (github)
Experience in an agile or kanban workflow
Some coding experience (in any language), including Python or R

title: Business Intelligence - Business Intelligence Developer I
description:
The BI Application Developer I is an entry level position that will work in a team environment building business intelligence applications. The ideal candidate has some experience in an Information Technology arena and has related education, sound decision making and a drive to learn and succeed. The BI Application Developer I will deliver analytical applications to the organization that include ETL, Data Marts, Data Cubes (OLAP), standard reports and other analytical applications as required.

Duties And Responsibilities Include

Development: Data Models, ETL and OLAP Cubes – Supporting role in the Deployment and Deployment of Dimensional Data Models, Integration Services packages, scripts and other elements to move data from source systems into the data warehouse.

Report Development – Gain experience in understanding business needs and assist in developing reports that analyze data warehouse information to support effective rapid decision making. Assist in developing and deploying reports using various tools including SSRS, Tableau, Excel and SharePoint.

Ad-Hoc Reporting Environment Support – Deploy and maintain reporting models using Visual Studio and SQL Server Reporting services that the business community can leverage for self-service analysis. Publish and maintain necessary metadata (data dictionary, etc.) to support the self-service reporting environment. Conduct informal training sessions that foster a solid understanding within the business community of both the ad-hoc reporting models and reports published through the reporting dashboard.

Job Requirements
Zero to three years’ experience working with SQL queries and processes in a Microsoft SQL Server environment.
Ability to learn and understand technical programming code and processes.
Working knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server 2012 or later and Microsoft SSIS, SSRS, and SSAS a plus.
Ability to understand business issues through detailed information analysis and the ability to analyze data in terms of its business meaning.
Ability to work in a collaborative environment on complex problems.
Exceptional problem solving and communication skills.
Good communication and documentation skills.
Strong work ethic and organized work habits.
Foster company success through a professional appearance, being courteous to customers & vendors and by having a positive attitude.

Physical Requirements

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job the employee is regularly required to sit. However, the employee may choose to stand and move within the cubicle area.
Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard and mouse.
Must possess the ability to effectively hear and communicate.
The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk.
The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 5 pounds.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.

Education

Bachelor’s degree in Math, IT or Finance.

This job description is not all inclusive. Other duties and responsibilities may be added as necessary by the Chief Information Officer

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Business Intelligence Analyst
Vail Systems Company Profile
Vail's mission is to create better contact experiences for the employees and customers of our Fortune 500 clients. We analyze various aspects of contact experiences to find ways to decrease agent and customer effort while improving customer engagement and satisfaction. To accomplish this, we developed proprietary technology that analyzes the most human aspects of conversations.
Business Intelligence Analyst
As millions of interactions move through our platform, billions of packets of voice data are analyzed by our systems. On behalf of our clients, we measure things like voice clarity, emotion, and stress to better understand, predict, and react to conversation dynamics. Vail's proprietary technology has opened the door to new measurements of customer satisfaction, speech intelligibility, and fraud risk. Our continuing development is leading to new solutions for speech analysis, automatic performance measurements, and real-time coaching which empower our clients to humanize their contact center experiences.
Building successful business relationships requires a clear understanding of our client's business needs as well as an ability to communicate the ongoing value of our solutions. Members of the team merge our data with client data to make the perfect match between their business needs and our solutions. Communicating our findings requires a knack for turning complex insights into compelling business stories. Our analysts test hypotheses and leverage storytelling to facilitate collaboration between our clients and product managers. We're looking for people to join this team.

About Yourself

You have an affinity and passion for analyzing vast amounts of quantitative and qualitative data. You are methodical and scientific, constantly building and testing your hypothesizes. You challenge yourself and work well independently, but can contribute to a diverse team as well. You feel just as much at home running statistical tests in Python, Excel, or R as you do with building visualizations in Tableau, Superset, or Power BI. You have no problem getting into the weeds of a problem when necessary. And when in the weeds, the drum you march to is an upbeat soundtrack playing in your head.

Here Are The Essentials We're Looking For
Bachelor's degree in Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Business, or related field
Fluency in Tableau, Superset, Power BI, or other data visualization tools
Experience supporting the strategic analysis that impact decisions
Proficiency with SQL, and non-relational databases
Ability to communicate and distill complex analyses for a non-technical audience
Proven track record of collaborating well with clients and team members
Experience developing statistical or pattern recognition applications in Python, R, or Matlab
But you'll set yourself apart if you can also demonstrate:
A talent for storytelling and an elegant visual style
A firm understanding of operational and financial business metrics
Prior experience with speech analytics tools and especially with contact center data

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Job Description

Business Intelligence Analyst - 6+ months project - Santa Monica, Ca.

Job Description

This position requires close collaboration with business stakeholders and subject matter experts, in order to gather requirements, translate them into technical specifications, and deliver implementation-ready datasets and dashboards that will guide the company's advertising strategy.

The ideal candidate should be familiar with ETL jobs and writing complex queries that will feed reports and/or dashboards. They should also be capable of tapping into multiple data sources and creating their own datasets to suit their end goal.

Responsibilities
Read and ingest data from multiple 3rd party advertising platforms.
Develop automated ETL flows, tap into ad tech APIs, and utilize data visualization tools like DOMO, Power BI, Tableau, MicroStrategy, SAP.
Gather and understand business requirements to set functional specifications for dashboards, reports, and reporting applications.

Demonstrable ability to write complex queries with SQL/Hive.

BA/BS degree in a quantitative field or equivalent experience

title: Business Intelligence Business Analyst
description:
WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

TDS has an exciting new opportunity on our Business Intelligence team at our Corporate office in Middleton, WI! We are seeking a driven, curious and technically passionate individual to develop and support BI solutions for our enterprise business unit customers. NOTE: We have one opening and can fill this position at the Staff or Senior level based on applicable skills and experiences. Come join our team!

WHO IS TDS?

TDS is a diversified Fortune 1000® national communications services company. TDS provides wireless products and services; cable and wireline broadband, TV and voice services; and hosted and managed amenities throughout the country via our U.S. Cellular, TDS Telecom, OneNeck IT Solutions, Bend Broadband and Suttle-Straus brands.

We are unable to provide sponsorship for this position and this is not a contract to hire role.

WHAT WILL THE BI BUSINESS ANALYST DO?

Partner with teams throughout the TDS family of companies to understand their business processes and requirements for data, reporting, and governance needs
Coordinate, assess, analyze, and document system requirements and/or functional needs to contribute to business intelligence solutions
Lead projects including defining scope, developing technical requirements and estimates for project work/business cases, creating work plans, assisting with application design, managing build, and providing input into support models and implementation plans
Assist in project management (including development of work plans, and effort estimates) and test approach/test planning
Analyze and document business processes and identify process improvements or enhancement opportunities
Perform governance audits, create instructional materials and determining delivery method

WHAT SKILLS & EXPERIENCE DO YOU NEED?

Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Business or related field or equivalent combination of education and experience -OR- Associates degree and 2+ years related IT work experience
2+ years additional experience in information technology systems that includes a combination of business analysis, requirements solicitation, process automation, and project management
WHAT SETS US APART FROM OUR COMPETITION?

TDS has a strong set of values and behaviors that help foster a high-performance culture.

We believe in partnering with local communities throughout the country and encourage all employees to participate in volunteer opportunities
TDS was recognized by Madison Magazine as one of the “Best Places to Work”
We make employee development and training a top priority
TDS promotes a healthy life / work balance in a professional, yet casual work atmosphere that values diversity and strong business ethics
Flexible work culture, wellness programs, tuition reimbursement, continuing education, on-site cafeteria, access to a fitness center and more!
#TDS offers a competitive salary and strong total rewards package. To learn more about this position, or our company, please visit tdsinc.com .

EEO

title: Business Intelligence Manager
description:
Bonaventure is looking for a Business Intelligence Manager to transform our data into insights that drive business value. Using data analytics, visualization, and modeling, they will relentlessly mine, aggregate, organize, and derive available data to identify opportunities to improve business performance. Communicating across multiple teams, this role will develop reports, KPIs, dashboards and serve as a point of contact for all things data. This new position will be based in our Arlington, VA headquarters and report to the Senior Vice President.

Responsibilities Include
Manage BI software and tools. Current tools include Tableau, Juniper Square, Insightly, and Slab, as well as a data warehouse
Design, develop, test and deploy dashboards, scorecards, forecast models, and reports for the presentation of business metrics according to business unit requirements.
Analyze data, discover insights, and draw actionable conclusions from results.
Provide analytics to influence key decision making.
Tell stories and create visualizations to tie data to business strategy and direction.
Develop simple and easy to use interfaces to make data appropriate to a variety of user groups.
Be an expert in BI and continue to identify opportunities to enhance data analysis, reporting efficiency and methodology. Stay on top of business changes, identify new gaps in data, and keep production dashboards relevant to the business at all times
Other responsibilities as assigned.

Qualifications And Skills
Bachelor's degree.
4+ years of relevant research and data analysis experience
Proficient in business intelligence software, Tableau preferred; SQL or similar relational database management systems; and Microsoft Excel.
Excellent interpersonal and communications skills, with strong critical thinking and attention to detail.
Strong work ethic with ability to effectively prioritize, meet deadlines, adapt to changing priorities and business needs, and succeed in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent attention to detail and the ability to efficiently summarize and prioritize information

About Bonaventure

Founded in 1999, Bonaventure is a private equity real estate company headquartered in Arlington, VA. Bonaventure specializes in multifamily development, redevelopment, and asset management, primarily in the Mid-Atlantic and Southeastern US. Bonaventure is fully integrated to oversee every phase of the acquisition, management, and disposition of our properties. With over $1.75 billion in transactions, $500 million worth of HUD loans, 7,500 residents, and 200 employees, Bonaventure boasts a full suite of multifamily property management and investments capabilities, a Class A construction company, and a portfolio of apartment homes in 2 states and 22 communities.

A comprehensive benefits package is provided. It includes a generous contribution to a group health plan, dental coverage, short and long term disability, life insurance, and a 50% match of the first 6% on our 401(k) plan. 20 vacation/PTO days are offered.

Candidates will be required to pass a credit screening, criminal background check, and drug test.

title: Business Intelligence - Business Intelligence Developer III
description:
Credit One Bank, N.A. is a technology and data-driven financial services company offering a full range of consumer credit card products. As one of the largest credit card banks in the United States, Credit One Bank issues Visa®, Mastercard®, and American Express® products, as well as the Official Credit Card of NASCAR® and the Vegas Golden Knights. Credit One Bank is also the official credit card partner of the Raiders, Big 12 Conference, and Las Vegas Aviators. Learn more at CreditOneBank.com and connect with us @CreditOneBank on Facebook , Instagram , Twitter , YouTube , and LinkedIn .

We are looking for highly qualified professionals at our state-of-the-art, corporate headquarters in Las Vegas, NV. In addition to providing our card members with superior value and service, we are dedicated to providing engaging and challenging career opportunities for our employees. As a member of the Credit One Bank team, we’ll help you be your best and support you so you can reach your full potential.

Position Summary

The BI Application Developer III is an experienced Data Warehousing Developer and Architect that will work as a senior member in a team environment building business intelligence applications. The ideal candidate has a minimum of eight (8) or more years of experience in Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence and deep knowledge of Microsoft BI tools including SSIS, SSAS and SSRS as well as SQL Server databases. The BI Application Developer III will deliver analytical applications to the organization that include ETL, Data Marts, Data Cubes (OLAP), standard reports and other analytical applications as required. The candidate will fill a strategic role assessing Data Architecture for future evolution and change and assess business needs, recommending new Visualization, Analytic and Data movement tools as required. The candidate will provide forward-thinking Business Intelligence and Data Management recommendations and play a key role in expanding the Company’s Business Intelligence Architecture. The BI Application Developer III will help to teach and assist the less experienced members of the team.

Duties And Responsibilities Include

Development: Data Architecture, Data Models, ETL and OLAP Cubes – Design, Develop and Deploy Dimensional Data Models. Create Integration Services packages, scripts and other elements to move data from source systems into the data warehouse. The BI Application Developer III will also utilize data transformation steps to cleanse, aggregate and summarize data to create star schemas consisting of fact and dimension tables. The candidate will assist in reviewing design and code produced by team members.

Report Development – Work in collaboration with the organization to understand business issues, identify new valuable areas of analysis and develop reports that analyze data warehouse information to support effective rapid decision making. Assist in developing and deploying reports using various tools including SSRS, Excel and Sharepoint. Recommend additional tools for improved Data Visualization for business users.

Ad-Hoc Reporting Environment Support – Deploy and maintain reporting models using Visual Studio and SQL Server Reporting services that the business community can leverage for self-service analysis. Publish and maintain necessary metadata (data dictionary, etc.) to support the self-service reporting environment. Conduct informal training sessions that foster a solid understanding within the business community of both the ad-hoc reporting models and reports published through the reporting dashboard.

Production Processing Support – Provide support and troubleshoot issues as needed for the automated ETL data processing environment. Assess the growing and evolving environment for improvement and work with the BI team to enhance process logic, improve data quality, and improve performance and data availability.

Position Requirements
Minimum eight (8) or more years’ experience building Data Warehouse and Business intelligence solutions.
Minimum of seven years’ experience working with SQL queries and data processes.
Minimum of seven years’ experience using Microsoft Business Intelligence technologies: SSAS, SSIS, SSRS or similar technologies.
Expert knowledge with SQL Server 2012 or later and SQL syntax.
Expert knowledge with OLAP (SSAS, Cubes) and MDX query syntax. Knowledge of DAX a plus.
Experience with Powershell programming and Python a definite plus.
Experience with Big Data technologies and tools a plus.
Experience with Microsoft SharePoint is a plus.
Experience with Tableau is a plus.
Ability to work directly in a team environment with a business group to translate business requirements into reporting solutions.
Keen interest in understanding business issues through detailed information analysis and the ability to analyze data in terms of it’s business meaning.
Ability to comprehend index design and SQL statement optimization techniques.
Ability to work in a collaborative environment on complex problems.
Must be able to analyze and understand business needs and requirements in order to translate to system specifications and deliverable solutions.
Should be able to effectively identify test scenarios in order to assist with systems and user testing.
Ability to troubleshoot both Code and Data quality issues.
Good communication and documentation skills.
Strong work ethic and organized work habits.
Ability to interface well with business end-users and vendors.
Foster company success through a professional appearance, being courteous to customers & vendors and by having a positive attitude.
Physical Requirements

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job the employee is regularly required to sit. However, the employee may choose to stand and move within the cubicle area.
Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard and mouse.
Must possess the ability to effectively hear and communicate.
The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk.
The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 5 pounds.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.
Education

Bachelor’s degree in Math, IT or Finance.

This job description is not all inclusive. Other duties and responsibilities may be added as necessary by the Chief Information Officer

Credit One Bank, N.A. is an equal opportunity at will employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, religion, color, disability, sex, sexual orientation or national origin.

Credit One Bank does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies and is not responsible for related fees.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Overview

Function (Scope and Main Purpose of Job)

The Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst is responsible for the implementation and operation of business intelligence, data visualization, and data driven applications to answer business questions using data driven methodologies, techniques, and analysis.

Responsibilities

Core Service Standards

CLEAN: Must make the property shine and look impeccable while maintaining a neat CLEAN and crisp personal appearance.

SAFE: Must make guests feel SAFE and comfortable through creating a worry free, carefree experience.

FAST: Provide FAST and efficient service with accuracy. Meet service time requirements and anticipate guest needs.

FRIENDLY: Greet each guest with FRIENDLY welcomes, making eye contact and smiling. Use H.E.A.R.T. steps to ease guest concerns. Say thank you to departing guests.

Skills: SQL, Teradata Tools and Utilities, Azure Analysis Services preferred

Casino gaming experience preferred

You will work in an environment where smoking is allowed.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Course Hero is scaling! Help us build a world where every student graduates, confident and prepared, through innovative applications of data science and analytics.

Are you our dynamic Business Intelligence Analyst? You will mine big data sets to create dashboards, scorecards, and reports that facilitate evidence-based decisions. You care about design as much as you do technical rigor and will aggregate the data and format it to allow decision-makers to easily gauge the health of the business. You will use your business acumen and experience working with cross-functional partners to gather requirements and understand the needs of the business to inform your framework for prioritization.

Here are some ways you’ll make an impact!
Partner with data scientists and stakeholders across the business, finance, product and engineering functions to build out a suite of dashboards necessary to track key KPIs for product groups
Work with large structured and unstructured datasets to summarize data for reporting purposes
Identify ways to design, build, and automate key dashboards and reports
Integrate multiple data sources into one visualization to tell a story and effectively communicate data findings to internal and external team members
Work on operational ad hoc data requests for data scientists that support operational decision making
Consistently look for ways to improve the status quo and raise the standards of our team

Are you our next Business Intelligence Analyst?
3+ years of working experience in a BI Analyst role, with experience analyzing data and creating reports using database queries
Have a deep understanding of data mining and data visualization techniques. Create reports and dashboards that facilitate self-service reporting solutions for stakeholders
Proficient in SQL and have experience working with large datasets
Experience developing scripts to enable summarization, aggregation, drill-downs, and visualization
Knowledge and experience working with platforms like Google Analytics, Tableau, Amplitude, and Treasure Data
Proactive, organized, detail-oriented, and quality-driven. You have an eye for quality and rigor in reports and data analyses
Communicate technical information clearly, whether in a presentation, report or in person
Deliver work on time and spot misalignment in expectations
Embrace a growth mindset and are always looking for ways to improve yourself
Excited about tackling tough data problems that no one else can solve


Bonus Points
Worked in education or e-commerce domain
Experience with big data tools such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive, and Pig is a plus
MS or BS degree in a scientific or quantitative field


About Us

At Course Hero, we have an awesome team and a truly engaging culture. We are customer-focused, collaborative, responsible, gritty and we love to learn. Our bold mission is to help students graduate confident and prepared!

We are not the only ones that think we’re onto something big. Course Hero has been recognized as the 278th Fastest Growing Company in North America on Deloitte’s 2019 Technology Fast 500 and also 2019’s One of the Best Places to Work in the Bay Area by the Bay Area News Group. Read up on some of our recent news coverage, blog, and learn more about us to see what it is like to work with our team.

Benefits & Perks!
Competitive salary and stock options
Full medical coverage (medical, dental, vision)
401(k) program with match
Education Reimbursement
Quarterly team events and outings (Sporting Events, Escape Rooms, Go-Kart Racing, Karaoke, Bowling and much more!)
Free lunches twice a week, on-site cafe discount, plus an endless snack and drink supply
Onsite gym – Pacific Shores Center – Classes – Pool – Spa – Rock Wall - Massages!
Commuter benefits, shuttle service from Redwood City, and cell-phone allowance
10K Local Move Program to move within 10 miles of our office
16 weeks of paid leave for maternity or paternity
8 hours per quarter paid time for volunteering for a cause of your choice
Front row seat to Master Educator lectures – check out videos on our LinkedIn Career Page

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
We are looking for a highly talented, passionate and analytical Business Analytics specialist to support our strategy team. This position will report directly to the head of Business Operations and Business Development, with oversight from the CEO. This individual will be responsible for tackling the highest priority strategic questions for our organization, supporting the core BizOps team in strategic initiatives and operational insights across the company. A successful candidate will demonstrate initiative, creativity, analytical skills and excellent problem-solving abilities. Check out this short video at https://youtu.be/r4DUmV5CRVM.

Responsibilities:
Work directly with the product management team to help guide our product's short and long-term growth and monetization strategy
Define, develop and execute highly visible projects such as entering new markets, playing an active role in bringing the new product to market, and analyzing and optimizing the performance of current product offerings
Work with the operations team to lead analytics/tracking of internal processes to streamline business operations
Help develop and refine metrics and KPI’s to help Cahoot achieve its strategic business objectives
Perform hands-on data exploration and analysis on massive data sets.
Use machine learning and data mining techniques to develop robust predictive models in the area of customer acquisition and retention.
Design, launch, and evaluate online A/B testing for the effectiveness of models.
Work with engineering teams to automate model prediction in production systems. Monitor model performance by visualizing results in dashboards.

Who You Are:
Strong interpersonal relations and verbal communication skills
Proactive and able to work autonomously when necessary; however, also being able to work collaboratively in a team
Superb execution and follow-through with strong organizational skills.
Detail-oriented and efficient at multi-tasking
Passion for innovation

Minimum Requirements:
Master of Science degree or equivalent in Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Computer Science, Engineering (Any) or related quantitative field
1 year of experience in statistical modeling or data mining.
Proven expertise with Business Intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau) a must
Demonstrated knowledge of machine learning techniques including clustering, decision tree learning, text mining, Logistic Regression, Linear regression, and deep learning.
Demonstrated knowledge of advanced statistics and probability theory including properties of probability distribution, experiment design, and hypothesis testing.
Experience using scripting languages R and Python to manipulate and visualize data and develop model prototypes. Demonstrated knowledge of coding.
Experience with several programing languages including Java, C, and C++.
Experience with extracting and manipulating data from structured databases using SQL languages.
Experience in Predictive Modelling.
Experience at a leading technology company preferred with a demonstrated track record of driving results
Experience working in SaaS technology companies serving SMBs a plus
Experience working with field staff (sales and account management) highly desirable

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst who will quickly make an impact on our business. We are looking for a problem solver & decision maker. This person will work in concert with stakeholders to improve our core products through recommendations for testing different experiences and advertisements. They will also work with other analysts & data scientists to build algorithms to improve click-thru-rates and conversions. This role also includes generating reports and some aspects of data engineering. This position interacts with all levels of leadership within our organization.

Responsibilities
Provide dashboards, reporting, analyses and actionable optimization recommendations using data science, data mining & statistical methods to drive customer utilization of the website and call centers
Work with internal stakeholders provide high-level insight and detailed segment analysis
Provide insight into current web behavior to inform site changes and marketing opportunities
Use existing data to help predict the impact and recommend the best course of action for future initiatives
Use quantitative and qualitative data to identify A/B and Multivariate testing opportunities and establish success metrics. Deploy and analyze tests.
Monitor and report on trends within the industry. Analyze these trends and provide recommendations for optimization.
Analyze and assess the performance of online advertising campaigns
Continually monitor, revise & optimize ad text
Create, categorize & refine keyword lists to create a comprehensive campaign that drives qualified visitors to client websites
Use statistical analysis to draw conclusions about marketing campaigns and make recommendations accordingly

Requirements
Experience with enterprise web analytics solutions (Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics preferred)
Advanced MS Excel & SQL skills required
Business intelligence tool required (Tableau experience a plus)
Detail oriented, with strong mathematical, analytical and reporting skills
Must be able to understand and analyze data, synthesizing large volumes of data and complex questions into clear analyses and actionable findings
Ability to convert requests from non-analytic stakeholders into actionable analysis & recommendations
Excellent data visualization and communication skills, including the ability to clearly and effectively communicate and present findings to stakeholders at all level
Strong organizational skills and the ability to effectively multi-task and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
Bachelor degree in data science, statistics, economics, marketing or other related field preferred
2+ years experience

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Job Summary

The Direct-to-Consumer International (DTCI) segment of The Walt Disney Company is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst with a strong business acumen and the technical skills necessary to uncover and present insights to various business stakeholders at Movies Anywhere (MA). This position will report to the Manager of Analytics for Movies Anywhere.

Movies Anywhere is a cloud-based digital movie service. This app for iOS, Android, Web, and 10-foot devices (Apple TV, Roku, etc.) enables consumers to discover, purchase, and watch movies from participating studios (Disney, Fox, Sony, Warner Bros., Universal) using a single service, regardless of the online retailer used to purchase those movies.

The Business Intelligence Analyst will use customer attributes, purchase transaction data, and event-level data from the Movies Anywhere apps to build dashboards, perform ad-hoc analyses, and generate insights that various teams at Movies Anywhere (including product, marketing, finance, strategy) can use to make better business decisions. Members of the analytics team at Movies Anywhere are expected to become experts in how consumers interact with the app and what product and marketing experiences will increase engagement, retention, and lead to increased returns to the participating studios. This role will have influence in the future direction of the product.

Responsibilities
Analyze customer cohorts to design maps of the customer journeys both inside and outside the product
Develop a deep understanding of engagement and retention drivers by cohort and provide insight on which product features are most effective in increasing retention and engagement
Uncover and recommend product improvement opportunities that would lead to increased purchase behavior (both inside and outside the app)
Help define metrics/KPIs for new product features and build automated dashboards that can display those KPIs for internal stakeholders
Help ideate and analyze A/B testing experiments to grow the MA user base and increase the number of core and engaged users
Ask and answer the next question(s) after gathering and analyzing the data to make insights more powerful – not just delivering what was asked for!

Basic Qualifications
Powerful SQL skills – almost all of the data we work with is accessible in our Amazon Athena SQL environment. We use JOINs, conditional aggregations (SUM(CASE WHEN), etc.) almost every day to combine data from different sources to understand our users and the performance of product features and marketing campaigns
Business acumen – ultimately, the analyses we perform need to lead to insights and business decisions. It’s not enough to be able to “pull data” and create reports and dashboards that others have requested; our team needs to combine product and consumer expertise with a sense of the bigger picture (general business landscape in which MA operates) to help influence and drive marketing and product decisions
Initiative – if you have something you want to learn about or think will make an impact, you will not only have the freedom to explore, but also you will be expected to do so
Ability to work independently – we understand that it will take some for you to become familiar with the product, our users, and our data, so you can expect to receive ample guidance and direction when you start. Over time, as you become an expert in our business, you will be asked to provide forecasts and recommendations that you will need to build/develop independently
Communication skills – some of the analyses we do are quite technical, but they need to be communicated to executive teams, both internal to MA and to studio leadership teams
Problem-solving ability – Our stakeholders don’t always know the right question to ask, so we often have to figure out what the real question or desired outcome before conducting an analysis
Data visualization skills (Tableau) – Putting together visualizations that update automatically allows our team to only need to do something once, rather than on a daily/weekly/monthly basis. This role needs to be able to turn the results of a complicated SQL query into something that a non-technical person can easily understand

Preferred Qualifications
Experience analyzing a digital product and its users – it’s what we do every day, so any examples you have that demonstrate the value you can bring to a digital product will make you a stronger candidate
Data manipulation skills using Python/R – sometimes we need to do analyses that SQL/Excel can’t handle, so a nice-to-have is being able to work with data using Python (Pandas) or R

About Direct-to-Consumer And International

Comprised of Disney’s international media businesses and the Company’s various streaming services, the Direct-to-Consumer and International segment aligns technology, content and distribution platforms to expand the Company’s global footprint and deliver world-class, personalized entertainment experiences to consumers around the world. This segment is responsible for The Walt Disney Company’s direct-to-consumer businesses globally, including the ESPN+ sports streaming service, programmed in partnership with ESPN; Disney+, the dedicated streaming home for entertainment from Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, National Geographic; and the Company’s ownership stake in Hulu. As part of the Direct-to-Consumer and International segment, Disney Streaming Services, developer of the ESPN+ and Disney +, oversees all consumer-facing digital technology and products across the Company.

About The Walt Disney Company

The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Direct-to-Consumer and International, which is part of a business segment we call Direct-to-Consumer and International.

Movies Anywhere is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

Job ID 738614BR

title: Business Intelligence Manager
description:
Position: We currently have an opening for a Business Intelligence Manager in our San Mateo, CA location. In this role, you will be responsible for owning the businesses key financial and SaaS Metrics reports as well as the underlying data, integration, and warehouse. We're looking for someone that is great with data, and has technical skills to manage and build a central warehouse, as well as understands the SaaS business model or is eager to learn.

Who are we looking for?
Background working with data, visualizations, and analytics
Technical background with an interest in business
Familiarity with the Software-as-a-Service business model
Agile, self-starter who can work independently and collaboratively
Technical interest - We want you to be excited by having your hands in code, working with cutting edge cloud tools, and engaging with the business team.
Ability to understand a business analytics need, break it down into dependencies, assess existing data for gaps, and put together and execute on a solution plan.


What will you be doing?
Becoming Celigo's "Data Czar" to holistically own the business analytics and metrics
Lead build-out of a cloud-based data warehouse solution using a tool like RedShift, Snowflake, or more traditional solution
Work with data visualization tools (PowerBI, Tableau, etc.)
Work to build out integrations to consolidate data in collaboration with the Business Systems Team
Use tools like Python, Pandas, R, Excel, and Google Sheet to analyze data sets from customer usage data to web traffic to financial
Analyze a mixture of larger data sets (customer usage data) to smaller, more defined ones like financial data
Build Celigo's next generation of SaaS Metrics and financial dashboards and reports
Perform regression analysis on data sets to identify areas to improve. For example diving into subscription and customer information to identify patterns in subscription churn.
Perform Data Science work to build models for usage with AI and ML tools
Closely collaborating with leaders across all departments in the business
Define quarterly objectives and drive the team to hit key milestones to increase acquisition and activation
Build and help to standardize business reporting for strategic analysis and internal business review
Provide recommendations and take actions based on strategic objectives, forecast or performance metrics
Work with Finance, HR, and sales leadership to develop reporting supporting initiatives to increase sales productivity
Identify and eliminate reporting and data process bottlenecks
Own the end-to-end process of tracking the sales funnel and operational metrics and delivering regular insights to the business; define and deliver techniques to improve the funnel performance for sales management
Produce and review actionable and accurate sales reporting and BI tools for reps, managers, and sales leaders
Ability to manage multiple priorities and tasks; proven strong organizational and project management skills in a fast-paced environment


Past Experience
Demonstrated data background
Technical skill set, coding background is ideal
Fast learner
Ability to focus on and dive into a problem
Familiarity with visual analysis tools
Advanced Excel/Google Sheet skills
Bachelor's degree in a technical (CS, Engineering, Math, etc) or business-related field


Why You'll Love It Here
We are solving a really hard problem that affects almost every business on the planet: integrating cloud apps
You get the best of both worlds: a start-up opportunity at a company that has already established itself in the market with thousands of happy customers.
You'll have the opportunity to make a significant contribution to the company as well as the iPaaS industry as a whole.
We're at an exciting crossroads as we re-imagine the Integration and iPaaS space. This will take teamwork, creativity, strategic thinking and a willingness to advance the market.
We offer a strong benefits package, 401k, pre-tax commuter expense reimbursement, fully stocked kitchen, snacks, and many other perks.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Home Point Financial Corporation (HPFC) is a rising star in the financial services industry. At Home Point, we created a culture that encourages community, caring and open communication. We want our associates to speak up, become innovators and make impactful changes – no matter what position they hold within the company. What makes our team special? Our "We Care" approach in all that we do. At HPFC we collaborate, question the norm, reinvent and help each other succeed. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment and are looking for an opportunity to develop your career, then we have a great opportunity for you!

General Responsibilities

The Business Intelligence Analyst analyzes and prepares the distribution of key business reporting data and works with management to ensure valuable information is being provided to relevant parties. This individual will be part of a team tasked with turning vast amounts of data into organized information and presenting this information then in a way that enables quick informed decisions. The Business Intelligence Analyst will use a broad spectrum of analytical skills including tracking data, data mining, filtering data, and reverse engineering. The goal of this role is to ensure that Sr. Leadership has all the information needed to make informed business decisions. Turning insights into action is the key to the success of this team.

Key Responsibilities
Gather business requirements for reporting and dashboard development
Assist in creation and publishing of dashboards and reports
Utilize multiple products to offer solutions such as MS Excel and Tableau
Help to inspire a creative learning environment while fostering big ideas
Corresponds/coordinates with other departments to offer solutions
Creates and analyzes key management reporting
Develops integrated analyses, dashboards, reports and presentations
Focuses on delivering key insights to the business
Serving as a consultant to teams across the organization, providing best practices, data interpretations, and training on created business solutions
Identifies potential risks within the multiple area.
Makes recommendations for improvements to current processes
Education & Experience
Bachelor's degree in business or computer science required
2-3 years of business analysis experience; preferably within the mortgage banking industry
Experience capturing business requirements and translating into technical needs
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proven strong critical thinking skills, a track record of innovative thought and analytical abilities
Ability to work well as a member of a team and handle multiple projects simultaneously
Strong organizational skills with close attention to detail
Ability to work under minimal supervision
Knowledge of Microsoft Office products and SQL development
Working understanding of relational databases, business intelligence tools, forecasting and/or statistical models is a plus
Home Point Financial Corporation (HPFC) is an equal opportunity at will employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, religion, color, disability, sex, sexual orientation or national origin.

description:
Overview

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

TDS has an exciting new opportunity on our Business Intelligence team at our Corporate office in Middleton, WI! We are seeking a driven, curious and technically passionate individual to develop and support BI solutions for our enterprise business unit customers. NOTE: We have one opening and can fill this position at the Staff or Senior level based on applicable skills and experiences. Come join our team!

WHO IS TDS?

TDS is a diversified Fortune 1000® national communications services company. TDS provides wireless products and services; cable and wireline broadband, TV and voice services; and hosted and managed amenities throughout the country via our U.S. Cellular, TDS Telecom, OneNeck IT Solutions, Bend Broadband and Suttle-Straus brands.

We are unable to provide sponsorship for this position and this is not a contract to hire role.

Responsibilities

WHAT WILL THE BI BUSINESS ANALYST DO?
Partner with teams throughout the TDS family of companies to understand their business processes and requirements for data, reporting, and governance needs

Assist in project management (including development of work plans, and effort estimates) and test approach/test planning
Analyze and document business processes and identify process improvements or enhancement opportunities

2+ years additional experience in information technology systems that includes a combination of business analysis, requirements solicitation, process automation, and project management

TDS has a strong set of values and behaviors that help foster a high-performance culture.
We believe in partnering with local communities throughout the country and encourage all employees to participate in volunteer opportunities

Flexible work culture, wellness programs, tuition reimbursement, continuing education, on-site cafeteria, access to a fitness center and more!

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Business Intelligence Analyst (Temporary)

Overview

Company is a global recorded music company with a roster of current artists that includes a broad array of both local artists and international superstars, as well as a vast catalog that comprises some of the most important recordings in history. Company is a wholly owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation of America.
The Latin/Iberia Region Division of Sony Music seeks a talented Business Intelligence Analyst with passion for music, insights and the entertainment business.
Reporting to the Head of Business Intelligence, s/he will be directly responsible for transforming data and trends into strategic recommendations and actionable insights in order to help our artists connect better with their audiences across the globe. S/he will provide planning and analytical support to such critical stakeholders as artists, artist management and internal business units in order to ensure achievement of organizational objectives. The Business Intelligence Analyst will champion knowledge-based decision making and act as an advocate for the Latin music audience.
The ideal candidate will have acquired his or her BI expertise in context of the Sales/Marketing function, poses experience in working with market research, expertise in data extraction and transformation methods, and basic statistical knowledge.
THIS POSITION IS BASED IN MIAMI, FL.

Responsibilities

Support developing outcome-oriented consumer and data-driven strategies for artists, projects & partners.
Provide audience insights in the area of music consumption, relation with artists & social habits.
Develop analyses to support marketing planning including deep dive Comprehensive Artist Assessments, Artist Attributes Analyses, and Market Segmentation Analyses.
Drive understanding of marketing and promotional campaigns performance and the impact of marketing investment including digital and social to drive ROI.
Analyze and report on social chatter, sentiment, reach, engagement and audience growth as related to artists and their content, enforce use of essential social metrics / KPIs.
Go beyond the data to identify and clearly communicate issues and opportunities as well as develop actionable recommendations that ensure achievement of business objectives.
Provide guidance throughout the artist career cycle from talent identification and market potential (A&R), to audience growth (marketing), to monetization (sales and business development).
Utilize internal data systems, analytics tools of Sony Music's digital partners and social media analytics platforms to synthesize data into custom insights.
Establish strong relationships with internal teams to gain an understanding of their strategies and objectives.
Understand data sources and systems to ensure data integrity and report accuracy.
Influence internal stakeholders at all levels of the organization to take action based on insights generated to seize business opportunities

Qualifications

Minimum 1 year of experience in business intelligence, insights or analytics with a focus onmarketing performance
Experience with analytical methodologies, social listening/social media analytics, performance/KPI reporting, data mining and visualization required, experience with consumer insights and analysis, market research, predictive / analytical modeling preferred
Advanced Excel skills (Pivot tables, VLookups etc.) and extensive experience in PowerPoint
Knowledge of SQL, Alteryx, R, Python, Tableau preferred
Bachelors degree in Business Analysis, Economics or related field
Fluency in English is required, command of Spanish is a major plus
Experience in the entertainment/music business is a plus, but not a requirement
Analytical mindset - ability to identify trends in large datasets, display creativity in problem-solving, and generate new ideas
Highly organized team player who is detail oriented
Ability to thrive in fast paced environment, manage multiple tasks at once and work to deadlines
Strategic thinker with strong analytical skills and the ability to connect disparate data sources into a straightforward, insightful story
Excellent communication and presentation skills to effectively report findings and influence change within the organization
Passion for music and desire to build a career in the industry
Company is committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all persons regardless of age, disability, national origin, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, veteran or military status, marital and civil partnership/union status, alienage or citizenship status, creed, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
First Atlantic is seeking an individual to help the company meet its goal of helping our members. The Business Intelligence Analyst position is responsible for developing processes, staff, and tools to analyze data and provide actionable predictive information to empower Credit Union management make informed business decisions and identify emerging trends.

They will organize and present data with an understanding of the business environment, business processes, and the insights that the business needs.

This role will design, build and manage all data and processes necessary to support operational analytics; simplify and advance the current reporting platform; provide data capabilities; and, continuously identify processes to automate/eliminate by applying business process improvements wherever possible.

The Business Intelligence Manager evaluates credit union's data, as well as competitor and industry data, to discover ways to improve their market position.

Experience architecting large scale BI solutions
Experience communicating analytical outcomes to both business and technical teams
Preferred Qualifications

Demonstrated ability to coordinate projects across functional teams, including engineering, IT, product management, marketing, finance, and operations

Experience with statistical analysis using R/SAS/Matlab or similar tools

Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

Do you want to join an innovative team of scientists and analysts who use machine learning and analytic techniques to create state-of-the-art solutions for providing better value to Amazon's Sellers and Customers? Are you excited by the prospect of analyzing and modeling terabytes of data to solve real-world problems? Do you like to own end-to-end business problems/metrics and directly impact the profitability of the company? Do you like to innovate and simplify? If yes, then you may be a great fit to join the Science and Analytics team for Amazon Global Fulfillment Services (AGFS).

If you have an entrepreneurial spirit, know how to deliver, love to work with data, are deeply technical, highly innovative and long for the opportunity to build solutions to challenging problems that directly impact the company's bottom-line, we want to talk to you.

We are looking for a stand out Business Intelligent Engineer responsible for building out analysis, visualization tools and processes to inform our business decisions. The successful candidate will be able to retrieve, integrate, visualize and present critical data in a format that is immediately useful to improve the business decision-making process. This role requires an individual with excellent analytical abilities as well as an outstanding business acumen. The successful candidate will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, who has a strong attention to detail, and enjoys working with large-scale data.

What is Amazon Global Fulfillment Services?
“Sellers on Amazon’s Marketplaces, from Fortune 50 companies to hundreds of thousands of small businesses and entrepreneurs operating in 135 countries, gain direct access to Amazon’s 300 MM+ customers in 180 countries. More than ever, these Sellers are brand owners designing and manufacturing new products, creating a wave of innovation in global commerce. Amazon Global Fulfillment Services (AGFS) provides the software and services to enable this global supply chain, linking the factory floor to the customer’s door. Not only does AGFS provide Sellers with reach and scale, but AGFS also enables Sellers to leverage Amazon’s Prime shipping speeds and customer trust. As Jeff Bezos put it, AGFS “is so important because it is the glue that inextricably links Marketplace and Prime…”

Who is AGFS?
“We are product managers, data scientists, engineers and more, all working on some of the world’s most complex operational challenges today at Amazon scale. We’re inventing new products, tools and services for Sellers to better manage their businesses. We’re using machine learning to prevent waste and defects for our Sellers, while improving shipping speeds and driving out cost – all of which, in turn, reduce prices and improve the experience for Amazon Customers.”

Why join AGFS?
“AGFS is a mission-driven business whose purpose is to empower global entrepreneurs and enable product innovation at scale. More than 20,000 of these businesses surpassed $1 million in sales in 2017 and they created 900,000 jobs worldwide. By joining AGFS, you will have the opportunity to engage in challenging problems alongside smart and hard-working colleagues who are passionate about innovating on behalf of our Sellers.”
Major responsibilitie
Partner with operations, product management and software development teams to consult, develop and implement KPI’s, automated reporting solutions and data infrastructure improvements to meet business needs
Design, develop and maintain scaled, automated, user-friendly reports, dashboards, etc.
Write high quality SQL code to retrieve and analyze data from database tables (ex. Redshift, MySQL, Hubble), and learn and understand a broad range of Amazon’s data resources and know how, when, and which to use and which not to use
Apply deep analytic and business intelligence skill to extract meaningful insights

Basic Qualifications
BA/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related field
4+ years of relevant work experience in a role requiring application of analytic skills to integrate data into operational planning/business planning or advanced degree
Advanced skills in Excel as well as any data visualization tools like Quicksight or similar BI tools (familiarity with Tableau and Quicksight preferred
Preferred Qualifications
Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics or related field
Experience in writing and tuning SQL scripts
Experience working in very large data warehouse environments
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age
