title: Business Intelligence Analyst
company_name: GLS General Logistics Systems Europe East
description:
About Our Company

Come work for a great company with strong employee retention and a team of industry veterans with true passion for what they do. General Logistics Systems (GLS), is a leading regional delivery carrier which has been providing Priority, Ground, and Freight services throughout the West since 1995. Thousands of companies across all industries rely on our company to deliver time-critical packages and documents every day because we’ve got an amazing team that goes the extra mile for our customers.

Position Summary

Collaborate with all other departments (Operations, Quality Assurance, Sales, Customer Service and Finance) to identify business intelligence, reporting and data analysis needs. Turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound business decisions. Define key performance indicators (KPI) and provide performance monitoring and insights. Analyze business processes and work with all teams to ensure we are optimizing our resources. Support improvement initiatives to reduce cost, increase production and improve service levels.

Responsibilities & Duties
Build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables identifying and addressing critical issues.
Develop meaningful and lasting relationships with partners that encourage collaboration and buy in.
Work with internal customers to define key performance indicators (KPI) and identify business intelligence, reporting and data analysis needs.
Validate data warehouse system for data integrity, quality and accuracy.
Provide performance monitoring and insights via BI reports, dashboards, alerts and ad hoc analysis with the help of BI tools and MS-Office products.
Educate and train business teams to use the data as an analytical toll to enhance business decision-making capability.
Research business problems and assist in creation of models that help analyze these problems.
Help establish costing models and track performance to report variances.
Use data mining, model building and other analytical techniques to develop operation insights and business opportunity.
Perform data analysis and reporting in support of budgeting, forecasting and pricing.
Perform alternative operating model analysis to establish most productive and cost effective operational setup.
Cross train and provide support within department as needs arrive.

Qualifications Needed
Education - Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Information Technology, Economics, Statistics or similar.
Skills and Abilities
Proficient computer skills including Windows and Microsoft Office Suite with exceptional Excel skills using large-scale, complex datasets and pivoting capabilities.
Have a good understanding of database principles with emphasis on SQL query language.
Previous experience with a BI tool and data visualization preferred.
Keen eye for details and aptitude for working with data.
Highly accurate and thorough in all tasks.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Have an interest in going beyond the obvious and delve into the source, the definition and foundational roots of a data element.
Data analysis, ability to infer trends and spot patterns.
Ability to translate data into actionable insights and advise management of findings for problem solving/decision making purposes.
Ability to handle conflicting priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Self-starter with a desire to learn and the ability to rapidly understand the business and its drivers.
Strong written and verbal/interpersonal communication skills.
High degree of professionalism, integrity, and the ability to exercise excellent discretion and judgment when dealing with confidential information.
Physical
Repetitive Motion - Movements frequently and regularly required using the wrists, hands, and/or fingers.

Disclaimer Statement

This job description is not intended, nor should it be construed to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, skills or working conditions associated with a particular job. It is intended to be only a general description of the principal requirements common to positions of this type

Benefits For Full-Time Employees
401K with employer matching
Healthcare benefit options
PTO & Sick Leave
Dental, Vision and Life AD&D

EEO Commitment

General Logistics Systems US (GLS), is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and is committed to a diverse workforce. We welcome all qualified applicants to apply to at GLS and we strive to select the best qualified applicant for each position in our organization. Applicants will receive fair and impartial consideration without regard to race, sex, color, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic data, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion or other legally protected status, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law. GLS complies with all laws and regulations relating to employment discrimination, and are always committed to doing what’s right.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
What if nature could be harnessed to help farmers sustainably feed the planet? Since 2014, Indigo has questioned agriculture's full value chain to improve grower profitability, environmental sustainability, and consumer health. The company’s scientific discoveries and digital innovations have amplified new value from soil to sale, benefiting more than 10,000 growers to date. Indigo is also the company behind The Terraton Initiative, a global effort to drawdown one trillion tons of atmospheric carbon dioxide by unlocking the potential of agricultural soils. In 2019, Indigo was ranked #1 on CNBC’s Disruptor 50 list. Headquartered in Boston, MA, Indigo has additional offices in Memphis, TN; Research Triangle Park, NC; Sydney, Australia; Buenos Aires, Argentina; Basel, Switzerland; and São Paulo, Brazil.

The Business Intelligence Analyst will lead efforts to enhance, monitor, and manage their Team’s business intelligence platform of dashboards and databases. They will be comfortable collaborating with business leaders to understand organizational pain points in order to build out reports and dashboards that will provide insights for data-based decision making. With technical skills to complement their analytical experience, they will solve business problems, collaborate across teams, and be passionate about data and having an impact on their Team.

Responsibilities
Become subject matter expert on Indigo’s BI team best practices, tools, and data warehouses
Use Looker and other supporting tools within BI functions (Snowflake, Git, Jira, etc.) to construct impactful dashboards that provide views into various business units
Augment current development processes through applying own experiences
Assist in creating documentation for team
Serve as a guiding member of the team when onboarding new analysts


Competencies
Strong analytical thinker with ability to decipher/determine highest priority, most impactful data outcomes
Passion for concise and thorough documentation
Ability to create and communicate findings from data-focused analyses with a variety of technical and non-technical stakeholders
Ability to perform detailed data exploration and validation from a variety of sources
Ability to work cross-functionally with business teams to ensure proper data collection for robust reporting
Highly flexible and comfortable with ambiguity; creative
Understands and manipulates data in order to create useful visualizations with actionable insights
Understands and is excited by Indigo’s mission and core values


Qualifications
3+ years experience with data modeling, BI dashboard design, or analytics experience
Experience translating functional requirements into easy-to-use, flexible reporting solutions and dashboards
Technical requirements:
Advanced SQL proficiency (any dialect)
Extensive experience with data modeling and warehouse architecture
Experience using Looker or other visualization tool (e.g. Spotfire, Tableau, Google Studio) to build reports and dashboards
Experience with Salesforce / Einstein Analytics, Python, R, Excel, or javascript (D3.js)
Individual contributor with experience leading projects or as a project lead
Broad industry experience preferred (data science, tech, life sciences, etc.)
Prior experience working in a fast-paced, growth environment
Bachelor’s degree, required


Indigo is committed to living our values, specifically “creating a work environment where everyone feels respected, connected, and has opportunities to learn and grow.” As part of living our values, we strive to create a diverse and inclusive work environment where everyone feels they can be themselves and has an equal opportunity of succeeding.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Job Description

We have a unique opportunity for a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will work directly with the executive leadership team to identify key data points that influence decision making in the company’ s operations through the management of and creation of unique operational reports and dashboards. This role will be crucial to business operations and will play an important part in how we scale as the company continues to grow.

Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To
Collaborate with company executives, sales team and operational team members to understand processes, identify strategic objectives and create unique operational reports and dashboards that track execution success
Utilize data visualization tools to promote the use of data driven decision making
Gather intelligence on key operational and financial metrics
Respond to direct requests for data and reporting from Chief Operating Officer and other senior-level executives
Use data to illustrate information stories in various mediums (Excel, Microsoft BI etc.) that aid in the development of key strategic initiatives and generate clear insights shared with company executives, industry professionals, and prospective investors


Qualifications
Demonstrated ability to exert influence and deliver on capabilities without having direct control over all participating resources
Experience with Retail / Wholesale businesses (preferable apparel).
Superior collaboration skills with the ability to listen, communicate, and motivate teams to achieve results
Ability to merge / combine mixed data from disparate sources
Ability to query reports from SQL databases or familiarity with relational database concepts
Strong Excel skills
Knowledge generating financial, sales, and other operational reports
Experience with scripting languages, such as Python or R, or visualization software, such as Tableau or MS Power BI, will be taken into consideration


Job Summary

Business Intelligence Analyst is a role for executing BI projects.

This person will be responsible for implementation of new projects within timeline stipulated, communication on project status, providing training and support, develop new features and troubleshooting any issues faced by users internally or on client side.

The BI Analyst will be an integral part of the Technology Business Intelligence Team focused on supporting the data and analytical needs. The BI analyst must have the ability to understand complex data, create analysis and visualization using MS Power BI.

title: Business Intelligence Manager - Pravana
description:
HENKEL IS FOR THOSE WHO STEP UP. DO YOU?

At Henkel, you can make a difference and craft your career. That’s why you own your projects and take full responsibility from an early stage. Our unique brands in markets around the world open up countless opportunities to follow your convictions and explore new paths. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset that allows you to always think out of the box - take the chance and shape the digital future together with us.

YOUR ROLE
Gather, evaluate, and produce all data and analytical information to be shared with all sales channels within the company.

Assigned as the Culver City office liaison between the field sales teams and the Marketing Team that provides the field with all data content needed to execute sales plans.
Work cross functionally with the Sales, Marketing, and Education teams to provide tools and resources for the field sales team.
Maintain consistent daily/weekly communication with Director of Field Sales

Your Skills
Proven data analytical background with 5+ years of experience.
Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent role experience.
High proficiency with MS Office - Word, Excel, Pivot Table, PowerPoint, OneNote, and other administrative tools required for completing the tasks of the role.
Team player with strong communication skills and ability to clearly articulate ideas through concise & timely written correspondence.
Strong organizational, multi-tasking and project planning skills with the ability to work with cross functional team members.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, ability to gather and analyze information to develop fact-based recommendations.
Henkel is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

Henkel does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms or employment agencies. title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Arrive Logistics is seeking a highly-motivated Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team. Our strong, data-driven culture offers a unique opportunity for a BI Analyst looking to make an immediate impact across all functions and at all levels of the organization. As the fastest growing logistics brokerage in history, we are seeking someone who will thrive in a fast paced and evolving environment.

In This Role, You Will
Develop an understanding of the logistics industry as well as Arrive’s core business functions and processes.
Work closely with key business stakeholders to identify analytical and reporting needs and document requirements.
Collaborate with the product and engineering departments to support the company's technology roadmap.
Identify patterns in large data sets and develop machine learning and statistical models to automate everyday decision-making.
Prepare, clean, and wrangle data for use in predictive and prescriptive statistical modeling.
Support the design and development of new data structures to facilitate reporting and analytical capabilities.
Visualize and communicate results to key business stakeholders based on analysis.
Respond to ad hoc requests for analysis as needed.
Maintain awareness of emerging technology trends and conduct product evaluations.

The Ideal Candidate Is/has
Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, Business or equivalent relevant experience.
5+ years of experience in Business Intelligence, Data Analysis, or Information Management.
Experience delivering BI and analytics solutions that involve statistical modeling and machine learning programs such as R and Python.
Expert with Excel, SQL, SSRS, and Power BI or other data visualization tools.
Strong written & oral communication skills and an ability to present effectively to stakeholders of all levels.
Strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills.

Experience in the Logistics or Transportation Industry a major plus.

Why Arrive?
Make an immediate impact on a lean business intelligence team.
Work in the heart of downtown Chicago, IL!

Collaborate alongside experts in the logistics industry and leaders in technology.
Take advantage of excellent benefits, including health, dental, vision, and life coverage.

Soothe aches and pains with our monthly in-office massages!

title: Business Intelligence Intern
description:
The Business Intelligence Intern is responsible for analyzing and reviewing data that is collected in our current and future products and services. Working with our Data Scientist team, the Business Intelligence Intern would need to be able to take this data and apply to the markets our products are in for us to better serve our customers. This position will require a high degree of attention to detail along with ability to review calculations for quality assurance. Troubleshooting and problem solving, as well as working closely with managers and software developers to solve these problems, will also be needed. This position requires good communication and organization skills, along with a working knowledge of day to day operations and priorities within their department and the company. Experience with Microsoft Excel preferred; skills in SQL, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, and/or R/Python are helpful but not required. Assume other duties as assigned.

Founded in 1978, Sandhills Global, Inc. serves the trucking, agriculture, construction, heavy machinery, aviation, and technology industries with a diverse range of products and services from well-established trade publications and websites to hosted technology services customized to meet the evolving needs of our customers. Headquartered in Lincoln, Nebraska, Sandhills’ facilities include an on-site printing press, bindery, and state-of-the-art data center (as well as a geographically disparate redundant data center in Scottsdale, Arizona). Twenty international office locations are backed by decades of experience and the continuous investment in the most cutting-edge technologies, making Sandhills Global, Inc. a global leader in the respective industries it serves.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Business Intelligence Analyst

You’ve seen and heard the media talking non-stop about Urlacher’s new head of hair, and the company (RESTORE HAIR) that helped give it to him. The billboards of Urlacher and Ryne Sandberg showing off their hair are literally everywhere - and all thanks to RESTORE.

Provide data mining, data modeling, and related analyses to drive forecasts, market segmentation, pricing decisions and to monitor performance

Statistical programming and analysis

Mastery in excel with great attention to detail

Ability to prioritize multiple projects and work independently or as part of a team
Restore Hair, headquartered in Oak Brook, IL, has become the nation's largest and fastest growing hair restoration clinic. You've seen and heard the media talking non-stop about Brian Urlacher and Ryne Sandberg's new hair, and the company (RESTORE HAIR) that helped give it to them. title: Manager, Business Intelligence
job_location: Township of Edgewater Park, NJ, US

Burlington is committed to being an employer of choice. We offer a competitive wage and benefit package including a generous paid time off plan, a company matched 401(k) and an associate discount. title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
"Syntelli" means SYNchronizing inTELLIgence with data. title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Job description
The Business Analyst supports senior management by engaging in data analysis and translation of a diverse environment of information into reporting and actionable recommendations that will enable the company to achieve its strategic objectives. Using business acumen and analytical tools, you will design solutions that will improve business unit performance, provide analytical support and guidance, and determine the best approach for business and reporting needs.

Responsibilities:
Explore and examine data from multiple disparate sources in order to identify, report, and analyze core metrics directly impacting business objectives
Find and interpret rich data sources, manage large amounts of data despite hardware, software and bandwidth constraints, merge data sources together, ensure consistency of data-sets, create visualizations, and communicate of the data insights
Work in conjunction with the Development team to define solution for extract, transfer and load of data from different sources into DW.
Promote the importance of data integrity and ensure consistent presentation of information across the organization
Provide technical analysis to prepare specifications for data and reporting needs – assist with QA and testing of new data
Based on assigned department need, research and gather data for industry benchmarking and support business decision-making
Design and develop automated reports, dashboards, and stories using Tableau

Requirements:
Exemplary analytical problem solving skills, and knowledge of business analytics tools. Hands on experience with data visualization tools and leading BI tools such as Tableau highly desired
Working knowledge of database architectures and structured query language (SQL)
Ability to work with company executives to understand the company’s business needs and strategy
Proficient at developing, gathering and writing functional and system design specs for web based, reporting and data solutions
Advanced knowledge of Excel
Experience developing budgeting and forecasting models
Strong attention to detail and excellent written/verbal communication skills
A driving curiosity to understand the core drivers and leverage points of the business and to research and analyze potential solutions
Ability to research and understand new technologies and methodologies for BI reporting
3 years of data analysis and business analysis or related experience
BS/BA in Business, Finance, Computer Science, Engineering, MIS, Statistics or other related field preferred
Working knowledge of the insurance Industry (Property/Casualty), terms, and processes a plus

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Why should you join Fairbanks Morse?
For 125 years, Fairbanks Morse has been powering the world forward with innovative distributed power generation solutions that deliver optimal performance in a wide range of applications from base load and standby in municipal, nuclear, and institutional facilities to locomotive engines, and naval and commercial-class ship propulsion and shipboard power. We are most known for our flagship Opposed Piston (OP) engine technology that has been trusted for decades and has totaled over 100 million operating hours - many units with over 40 years of service.

If you have ideas and passion and want to join a world-class team, then we want to help you fulfill the dreams and passions that truly drive you. Read more about what it is like to be a part of the Fairbanks More team here: https://www.fairbanksmorse.com/careers

Fairbanks Morse invests in YOU!

By joining us, you'll have the opportunity to make the most of your potential. As a standard, you will be entitled to:
A benefits package including: health, dental, and life insurance, 401k match at 6%, tuition reimbursement, vacation and sick time, bonus potential, and many more
Personal development to grow your career with us based on your strengths and interests
A working culture based on a philosophy that balances the individual's success and growth on an equal footing to that of the company


As a Business Intelligence Analyst at Fairbanks Morse, you will utilize your passion for engineering and technology to help create a more streamlined and efficient inventory system for our world-renowned engines. You will be responsible for the development of various Business Intelligence solutions, including the design of reports, dashboards, and other strategic initiatives for customer and business needs in the aftermarket segment.

Within this entry-level position, you will take full ownership of the aftermarket segment's Business Intelligence function, including:
Developing Business Intelligence reports and dashboards, such as for inventory management, inventory planning, and ERP maintenance.
Providing information to management by assembling and summarizing data, preparing reports, and making presentations of findings, analyses, and recommendations.
Validating the data warehouse feeds into the reporting tools.
Conducting data investigations and assisting business partners with complex data analysis and ad-hoc queries.
Working to enable business partners in the development of their own reports and dashboards.
Monitoring queries and report behaviour to assure performance KPIs are met.
Providing training for end-users as needed.


What are we looking for?
Completed Bachelor's degree.
1+ years of experience as an engineering intern or in a technical-focused position within a manufacturing environment, including the exposure to an inventory database management, particularly parts inventory
A passion to learn more about business intelligence tools, databases, data warehousing, multi-dimensional/relational data, and data hierarchies


What would make you stand out?
Completed degree in Mechanical/Industrial Engineering or Management Information Systems Engineering.
Experience with a Business Intelligence tool, preferably Qlik or QlikView
Knowledge of one of the following; Oracle Discoverer, Oracle Daily Business Intelligence, Oracle XML Publisher, Oracle Reports, SQL, SQLPlus, PowerBI or Tableau. 


This position requires access or potential access to Unclassified Naval Nuclear Propulsion Information, which is Not Releasable to Foreign Nationals (NOFORN) data. Therefore, to meet NOFORN requirement, you will have to provide proof of US Citizenship and attest that you do not have dual citizenship. Acceptable proof of US Citizenship is a US Passport, US Birth Certificate or Naturalization Certificate.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Purpose

The Predictive Index—the talent optimization leader—is an award-winning best place to work (Inc., Glassdoor, Boston Business Journal, The Boston Globe).

Our mission is “Better work, better world," and we take great pride in PI’s power to supercharge workplace relationships and culture to achieve the unthinkable. We’re our own best case study! You’ll be working toward a mission that inspires you, and you’ll be surrounded by fun, smart, driven people day in and day out.

There’s a reason more than 8,000 companies—including Nissan, Citizens Bank, Drift, Subway, Blue Cross Blue Shield, Docusign, and Omni Hotels—trust PI to help them hire top talent, design winning teams, and develop leaders at every level. Come discover how we empower our clients to solve their biggest challenges and make their business dreams come true.

At The Predictive Index, we embrace a fun, hard-working, and action-oriented workplace culture while keeping our employees’ careers and lives outside of work top-of-mind. If you function best in a client-focused, fast-paced environment where you’re expected to think outside of the box and take action, you may be a good fit.

The Predictive Index is a place where people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives collaborate on amazing, important work. We celebrate our differences, knowing that they are fundamental to our success as an organization. “Better Work, Better World,” starts here, in an organization where every member of the PI community is valued, respected, and welcome. We encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds to apply.

Position

We are seeking an energetic, dedicated, data-driven Business Intelligence Analyst that will take a proactive problem-solving approach to inform decisions and process improvements across the organization. The Business Intelligence Analyst will work with key stakeholders across the company to analyze data, in Domo and other BI platforms, that will drive insights, engagement, effectiveness, and efficiencies across all functions of the organization (sales, marketing, success, product). Output and analyses will directly inform the Senior Management Team. The ideal candidate will be confident delivering the information obtained by analyzing data and developing rich datasets and dashboards.

At The Predictive Index, we embrace a fun, hard-working, and action-oriented workplace culture while keeping our employees’ careers and lives outside of work top-of-mind. If you function best in a client-focused, fast-paced environment where you’re expected to think outside the box and take action, you may be a good fit.

Key Responsibilities
Generate dashboards and cards within Domo that track metrics across all levels of the organization.
Partner with functional leaders to understand their business needs and the data sets required to support them. Integrate with their teams to establish strong professional relationships.
Utilize Domo to create data sets that aggregate data from different sources with the goal of creating a full picture of the health and engagement of our client base.
Build complex data structures by extracting data from disparate sources, and transforming data as needed to support analyses that provide useful insight to key stakeholders.
Examine existing processes and make recommendations to better enhance PI’s data structure, hygiene, and health across multiple systems.
Create a unified and integrated view of our organization’s data that is aligned with our objectives and goals.
Define and evolve cohort classification and assess how well lead generation, sales, product releases, onboarding programs, and other initiatives are impacting cohorts over time.


Desired Experience
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience preferred; experience working as an Analyst or comparative role where data was used to facilitate business decisions.
Comfortable working with data sets, data transformation, and building cards within Business Intelligence platforms like Wave, Tableau or Domo.
Comfortable presenting data visually that is informative, insightful, and easy to understand.
Strong analytical skills: Ability to collect, organize, and analyze data; summarize findings and develop conclusions and recommendations.
Self-starter who takes initiative and is proactive and able to prioritize multiple projects involving various end-users by meeting deadlines and proactively communicating status updates.
Ability to communicate at all levels of the organization, from end-users to Senior Management


People Most Qualified For This Role Will Be
Energetic, self-driven, hyper-focused and career-oriented
Creative, out-of-the-box thinkers
Quick and eager to learn
Comfortable working with end-users to gather requirements and build technical solutions from concept to implementation.
Adept at presenting data insights visually to all stakeholders across the organization.
Strong understanding of data structures and the tools utilized to combine and transform data.
Previous exposure to business intelligence/analytics tools.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.


This role will be located in our Westwood, MA office.

Just as our employees are threads in the cultural fabric of PI, THREADS is our framework for understanding our core values.

Teamwork: Focus on the “we,” not the “me.”

Honesty: Follow your moral compass.

Reliability: Be someone others can count on.

Energy: Be balanced, be energized.

Action: Errors of action are better than errors of inaction. Be brave.

Drive: Own it.

Scope: Don't try to boil the ocean.

The Predictive Index participates in E-Verify. E-Verify is an Internet-based system that compares information from an employee's Form I-9, Employment Eligibility Verification, to data from U.S. Department of Homeland Security and Social Security Administration records to confirm employment eligibility.

The Predictive Index is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Our Mission at ADS Inc. is to actively seek our customers' equipment and logistical challenges and deliver innovative and cost-effective solutions. As we focus on growing our business, engaging with the internal stakeholders and providing them with high quality reliable information and insights is critical for success. As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will have the opportunity to centrally support these efforts at ADS.

You will collaborate with all the departments within ADS. You will become the primary contact for business intelligence solutions within the company. You will also have the opportunity to participate in every step of a data driven decision-making process including identifying business needs, generating hypotheses, work planning, identifying and collecting data, analysis, producing conclusions and insights, and communicating findings.

Responsibilities
Business User Liaison Collaborate with the business users
Requirement gathering and analysis for Business Intelligence products
Develop and Manage Business Intelligence reports and dashboards
Create and maintain documentation for requirements, designs and solutions
Identify and implement Best Practices for Business Intelligence products
Identify opportunities to employ technology to improve processes
Assist Business Units with ad-hoc reports and analysis to support business goals
Be the Point-Person for any data related request from the various users
Analyze business impact of various factors in collaboration with the sales team and suggest courses of action
Identify advanced analytics projects and collaborate with the team to deliver high quality products
Promote Business Analytics products within the company
Ensure continuous learning related to Business Intelligence through courses, conferences, webinars etc.

Minimum Requirements
3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst or Business Analyst
Bachelor's degree, preferably in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Analytics, or Mathematics
Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills
Proficient in SQL, MS Office (especially Excel) and Tableau (or a similar visualization platform)
Knowledge of basic statistics, data analysis and visualization
Excellent listening, communication, interpersonal and presentation skills
Ability to handle multiple projects and responsibilities
Ability to easily communicate complex ideas, issues and designs to a diverse audience
Ability to work both independently and as a part of a team

Preferred Qualifications
MS in Business Analytics
Knowledge of SCRUM Framework
Knowledge of one or more programming languages like Python, R, Java, Scala

ADS believes that a diverse work environment leads to bigger thinking and more creative solutions to our customers problems and we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation or gender identification, national origin or any other legally protected characteristic. We strive to represent our community with a workforce diverse in gender and ethnicity. We actively seek out veterans and the disabled for opportunities at ADS.

Job Posted by ApplicantPro

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
About us:

Fisher & Paykel Healthcare is a thriving, cutting-edge medical device company with a wide and growing range of highly innovative healthcare products. We have manufacturing locations in New Zealand and Mexico, and sales offices and distributors operating in 120 countries around the world, with our largest sales office in Irvine, California.

Our success is due to a supportive and friendly culture that fosters collaboration. You will reap the rewards of working for an organization with a consistent growth strategy ensuring an expanding range of innovative devices for use in respiratory care, acute care and the treatment of obstructive sleep apnea.

We are seeking a BI Analyst to join our Financial Planning & Analysis team. The role's purpose is to improve team reporting through building reporting dashboards and enhancing data visualization.  

Responsibilities:

Create reports including ad hoc request and enterprise reports to support business requirements
Convert ideas and business needs into meaningful report designs and data requirements
Apply predictive analytics to provide customer level reporting
Work with different business units to understand reporting needs; translate business needs into relatable reporting
Create and maintain Business Intelligence Dashboards, ScoreCards, Key Performance Indicators and reports for all business units
Identify opportunities to improve processes and strategies with technology solutions
Proactively manage report development to meet expectations of format and delivery timeframe
Streamline and automate existing reporting
Develop strong knowledge of how our company operates, including how we sell and compensate our sales team
Develop and implement BI solutions that support the monitoring of data quality and integrity
Prepare and maintain BI reporting and analysis documentations
Provide recommendations to enhance BI system performance and capacity

 Skills/Expectations:

Experience designing and developing dashboards and reporting metrics using business intelligence software like Web Intelligence, Cognos, Lumira, Business Objects, Power BI, Tableau, etc.
Experience supporting Operations, as well as Marketing & Sales groups
Ability to write queries using SQL to extract and manipulate data to achieve desired results using select statements, sub-queries, functions, links of multiple tables, scripting, etc.
Ability to understand business questions and translate that business question into analytics
Communicate effectively with multiple stakeholders
Manage competing deadlines as well as variances in schedules and resources
Contribute both independently and as part of a team
Adapt to shifting priorities
Attention to detail and accuracy

Education and Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Business or a related field (Finance, Economics, Statistical Analysis)
3-5 years of experience in business intelligence, data modeling & reporting using BI software
Advanced level skills in Web Intelligence, Power BI/Tableau, Lumira, Cognos or similar business intelligence software, Excel (pivot tables, look-ups, advanced formulas, regressions, etc.) and SQL
Strong understanding of extractions, transformations, loading (ETL) and online analytical processing (OLAP)
Proficient in Data Analysis & Data validation
Familiarity with financial analysis preferred

Fisher & Paykel Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer. The Company's policy is not to discriminate, nor allow any employee to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, age, religion, sex, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status, including veterans and disabled veterans.

Fisher & Paykel Healthcare participates in E-Verify.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Job Description
Works with other team members to plan and implement the move of ETL processes and reports from an Oracle data warehouse to a Microsoft-based SQL Server data warehouse
Interacts with business users to elicit requirements to design, build, and maintain a comprehensive set of facts, measures, and dimension tables
Designs, implements, and maintains a data dictionary
Designs, implements, and maintains COTS business intelligence suite to include creation of new custom reports, dashboards, and content requested by business users
Designs, implements, and maintains new ETL workflows, business logic, metadata management, and change data capture functions from inactive datacenter to an operational enterprise data warehouse
Maintains a denormalized data model for online analytical processing
Maintains an operational data store and enterprise data warehouse
Explains the rationale for architectural decision and defends architectural principles, standards and methods.
Partners with IT management to establish and institutionalize processes and procedures
Estimates level of effort for implementing systems
Participates in technical sessions such as design reviews and code walkthroughs.
Anticipates and resolves issues and risk

Job Requirements

Basic Qualifications
B.S. Degree in Computer Science or a related field
Four (4) or more years of experience in IT field with emphasis on Microsoft-based systems
Specialization in, or is involved with databases, data warehouses, and reporting and analysis solutions
Must understand federal systems, methods for delivering secure IT systems, and be able to support the accreditation of federal IT systems
Experience as an architect of Microsoft systems
Experience as an architect of Oracle systems
Experience as an architect of data warehouses

Additional Requirements
Experience with Enterprise SharePoint Systems
Experience with working with software development teams
Must be a U.S. citizen
Must have or be able to obtain Secret Clearance

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
The Business Intelligence Developer collaborates with the Business Intelligence Senior Developer to analyze, provide specifications for, and write individual reports for assigned applications. Meets with Epic application coordinators and report end users to understand their reporting needs.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities
Designs and documents the general functional requirements and detailed technical specifications for reports and their related databases.
Assesses reporting needs of Phelps Health end users through investigations, analysis, and evaluation to create desired reports. Receives and documents formal requests from consumers including specifications (layout, calculations, data source, etc.) Evaluates requests for completeness, and if needed, works with end user to finalize the request.
Creates complex operational and project-related reports including analysis, design, documentation, versioning, development, configuration, testing, implementation and ongoing support for Epic Clarity and Chronicles reports. Utilizes tools such as Reporting Workbench, Crystal Reports, and Business Objects Enterprise.
Maintains existing reports and analyzes and evaluates requirements for new and modified reports, and databases.
Prepares detailed specifications, technical, and user documentation from which reports, downloads, and extracts will be written. Ensures complete and accurate logical definition of data.
Responsible for maintaining data integrity and ongoing quality control of delivered reports. Validates system build and report designs and performs audit and report findings of security and data controls.
Provides technical direction, guidance, and assistance during project development to accomplish all required formal sign-offs.
Investigates, resolves and performs follow-up tasks on system and related problems. Collaborates to seek resolution of system design conflicts for points of integration, and communicates risk implications to the Business Intelligence Senior Developer.
Implements reports and database software in an optimal manner to minimize the effect on production and development activities.
Consults with and advises vendors and technical groups concerning the continued support of reports and databases.
Recommends changes to established guidelines, standards, methodologies, and conventions as appropriate.
Assists end users with quality assurance testing, and documentation of testing results through standard procedures and processes. Ensures test scenarios are adequately documented and perform testing as needed.
Provides technical direction, guidance, and assistance during project development to accomplish all required formal sign-offs. Participates in hardware and software selection, modification, and implementation.
Maintains related support tools, including database installation and testing programs and standards and procedures.
Analyzes, designs, documents, develops, tests, implements, and maintains reporting user interfaces including alerts, prompts, screens, dashboards and templates.
Prepares report management documentation to manage reports library, track project progress, and report problems in timely fashion. Provides documentation and training to transfer knowledge and operational support to the reporting BI team.
Works within established guidelines, standards, methodologies and conventions for report writing and documentation. Recommends changes to established guidelines, standards, methodologies, and conventions as appropriate.
Safeguards protected patient health information and organizational sensitive data from any intentional or unintentional disclosure in compliance with applicable rules and regulations, standards, and quality assurance. Adheres to policy and procedure defined in Phelps Health manuals.
Participates in meetings with stakeholders from physicians groups, nursing, ED, OB, hospital service departments, information systems, clinic operations, management, executive leadership, and reporting. Document main points, issues and key decisions.
Maintains professional growth and development through seminars, workshops, and professional affiliations.
Displays strong written, verbal, and follow-up skills with the ability to communicate complex technical issues in terms clearly understood by technical and non-technical audiences. Demonstrates positive interpersonal skills by effectively working with other team members to identify and resolve problems with project workflow.
Possesses good organizational skills. Prioritizes multiple activities and objectives in a rapidly changing environment, and delivers quality service to ensure timely project completion and timely responses to problems and change management requests. Presents conflicts in priorities to the Business Intelligence Senior Developer for resolution.

Education

Associates degree in a related field of study (i.e. health care, business, computer science, information systems) required. Bachelor's degree preferred. Working knowledge with Microsoft Office products, SQL querying and relational database concepts, including primary keys, foreign keys, and joins. Software development experience in Visual Basic for Applications is preferred.

Minimum Work Experience

One year of working knowledge of developing Business Intelligence report writing systems, data analytics, data mining and dashboards; and reporting programs creation and maintenance within a healthcare/hospital organization.

One year of working knowledge of HIS systems in either (Meditech, eCW, or EPIC) a plus.

Certification/Licenses

Certification in Epic Clarity preferred.

Mental/Physical Requirements

Considerable mental concentration required to complete largely variable duties. Applicant must be able to manage multiple tasks and deadlines with frequent interruptions. Standing, walking, and sitting are required. Light lifting (25lbs/12kg) rarely required.

Working Conditions

Standard office conditions which include occasional noise and distractions or partial remote work environment as defined and approved by Director and Human Resources.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
company_name: The Penn State Student Radio Alumni Interest Group
description:
Campus/Location: University Park Campus Campus City: University Park, PA Date Announced: 01/14/2020 Date Closing: open until filled Job Number: 92942 Level/Salary Band: 03 - H - Exempt Work Unit: College of Information Sciences and Technology Department: College of Information Sciences and Technology Full/Part Time: Full-Time

Description

The College of Information Sciences and Technology seeks a highly motivated and innovative Business Intelligence Analyst ready to provide data query creation, reporting assessment, and modeling data, accessing and querying internal and external data sets to extend to the college's data warehouse capabilities; and design and creation of data reports and visualizations. The successful candidate will be responsible for working with the academic and administrative leadership to create routine to moderately complex applications to ensure delivery of the highest quality and accurate information across all functional areas within the college. Essential responsibilities of this position include: accessing and querying internal and external (where available) data sets to extend the college's data warehouse capabilities; design and creation of data reports and visualization models that are intuitive and user-friendly to users as well as timely and accurate dissemination; design and implement tools/databases that enhance the collection of and reporting of approved data; assist in the coordination with various user groups to gather and analyze requirements and promote the correct interpretation and use of University information; assist, when necessary, in the development of training material and delivering training for data warehouse and reporting deliverables; and assist in the coordination of gathering and analyzing requirements and development of a learning analytics dashboard for faculty and student use. Candidate must have experience with relational and dimensional data modeling, professional experience with structured databases (using SQL), and should have a basic understanding of Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL/ELT) business practices. Experience with Oracle Business Intelligence Enterprise Edition (iTwo), or Tableau is preferred. Knowledge of Python and/or machine learning is a plus. The ideal candidate will be detail oriented, have strong data analysis skills, have excellent written and oral communication skills, and have some experience/knowledge of higher education processes, particularly areas related to student data, finance, human resources, compliance and research functions and strategic planning. Typically requires a Bachelor's degree or higher plus three years of related experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. This is a fixed-term appointment funded for one year from date of hire with excellent possibility of re-funding.
CAMPUS SECURITY CRIME STATISTICS: Pursuant to the Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act and the Pennsylvania Act of 1988, Penn State publishes a combined Annual Security and Annual Fire Safety Report (ASR). The ASR includes crime statistics and institutional policies concerning campus security, such as those concerning alcohol and drug use, crime prevention, the reporting of crimes, sexual assault, and other matters. The ASR is available for review at https://police.psu.edu/annual-security-reports.
EEO Is The Law
Penn State is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer, and is committed to providing employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Dennis Group is currently seeking a Corporate Strategy Analyst to work in our headquarters office in Springfield, MA.
 Position Summary, Essential Functions and Candidate Attributes
As a Corporate Strategy Analyst, you will work closely with the Corporate Team, reporting to the Chief Financial Officer and International Operations Manager, on three main areas:
·        Corporate Governance & Reporting
·        Mergers & Acquisitions
·        International Development

The main duties and responsibilities of the position include:
·        Create and maintain monthly management reports and performance dashboards, consolidating data gathered from multiple sources to provide Senior Management with valuable information regarding financial analysis, business development, operations and human resources metrics from all offices and international subsidiaries
·        Prepare annual budget projections and scenarios, as well as track actual results against forecast
·        Prepare materials for Board of Directors meetings to support strategic decision making, gathering and reconciling information from multiple business partners, such as Project Managers and Office Managers
·        Research industry benchmarks to compare company performance and identify opportunities, challenges and risks to Dennis Group’s future growth
·        Research markets, competitors and clients and prepare conclusion reports to support business development initiatives
·        Assist with financial modelling and valuation to support M&A efforts
·        Assist with internal process workflow optimization and automation of tools to streamline reporting in a timely manner
·        General operational support and ad-hoc projects

Exceptional candidates will be professional, self-motivated, well-organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to prioritize multiple responsibilities in a demanding environment. This position requires frequent interaction with Senior Management, as well as external stakeholders, and the selected candidate will possess strong interpersonal skills. Advanced MS Excel and MS PowerPoint knowledge are essential to the job function.

Required Education, Skills and Experience
·        BS in an Engineering-related field. MBA is preferred but not required
·        1 - 3 years of experience, including internships, in an engineering and/or business, financial or research analyst capacity. Experience working with an architectural, engineering or construction management firm is a plus, but not required
·        Proficient in Microsoft Office
·        Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
·        Excellent written and verbal communication skills
·        Ability to conduct in-depth analysis and draw conclusions and recommendations
·        Ability and willingness to travel as necessary, including internationally
·        Ability to fit into a team environment that includes members at various locations
·        Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with competing priorities to meet tight deadlines and deliver high quality results
·        Portuguese or Spanish language skills are a plus, but not required

Location
Springfield, MA, with opportunity to relocate to another office after 2 years.
 Compensation and Benefits
Dennis Group offers competitive compensation packages commensurate with experience. We provide comprehensive employee benefits including medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance, paid time off including an open vacation policy, as well as performance bonus, profit-sharing, and 401(k) plans. 

Our Company
Dennis Group is the premier Design, Engineering and Construction Management firm exclusively serving the food and beverage production industry. Over the past three decades we’ve built a team with a deep understanding of the intricacies, challenges, and needs of food and beverage producers around the globe. As a full-service firm offering architectural, engineering, master planning, process design and construction management services, Dennis Group is uniquely structured to serve our clients and has earned a reputation for consistently delivering safely executed, high-quality, value-oriented work.

Our company has consistently been ranked the #1 food and beverage design firm by Engineering News Record since 2015. Dennis Group debuted at #3 on the 2019 Zweig Hot Firm list, which recognizes the fastest growing architecture and engineering companies in North America. Our work has been honored with five Food Plant of the Year awards and a National Design-Build Institute of America Project Team award. Over the past thirty years, we have worked with most of the 100 largest food manufacturers.

Headquartered in Springfield, MA, we execute projects worldwide with an in-house team of 500 professionals, based out of eight offices throughout the United States, Brazil, Canada and Portugal. Dennis Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Joining Tipalti means you're stepping onto a fintech rocketship in a collaborative environment. We're the financial execution experts powering high-growth companies and eliminating the pain in payables. Tipalti eliminates up to 80% of the supplier payment and regulatory compliance workload for finance departments. In short, our AI-driven technology does the work no one wants to do, and we do it better than anyone.

Do you dream about large data sets? Do you love solving complex problems with data that drive good decision making? Does the thought of hundreds of variables and tens of thousands of transactions a day make you excited to dig in? Have you used data visualization in your personal life, just for the fun of it? If you say yes to any of the above, this job is for you.

Tipalti is Looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst who will join our growing team. This person will be responsible for cross-departmental analytical work primarily using PowerBI, SQL, and Excel to convert real-time data information into powerful insights that help us manage the business, provide accurate reporting, and make strategic decisions.

This individual will report to the CFO and will actively work with many parts of the Tipalti Organization from Operations, Product, Sales, Marketing, and Compliance. This is a great opportunity for someone with a strong analytical mind to contribute across the organization and get a broad set of experiences from many different functional leaders and projects.

Responsibilities
Point of contact for US operations seeking data and answers from our databases for one-time or on-going projects.
Development of Key PowerBI Dashboards for managing the business at both executive and departmental/functional levels.
Strong business judgment to be able to ask thoughtful questions of the data, track and understand key metrics, and develop hypotheses from the data in collaboration with the CFO.
Developing, maintaining, and managing advanced reporting, analytics, dashboards and other BI solutions.
Merging data sources from multiple places (Financials, Salesforce, Product databases, etc.) to deliver meaningful reporting.
Delivering projects and reporting on time for both set weekly/monthly cadences as well as one-time projects.

Desired Skills And Experience
Advanced PowerBI skills with at least 2 years of using PowerBi in a professional context
Strong SQL Experience
Experience with LINQ and scripting languages
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills to assist in developing solutions to complicated data questions and queries
Strong communication skills both oral and written and the ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical team members.
Ability to work independently
Expert knowledge in Excel required
Experience in developing clear presentations in Powerpoint preferred, but not required
Requirements
Must have 5+ years of Business Intelligence and/or Data Analysis experience
Bachelor’s degree required; advanced degree in related data science or analytical field preferred
Proficiency in PowerBI required; other BI tools are nice but not required
Companies like Classpass, Twitter, GoDaddy, and Zola entrust Tipalti to activate their business models and dramatically reduce AP friction. Founded in 2010 and headquartered in San Mateo, California, we're a well-funded startup growing at 100% year-over-year, supporting over 500 customers.

Beyond transformative technology and industry-leading long-term value with customers, we offer a modern company culture that is customer-centric and built on trust and transparency. We're a "can do" environment where everyone acts to deliver customer value and to build a company that will last.

We oﬀer comprehensive health benefits, a flexible workplace, catered lunches, career coaching, and an environment where you can grow, be an impact player, and thrive! title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
REF#: 36323

CBS BUSINESS UNIT: Simon & Schuster

JOB TYPE: Full-Time Staff

JOB SCHEDULE: Full-Time

JOB LOCATION: New York, NY

About Us

Simon & Schuster, a division of ViacomCBS, is a global leader in the field of general interest publishing, dedicated to providing the best in fiction and nonfiction for consumers of all ages, across all printed, electronic, and audio formats. Its divisions include Simon & Schuster Adult Publishing, Simon & Schuster Children’s Publishing, Simon & Schuster Audio, Simon & Schuster Digital, and international companies in Australia, Canada, India and the United Kingdom.

Description

Simon & Schuster, a division of ViacomCBS, is looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst to perform data analytics and business modeling for our highly successful Pimsleur Language Programs business.

The Business Intelligence Analyst will have very strong analytical, statistical and modeling skills and will come from a direct response, eCommerce environment. Subscription business modeling and retention analysis is required.

On a broader scale this role will help champion a data-driven culture and be responsible the overall health, maintenance, and accuracy of our data collection practices and assets. The candidate will be responsible for compiling, analyzing and informing the business team with valuable data insights to drive business decision making. Specifically, the role will include data analysis from multiple digital sources, including web analytics, mobile data, in-app purchasing, marketing channels, internal sales data, and other sources. The analyst will report on business performance, and make recommendations for improvements.

The analyst will also perform business modeling with a focus on subscription marketing, including, acquisition, retention, and P&L impact.

The ideal candidate will be highly proficient in digital business reporting and analysis leveraging various digital analytics platforms, (Google Analytics, Google Firebase, iTunes Connect, tag managers, etc.) and have extensive experience with campaign management analysis, forecasting and modeling.

Other Responsibilities Include
Reporting on daily/weekly on marketing and sales performance.
Develop monthly revenue & sales forecasts for direct response business.
Analyze subscription acquisition and retention rates, and churn, in order to maximize lifetime value.
Develop predictive models to forecast revenue growth.
Advise on test set up and report on A/B optimization testing for mobile and web.
Define and refine multi-touch attribution models to enhance marketing ROI.
Work with development team and tag management vendors on requirements and execution of analytics tracking
Inform the evolution of digital product development using data-driven analysis of app usage and analytics.
Stay abreast of changes in tracking technology and consumer privacy to ensure data collection is uninterrupted.


Qualifications
5 years’ experience working on a digital direct response marketing team.
Technical competence to perform advanced analytics.
Proven track record in developing models in the fields of marketing / revenue / consumer behavior, such as: response models, LTV, Churn & AB testing.
Ability to translate business questions into analysis, create queries, interpret results, and present findings to senior management.
Ability to analyze trends, synthesize data, and make strategic recommendations based on findings.
Solid understanding of database architecture, data management, file integrations, data processing and hygiene. Prior experience building and managing internal or outsourced marketing databases a plus.
Expertise in Google Analytics, page tagging, aggregating of data from various digital sources.
Experience with Python, excel and other tools for scripting and analysis.

Educational Background Required: Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., economics, econometrics, statistics, finance, the sciences) required. Prior experience working for a subscription-based and direct response business is required.

Eeo Statement

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

Amazon’s Worldwide Operations Employee Relations (ER) team is looking for a customer obsessed Business Intelligence Engineer (BIE) with a demonstrated passion for building innovative new tools and processes for our Associates, site leaders, ER team and senior leadership. The Employee Relations team is responsible for reducing risk to the World Wide Operations business by deploying programs to empower the next generation of high-performing, Associate-centric frontline leaders. Our programs are global in scale and we continually innovate to transform and improve the employee experience. Candidates must have a successful record of building net new reporting infrastructures that support a global team at scale.
The Business Intelligence Engineer will play a critical role in advancing our mission. You will join a tight-knit team of ER professionals, including former HR, operational, program and legal leaders. You will be supporting Amazon's Worldwide Operations portfolio, and have direct impact on the daily work of over 600k+ Amazonians.
Our projects span multiple organizations and require coordination of experimentation, economic and causal analysis, forecasting, dashboarding and predictive machine learning tools. You will act as the business-facing subject matter expert for data manipulation, data visualization, feature adoption and the development of the ER reporting ecosystem.
In this role, you will be a technical expert as you create the ER reporting systems that will track our site, operations and ER health indicators while tracking our impacts to key performance indicators. You will work on mission critical problems, building unique, high quality, reliable, accurate, consistent, and architecturally sound reports/analyses that are aligned with our business needs.

Core Responsibilities
Own the design, development, and maintenance of scalable solutions for foundational business metrics, reports, analyses and dashboards.
Translate basic business problem statements into analysis requirements to deliver astute data powered insights.
Use analytical and statistical rigor to answer business questions and drive business decisions.
Find and create ways to measure the workforce experience at multiple levels in the organization.
Write queries and have in-depth knowledge of the data available in area of responsibility.
Pull the data needed with standard query syntax; periodically identify more advanced methods of query optimization.
Recognize and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, design, analysis, validation, and documentation.
Troubleshoot operational data-quality issues and review/audit existing ETL jobs and queries.
Recommend improvements to back-end data sources for increased accuracy and simplicity.

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree
4+ years of industry experience in role(s) like: Data/Business Analyst, Data Engineer, Business Intelligence, Data Scientist, or equivalent.
4+ years of data modeling, ETL management, and data warehousing experience.
Proficiency with data querying or modeling techniques with SQL or R
Knowledge and direct experience using and deploying business intelligence reporting tools. (Quicksights, Tableau, Microstrategy, Excel etc.)
Preferred Qualifications
Masters in computer science, mathematics, statistics, economics, or other quantitative fields.
Experience working with AWS big data technologies (Redshift, S3, EMR).
Experience with Python Jupyter Notebook
Demonstrated strength in data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing.
Familiarity with statistical models and data mining algorithms.
Knowledge of software engineering best practices across the development lifecycle, including agile methodologies, coding standards, code reviews, source management, build processes, testing, and operations.
Strong verbal/written communication & data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams.
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age

description:

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

We are seeking an experienced Business Intelligence Engineer (BIE) to help invent the future of everyday grocery shopping with Alexa. Our team enables shopping in everyday life by making it easy for customers. Whether it is to capture what customers need in the moment by adding items to their Alexa Shopping List, help them build their carts with Whole Foods Market, or just buy some more aluminum foil, Alexa is there to help save time and money. Our services allow customers to shop, anywhere, easily without interrupting what you’re doing – to go from “Alexa, buy bananas” to “It’s on the way” in a matter of seconds. Join us, and be a key member of the new and exciting Alexa Shopping Grocery analytics team.

As a BIE In The Alexa Shopping Team You Will Focus On Exciting And Challenging Problems, Including

The analytics team’s success depends on our ability to create actionable insight from the data that that our customers generate. A BIE in our team requires the ability to dive deep into large amounts of data, have good business intuition, curiosity and a grit to deal with ambiguity, and the desire to influence strategic decisions with data-driven analysis and insights. Working with the business teams and collaborating with key stakeholders across the company, you will have the opportunity to design and implement features to enhance the experience of your customers.
Identify, develop, manage, and execute analyses to uncover areas of opportunity and present written business recommendations that will shape the future of Alexa Shopping.
Report key insight trends, using statistical rigor to simplify and inform the larger team of noteworthy story lines that impact the business.
Learn and understand a broad range of Amazon’s data resources and know how, when, and which to use.
Build automated data solutions and dashboards to enable your team to self-service 80% of data needs, allowing you to focus on answering hard and ambiguous problems.
Scope, build and own technical data warehouse processes to help the business scale.
Collaborate with software engineering, product management, marketing and UX as a leader of quantitative analysis and where you develop solutions that utilize the highest standards of analytical rigor and data integrity.

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Statistics or a related discipline.
3+ years of years of relevant work experience in business intelligence, analytics, data engineering, or related field.
Proven track record of crystalizing out impactful and actionable insight from big data.
Highly proficient using ETL manager to write and optimize SQL queries in an ambiguous business environment.
Proficient in processing dirty, large, multi-dimensional datasets from multiple sources.
Proficient using at least one data visualization product (Tableau, Looker, Amazon QuickSight, etc.)
Knowledge of data mining and working knowledge of at least one Statistical Software (SAS, R, Python, etc.)
Excellent written and verbal communications across technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Preferred Qualifications
Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Statistics, Data Science or a related discipline.
Familiarity with AWS solutions such as S3 and Redshift.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:

Our team of analysts, data scientists, and database developers strives to be nimble, while leveraging the data collected from student interactions beginning with our first contact on through to graduation.

The Business Intelligence Analyst collaborates with the Analytics Team’s members and internal business clients to provide actionable insights and recommendations.

Gather and analyze data from various databases and perform single-variate analyses regarding business and operational trends and improvement opportunities

Present qualitative and quantitative analyses to business partners, including recommendations
Leverage story-telling skills to deliver insights that are clear, concise and actionable
Work with business partners to interpret analysis results with a focus on actionable next steps
Perform statistical or analytical modeling, as needed, on a project by project basis

Provide consultation, training and technical assistance to internal clients

Design and assist in implementation of process improvement initiatives

Why Join SNHU?
Southern New Hampshire University (SNHU), founded in 1932, is a private, nonprofit, accredited institution located in Manchester, New Hampshire. We’re proud to have been recognized as a Great College to Work for by the Chronicle of Higher Education every year since its inception. title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Business Intelligence Analyst
Position Overview:
The Business Intelligence Analyst reports to the Finance & Operations Department and supports AllSpire Health Partners (“AHP”) and AllSpire Health GPO (“AHGPO”) through a comprehensive understanding of healthcare practices and business analysis. The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for collaborating with AllSpire members, governance committees, collaborative participants, and external vendors to ensure consistent data management practices and accurate information flow.

•        Provide technical expertise and troubleshooting for issues that disrupt critical business process and provides analysis on required remediation that addresses root cause.

•        Strong understanding of analytical approaches for answering business questions.

 Behavioral Competencies:
•        Ability to communicate complex concepts in simple form to cross-functional teams.
•        Ability to mediate and resolve complex problems and issues.

•        Demonstrated customer service orientation, seeking to understand customer requirements and exercising judgment in meeting their expectations.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Location: Madison, WI

OVERVIEW AND RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST
Your work at Bluetree will focus on defining and owning key performance indicator (KPI) strategy and delivering actionable analysis and reporting. As our KPI metrics guru, you will coordinate with Bluetree leaders across all business units and teams to define, calculate, and present relevant KPIs to ensure we are growing our business efficiently by making smart business decisions supported by the data. You will leverage your ability to effectively translate business needs into technical solutions that produce value-added reports and dashboards.

Reporting Strategy duties include:
Develop and own overall business intelligence/analysis reporting strategy
Partner with internal stakeholders to define relevant KPIs and metrics
Train, explain, and present KPIs to leadership
Update and revise KPIs as business needs evolve
Work with internal business units and teams to ensure necessary data is captured in business process
Collaborate with business analysts to understand business process changes that may impact KPIs 

Report Development duties include:
Develop appropriate SQL queries, views, and procedures to calculate KPIs
Develop PowerBI reports and dashboards to present KPIs and related metrics
Validate KPIs and metrics against the underlying data
Coordinate with database administrator to provide data model to support analysis
Support database administrator in monitoring database and reporting infrastructure

QUALIFICATIONS

Required Qualifications
At least 5 years of business intelligence and analysis experience
At least 2 years of experience with SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) and/or Analysis Services (SSAS)
At least 2 years of experience with PowerBI
Demonstrated experience collaborating with leadership to create and use KPIs
Proven ability to effectively present technical concepts to non-technical individuals

Desired Qualifications
Experience with reporting and analysis of Salesforce data
Experience with data warehouse design and implementation

More About You
Please get in touch if you read the following and think, “me…me…me!!!”
Energetic, sincere, and adaptable
Able to adapt to a dynamic environment with an ever-changing workload
Organized with exceptional verbal and written communication skills, and a customer service orientation
Skilled with Microsoft PowerBI and/or SQL Server Reporting and Analytics Services (SSRS/SSAS)
Savvy in recognizing how business process changes can impact KPI definitions or calculations
Capable of owning projects by acquiring knowledge, sharing it with decision makers, executing in a timely manner, and producing quality outcomes
Detail-oriented – able to catch the small stuff
Having high standards for the quality of your and others’ work
Process-minded – able to create and follow processes
Autonomous and have excellent follow-through
Enjoy communicating with strangers (and non-strangers)
Generally awesome
Tell good jokes

BENEFITS
You will receive full benefits for this position, including access to health insurance and company-paid long-term disability, short-term disability, and dental insurance premiums. We also offer a 401(k). We have an open paid time off policy in which each employee is afforded the flexibility to take vacation, take time off for illness, and shift schedules as needed.

We also offer opportunities for remote work, in-office snacks and coffee, a wellness program, opportunities to volunteer and participate in philanthropic missions, and a company culture that has won us Best Places to Work awards for several years. Your new Bluetree colleagues are genuinely funny, kind, smart, and driven.

Bluetree Network is an equal employment opportunity employer and provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Bluetree will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply.
