title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

Amazon Web Services (AWS) Finance team is seeking a Business Intelligence Engineer (BIE) passionate about developing BI frameworks, tools and reporting dashboards needed to analyze data, and dive deep on AWS organization performance/optimization. The successful candidate will build analyses on very large data sets in one of the world's largest and most complex data warehouse environments. The candidate will also be able to stretch their skills in Machine Learning and Data Lake Technologies. Our data warehouse is built on AWS cloud technology like EC2, S3, and Redshift and the current reporting architecture leverages Tableau, MicroStrategy, AWS QuickSight, and internal reporting tools and systems.

As a BI Engineer In AWS Finance

The role requires strong understanding of large datasets and Finance, solid interpersonal and communication skills, a keen attention to detail, ability to work in a fast-paced environment, an entrepreneurial ability to work with minimal direction, and rapid prototyping.
You will be leading the technical charter on reporting platform for self-service analytics and you will solve complex analytical problems at a global scale.
You will have a direct interaction with AWS businesses, finance, and other BI teams to translate their business requirements into technical specifications.
You will partner effectively with the data engineering team on common areas of scalability, data quality management, data delivery management and performance optimization.
You will work closely with the business and technical teams in analysis on many non-standard and unique business problems and use creative-problem solving to deliver actionable output.
Your work will have a direct impact on the day-to-day decision making and operational planning processes within the AWS Finance organization.
Additional Responsibilities Will Include
Development of reporting, analytics and decision support to enable the AWS Finance org leaders and teams create accountability and mechanisms for revenue targets, operational efficiencies, manpower planning globally, etc.
Tableau Developer with an expertise to create visualizations that provide business insights for our partners.
Manipulating/mining data from database tables (Redshift, Oracle, Data Warehouse)
Being one of the key builders of our BI Data Models supporting the Finance org and other Amazon Corporate organizations.
Maintaining ETL processes related to Data Model
Research Machine Learning algorithms and implement technical solutions tailored to individual finance team org and business needs, and tested on large datasets

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related technical field
5+ years of industry experience with BI Development – reports, metadata layer, dashboards, using SQL queries or other BI tools.
3+ years proficiency with TABLEAU, Microsoft Excel to include making charts, data manipulation, pivot tables, creating macros, and visual basic knowledge
Able to write SQL scripts for analysis and reporting
Experience processing, filtering, and presenting large quantities (Billions of rows) of data
Preferred Qualifications
Advance/Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related technical field
Experience using one or more programing languages Python, Ruby etc… programming languages
Experience with statistical analysis tools like ‘R’, regression modeling and forecasting, time series analysis, data mining, financial analysis, and demand modeling
Experience with AWS technologies such as Redshift, RDS, EMR, etc.
Experience in developing and deploying Data Model
Superior attention to detail and ability to successfully manage multiple competing priorities simultaneously
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. The role requires effective communication with colleagues from computer science, operations research and business backgrounds.
Advanced analytical skills and demonstrated ability to meet deadlines while managing multiple large scale projects in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment.
Comfort with ambiguity and a willingness to work with a high degree of autonomy
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation

Job ID: A1043197

title: Manager - Business Intelligence
description:
Job # 531532

What You’ll Be Doing...

The Manager of Business Intelligence will deliver analytically driven insights to the Verizon Business Group Leadership Team to empower them with fact-based science to drive profitable growth cost effectively, while minimizing the emotional aspect of decision making

The ideal candidate will have experience with project management and developing new processes. Creates, reviews and reports status of activities to ensure progress is being accomplished toward specified project objectives and directs and/or modifies methodology as required.

The role requires the candidate to turn multiple sources of information into actionable data sets to assist senior leadership across the Verizon Business Group in identifying trends, anomalies, or other points of interest that require further investigation.
Design and conduct comprehensive analyses that promote timely actionable insights, empower decision making around strategic product/pricing initiatives, promotions and offers, and impacts from competitive activity with insights and recommended course corrections.
Support, structure and deliver concise, data driven narratives in order to drive the company's priorities; by translating data into compelling stories which connect findings from different sources and synthesize them into one complete picture.
Review changing market conditions and historical performance, identify opportunities, deliver insights, and assess the impact of strategic initiatives that improve Business profitability and eventually shareholder value.
Work with the Business Analytics Center of Excellence to institutionalize BI and decision support for Customer & Revenue analytics to identify pressure points, business levers and future opportunities.
Management / Development of tools to track new and existing initiatives
i.e. interactive dashboards, mobilized Business Intelligence, online reports and scorecards
Ability to manage multiple high-visibility and complex cross-functional projects, and resolve conflicts.
Aptitude to learn new technical subjects and emerging technologies and articulate their business implications.

What We’re Looking For...

You can visualize the big picture strategy, but can also break it down into the components to get the job done. You believe that the best decisions are based in data and you’re the one that knows how to tease out the key learning within a dataset. You have credibility with people because you are an expert in all things data and you know how to bring data to life through a compelling story — that’s practical and will help the business improve. You work on building a collaborative environment and can foster strong relationships with decision makers. You’re an effective and inspiring leader who brings out the best in others. You have a passion for emerging technology, are creative and always hungry to learn more.

You'll Need To Have
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Finance or Business or four or more years of work experience.
Six or more years of relevant work experience.
Experience in building and leading Finance / Marketing Analytics
Experience with Microsoft Office Suite.
Willingness to travel.

Ever Better If You Have
Master's degree in Engineering, Business or Technical field of study.
Analytical experience with focus on results and strong track record.
Strong visualization/storyboarding skills to present insights and recommendations in concise, and intuitive, narratives
Enable business insights across the company by driving the design and deployment of self-serve BI tools.
Demonstrated ability to manage across complex matrix business structures and guide highly technical resources
Strategic thinking, formulation and planning skills to deliver against team commitments and work objectives.
Ability to assess and combine different analytical/modeling approaches to best suit objectives
Experience in building and leading Finance / Marketing Analytics units in B2B industries that are recognized for their analytical excellence
When you join Verizon...

You’ll have the power to go beyond - doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, join our team of the best and brightest. We offer great pay, amazing benefits and opportunity to learn and grow in every role. Together we’ll go far.

Equal Employment Opportunity

We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer- and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. Different makes us better.

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

Amazon Compensation Technologies is looking for a Business Intelligence Engineer to help manage our ever growing information needs and support analysis of increasingly complex business questions. You will seek out hidden and valuable correlations between the easily-measurable and the hard-to-quantify, within immense volumes of real-world data. You will also formulate quantitative metrics which allow us to track our progress, and then devise creative measurement and audit solutions which allow us to track those metrics with minimal cost and human effort. You will provide input into business and technical direction, steering broader solutions in support of these objectives. This role is expected to push the boundaries of measurability without sacrificing rigor.

The successful candidate will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail. You will consult, design, build and manage analytical projects with your customer in mind. You should have a strong expertise and proven success in the design, creation, management, and business use of large datasets. You should be experienced at designing, implementing, and operating stable, scalable, low cost solutions to flow data from production systems into the data warehouse and into end-user facing applications or reports. Above all you should be passionate about inventing on behalf of your customers while learning new solutions to answer business questions to drive tangible change.


Basic Qualifications
BA/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance or related field.
5+ years’ experience as a BIE, data scientist, data engineer or similar job function with a technology company.
Demonstrated strength in SQL, data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing.
Advanced skills in Excel as well as any data visualization tools like QuickSight, Tableau or Cognos Solutions.
Understanding of Finance concepts is a plus.
Working knowledge of Python/Java or similar coding languages.
Familiarity with AWS solutions such as Redshift, S3.
Advanced ability to draw insights from data and clearly communicate them to the stakeholders and senior management.
Have ability to independently influence and drive outputs, meet deadlines, and set clear expectations and roadmaps.
Preferred Qualifications
MBA or Master’s in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance or related field.
Experience in projects involving complex data sets and high variability.
A history of teamwork and willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job done.
Excellent communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills and an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams.
Experience handling confidential and sensitive data.
Design and develop data infrastructure to support business growth.

description:
Well known global firm seeking a Director/Assoc Director of Business Intelligence to lead engagements and provide data analysis and strategic consulting to clients in the health and wellness industry. Will work with internal and external stakeholders to craft measurement plans that satisfy all client objectives and address business challenges. Synthesize available data into insights and recommendations and identify opportunities for improvement. Background in data analytics consulting or quantitative marketing analysis a must. Fantastic communication and client facing skills.

5+ years of work experience in data/analytics consulting and/or quantitative marketing/analysis, healthcare, pharmaceuticals and life sciences experience a plus

Travel around 10 to 15% of the time

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Description

Robert Half Technology is looking for a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst. The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for supporting the institution's use of data as a strategic asset. The resource must inform analysis and decision-making at the executive level and throughout the client's offices. The Business Intelligence Analyst plays a critical role in the development of the organizations' business analysis and intelligence platforms. The Business Intelligence Analyst will research, prepare and develop data solutions for operational and strategic analyses and in support of the client's strategic priorities. This role is also responsible for management of contract data analyst and scientist working on behalf of the organization.

Requirements
Bachelor's or Master's degree - 5 years of progressively responsible experience in a business intelligence related operation - Experience with cross-functional reporting and analysis - Demonstrated ability to develop and implement data-analytic and technology strategies to support business objectives. - Demonstrated experience overseeing a large portfolio with many concurrent projects - Proficient with Tableau (Desktop, Prep and Server) - Proficient with data warehouses, data lakes, or similar typography - Proficient with database software or cloud solutions (Oracle, MSSQL, or similar) - Experience with organizational data/metadata management tools - Experience with columnar database solutions (Redshift, BigQuery, or similar) - Experience with statistical software packages (SAS, SPSS, or similar) - Strong oral and written communications skills - Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively with colleagues with different areas and levels of technical expertise - Strong organization skills - Proven ability to manage time and priorities, ability to manage complex projects and tasks with attention to detail - Demonstrated ability to effectively lead cross-functional teams - Proven effectiveness in dealing with a wide range of staff - Ability to contribute to a work environment that encourages knowledge of, respect for, and development of skills to engage with those of other cultures or backgrounds in accordance with the Holy Cross. Apply today for immediate consideration!
Technology doesn't change the world. People do.

As a technology staffing firm, we can't think of a more fitting mantra. We're extreme believers in technology and the incredible things it can do. But we know that behind every smart piece of software, every powerful processor, and every brilliant line of code is an even more brilliant person.

Leader among IT staffing agencies

The intersection of technology and people — it's where we live. Backed by more than 65 years of experience, Robert Half Technology is a leader among IT staffing agencies. Whether you're looking to hire experienced technology talent or find the best technology jobs, we are your IT expert to call.

We understand not only the art of matching people, but also the science of technology. We use a proprietary matching tool that helps our staffing professionals connect just the right person to just the right job. And our network of industry connections and strategic partners remains unmatched.

Apply for this job now or contact our branch office at 888-490-4429 to learn more about this position.

All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be authorized to work in the United States. All applicants applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.

© 2019 Robert Half Technology. An Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Veterans.

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

Are you interested in understanding how Amazon manages to make sure that it has such in-stock rates on such a broad selection of products and makes sure that the products are placed correctly to fulfill customer demand? Our group is demand forecasting within supply chain optimization team that ensure that not only we have an accurate forecast for quantities we will sell for each product but also where this demand is located. We build the systems and algorithms that predict customer demand for all products sold on the Amazon platform. We are applying advanced statistics, deep learning and machine learning techniques to improve forecast accuracy, while tackling cutting edge "big data" problems in storage and computation.
We need a creative, smart and enthusiastic thought leader with a background in data analysis and analytics ready to help us identify our best opportunities for improvement and make key business decisions.
As a Business Intelligence Engineer in forecasting, you will be responsible for
Understanding the opportunities for improvement and partnering with PMs, Science and Engineering to design solutions to tough forecasting problems.
Come up with innovative solutions working with our machine learning & research scientists that solves forecasting challenges for new businesses that Amazon keeps inventing
Communicate and earn trust with our customers in retail & our downstream systems
Develop strong reporting mechanisms for internal and external teams.

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Economics, Math, Finance, Engineering, Computer Science or a related quantitative field.
At least 3 years of experience with data querying languages (e.g. SQL, Redshift).
At least 3 years of experience articulating business questions and using quantitative techniques and driving insights for business.
Experience with automated self-service reporting tools (e.g. Tableau).
Confidence in dealing with technical and non-technical senior level staff.
Ability to operate successfully and independently in a fast-paced environment.
Comfort with ambiguity and eagerness to learn new skills.
Preferred Qualifications
Master’s degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Economics or a related quantitative field.
5+ years’ experience with 2+ years Analytics and Process Improvement-related initiatives
Demonstrable track record of dealing well with ambiguity, prioritizing needs, and delivering results in a dynamic environment
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience processing, filtering, and presenting large quantities (Millions to Billions of rows) of data
Experience working in R/Python
Experience in supply chain is a plus

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Job Description

The Business Intelligence Analyst will provide market segmentation, sizing and general business analysis and reporting in support of Keysight’s Ixia Solutions Group. Through a combination of market understanding and financial acumen they will provide quantitative perspectives on market performance and attractiveness, as well as strategy recommendations. The successful candidate will be skilled in using third party and available market data, calculating market statistics, and business results to prepare comprehensive dashboards and reports. This position requires a hands-on data mindset, together with business acumen, presentation skills, and enthusiasm to identify and communicate business insights.

Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in finance, economics, data analytics, statistics, mathematics, or computer science
3 - 5 years of experience in finance, strategy consulting, product management, or data analytics
Strong experience building financial models
Experience working with quantitative market sizing and forecasting
Solid problem-solving skills, decision making and use of initiative
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
A desire to explore new techniques including machine learning enabled engines
Able to work independently but also in a team environment

Some of the following experience is also Desirable;
10 years of relevant experience in high tech industry
Experience negotiating and working with market analysts including Gartner, IDC, and others
Power user skills in Excel and Power Point
Experience in Tableau, SFDC, Python, Java, HTML
Networking and/or security market knowledge (e.g. switches, routers, firewalls, etc.)
MBA and/or Masters level degree

Job Function

The Business Intelligence Analyst is a key member of the Ixia Solution Group team, within Keysight, whose duties and responsibilities include;
Determine and develop approaches to business system/process assignments
Lead business process related projects requiring coordination with other functions
Identify new strategic opportunities for Keysight to grow and provide quantitative performance metrics to product teams
Evaluate business user problems and develop systems or processes to address them
Find ways to measure the performance of value-added solutions with partners
Present to senior level executives and working with external analysts
Collaborate with product management, sales, and marketing on financial modeling projects

Work Location: Santa Clara, CA

title: CPWS Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Overview

Description

Provide reporting, analytic review and support to members of the BI, Commercial Strategy, Commercial Sales and Commercial Operations teams to assist in evaluating the effectiveness of route-to-market strategies, business intelligence tools and applications.

Duties and Responsibilities
Input corporate and supplier programs into designated business intelligence applications (i.e. NSM, Goal Builder, SODs, Business Objects, etc.)
Track, review, verify, analyze and report accurate results to Commercial leadership, field team, and/or suppliers in a timely manner
Identify system deficiencies and propose possible solutions
Evaluate past program success/failure trends; use trend analysis to advise stakeholders on proposed programs
Provide accurate insights on live program performance and evaluate ROI on key initiatives
Follow established reporting and documentation standards to ensure uniformity throughout the organization
Provide analysis on Route-to-Market design, sales planning/execution, sales force size/coverage, org. structures, etc.
Develop performance management initiatives including compensation/incentive design, development of KPIs, etc.
Analyze data available to anticipate potential issues and proactively model potential solutions
Cross-compare customer selling opportunities with sales performance and brand challenges/initiatives
Provide Sales and Marketing stakeholders with a data-driven roadmap for sales execution
Complete quarterly field sales ride-withs throughout the sales organization as needed
Support operational efficiencies and cost savings initiatives (e.g., supplier/SKU optimization, variable service and delivery levels/fees, etc.)
Streamline established Business Intelligence reporting to align with standards and processes
Provide support to Leadership with ad hoc reporting needs and provide accurate and timely results consistent with state/region/national standards
Create ad-hoc queries and reports as requested and provide on-going analytical support for these requests
Perform other job related duties as assigned

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree and 3 years of experience in a corporate business analyst role

Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor's degree and 5 years of experience in the Wine and Spirits/Beverage Industry with cross functional experience
Knowledge of applicable state regulations and adult beverage market dynamics
Experience in RTM
Proficient in SharePoint and all aspects of Microsoft Office Suite with an emphasis on Excel
Demonstrated analytical ability and able to build presentation and business cases
Strong interpersonal skills and able to communicate both verbally and in writing
Able to organize priorities and work under deadlines while producing a high quality result in a team environment

Physical Demands
Physical demands with activity or condition for a considerable amount of time include sitting and typing/keyboarding using a computer (e.g., keyboard, mouse, and monitor) or adding machine
Physical demands with activity or condition may include occasional to rare amount of time include walking, bending, reaching, standing, and stooping
May require occasional lifting/lowering, pushing, carrying, or pulling up to 20 lbs

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Sightline Media Group is the leading news organization covering military, defense, public sector, federal technology, C4ISR and cyber defense. Our independent, award-winning journalism offers coverage from around the globe, from Sightline headquarters in the Washington, DC area to bureaus and correspondents in the U.S. and around the world. Sightline Media offers our business clientele a wide range of platforms to reach the market. From digital and mobile solutions to events, thought leadership, publications, video and custom options, Sightline works with clients on opportunities that have credibility, integrity, engagement and impact.

Sightline Media Group is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst specializing in Google Analytics 360 data. The Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for implementing the digital tagging and analytics measurement strategy and supporting data collection on all platform implementations (Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics 360 Suite, Google Ad Manager, Customer Data Platforms like Salesforce and Pardot) and assuring the validity of the data on a continuing basis.

The Business Intelligence Analyst should be highly skilled in working with SQL, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Google Big Query, Google Ad Manager, Google Data Studio as well as one or more Business Intelligence tools.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Centralize and standardize digital tracking, analytics, and associated data quality by working with developers and digital producers to determine appropriate metrics and behavior to track on new and existing properties.
Administer analytics accounts, properties, user management, dashboards, and reports in Google Analytics 360 suite and Google Tag Manager to then combine with Google Ad Manager to determine asset (article, video, photo gallery, etc) value.
Build and maintain automated reports with visualizations via Google Data Studio
Diagnose issues with existing platform configurations and tags, and provide recommendations for improvement.
Analyze audience reach, engagement, and behavior metrics holistically across different business units while keeping in mind the custom needs and use cases.
Analyze and solve problems at their root, stepping back to understand the broader context. (tracking was working pre-release, but counts are now off... why? Traffic is up or down is this real or is tracking off etc.)
Support stakeholders to create custom reports for their business needs.
Identify areas of inefficiency and develop methods for improvement.
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree in Analytics, Math, Finance, Statistics, Engineering or related discipline
2+ years experience of working with Google Analytics and familiarity with GA360 suite (Data Studio, Big Query)
Self Starter, must be able to go from concept to completion
Working knowledge of SQL
Hands-on experience with Tag Manager and potentially Google Ad Manager reporting tools
Familiarity with:
Web APIs
Production process for digital products and properties
Queries, dimensions, and cross schema reporting
Ability to foster teamwork and collaboration, but also able to work independently
A critical thinker with aptitude to isolate and fix technical issues related to the flow of data
Passionate about the accuracy of data and its value to inform business decisions
DESIRED/ADDITIONAL SKILLS
Experience in media
Understanding HTML/HTML5/CSS/Java Script.
Knowledge of front-end languages (Phyton, NodeJS, PHP, etc.)
Experience with A/B testing tools such as Optimizely
Understanding of SEO
CRM software and email marketing tracking
Open source PHP based CMS platforms
Project and workflow management tools such as Jira
Other dashboard reporting tools such as Tableau
Familiarity with AppFigures, Flurry or other analytics tools
Experience working in an Agile environment

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Who We Are

The Trade Desk is leading the way to the future of marketing by changing how advertising is bought and sold. Working with the largest brands and agencies around the world, our technology platform helps consumers discover products they want by enabling advertisers to target and reach them on the right channels at the right time.

Employees join The Trade Desk to discover opportunity, contribute to our customers’ success, and be part of building the future of marketing. You’ll work with creative, compassionate, and collaborative colleagues that share a passion for making the internet better for all – a combination that simply can't be beat.

When you join The Trade Desk, you’re joining a family. We have open space work environments, adjustable sitting/standing desks, and a celebrated open-door policy (at all levels) that can inspire out-of-the-box solutions and camaraderie among your coworkers. The competitive compensation packages, full benefits, stock options, and additional discounted stock purchase opportunities, catered lunches, and offsite team building activities may cause slight to severe jealousy among your peers.

Who We Are Looking For

The Global BI team works closely with a broad range of teams including Client Services / Product / Engineering / Finance / Marketing to provide business intelligence reporting, address complex questions and help identify key metrics to drive data-driven decision making. We’re looking for someone who is enthusiastic about new technology, has not only the existing technical skills to be successful but also the acumen to learn even more; you’ll never run out of things to learn here! You’re comfortable being a mediator between business and technology teams, helping both reach solutions on high-priority technical issues. There is plenty of room for advancement in this role within the department or otherwise within our company that is a meritocracy.

The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst will report to the Business Intelligence Regional Lead and own BI service delivery and special projects from start to completion. Ultimately, your technical expertise and understanding of operating KPIs will help our Senior Management team identify key growth opportunities.

What You Will Be Doing
You will manage and resolve ad hoc Business Intelligence requests, developing new tools to automate repetitive tasks
You will use predictive modeling techniques to drive business growth and generate accurate revenue forecasts
You will support the business with time-critical data analysis and improve business operations by using cutting edge operational research and modelling methods
You will maintain the integrity of company data and put checks in place to ensure accuracy
You will apply a broad range of analytical techniques to identify business critical trends and insights by exploiting big data
You will create dashboards and reports to allow teams to easily explore data pertinent to their ongoing operations
You will serve as a subject matter expert for data analysis methods and tools, as well as data visualisation best practices


What You Bring To The Table
A quantitatively focused education (minimum BSc in Statistics, Economics, Computer Science etc.) with 7+ years professional experience in Business Intelligence, Business / Data Analyst roles
You’re a SQL pro and have a deep hands-on expertise with relational databases and data warehouse methodologies
You have experience with multiple programming languages (Python, R etc.)
You have experience with big data technologies (Qubole, Spark, HIVE, Hadoop etc.)
You have a solid understanding of statistical techniques, strong problem-solving skills as well as the ability to drive actionable insights from massive data sets
You can design clean and intuitive dashboards in Tableau and have outstanding Excel skills
You are comfortable collaborating in a fast-paced environment with teams spread across the globe
You have experience in a customer / client facing role working directly with business stakeholders
You have excellent written, verbal and presentation skills
You can prioritise and meet deadlines


The Trade Desk does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firm recruiters. Fees will not be paid in the event a candidate submitted by a recruiter without an agreement in place is hired; such resumes will be deemed the sole property of The Trade Desk. The Trade Desk is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Job Description

Design and develop enterprise-wide data analysis and reporting solutions

Manage and grow relationships with business stakeholders, ensuring that they are fully engaged in the execution data-driven projects and realize business value

Collect, analyze, and mine data stored in multiple environments

Design, develop, and maintain data warehouses and systems

Research and recommend technology solutions related to data storage, reporting, middleware, etc.

Develop data cleansing rules

Develop and implement strategies for gathering data from operational databases as well as third party vendors

Work with database developers and administrators to ensure that data systems conform to enterprise data architecture and strategy

Provide evidence and support for assigned key controls to internal and external auditors

Manage changes that affect data structures and analytics through the internal change management process

Create or discover new data procurement and processing methods and programs

Manage professional and managed services when necessary for the development and deployment of data structures and analytics

Implement new data analysis methodologies

Perform data profiling to identify and understand anomalies

Qualifications

4-year degree in a relevant field or equivalent experience

Strong knowledge of finance and investment management, with direct experience in commercial real estate investment strongly preferred

Expertise in report development and administration within the Microsoft suite, including MDS, SSRS, Power BI, Excel, Power View, Power Pivot

3+ years data warehouse, data quality, and business intelligence report development experience

3+ years hands-on experience of MS SQL Server

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

Amazon Lab126 is an inventive research and development company that designs and engineers high-profile consumer electronics. Lab126 began in 2004 as a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc., originally creating the best-selling Kindle family of products. Since then, we have produced groundbreaking devices like Fire tablets, Fire TV, Amazon Echo and Amazon Show. The Amazon Devices group delivers delightfully unique Amazon experiences, giving customers instant access to everything, digital or physical.

Are you interested in a fast-paced, high-growth environment with the opportunity to work on business-critical decisions? Amazon Device Accessories is looking for an outstanding Business Intelligence Engineer to join our Operational Excellence Team. We’re looking for someone who can provide insight on KPI’s, understand inferential statistics and advise business teams on how to optimize for profit.

As an engineer on the team, you'll leverage tools and services including Amazon Redshift, Tableau, AWS Glue, AWS Athena, Spark, EMR, Machine Learning and Time Series models to build solutions that deliver data-driven reports, dashboards, and recommendations to high level leadership.

You'll work directly with business leaders and stakeholders to understand different business problems and use cases. You'll work with Finance, Tech and Business teams to identify and consume data sources, transform the data, and build the reports and visualizations needed to meet the requirements. You’ll have the opportunity to get hands on experience with Machine Learning, Time Series Modelling and high impact business analysis.

Developing this capability will provide insights that are used to lead decision making around product allocation, product effectiveness, productivity analysis and business impact. Consumers of these insights will include Directors, VP’s and SVP’s.

Our Tenets For Analytics Team Members Are As Follows
Utilizing the Scientific Method to make tangible business impact
Metrics before Messes
Ensuring we’re measuring the right business metrics to guide the business
Forecast or be Last
Developing state of the art predictive models for ensuring we’re moving in the right direction
Roles And Responsibilities
Build data solutions using AWS services that deliver data-driven reports, dashboards, and tools.
Develop and implement Time Series and Machine Learning Forecast Models
Manage marketing and sales data for the organization
Manage ETL pipelines using AWS EMR and Spark
Distill problem definitions, models, and constraints from informal business requirements.
Provide innovative self-service tools to our customers to self-serve and scale data
Follow established engineering best practices and define new best practices where required.
Identify critical metrics/reports that measure product performance, efficiency/effectiveness and create client facing dashboards to facilitate decision making.
Collaborate on the design, development, maintenance, and delivery/presentation of forecasting models, metrics, reports, analyses, tools, and dashboards
Perform proactive diagnostic analysis on the various product measures and surface meaningful insights to the leadership team.
Collaborate with Data Scientists, Data Engineers and Economists to develop Product Insights on Marketing and Sales data.

Basic Qualifications
Bachelors in engineering, science, math, statistics or computer science
3+ years of work experience as a business intelligence engineer, data engineer or data scientist role
3+ years of experience in SQL programming
3+ years of experience in building data warehouses and dimensional modeling
3+ years of experience with business intelligence and data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau)
3+ years of experience with a modern programming language (e.g. Python, R, Scala etc.)
Experience with AWS Suite
Preferred Qualifications
Masters in engineering, science, math, statistics or computer science
Experience using AWS services for data analytics (i.e., Athena, Glue, Redshift, EMR, etc.)
Experience developing custom ETL solutions using Python and SQL
Experience with Tableau Desktop and Tableau Server
Strong written and verbal communications skills. Having the ability to translate scientific findings into business recommendations and outputs.
The ability to influence stakeholders through delivering results and earning trust
Basic statistical tests (but not limited to) t-tests, chi-square and regression
Expert SQL
Proficiency in Python
Experience delivering the best Products to customers
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age.


Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
At STERIS, we help our Customers create a healthier and safer world by providing innovative healthcare and life science product and service solutions around the globe.

LEARN. GROW. MAKE A DIFFERENCE as a Business Intelligence Analyst in Mentor, OH!

Position Summary

As a part of our Healthcare Services operation team our analysts are responsible for reporting key performance indicators that measure financial and operational performance. This position supports the team by ensuring quality and error free reporting is delivered to key stakeholders which includes but is not limited to measuring the service contract renewal and new sales process, completing territory analysis performance optimization reports, incentive plan metrics, and support request for proposals. Above all the business analysts provide insightful recommendations on the performance of the business that help drive the direction of the organization.

What You Will Do
Report upon key performance indicators related to the service contract renewal and new business sales.
Measure incentive compensation plan metrics accurately and timely
Complete service territory optimization reporting and territory mapping
Summarize monthly operational performance with data based recommended improvements
Provide equipment and Customer sales data summaries including pricing recommendations and gross margin assessment required for requests for proposals
Support incoming operational reporting requests as requested
Provide analytical support required for marketing campaigns
Report upon Customer Experience data and suggest enhancements
Support the development of performance dashboards in Tableau

What You Need To Be Successful
Bachelor’s Degree in finance, accounting, math, or engineering and 2+ years of experience, OR 5+ years of related experience in lieu of degree
MBA Preferred
Strong Excel, Access and PowerPoint skills
Experience in Tableau or PowerBI preferred
Strong business acumen with good oral and written communication skills
Experience reporting upon key performance indicators and summary recommendations
Experience presenting performance to management
SQL & query writing skills preferred
Strong problem solving skills
Customer service mindset a must
Attention to quality and accuracy

STERIS is a $3B, publicly traded (NYSE: STE) organization with approximately 12,000 associates worldwide and operates in more than 100 countries.

If you need assistance completing the application process, please call 1 (440) 392.7047. This contact information is for accommodation inquiries only and cannot be used to check application status.

title: Business Intelligence Manager
description:
About The Team

The Business Intelligence (BI) team builds and maintains database solutions used for daily/weekly/monthly reporting. By designing dashboards, reporting structures, and data warehouse architecture, the BI team serves as the foundation for DoorDash’s decision-making.

About The Role

DoorDash is looking for a Business Intelligence Manager to act both as technical expert when scaling data infrastructure, and as an exceptional people manager. This manager will guide the greater BI team, analysts, data scientists, and DoorDash partners toward vital structured data and insights.

You’re excited about this opportunity because you will…
Offer expertise across data warehouse design and infrastructure maintenance that best supports a rapidly evolving set of products in partnership with our amazing data infrastructure engineering team
Collect, process, and clean data from different sources using SQL, Python, or other scripting languages
Work with cross-functional teams to automate reporting and build a strong reporting architecture
Provide technical mentorship and team management, engaging in recruitment processes across BI
Own and manage a portfolio of internal and external tools which empower analysts and data scientists across the company
Continuously optimize ETL jobs to hit performance targets
Build data governance with scalable processes, useful data definitions, and effective project planning

We’re Excited About You Because You Have…
5+ years experience working in business intelligence, analytics, data engineering, or a similar role
An ability to code complex SQL queries. Python a plus
Knowledge of relational databases (Snowflake, Redshift, PostgreSQL, etc.) as well as big data structures
Experience using and building solutions to support various reporting and data user tools (Chartio, Tableau, Looker, etc)
Experience implementing enterprise dashboarding tools a big plus
Experience with data generated by proprietary software systems as well as industrial solutions (SFDC and Segment a plus)
Experience with Git, Airflow, and Snowflake a plus
Excellent communication skills and experience working with teams to assess their data needs
A can-do attitude. You’re not afraid to roll up your sleeves as a hands-on leader and help the team internalize best practices by example
Why You’ll Love Working at DoorDash
We are leaders - Leadership is not limited to our management team. It’s something everyone at DoorDash embraces and embodies
We are doers - We believe the only way to predict the future is to build it. Creating solutions that will lead our company and our industry is what we do -- on every project, every day
We are learners - We’re not afraid to dig in and uncover the truth, even if it’s scary or inconvenient. Everyone here is continually learning on the job, no matter if we’ve been in a role for one year or one minute
We are customer obsessed - Our mission is to grow and empower local economies. We are committed to our customers, merchants, and dashers and believe in connecting people with possibility
We are all DoorDash - The magic of DoorDash is our people, together making our inspiring goals attainable and driving us to greater heights
We offer great compensation packages and comprehensive health benefits

About DoorDash

DoorDash is a technology company that connects customers with their favorite local and national businesses in over 4,000 cities and all 50 states across the United States and Canada. Founded in 2013, DoorDash empowers merchants to grow their businesses by offering on-demand delivery, data-driven insights, and better in-store efficiency, providing delightful experiences from door to door. By building the last-mile delivery infrastructure for local cities, DoorDash is bringing communities closer, one doorstep at a time. Read more on the DoorDash Engineering blog or at www.doordash.com.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of the best and brightest from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Lithia Motors, Inc., Medford, OR

Lithia Motors, Inc. is one of the largest automotive retailers in the United States, the leading retailer in each of our markets and is publicly traded on the NYSE (LAD). We’re looking for a self-motivated and career driven business analyst professional who will thrive in a challenging, dynamic environment to join our team.

4-year degree from an accredited university

Quickly learn new business domains and corresponding data
Excellent communication and documentation skills
Strong SQL skills

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Job
Business Intelligence Analyst

Description

Deluxe Entertainment Services Group Inc. is a global leader in media and entertainment services for film, video and online content, from capture to consumption. Since 1915, Deluxe has been the trusted partner for the world’s most successful Hollywood studios, independent film companies, TV networks, exhibitors, advertisers and others, offering best-in-class solutions in production, post-production, distribution, asset and workflow management, and new digital solution-based technologies.

With operations in Los Angeles, New York and around the globe, the company employs over 8,600 of the most talented, highly honored and recognized artists and industry veterans worldwide. Deluxe is a wholly owned subsidiary of MacAndrews & Forbes Holdings Inc. For more information, please visit www.bydeluxe.com

We currently have an opening for a Data Analyst, Business Intelligence. This position will be located in Burbank, CA.

Position Overview

The Data Analyst, Business Intelligence will be responsible for creating and publishing Tableau reports as well as conducting data analysis, using internal and external data sources. The position will work with an internal team to gather and analyze report requirements, build client and LOB-specific Tableau dashboards, and assist in identifying and maintaining data governance policies across Deluxe systems. This position is based out of Burbank, CA and will report to Manager, Business Intelligence.

Primary Responsibilities
Ability and experience working with Business Leads to understand business needs, define scope and translate requirements into technical specifications
Work with internal team and lines of business to design and build BI reports and dashboards to drive key business and product decisions
Build and maintain SQL scripts and queries for data analysis and extraction
Conduct analysis to identify trends, anomalies, and insights within enterprise system data
Engage with internal teams globally to ensure that data sources are accurate, timely, and structured properly to support all internal and external needs
Maintain data quality standards and best practice in our core data pipelines and datasets
Provide timely, accurate, professional and responsive support, verbally and via email, to internal and external customer/clients to resolve all issues reported and take proactive steps to prevent the conflict/problem from reoccurring
Conduct training, knowledge-sharing and best practice communication related to projects, services, and providers
Execute additional data initiatives identified by team leadership

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field
5+ years’ experience in gathering reporting requirements, identifying KPIs, and building Tableau workbooks and dashboards
Strong knowledge of scripting and other coding languages, including SQL and Python
Experience applying machine learning and predictive analytics to extract critical information from collected data sets
Strong analytical/data/modelling skills, with the ability to synthesize business requirements and questions, source and analyze data, build conclusions and articulate actionable recommendations
High level understanding and knowledge of the video post-production process, media operations, and/or digital content delivery workflows for broadcast & OTT platforms
Strong project management skills
Excellent attention to detail with strong organizational skills and ability to multitask
Excellent teamwork, written and verbal communication skills
Ability to troubleshoot and solve technical problems
Must demonstrate positive attitude, ability to maintain professionalism in a high stress situation, and project self as a team player

We offer competitive pay and benefits program including medical, dental & vision coverage, vacation & sick leave, 401(k), and more.

Deluxe’s policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, and will not be discriminated against, on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state or local laws, regulations or ordinances. Deluxe will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and federal law.

Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Deluxe. Please inform the company's personnel representative if you need assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.

description:

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Business Intelligence Analyst
Roti Modern Mediterranean is seeking a thoughtful BI Analyst to create dashboards that empower our business success. In this role you will be working with a fully modern suite of tools designed to facilitate quick iteration and automation. This role will need to work with stakeholders across the business to help solve our most important business problems. This role is perfect for someone who has both an analytical mindset and a strong business acumen. The ideal candidate will not only have a passion for finding the answers to problems, but will also understand the best ways to visualize that data so business users can take appropriate action.

What You'll Do
Managing requests for insights from requirements definition through visualization delivery
Clearly defining the business problem to be solved through collaboration with business users
Creating data visualizations that help users easily draw the right conclusions from complex datasets
Owns, cultivates, and supports a library of business logic and dashboards in Looker to facilitate business insights
Required

What we're looking for:
1-3 years professional experience as a BI Analyst or similar role
Expert data visualization and communication skills
Strong SQL skills with the ability to write and optimize complex queries
Preferred
Experience managing large Looker projects and codebases
1-3 years experience with Looker, writing LookML and creating dashboards
Ability to find business insights in a large data warehouse

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
About Us

Description

Alder is one of the fastest-growing Smart Home/Home Alarm companies in the nation. Even though we are growing at a rapid pace, we feel like we are just getting started. The start-up feel coupled with the financial stability of the company has led to some lofty goals for growth. Our mission is to passionately serve so that our customers have the freedom to live. Our goal is to provide total Life Safety for every home in America. Our headquarters is located in Orem, Utah.

The Role

Alder is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to support finance, operations, sales, marketing & company leadership teams with insights gained from analyzing company data. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization. They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for working with investigating, interpreting and visualizing large data sets and working with leaders to improve business outcomes.

What You'll Do
Work with leaders throughout the organization to identify requirements and opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions and ensuring the validation and verification of data used.
Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques, financial models and business strategies.
Provide support to end-users on standardized and ad hoc reports.
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes.
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.

Requirements
Bachelors degree in a business related discipline or mathematics
2+ years of experience in an analytical role and experience with large data sets
At least one year of experience in architecting, building, and maintaining BI environments
Expert SQL query writing, especially across multiple databases and servers
Experience in programming R
Experience with setting up and maintaining BI analytics tools, such as Tableau, Power BI, Domo, Qlik, etc
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Significant work experience with SQL and report building
Advanced Excel skills
Strong communication skills
MS in Analytics/BI a plus

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
At WHOOP our mission is to create cutting edge technology that allows individual athletes and teams to perform at a higher level by providing a deeper understanding of their bodies and daily lives.

As a Business Intelligence Analyst at WHOOP, you’ll gather, clean, and analyze data with a focus on helping WHOOP better understand business and engagement data in order to continue growing and retaining members. We are looking for someone who has an extremely data-driven mindset and is able to mix business knowledge with statistical tools to deeply understand and report on business trends. You will work closely with the talented WHOOP Marketing, Software, Product, and Finance teams to understand and improve customer acquisition and retention.

Responsibilities
Measure, analyze, and understand the data of the entire customer lifecycle from acquisition, activation, engagement, retention, and churn
Find, extend, and implement industry best tooling, or custom made solutions, to accomplish your goals
Be data-driven but also aware of business context and user experience to understand and improve acquisition and retention
Utilize strong statistical and analytical skills to make sense of business trends
Communicate findings to technical, non-technical, and executive audiences
Work collaboratively in a startup environment with a high performance team

Qualifications
Strong track record delivering value on an analytics, business intelligence, and/or growth marketing team - preferably in consumer SaaS startup environments
A creative approach to problem solving - able to take disparate pieces of information and use statistical analysis to deliver innovative solutions and reports
Strong technical and analytical skills; we use currently use a Python stack for data analysis, but strong SQL skills are also a must
Experience working with data sources such as Stripe, Salesforce, Shopify, Facebook Ad Manager, Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Segment.IO or equivalents. Experience with BI tools like Tableau or Looker
Strong oral and written communication skills

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
ActiveCampaign’s category-defining Customer Experience Automation Platform helps over 90,000 businesses in 161 countries meaningfully engage with their customers. The platform gives businesses of all sizes access to hundreds of pre-built automations that combine email marketing, marketing automation, CRM, and machine learning for powerful orchestration, segmentation and personalization across social, email, messaging, chat, and text. Over 70% of ActiveCampaign’s customers use its 300+ integrations including Shopify, Square, Facebook, Eventbrite, and Salesforce. ActiveCampaign scores higher in customer satisfaction than any other solution in both Marketing Automation and CRM All-In-One on G2.com.

As the fastest-growing SaaS company in Chicago, we are scaling rapidly to keep up with market demand. We are growing all of our teams and looking for people who share our values, deliver innovation frequently and join us in our mission to grow our customer base from 90,000 today to millions.

We are currently seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our Operations team. The Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for leveraging data to help answer our organization's most important questions and ensuring everyone has the data they need to perform their jobs well. We are looking for a candidate who shows both a strong understanding of how to manipulate data using SQL and an exceptional ability to design metrics that reveal insights to our different business units.

What Your Day Could Consist Of
Acting as an internal consultant, using analytical skills to answer critical business questions
Owning the validation, clean up and governance of data
Interfacing with team members (including executives) to understand reporting requirements and data needs
Sharing knowledge around data tools throughout the company
Participating in data exploration, and providing analytical insights
Building visualizations and reports for all of our business units
Being a steward of the data warehouse (e.g. documentation, maintenance, and knowledge sharing)

What Is Needed
Proficient SQL skills (1-2 years)
Analytical experience with data and data modeling concepts
Understanding of data warehouses and ETL principles
Experience answering unstructured business questions
Willingness to learn new skills on the job
Data manipulation with Python (preferred)
Experience with any analytical/visualization tool (Looker, QuickSight, Pentaho, Tableau)
Experience with an ETL platform such as Airflow, Informatica, etc (preferred)
ActiveCampaign is an employee-first culture. We take care of our employees at work and outside of work. We'll share all the details later on but in summary: comprehensive health and wellness benefits including no premiums for employees on our HSA plan, open time off plan, generous 401(k) matching with no vesting, lunch and endless snacks/ beverages, reimbursed commuting, education budgets, ongoing learning and development, a proactive approach to diversity and inclusion, career pathing and lots of swag.

title: Business Intelligence Developer
description:

5+ years of expreince in data warehouse design (e.g. dimensional modeling) and data mining.

In-depth understanding of database management systems, online analytical processing (OLAP) and ETL (Extract, transform, load) framework 
Excellent communication skill

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

In the Alexa Shopping team we are building experiences to allow customers to instantly order whatever they need, by simply interacting with their smart devices such as Amazon Echo, Fire TV, and Echo Show. Our services allow you to shop, anywhere, easily without interrupting what you’re doing – to go from “I want” to “It’s on the way” in a matter of seconds.

As a Business Intelligence Engineer, you will be responsible for understanding and mining the large amount of data, build metrics and drive customer adoption. You will play a key role in our team – the team will look to you for advice on analytical and business issues facing them. You will have a department-wide view of the analytical solutions that you build, and you will consistently think in terms of automating or expanding the results company-wide. You should be a self-starter who knows and loves working with BI tools, and who thrives on implementing creative approaches and dealing with the intricate complexity of large data sets, while partnering with customers to answer key business questions. You are analytical and creative, and you don’t quit.
You will also have the opportunity to display your skills in the following areas:
Interface with cross functional teams, gathering requirements and delivering complete BI solutions.
Lead customer utilization research projects to better understand how our customers are using our systems.
Interface with other technology teams to extract, transform, and load data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL (Redshift, Oracle) and ability to use a major programming and/or scripting language to process data for modeling
Recognize and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Math/Statistics/Engineering or other equivalent quantitative discipline
5+ years in relevant experience as data scientist, software engineer, business intelligence engineer, or equivalent
Demonstrated development and application of predictive statistical procedures in languages such as R, SAS, SPS
Experience data modeling and transformation of large scale data sources using SQL, Hadoop, Spark, Hive, EMR, or other Big Data technologies
Knowledge of scripting for automation (e.g. Python, Perl, Ruby)
Ability to work cross-functionally, building and maintaining trust with internal stakeholders
Preferred Qualifications
Strong active listener with solid written and verbal communication skills
Advanced knowledge of Oracle BI tools, MySQL, Linux/UNIX
Experience with AWS solutions such as EC2, DynamoDB, S3, and Redshift
Knowledge and direct experience using business intelligence reporting/visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, MicroStrategy, SSAS Cubes, etc.)

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

Interested in joining the Selection team of SCOT (Supply Chain Optimization Technology Division)? As one pillar component of the famous Amazon Flywheel, Selection is key to the topline growth. We are responsible for driving thoughtful leadership and innovation to either improve existing or develop new solutions for optimizing Amazon’s selection, better serving our customers.

As a BIE on the team, you will need to understand what information is valuable to our internal customers and then work closely with product managers to deliver tools/metrics/models that are easy for end users to interpret and provide all data points necessary to extract comprehensive business insights. Given the scale at which Amazon operates, we handle millions of products and will rely on your expertise to test and validate data at scale, set up mechanisms to catch data quality issues before they impact our customers, and build prototypes to generate business insights.

This is a highly visible role and will require regular interaction and communication with senior leaders. You must have experience and capability to document your work for technical as well as non-technical audiences. Successful candidates should excel at diving into data in order to analyze problems and implement simple, long term solutions.


Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent training/experience in Economics, Statistics, Machine Learning, Data Science, Mathematics, or a related field
3+ years experience in business intelligence engineering, statistics, or similar
Experience with writing and optimizing advanced SQL queries to work with complex/large datasets
Proficient in industry standard data analysis and presentation tools
Track record of effective data mining/report building
Proven analytical/problem solving skills and attention to detail, including the ability to recognize non-obvious patterns/predictors, with the ability to propose insightful hypotheses
Effective spoken and written communication to senior audiences, including strong data presentation and visualization skills
Preferred Qualifications
Master's or higher degree in an analytical area such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering
6+ years experience in business intelligence engineering, statistics, or similar
Experience working in a corporate environment and evidence of positive impact on real world business decision making using statistical, machine learning, or other types of modeling techniques
Experience in supply chain or knowledge of basic supply chain concepts
Hands-on experience with AWS services like Redshift, SageMaker, Quicksight, etc.
Proficiency in programming/scripting languages like R and Python
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

Amazon tops the 2018 Harris Poll for most reputable company, scoring first for Emotional Appeal, Products & Services, and Financial Performance, and top ten for Vision & Leadership and Workplace Environment. Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of enterprise, government and start-up business and organizations in over 190 countries around the world. Launched in 2006, Amazon Web Services officially began offering developer customers access to web services – now widely known as cloud computing – based on Amazon’s own back-end technology platform.

In AWS Finance, you will work with exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people who believe financial partnership is critical to customer success. We benefit from diverse experiences and perspectives and are committed to inclusion as a business advantage and the right thing to do. The growth of AWS and scope of Amazon’s business create opportunities to grow your career and broaden experience in any direction you choose. As a pioneer in cloud services, AWS lets you apply data, creativity, and analytical ability, to completely new challenges and opportunities. This is a chance to work hard, have fun, and make history.

This Business Intelligence Engineer, Network Finance will partner with AWS business operations and the multiple Finance teams to ensure we deploy network capacity to meet our customers’ extraordinary growth, while maintaining control as we scale. Our business partners develop and operate the network platform for all of Amazon, including e-commerce products and AWS cloud computing solutions, and is critical to our customers’ success.
This role will partner closely with the business teams to understand the data-needs of the team and ensure that the business teams are able to answer hard questions with real data. This individual will participate in business reviews and new-initiatives. They should be able to identify and help close gaps in the information available, as well as predict up-and-coming data-needs when participating in discussions about new products or features.
A successful individual should be highly collaborative and organized. You should be capable of prioritizing multiple deliverables and effectively communicate progress and blockers. You should feel comfortable working across multiple data-sources, and be capable of participating in and understanding how multiple systems communicate information to one-another, and a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with the ability to work in a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment.

Key Responsibilities For This Role Would Include
Root cause analysis and uncovering core issues using data, then assisting logistics in improving and creating new measures using visualization tools
Collecting, analyzing and reviewing quantitative data and creating meaningful reports to drive business improvement for AWS
Gathering and translating business requests into technical requirements for further development
Conduct deep dive analyses of business problems and formulate conclusions and recommendations to be presented to senior leadership
Work with data source providers and technology teams to ensure that key decision data is accurate, automated and timely
Owning the design, development, and maintenance of scalable solutions for ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to support analytical and business needs
Translate basic business problem statements into analysis requirements
Use analytical and statistical rigor to answer business questions and drive business decisions
Develop queries and visualizations for ad-hoc requests and projects, as well as ongoing reporting
Recognize and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, design, analysis, validation, and documentation
Troubleshoot operational data-quality issues
Review and audit existing ETL jobs and queries
Recommending improvements to back-end data sources for increased accuracy and simplicity

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Finance, or a similar field
5+ years relevant experience in finance, business intelligence, engineering consulting or related highly-analytical field
Highly proficient at SQL and ETL
Highly proficient in visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI and Quiksight
Practical experience with scripting language like Python, R is a plus
Solid communication skills and team player
Attention to detail and ability to successfully manage multiple competing priorities simultaneously
Preferred Qualifications
Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Finance, or a similar field
Experience with AWS technologies such as Redshift, RDS, S3, etc.
Advanced knowledge of SQL and MS excel
Advanced practical experience in programing or scripting languages like Python, R, etc
General business acumen and basic finance knowledge

title: Business Intelligence Manager
description:
The Retail Business Intelligence Manager should be an analytical, organized, well-spoken, and detail-oriented individual that can help manage the statistical planning and analysis of our mobile retail business. They must also apply a wide range of knowledge, technical skills, and abilities to analyze and manage strategic initiatives to drive the sellout performance of Mobile products.
This position will support and drive strategic initiatives that center around channel sales planning, statistical modeling, and web-based reporting development, while crafting & communicating insightful findings and results to Retail and Mobile leadership.

Develops and maintains channel-centric and geography-based sales performance models to support development of targets, demand generation campaigns, and guide marketing investments

Excellent oral and written communication skill, with demonstrated experience building and delivering executive level presentations

Experience building relationships across cross-functional teams and working as a team player

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Who we are ETQ is the leading provider of quality, EHS and compliance management software, trusted by the world's strongest brands. title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Eastman is a global specialty materials company that produces a broad range of products found in items people use every day. With the purpose of enhancing the quality of life in a material way, Eastman works with customers to deliver innovative products and solutions while maintaining a commitment to safety and sustainability. The company's innovation-driven growth model takes advantage of world-class technology platforms, deep customer engagement, and differentiated application development to grow its leading positions in attractive end-markets such as transportation, building and construction, and consumables. As a globally inclusive and diverse company, Eastman employs approximately 14,500 people around the world and serves customers in more than 100 countries. The company had 2018 revenues of approximately $10 billion and is headquartered in Kingsport, Tennessee, USA. For more information, visit Positions available in both ST. LOUIS, MO and KINGSPORT, TN As a Business Intelligence Analyst in Eastman's EIM (Enterprise Information Management) organization, you design, develop, and implement information systems integrating operational and business data to generate insight and improve finance, supply chain, and enterprise performance. You work collaboratively with various functional units, business, information technology, and data science teams to understand needs, capabilities, and gaps and then create solutions that help us increase productivity, improve quality, and meet customer demand reliably and cost-effectively. And you do so in a collaborative workspace where creativity is the core of your success. We are looking for a curious and creative person who loves to learn and relishes problem-solving. You are not a back-office order taker, but rather want to engage the clients of your work and iterate between their needs and your deliverables to produce highly functional products. You can prioritize work, handle multiple tasks, achieve goals and deliver timely and accurate results. You constantly look for ways to improve things, not only for yourself and your workgroup, but also for your clients. You must be good team player who work collaboratively in small teams to improve the operations of immediate work group by offering ideas, identifying issues, and respecting team members. Job Requirements / Qualifications Bachelor's degree required, preferably in computer science but will consider another technical degree where you can also demonstrate strong computer science skills learned in some other setting
For internal candidates, relevant experience is a big plus, but we're also willing to allow for some on-the-job development if you've got a track record of learning quickly. The more of the following areas of expertise you have, the better you fit what we are looking for: Data integration - data modeling, extract/transform/load, job automation/orchestrationRelational databases and SQL - Microsoft SQL Server is a plusVisual analytics, especially with Microsoft PowerBI and SQL Server Reporting ServiceUnderstanding of SAP modules like SD and PA is a plus Eastman Chemical Company is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other characteristics protected by law. Eastman is committed to creating a powerfully diverse workforce and a broadly inclusive workplace, where everyone can contribute to their fullest potential each day.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
