Employees can make an immediate effect in a growth stage company.

OppLoans is a team of caring and inventive “Opptimists” with diverse perspectives and backgrounds. OppLoans employees approach every new challenge with an unparalleled ability to see what could be rather than settle for what is. We want people to be excited to come to work every morning and know they are a part of something great. That’s why we prize collaboration, collegiality, and letting the best ideas win the day.

What You Get To Do
Analyze our business to improve processes and maximize conversion rate. You will never stop asking, “How can we do this better?”
Absorb and analyze data, to tell compelling stories through your analyses.
Combine and analyze both structured and unstructured data to create meaningful analyses.
Extract, segment and report on data in clear graphs, charts and other visualizations. Provide strategic recommendations based on the data to improve our business.
Lead the daily trending analyses of our KPIs.
Enhance our automated monitoring systems, and forge better visualization frameworks to increase the accessibility of our data.
Help build algorithms that breathe more intelligence into our existing systems, such as automation for decision-making, customer routing, and call strategies.
Be unafraid to break existing rules, re-imagine new processes, and build them.
You will be the intersection of Business, Data, and Operations. This cross-functional, visible role, is the central hub to important partners across various departments such as Sales, Marketing, Credit, and Technology.

Level
Analyst/Associate

What You'll Bring To The Team
1-4 years of experience in data analytics. Experience with SQL/R/Python and data visualization tools such as Periscope, Tableau, etc.) Experience building supervised and unsupervised machine learning models is a plus.
Experience in a high-growth startup and/or the financial services industry is a plus.
Excited to learn and identify opportunities to translate data analysis into action.
Have quantifiable achievements in previous roles.
All-around “athlete” who is curious, analytical, and purposefully strategic.
Must already be authorized to work in the USA
No relocation assistance provided; local Chicago applicants preferred.

Why OppLoans?

Employees Love Working Here

With a dynamic startup culture and great benefits, we’ve attracted top talent and boast one of the most engaged offices in the country.OppLoans is ranked an Inc. 500 company for four straight years and named the fourth fastest-growing Chicagoland company by Crain’s Chicago Business. We’ve been named one of the best companies to work for in the nation by Glassdoor two years in a row. Check out our Glassdoor reviews to see why our employees love us!

Customers love our product

OppLoans is committed to delivering an outstanding experience to our customers. Don’t believe us? See what our customers are saying on Google and the BBB ! We were also named a number one personal lender by Lending Tree, and a “Leader in Quality and Innovation” by the Center for Financial Services Innovation.

Benefits

We offer a great compensation package and benefits package to support you inside and outside of work as you define your career with us. Some of these benefits include a 401(k) matching program, paid vacation policy, free PPO medical option with BCBS for Employee Only Plans, dental, vision, and accident coverage, tuition reimbursement, free gym membership, discounted Divvy memberships & ClassPass fitness classes, CTA and Metra benefit programs, casual dress policy, subsidized daily lunches, a stocked kitchen with healthy snacks and drinks, an employee and peer recognition program, and intramural sports leagues.

Our office is conveniently located in downtown Chicago with panoramic views of Millennium Park and Lake Michigan with rooftop access.

OppLoans is an equal opportunity employer. OppLoans does not discriminate against any applicant for employment due to age, color, sex, disability, national origin, race, religion, veteran status, or any other protected class.

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

We are seeking an experienced Business Intelligence Engineer (BIE) to help invent the future of everyday grocery shopping with Alexa. Our team enables shopping in everyday life by making it easy for customers. Whether it is to capture what customers need in the moment by adding items to their Alexa Shopping List, help them build their carts with Whole Foods Market, or just buy some more aluminum foil, Alexa is there to help save time and money. Our services allow customers to shop, anywhere, easily without interrupting what you’re doing – to go from “Alexa, buy bananas” to “It’s on the way” in a matter of seconds. Join us, and be a key member of the new and exciting Alexa Shopping Grocery analytics team.

As a BIE In The Alexa Shopping Team You Will Focus On Exciting And Challenging Problems, Including

The analytics team’s success depends on our ability to create actionable insight from the data that that our customers generate. A BIE in our team requires the ability to dive deep into large amounts of data, have good business intuition, curiosity and a grit to deal with ambiguity, and the desire to influence strategic decisions with data-driven analysis and insights. Working with the business teams and collaborating with key stakeholders across the company, you will have the opportunity to design and implement features to enhance the experience of your customers.
Identify, develop, manage, and execute analyses to uncover areas of opportunity and present written business recommendations that will shape the future of Alexa Shopping.
Report key insight trends, using statistical rigor to simplify and inform the larger team of noteworthy story lines that impact the business.
Learn and understand a broad range of Amazon’s data resources and know how, when, and which to use.
Build automated data solutions and dashboards to enable your team to self-service 80% of data needs, allowing you to focus on answering hard and ambiguous problems.
Scope, build and own technical data warehouse processes to help the business scale.
Collaborate with software engineering, product management, marketing and UX as a leader of quantitative analysis and where you develop solutions that utilize the highest standards of analytical rigor and data integrity.

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Statistics or a related discipline.
3+ years of years of relevant work experience in business intelligence, analytics, data engineering, or related field.
Proven track record of crystalizing out impactful and actionable insight from big data.
Highly proficient using ETL manager to write and optimize SQL queries in an ambiguous business environment.
Proficient in processing dirty, large, multi-dimensional datasets from multiple sources.
Proficient using at least one data visualization product (Tableau, Looker, Amazon QuickSight, etc.)
Knowledge of data mining and working knowledge of at least one Statistical Software (SAS, R, Python, etc.)
Excellent written and verbal communications across technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Statistics, Data Science or a related discipline.
Familiarity with AWS solutions such as EC2, DynamoDB, S3, and Redshift.

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

Ready for a role with the potential to influence decisions across the entire company? Clickstream builds and supports data pipelines for datasets describing Amazon customer behavior in website and applications. We collect, transform and assemble logs from webservers, services, browsers, and devices to create a coherent view of customers' experience using Amazon across web, mobile, connected screens and beyond. Several hundred teams at Amazon make use of the data we provide to make critical business decisions in inventory planning, on site content optimization, off site advertising and countless others.
The size and complexity of our data has increased over time as more and more customers shop online across different types of devices and more and more Amazon businesses spin up. Our current data processing infrastructure is ready for an upgrade, and we are looking for BIEs to help define and deliver Clickstream 2.0. You will work as part of a cross functional team of product managers & software developers to produce high quality data that truthfully represents the online behavior of Amazon's customers. If you are interested in defining and delivering a state-of-the-art data processing system for one of the world's largest and most complex data-sets, come join us!

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance or related field.

Experience of working in very large data warehouse environment and multi data sources.
Advanced ability to draw insights from data and clearly communicate them to stakeholders and senior management.

Experience with complex customer interaction data-sets.
MBA/MS in Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Finance, Business Analytics, Information Systems or related field.

Upgrade aims to deliver frictionless mobile banking and exceptional value to mainstream consumers. Founded in 2017, Upgrade has already originated over $2.4 billion in consumer credit.

Upgrade products are designed to create a new banking experience that seeks to eliminate fees on everyday transactions and offer access to more affordable and responsible credit through cards and loans. In 2 short years 8 million people have already applied for an Upgrade Card or loan. Upgrade is very well funded with $150 million in equity capital.

Upgrade has been named a “Best Place to Work in the Bay Area” by the San Francisco Business Times and Silicon Valley Business Journal, and received “Best Company for Women” and “Best Company for Diversity” awards from Comparably.

We are looking for new team members who are excited about creating, designing and implementing new and better solutions to join a team of 300 talented and passionate professionals. Come join us if you like to tackle big problems and make a meaningful difference in people's lives.

The Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst will be responsible for helping the business make intelligent, data based decisions. This is done by performing detailed research & analysis, producing new and existing reports, dashboards, scorecards, and other data products. This person will play a key role in developing and maintaining BI solutions within the organization and for other team members to ensure performance and reliability. The ideal candidate will also analyze information obtained from the BI solutions, verify accuracy, and make recommendations that drive advancement within the organization. The ideal candidate must be capable of delivering high-quality deliverables, on time, with careful attention to detail. Additionally, the ideal candidate must be able to dig deep past the initial request to ensure they understand the core of what’s being asked so they can deliver the best end-state solution.

Responsibilities
Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and scorecards using Tableau and SQL.

Effectively communicate (written and verbal) technical subject matter to non-technical business stakeholders.

Skills

3+ years of experience in a quantitative/analysis/reporting role within the Financial Services industry.
1+ years building dashboards and reports in Tableau (preferred), Looker or similar BI platform.
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of SQL (PostgreSQL a plus).
Skilled with the use of Microsoft office software including Excel and PowerPoint.
Skilled with the use of Google products, such as Google Sheets, Google Slides, etc.
Knowledge of how to collect data from different information sources and distribute them to users; ability to use this information to simplify information systems and make sound business recommendations to senior business leaders.
Visionary thinking, be someone who can partner with the business to get to the core of what’s needed to run the business successfully.
Team-player with superior interpersonal skills who can work closely with both technical development teams and end business users.
Effective written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills.
Experience documenting BI requirements and developing reports based on user requirements, delivering creative options once you understand the need behind the request.
Sense of ownership and responsibility towards problems and solutions.
Demonstrated ability to adapt quickly and smoothly to a rapidly changing environment.

Great OPEN office environment!
Conveniently located in the heart of downtown Phoenix.
Close to light rail and public transportation.

Kitchen stocked with beverages and snacks.

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

Amazon Imaging builds the world’s best online shopping experience through photography, video, graphic design, and usability design enabling millions of customers to make more informed purchasing decisions. Imaging at Amazon is a large and fast-growing network of teams located throughout North and South America, Europe, India and Asia, focusing on fashion and product photography, robotics, image virtualization, machine learning for quality processing, photo retouching, and image support services. We are continually innovating and setting new industry standards for showcasing 10s of millions of products across multiple global marketplaces. We are obsessed with innovating on behalf of our customers, and continually push beyond the boundaries of traditional e-commerce photography and videography.
As a Business Intelligence Engineer, you will be working with other BIEs, data engineers, development and finance teams to drive the next generation of analytical and business intelligence capabilities. You’ll coordinate with our partner teams to define and build the data architecture, data mart and reporting layers to facilitate standardized reporting and deep business insight. Your expertise will enable us to standardize on taxonomy and simplify data availability for all users.
The successful candidate will be comfortable with big data structures, intimately familiar with SQL, database schema and business processes. The candidate will have a strong bias towards data-driven decision-making and will be comfortable with ambiguity while working in a fast-paced dynamic environment.

Responsibilities
Encourage the organization to adopt next-generation data architecture strategies, proposing both data flows and storage solutions.
Partner with analysts, data engineers and software development engineers across Product Imaging org to identify critical datasets which will provide structured and timely access to actionable business information.
Participate in developing and influencing extensible data design and technical strategy to provide the business with standard dimensions and measures.
Investigate and implement new big data technologies to solve business problems where appropriate.
Improve back-end data sources for increased accuracy and simplicity.
Recognize and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: including data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation.
Simplify and automate reporting, audits, and other data-driven activities.
Support business with time-critical tactical data analyses.

Basic Qualifications
5+ years of experience in relevant business domains, including data warehousing (understanding of relational databases, data modeling, data structures and architecture), ETL development and business intelligence tools, techniques and technology, or experience in analytics, business analysis or comparable consumer analytics solutions; development of complex reports
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Finance, Statistics or a related discipline.
Advanced Oracle SQL knowledge (using iterative functions, methods of tuning SQL code, etc.) and database in a business environment with large scale complex data sets.
Proven analytical and quantitative skills (including ability to effectively use business tools such as Tableau, Excel/Access, macros, SQL, SSAS-type tools, etc.) and an ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses.
Ability to meet tight deadlines and manage multiple competing priorities; ability to work independently and navigate through ambiguous requirements
Strong verbal and written communication and data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with creative, business and technical teams
Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations
Inquisitive mindset, with proven problem solving ability, and a passion for big data.
Experience in gathering requirements and formulating business metrics for reporting.
Preferred Qualifications
Competency with AWS solutions such Redshift (or other columnar DW), NoSQL e.g. Dynamo, and S3.
Competency with Tableau
Experience working with predictive analytics as well as the tools for developing the same
Experience building or administering reporting/analytics platforms

description:
Overview

Our Community Operations team provides high quality phone, chat, and email support to both our customer and shopper communities. Community Operations has launched its Customer Experience Center in Atlanta and we are looking for a strategic thinker who is passionate about understanding the data from all of our interactions and how it drives real world changes in behavior. In this role, you will support strategic decision making processes through your analytics, heavy data-driven approach, and operational mindset. You should possess superior analytical skills, excellent time-management and organizational habits, and the ability to clearly communicate and present information to key stakeholders. You’ll work closely with leadership to help manage dashboards and provide the ad hoc and KPI reporting that drives critical decision-making and propels organizational success.

In this role, you will support strategic decision making processes through your analytics, heavy data-driven approach, and operational mindset. You should possess superior analytical skills, excellent time-management and organizational habits, and the ability to clearly communicate and present information to key stakeholders. You’ll work closely with leadership to help create manage dashboards and provide the ad hoc and KPI reporting that drives critical decision-making and propels organizational success.

Your day to day…

Advanced SQL Skills - able to write complex and performant queries to extract data from our Snowflake cluster
Proficient with Tableau or other analytical visualization tools

About Instacart

Founded in 2012, Instacart is a leader in North American online groceries and one of the fastest-growing companies in e-commerce. Our same-day delivery and pickup services bring everyday essentials and fresh groceries to consumers in the U.S. and Canada in as fast as an hour. We have partnered with more than 300 beloved national, regional and local retailers to deliver from more than 20,000 stores across more than 5,500 cities in North America.

We believe that great people are the ingredients for success. We like to think that we are like a potluck—everyone brings something new, different and flavorful to the table. We believe that just as meals are best shared together, success is best shared together. Our mix of thoughtful, inventive and neighborly employees work together to deliver our common goal: to make grocery shopping effortless for everyone. If this resonates with you, then Instacart just might be the place for you. Welcome home.

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

The Supply Chain Optimization Technologies (SCOT) organization owns Amazon’s global inventory management systems: we decide what, when, where, and how much we should buy to meet Amazon’s business goals and to make our customers happy. We do this for millions of items, for hundreds of product lines worth billions of dollars of inventory world-wide. Our systems are built entirely in-house, and are on the cutting edge in automated large-scale business, inventory and supply chain planning and optimization systems. We foster new game-changing ideas, creating ever more intelligent and self-learning systems to maximize the efficiency of Amazon's inventory investment and placement decisions.

The Fulfillment Insights team is focused on using cutting edge science to improve customer outcomes and transform our logistics, along with machine learning, and scalable distributed software in the cloud that automates and optimizes shipments to customers under the uncertainty of demand, pricing and supply. When customers place orders, our systems use real time, large scale optimization techniques to optimally choose from where to ship and how to consolidate multiple orders so that customers get their shipments on time or faster with the lowest possible transportation costs. One of our core responsibilities is to leverage big data to identify key patterns of success and failure, identify the areas we need to focus on first, understand root cause(s) that triggered failure, and to build predictive models that will help fix the most impactful problems. The amount of data, the variables that come into play, and diversity of customers and locations make this role very challenging and also fun. It's great for those who love solving problems, especially when dealing with a lot of ambiguity and asking lots of smart questions that will lead to the discovery of universal concepts, and truly innovative ML solutions that continuously improve the customer delivery experience.

As a Business Intelligence Engineer on Fulfillment Insights, you will:
Directly interface with business customers, gathering requirements and delivering complete BI solutions.
Analyze and extract relevant information from large amounts of data to help automate and optimize solutions to key business problems.
Conceptualize models and solutions essential to delivering customer value.
Work closely with research science, data & software engineering teams to build model implementations and integrate successful models and algorithms in production systems at very large scale.
Recognize and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation
Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses, model development, model validation and model implementation.
To help describe some of our challenges, we created a short video about Supply Chain Optimization at Amazon - http://bit.ly/amazon-scot

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age.

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Management, Industrial Engineering, Maths, Statistics, Finance, or related industry experience

Experience processing large scale datasets, analyzing data to solve business problems and presenting impactful insights to business teams
Advanced knowledge in SQL
Knowledge and direct experience using business intelligence reporting/visualization tools (OBIEE, Business Objects, Cognos, Tableau, MicroStrategy, SSAS Cubes, etc.)
Strong written and verbal communication skills. The role requires effective communication with colleagues from machine learning, economics and business backgrounds
Preferred Qualifications
Master’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Management, Industrial Engineering, Maths, Statistics, Finance, or other technical field from an accredited university
Domain knowledge in Buying, Logistics/Supply Chain, Transportation, Engineering
Advanced knowledge of Oracle BI tools, MySQL, Linux/UNIX
Experience with AWS solutions such as EC2, DynamoDB, S3, and Redshift
Experience with statistical analysis, regression modeling and forecasting, time series analysis, data mining, financial analysis, and demand modeling
Experience using Python for scripting or statistical analysis

Description

Amazon Lab126 is an inventive research and development company that designs and engineers high-profile consumer electronics. title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
About Us

Oklahoma's Credit Union has been happy to help Oklahomans for over 60 years. From the beginning, OKCU has sought to keep people economically independent by helping them learn to save and borrow responsibly. We have almost half of a billion dollars in assets and employ over 125 people. OKCU offers branch access at over 91 locations across Oklahoma and over 5,000 locations nationwide. We serve over 40,000 people who enjoy benefits such as low or no fees on services, higher rates on deposits, and low rates on home or auto loans.

At OKCU, we are happy to guide you through a comprehensive training program to find a career path that works for you. Experience a robust benefits package and have a little fun along the way.

About You

You really care about helping people in your community. You are always thinking of ways to make your job or life easier. You are the kind of person who likes to be held accountable, you don't want to leave anyone hanging! You love helping people do more with their money. You enjoy a happy place to work.

Join a community that puts people first, not profits. Want to learn more about who we are and what we're about? Take a look at what's important to us and hopefully it's important to you, too.

Visit:Instagram, Twitter,Facebook,YouTube,LinkedIn,OKCU

This position is located at our Capitol Branch, 3001 N Lincoln Blvd, OKC, OK 73105.

Essentialfunctions
Provide outstanding service and contribute to overall team effort.
Translate business questions into problems solvable using analytics tools, and convert the results of analyses into visual stories tailored to the needs of the audience.
Proactively share BI insights with leadership, departments and branches to turn data into knowledge that can be used to make sound business decisions, unify processes and strategic efforts.
Monitor, optimize and maximize the effectiveness of current and proposed future marketing and communications initiatives using BI.
Provide data that is accurate, congruent, reliable, and easily accessible.
Document BI needs from departments.
Track and analyze key performance indicators by branch and business line.
Identify business use for data from systems to enhance additional BI analytics and grow the credit union.
Develop policies, procedures and documentation for the consistent collection and analysis of data.
Champion and drive adoption by leading knowledge transfer for new data initiatives and tools.
Develop and manage reporting library, tools and dashboards.
Work closely with vendor to have an intimate knowledge of BI system and future enhancements.
Maintain knowledge of digital attribution (data collection, tagging management, data integrity, advanced analytics & reporting.)
Utilize A/B, multivariate testing tools.
Understand the credit union industry and technology; how the web, analytics, SQL and relational databases work.
Expert in OKCU's member demographics and current and future products.
Utilize BI to ensure product benefits are consistently and properly presented to the appropriate audiences across all channels.
Ensure confidentiality regarding member transactions and information.
Ensure compliance with all credit union policies and procedures.

Education And Experience
Bachelor's degree in statistics, data science, operations research OR marketing degree with like job experience.
Prior business analytics experience with at least 5 years of relevant work experience.

Benefits For Full-time Employees
Employee medical coverage 90% paid for by OKCU
Employee dental, vision and other insurance coverage provided at little or no cost
Life insurance and AD&D paid for by OKCU
Tuition reimbursement program

Benefits For All Eligible Employees
401(k) contribution match of up to 3%, plus additional profit-sharing match of 3%
Volunteer opportunities to serve the community
Gym membership reimbursement
Comprehensive training opportunities
And much more
Oklahoma's Credit Union is an EEO/AA employer.

title: Business Intelligence Developer
description:
Description

Robert Half Technology IT Search is currently working with a client looking to add a Business Intelligence Developer (BI Developer) to their team. This is a well-known organization in the Jacksonville area that offers excellent benefits and flexible schedule. For immediate consideration, please email an updated resume to chris.luther@rht.com. Develops, tests, documents and implements high quality Business Intelligence solutions using tools such as the Microsoft BI stack including SSRS, SSIS, SSAS, and T-SQL stored procedures as well as MDX and Power BI in accordance with specifications and supporting documents.
Proactively analyzes performance of stored procedures, queries and reports in order to take actions to correct any discrepancies.

Five years of SQL OLTP or Data Warehouse development experience. Three years of development experience with Microsoft SQL Server components including T-SQL, MDX, SSIS, SSRS, and SSAS. title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and visionary people. We are looking for a highly analytical Business Intelligence Engineer to join the Global Initiatives team.

As a Business Intelligence Engineer, you will generate insights that will guide operational excellence and business strategy for our team and stakeholders. Data analysis is at the core Amazon’s culture, and your work will have a direct impact on decision making and strategy for our organization. You will be gathering customer insights, mining data, and making recommendations.

The ideal candidate will have excellent analytical abilities, outstanding business acumen and judgment, intense curiosity, strong technical skills, and superior written and verbal communication skills.

They will have a strong bias toward data driven decision making. They will be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, able to think big and be creative (while paying careful attention to detail). Enjoys working in a fast-paced dynamic environment. If you are excited about data, are results oriented, and want to join a growing analytics team within Amazon, this role is for you.
Design, develop and maintain scaled, automated, user-friendly systems, reports, dashboards, etc. that will support the needs of the business.
Partner with business and technical teams to consult, develop and implement KPI’s, automated reporting/process solutions, ad-hoc analyses, and data infrastructure improvements to meet business needs.
Apply deep analytic and business intelligence skill to extract meaningful insight and learning from large and complicated data sets.
Serve as liaison between the business and technical teams to achieve the goal of providing actionable insights into current business performance, and ad hoc investigations to support future improvements or innovations. This will require data gathering and manipulation, problem solving, and communication of insights and recommendations.
Be hands-on with SQL to build analyses and contribute to the better understanding of the business
Build various data visualizations to tell the story of business trends, patterns, and outliers through rich visualizations
Help guide the direction and build the future of our metrics and reporting
Design and develop weekly, monthly, and quarterly dashboards, scorecards and reporting for the business
Work closely with various stakeholders to define the information needed and how best to present it
Recognize and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation

Basic Qualifications
BA/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, or related experience
4+ years of relevant work experience in data science, business analytics, business intelligence (BI), or comparable experience in big data environments
3+ years of experience in data mining and dataset preparation using SQL
3+ years of experience with Tableau Desktop or other relevant data visualization software
Preferred Qualifications
5+ years of experience in a data engineer or BIE role with a technology company
Advanced ability to draw insights from data and clearly communicate them (verbal/written) to the stakeholders and senior management as required.
Be self-driven, and show ability to deliver on ambiguous projects with incomplete or dirty data.
Experience working in very large data warehouse environments
Experience conducting large scale data analysis to support business decision making
Proficient understanding of data warehouse/modeling methods.
Experience conducting large scale data analysis to support business decision making
Strong verbal/written communication and data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical team
Familiarity with Amazon's cloud infrastructure including EC2, S3 and Redshift
Experience with Python or other relevant scripting language
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

Alexa is Amazon’s groundbreaking virtual assistant designed for voice interactions. We believe voice is the most natural interface for interacting with technology across many domains. We are looking for a Business Intelligence Engineer (BIE) to join our Analytics team located in beautiful Santa Barbara, CA.

If you are passionate about developing business metrics and insights from complex datasets, this role is for you. You will work closely with data engineers, software development engineers, knowledge engineers, product managers, and business leaders to produce reports and analyses that help improve Alexa’s answering capabilities across multiple information verticals: Sports, Business, History, Science, etc. To be successful in this role, you must be able to turn ambiguous business questions into clearly defined problems, develop quantifiable metrics, and implement Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) processes to support all data needs across the organization.

Last but not least, you love building insightful reports and beautiful data visualizations, and want to automate everything you have built.

Key Responsibilities
Interview stakeholders to gather business requirements and translate them into data and analytic requirements for software development engineers and data engineers
Write Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) jobs to calculate business metrics
Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions
Monitor and troubleshoot operational or data issues in the data pipelines
Review and audit existing ETL jobs and SQL queries
Identify and recommend opportunities to automate systems and tools
Analyze data from many sources and present key findings to improve products, customer experience, and other business metrics

Experience in business intelligence software (Tableau, Qlikview, MicroStrategy) and ETL software

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

How can Amazon improve the advertising experience for customers around the world? How can we help advertisers and customers find each other in a meaningful way? Amazon Advertising creates and transforms the connection between retailers/service providers and customers. Join the Insights & Performance Team to contribute to product solutions that allow us to solve this through technology and automation.

Amazon Advertising seeks a Business Intelligence Engineer to to contribute to ongoing performance analysis, development of metrics and creation of solutions that prescribe actions that help maximize ad campaign performance and grow revenue. This person will be tasked with thinking critically about how to combine elements from existing systems, technologies and operational workflows, and translate this into dashboards and tools that allow users to deeply understand what contributes to and impacts display campaign effectiveness. The ideal candidate must be willing to effectively project manage and prioritize across multiple tasks, exhibit strong problem solving skills and autonomy, and be ready to jump into a fast-paced, dynamic and fun environment.

Responsibilities
Own, update and continually improve metrics dashboards that allow individual contributors and team managers better understand campaign performance and identify follow-on actions
Create correlation and linkage between projected performance, actual performance and subsequent downstream impact to revenue and renewal
Work closely with product, operations, engineering and analytics teams to create the appropriate signals and metrics to drive performance.
Work closely with internal stakeholders and customers to gather feedback to inform scope, evaluate options, and continually refine and iterate on solutions over time.
Create, own and maintain input and output metrics related to performance that allow audit of user adoption, usage patterns and defect monitoring.
Uncover data anomalies to test new hypotheses, and generate ideas to fuel recommendations and product innovation on behalf of customers.
Drive alignment with stakeholders to carry your solutions forward into changes in workflow and processes to fuel innovation.

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Math, Finance, Economics, Engineering, Computer Science or related field
Proficient extracting and processing data using SQL
Experience with data visualization tools for reporting such as AWS Quicksight, Tableau or similar
3+ years experience in analytics, statistics or comparable analytics position
Proven problem solving skills, attention to detail and structured approach to thinking
Ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams
Ability to deal with ambiguity and competing prioritization while maintaining autonomy and ownership
Preferred Qualifications
Masters degree in quantitative field
Advance knowledge of statistical analysis using R and Python or similar platforms
Digital advertising experience
Demonstrated ability to learn and use new technologies
Amazon.com is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

Amazon.com was recently voted #2 most admired company in the US, #1 most innovative, and # 1 in Customer Service.
The Advertising Analytics and Data Management team is looking for an exceptional Business Intelligence Engineer who is passionate about data and the insights that large amounts of data can provide. We are investing heavily in building an excellent advertising business and are responsible for defining and delivering a collection of self-service performance advertising products – “always-on analytics” - that is fully scalable and reliable. Our products are strategically important to our leadership, economists, analysts, and product teams to drive long-term growth. We mine billions of ad impressions and millions of clicks daily and are breaking fresh ground to create world-class products. We are highly motivated, collaborative, and fun loving with an entrepreneurial spirit and bias for action. With a broad mandate to experiment and innovate, we are growing at an unprecedented rate with a seemingly endless range of new opportunities.
We rely on data and metrics to drive action, and are thoughtful and intentional in developing metrics that support fast decision making and highlight optimization opportunities. This role will focus on working with a team of product managers, data engineers and financial analysts to extract value out of our large and disparate datasets by streamlining and simplifying the metric reporting needs for our operating cadences such as daily, weekly and monthly business reviews.
This role requires an individual with excellent big data – extraction & visualization, business, communication, technical and analytical skills. The successful candidate will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, an ability to work in a fast-paced, high-energy and ever-changing environment. The drive and capability to shape the organization’s data strategy is a must.
The successful candidate will be a subject matter expert who will leverage data to identify areas of opportunities in the business, support fast decision-making and highlight optimization opportunities.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST
AANA – American Association of Nurse Anesthetists
Park Ridge, Illinois
 The AANA is an organization that is in active transformation, so this is the kind of opportunity that doesn’t come around often. We’re looking to add a talented Business Intelligence Analyst to our dynamic team of professionals that is deeply dedicated to advancing the nurse anesthesia profession. While work experience and educational preparation are certainly important, a can-do attitude and drive to do epic stuff are the most desired characteristics for this new position! All staff members are expected to foster a workplace culture that promotes divergent thinking, openness, respect, trust, and the desire to be epic!
 SUMMARY
 This newly created Business Intelligence Analyst role at the AANA is key to the organization, providing insights and visualizations which will affect business change. You will work as part of a cross-functional team, working collaboratively as well as independently to deliver insights across marketing, membership, events and education products.
 The Business Intelligence Analyst will develop dashboards/visualizations using Microsoft Power BI and other tools which will empower the team to understand AANA’s customer and member journey, providing insight into needs, identifying behavior and gaps. You will be primarily responsible for analyzing, interpreting, and summarizing data findings for financial, operations and strategic aspects of our business.
 The Business Intelligence Analyst will identify data integrity issues and participate in project level data validation and correction efforts, ensuring data aggregation is successful and accurate.
 The Business Intelligence Analyst reports directly to the Director of Marketing.
  MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
 Business Intelligence Strategy, Implementation and Operations & Data Requirements:
Assists in development and maintenance of BI Strategy, identifying short and long-term goals and initiatives
Documents data visualization/report requirements
Proactively measures effectiveness of BI standards and tools, updating as needed
Leads data requirement sessions with business units, translating requirements into data visualization needs, documenting requirements and developing visualizations
 Dashboards, Visualizations and Market Insights:
In collaboration with the appropriate business units, participates in implementation of selected BI Data visualization tools, working with vendors to ensure accuracy and relevance
Develops and modifies reports, verifies information integrity and designs BI dashboards, scorecards, charts/graphs, drill-downs, and dynamic reports to meet new information needs
Maintains / updates data warehouse as new data sources are identified; performs regular data audits to ensure clean and relevant data is recorded; makes recommendations for correction of data
Develops thorough understanding of customer behavior, product and program trends to inform decision making
Leverages data to understand our products and processes in-depth; identifies areas of opportunity, and supports projects to drive growth, engagement and process improvement
Monitors historical and real-time performance of key metrics to detect and report anomalies
Analyzes customer behavior including behavioral customer profiling, life cycle analysis, customer segmentation, purchase trends
Identifies, develops and executes analysis to uncover areas of opportunity and presents recommendations that will help shape member engagement, sales and marketing road map
Analyzes internal and external (competitor) data sources to identify trends in customer behavior; makes recommendations to gain efficiencies, identifies cross-sell/up-sell opportunities and improves market share as well as identifying new markets
 Data Governance and Integrity:
Collaborates with IT team to develop and enforce data governance to ensure customer data is measured effectively across organization
Contributes to development of organization-wide data governance policies and procedures
Partners with data processing team to accurately and efficiently capture data
Organizes and manages customer and marketing data
Ensures accuracy of reporting data and analytics

REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Mathematics, Statistics or another related field from an accredited university
4+ years of data analytics experience
Proficient with Excel, SQL, Tableau, and Power BI or similar tools
Exceptional analytical skills and a passion for data and discovering new trends / insights
Excellent statistics background and ability to explain analytical methodologies simply and thoroughly
Experience in working with stakeholders to gather data requirements and develop data visualizations based on requirements
Experience implementing or working with data warehouses
Experience performing data audits, cleanup initiatives and proactively developing and improving processes
Experience with integration and migration of data validations/user acceptance testing
Knowledge of and/or direct experience with implementing organizational governance
Excellent communication skills, both written and oral, to clearly and concisely communicate to all levels within association
Strong collaboration skills with both technical and non-technical groups
Experience working with behavioral analytics for software products like Google Analytics
Experience working with large volumes of data, combining and reconciling data from different sources with ability to turn data into insights
Demonstrated project management skills
Proven experience with and ability to proactively collaborate with Technical, Financial and other Business Unit teams to connect various internal and external data sources (AMS, Event System Data, Mobile App data, Financial data, etc.) to perform data mining and integrity

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Job Title: Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst

Responsibilities

Summary of Responsibilities: The Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst position is responsible for developing and reporting KPIs, KRIs, and other metrics associated with credit risk, portfolio acquisition and performance, servicing activities, and other risk and performance metrics. Additionally, this person is responsible for maintaining and trouble-shooting reports and working closely with the IT/database team in the interest of achieving the overall company objectives. The position involves the application and enhancement of systems and procedures to ensure accuracy, compliance, and good data and reporting governance.

Essential Functions
Provide actionable insights through data analytics
Identify opportunities for growth, profit, cost savings, efficiency, etc. through deep analysis and understanding of company and industry data
Develop dashboards, presentations, and other communications to share meaningful business insights to internal clients
Develop and maintain essential reports for internal and external clients including:
Client Servicing reports
Portfolio Performance reports
Internal Accounting reports
Ad hoc reporting as needed
Proactively monitor and report relevant changes in acquisitions, servicing trends, credit performance and model performance
Effectively summarize and communicate analytic analysis to the sales, credit review, collections and loss mitigation teams to support their ongoing needs and identify opportunities
Assist with ad hoc research projects incorporating project design, data collection and analysis, summarization of findings, and presentation of results

Other Functions
Communicate and interact across all divisions as appropriate
Deliver assistance, recommendations, and feedback to VP Risk Management
Document procedures, reports, and other processes
Maintain up to date knowledge of risk related data and analytics best practices
Special projects as requested.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Requirements

QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in an analytic or business field (Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Business, etc.) required, advanced degree or certification preferred
Experience with various data analytics, reporting, and statistical techniques
Experience in auto finance and/or credit industries with preference given to candidates with knowledge of credit risk
Advanced skills with SQL and Excel
Experience with reporting/data analytics (Visual Studio, Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Detail oriented with strong technical skills, good judgment, problem solving skills and decision- making abilities
Effective verbal and written communication skills are required
Ability to work independently, handle multiple concurrent projects and manage time effectively
Self-starter with positive attitude and ability to work with minimal supervision
At least 2 years’ experience in an analytics/reporting role
Working Conditions
Extended working hours may be required as dictated by management and business needs
Ability to work flexible hours and be on-call
Ability to maintain confidentiality

Innovate Auto Finance is a full service auto finance company that originates auto loans and
leases, conducts bulk acquisitions of portfolios, services existing accounts, and conducts repo and
remarketing activities for itself and for third party clients and investors. The Credit team is responsible
for the evaluation of portfolios for purchase, originating loans and leases for clients, and the upload of

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

Amazon’s Global Talent Acquisition team is has grown to a worldwide organization of more than 4,000 recruiters, coordinators, managers, and PM, all serving to solve at scale for our massive headcount growth. At the center of that hiring process is the most important stakeholder: the candidate. To help our recruiting teams, programs, and tools become the most customer-centric on the planet, Amazon deploys a candidate experience survey, Recruiting How’s My Driving (RHMD) after every interview.

The Business Intelligence Engineer, RHMD & Interview Experience will be responsible for the distribution of the RHMD survey, data summarization and visualization, and company-wide analysis. In 2019, the survey was sent to 195,284 phone screen and 219,330 candidates, creating a deep dataset. Each week the BIE manages batch distribution of surveys through a semi-automated connection to the survey platform (Qualtrics), and for the semi-automated e-mail push of feedback summaries to recruiters. We would like to expand the distribution of results to a wider audience to include interviewers and bar raisers, which would require further development of automation processes, including building privacy rules. The BIE manages the reporting dashboard for RHMD results, which is available for the company-wide GTA organization of over 4,000 users. Individual recruiters, recruiting coordinators, and recruiting managers file tickets with the BIE for reporting feature requests, bug fixes, or investigations.

Further, this BIE will begin to explore additional research and data science questions in partnership with our Talent Assessment team. These questions relate to interviewer and interview structure & content, and their effect on candidate experience. By helping to answer these questions at an aggregate level, the BIE will influence interview program design, product enhancements, and interview paradigms across the company.


Basic Qualifications
Quantitative bachelor’s or master’s degree
Preferred Qualifications
4+ years experience in BIE or related role
Skilled in developing SQL code
Demonstrated experience creating reporting dashboards within Tableau or QuickSight
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age.


Company - Amazon.com Services LLC
Job ID: A1045885

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

This role will be the dedicated Business Intelligence Engineer (BIE) owning data, reporting, and analysis related to the core cultural bedrock for Amazon interviewing: the Bar Raisers. As Amazon's growth skyrocketed in the past few years, the demands on the recruiting teams, interviewers, and Bar Raisers grew as well. A major focus in scaling the BR program was on supply vs demand--do we have enough Bar Raisers to be able to facilitate thousands of interviews expected each year? Today, that demand planning is still paramount, but a new set of questions need to be explored:
How can we continue to scale the program as Amazon grows?
How do we look beyond just Bar Raisers and upskill the rest of the interviewers at Amazon? That is, how can every interviewer at Amazon act like a Bar Raiser?
How do we effectively communicate process changes and program research to an ever-expanding base, and gather relevant feedback without requiring consensus on decisions?
How can the role of the Bar Raiser evolve as our Recruiting and Talent Assessment teams experiment with alternative interview processes?
With these questions in mind, the BIE, Interview Experience will be responsible for managing the ETL jobs connecting interview and bar raiser data from PeopleTech’s Tier 1 and Tier 2 datasets with a front-end reporting tool in QuickSight for company-wide bar raisers, bar raisers in training (BRITs), recruiting coordinators, and bar raiser program managers. The reporting tool was launched in Q2 2019, and has since been utilized by 3,249 unique users across 47 countries. The tool provides bar raisers with interview activity counts to help drive ownership of their contributions as bar raisers. BR program managers are able to view interviewers within each org who reach eligibility for BR nominations based on tenure and interview counts. Recruiting coordinators are able to view bar raiser and BRIT activity scheduled for the coming weeks to know who should/should not be reached out to for an interview request based on their current encumbrance.

Enhancements are required for this dashboard to connect Student Programs interview activity data with data from corporate recruiting tools (Hire and iCIMS); this work requires backend data engineering. Individual BRs, BRITs, RCs, and BR program managers file tickets with the BIE for reporting feature requests, bug fixes, or investigations. In addition to the existing BR dashboard, this BIE will be responsible for all data and reporting for the bar raiser program, including several unanswered questions today about bar raiser headcount health within each Steam.


Basic Qualifications
Quantitative bachelor’s or master’s degree
Preferred Qualifications
4+ years experience in BIE or related role
Skilled in developing SQL code
Demonstrated experience creating reporting dashboards within Tableau or QuickSight
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age.

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

Are you passionate about leveraging data to deliver actionable insight that impacts daily business decisions for Amazon? Does the prospect of dealing with massive volume of data excite you?

Amazon Fulfillment Technologies (AFT) powers the physical engine at the heart of Amazon Retail. AFT builds and operates software, hardware, and processes that run the global network of fulfillment centers that move many millions of units of inventory, employ hundreds of thousands of employees, and ensure that customers get what they want when we promised we would get it to them. We do this by building automated solutions to handle things that technology does well, while relying on people to handle things that humans do well.

Amazon has a culture of data-driven decision-making, and demands business intelligence that is timely, accurate, and actionable. Our ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, relishes working with large transactional volumes and big data, enjoys the challenge of highly complex business contexts (that are typically being defined in real-time), and, above all else, is a passionate about data and analytics.

As a Business Intelligence Engineer you will be conducting large scale data analysis and providing business insights based upon data to further improve our operations and processes. Identifying non-existent data fields to improve existing KPIs would be a key responsibility for this role. Understandings around internal fulfillment center operations will be a plus.

A successful candidate knows and loves working with business intelligence tools, is comfortable accessing and working with big data from multiple sources, and passionately partners with the business to identify strategic opportunities and deliver results. You should have an internal drive to answer “why?” questions, excellent analytical abilities, strong technical skills, as well as superior written and verbal communication skills. S/he would be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, able to think big (while paying careful attention to detail), and enjoy working in a fast-paced dynamic environment.

Key Responsibilities Include

You will also have the opportunity to display your skills in the following areas:
Analyze and solve problems at their root, stepping back to understand the broader context.
Use data mining, model building, and other analytical techniques to develop and maintain customer segmentation and predictive models to drive the business.
Respond to high priority requests from senior business leaders.
Learn and understand a broad range of Amazon’s data resources and know when, how, and which to use and which not to use.
Interface with other technology teams to extract, transform, and load data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and Redshift.
Interface with business customers to gather requirements.
Model data and metadata to support ad-hoc and pre-built reporting.
Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions.
Recognize and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation.
Tune application and query performance using Unix profiling tools and SQL.
Continually improve ongoing reporting and analysis processes, automating or simplifying self-service support for secondary datasets
Help answer challenging business questions for implementation through technology ultimately delivered to business and operations partners.

Basic Qualifications
Bachelors degree in a quantitative field such as Business, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics or Operations Research.
2+ years experience as a business analyst, data scientist or similar job function
Ability to develop experimental and analytic plans for data modeling processes, use of strong baselines, ability to accurately determine cause and effect relations
Design, implement, and support infrastructure providing secured access to large datasets.
Verbal/written communication & data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams
Preferred Qualifications
Advanced degree in Math, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science or related discipline
Experience with Python, R, or other statistics/machine learning packages
Demonstrated ability to frame complex analytical problems and extract insights that led to tangible business results
High-level knowledge of various machine learning techniques and key parameters that affect their performance

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

Have you ever ordered a product on Amazon and when that box with the smile arrived you wondered how it got to you so fast? Have you wondered where it came from and how much it cost Amazon to deliver it to you? If so, the Amazon Logistics, Last Mile team is for you. We manage the delivery of tens of millions of products every week to Amazon’s customers, achieving on-time delivery in a cost-effective manner.
Amazon seeks a passionate, results-oriented, Business Intelligence Engineer to identify strategic initiatives that will form the next generation of Amazon Logistics. We strive to solve complex cost and cycle time optimization problems that no one has solved yet. Are you up for the challenge and ready to further develop your skills and long-term career? Look no further.

As an Amazon.com Business Intelligence Engineering you will be working in one of the world's largest and most complex data warehouse environments. You should have deep expertise in the design, creation, management, and business use of extremely large datasets. This high impact role will have an opportunity to help design and build our data infrastructure from the ground up, work with emerging technologies such as Redshift, while driving business intelligence solutions end-to-end: business requirements, workflow instrumentation, data modeling, ETL, metadata, reporting, and dashboard development. You should be an expert at designing, implementing, and operating stable, scalable, low cost solutions to flow data from production systems into the data warehouse and into end-user facing applications. You should be able to work with business customers in understanding the business requirements and implementing reporting solutions. The role requires someone who loves data, understands enterprise information systems, and has a strong business sense.

Responsibilities Include
Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, and analyses used to drive key business decisions
Manipulate/mine data from database tables (MySQL, SQL server, Oracle, Data Warehouse, FC log files)
Conduct deep dive investigations into business problems and identify potential opportunities.
Identify and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation.
Continually improve ongoing reporting and analysis processes, automating or simplifying self-service support for customers.
Work with in-house scientists, global supply chain, transportation and logistics teams, and software teams to identify new features and projects.
Identify ways to automate analysis through smarter software systems.
Track realized savings and impacts, and communicate results with senior leaders.
This is an individual contributor role that will partner with internal stakeholders across multiple teams, gathering requirements and delivering complete solutions

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics, or a related technical discipline.
5+ years of experience in data modeling, ETL, data warehousing, and transformation of large scale data sources using SQL, Redshift, Oracle, or other Big Data technologies.
4+ years of demonstrated quantitative and qualitative data science experience with impact to a business, a track record of problem solving using software systems, and the desire to create and maintain data warehouse systems.
Ability to work in a deadline-driven work environment; ability to re-prioritize on a regular basis in order to remain current with business needs.
Ability to influence others in a positive and professional manner.
Preferred Qualifications
Master degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering or Math/Statistics/Finance or related discipline.
Advanced knowledge and expertise with Data modelling skills, Advanced SQL with Oracle, MySQL, and Columnar Databases.
Prior experience with forecasting, budgeting, and variance analysis

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
The BI Analyst will provide company wide strategic, analytical and technical support for business intelligence (BI) activities. The BI analyst acts as an intermediary between the business community and the technical community working with IT project teams and business clients to collect, clarify, and translate business requirements into documentation and conceptual design (using appropriate tools and models) from which BI applications and solutions are developed. The BI analyst is also heavily involved with the distribution and successful delivery of all BI reports.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Partners with stakeholders, process specialists, and users to elicit and document business requirements; translates non-technical requirements into technical business requirements.
Partners with business departmental teams to define and document business requirements for new metrics and reports
Teach, tailor, and assert influence during interactions with business partners and relationship-building.
Elicits requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis.
Designs, develops and maintains reports and analytical tools.
Evaluates alternate solutions and design processes and systems which includes: user impact considerations, cost and benefit analysis and processing specifications.
Uses current knowledge of business and technology to recommend systems and process improvements.
Performs ongoing monitoring and refinement of reports and BI solutions.
Partners with architecture and solution delivery teams to enable BI applications that have long-term value.
Critically evaluates information gathered from multiple sources, reconciles conflicts, abstracts up from low-level information to a general understanding, and works with customers to uncover unmet business needs.
Performs other duties as assigned.


REQUIREMENTS:
Education / Experience:
 Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or equivalent Engineering or Business Degree.
1+ years of experience working in the appropriate business process with a good understanding of the business / systems concepts.
Experience in business process analysis, standardization and optimization.Experience with tools like Lean Manufacturing, TMS, and Six Sigma a plus.
Experience working with the relevant systems (e.g. SAP), experience with project methodology including planning, testing and documentation standards.
Experience providing technical and functional training courses.

Skills:
Strong working knowledge of Business processes and data warehouse lifecycle.
Proven ability to quickly learn new applications, processes, and procedures
Able and willing to collaborate in a team environment and exercise independent judgment and initiative
Professional image with ability to form good partner relationships across functions
Strategic, intellectually curious thinker with focus on outcomes
Ability to work with others in remote (foreign country) locations in different time zones.
Capable of applying a comprehensive requirement elicitation process and track those requirements all the way through the development and testing processes.
Proven skills in Excel / Word / PowerPoint / MS Project.
Technical skills with MS SQL Server, Business Objects, and PowerBI
Ability to establish good business relations at different levels in a virtual organization.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
Additional basic knowledge in one other language German, French or Spanish is preferred in some regions.

Travel:
Ability to travel – on average 25%.

Physical Demands & Work Environment:
Often required to sit and use their hands and fingers, to handle or feel objects.
Occasionally required to stand, walk, reach with arms and hands, climb or balance and to stoop kneel, crouch or crawl.
Vision abilities required include close vision.

The noise level in the work environment is quiet to moderate.

Description

Have you ever ordered a product on Amazon and when that box with the smile arrived, wondered how it got to you so fast? Wondered where it came from and how much it cost Amazon? If so, the Amazon Global Supply Chain Optimization organization is for you.

The Resource Planning team is a product team within Supply Chain Optimization Technologies (SCOT). Recognizing and adopting best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation
