title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Job Description

DESCRIPTION

The Amazon Fashion Private Brand team is looking to innovate across the value chain as we bring apparel, footwear and accessories to market that our customers love and trust. We are looking for an entrepreneurial, analytical and highly motivated business intelligence analyst with a passion to dive into disparate, large-scale data sets, to surface insights that will drive the direction and profitability of our business, as well as create infrastructure solutions for our teams. You will be working with design, brand, instock, sourcing, marketing, traffic and finance teams to develop solutions that drive the business forward. We are one of the priority growth areas of Amazon and offer a unique space that combines analytical and creative talent to transform how fashion is brought to customers. Come join us and create something amazing !

The ideal candidate will have excellent analytical abilities, strong technical skills, outstanding business acumen, intense curiosity and superior verbal/written communications skills. The successful candidate will be a self-starter that is comfortable with ambiguity, strong attention to detail, and an ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment. Experience in Amazon systems and processes will be a key enabler of your success.

We are looking for someone with a track record of data driven root cause analysis (Deep Dive), an ability to innovate (Invent and Simplify), can operate comfortably in a fast paced environment (Bias for Action), and has an ability to work with ambiguity across disparate business and technical teams (Earns Trust).

Responsibilities
Work closely with multiple stakeholders to understand and consolidate disparate issues, complete root cause analysis, and develop standardized solutions that drive informed decision making.
Own the design, development, and maintenance of metrics, reports, analyses, and dashboards to drive and track the performance of key business decisions.
Enabling effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format to inform WBR, MBR, QBR, OP1, OP2 decisions
Automate reporting and analysis tools wherever possible.
Analyze key metrics across all stages of the go to market process to identify opportunities to grow profitability.
Define and drive the adoption of best practice data analysis and reporting across the business.
The ideal candidate will have excellent analytical abilities, strong technical skills, outstanding business acumen, intense curiosity and superior verbal/written communications skills. The successful candidate will be a self-starter that is comfortable with ambiguity, strong attention to detail, and an ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment. Experience in Amazon systems and processes will be a key enabler of your success.

We are looking for someone with a track record of data driven root cause analysis, an ability to innovate, can operate comfortably in a fast paced environment, and has an ability to work with ambiguity across disparate business and technical teams.


Basic Qualifications

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or Economics.
5+ years of relevant work experience in data science, business intelligence, or other big data environments.
Strong proficiency at querying relational databases, eg. Oracle SQL Developer, ETL, Redshift, Vertica, MS SQL.
Proficient in multiple flavors of SQL, (e.g. PostgreSQL, MySQL, Redshift)
Experience in data visualization platforms (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, QuickSight)
Advanced Microsoft Office skills, particularly Excel (VBA) and analytical platforms.
Ability to prioritize multiple concurrent projects while still delivering timely and accurate results
Experience with big data: processing, filtering, and presenting large quantities (millions of rows) of data.
Ability to work effectively with Data Engineers to mine the correct data sources efficiently and accurately
Strong verbal/written communication and data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams.
Genuine curiosity, proven problem solving ability, and passion for data.

Preferred Qualifications

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in predictive modeling and analysis in big data environments.
Experience leading large-scale data warehousing and analytics projects, including using AWS technologies – Redshift, S3, EC2, Data-pipeline and other big data technologies
Experience in advanced machine-learning methodologies (e.g. supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning etc.)
Experience with clustered data processing (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, Map-reduce, Hive)
Experience in one of the modern visualization/reporting tools such as Tableau, QuickSight, etc.
Experience using one or more programming languages (e.g. Python, Java, C++, C#, Ruby)

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

At Amazon we strive to be earth’s most customer centric company and data is a foundational component to making this happen. In this role you will be responsible for navigating this wealth of data and turning it into actionable and insightful information for business partners in order to deliver better products and services to our customers.

Are you curious about new platforms and technologies and have a desire to deliver world-class customer service? Are you excited by the idea of owning a problem and innovating on behalf of customers? Can you deal with ambiguity and keep up with the pace of a company whose cycles are measured in weeks, not years?

Amazon introduced the first Kindle in 2007 — at that time, it offered 90,000 eBooks and sold out 5.5 hours after the announcement. Since then, we have expanded to become the best-selling e-reader family in the world. We have gone beyond Kindle with our powerhouse Fire tablets, built for work and play with our Fire operating system. For streaming media lovers, we have created Amazon Fire TV, Fire TV Stick, and Fire TV Edition with voice search. Fire TV devices come with access to 500,000 movies, TV shows, and tens of thousands of channels, and apps. In 2014, we introduced Amazon Echo and Alexa, the voice service that powers Echo and other devices so customers can play music, control their smart homes, and get information, news, weather, and more using just their voice. Alexa is now integrated with over 20,000 third party devices from 3,500 brands. Alexa has 50,000 skills and developers in 180 countries. Want to know more, join our team!

As a BIE on our Digital, Device and Alexa Support team (D2AS), you will utilize big data technologies such as Redshift and Tableau to develop standardized reporting and analysis that enable leaders to take action on findings and recommendations.

Overall Responsibilities Include
Create and maintain data visualizations that inform and engage business partners on key metrics.
Data mine key performance indicators to discover root causes for customer dissatisfaction.
Conduct trending analysis to identify opportunities, highlight strengths, and provide recommended corrective actions.
Perform complex data analysis in support of ad-hoc reporting requests.
Develop programs, methodologies, and reports for analyzing and presenting data.
Supporting cross-functional teams on day-to-day execution of projects and process improvements.

Basic Qualifications
Degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, engineering, economics or related field
5+ years of direct experience in quantitative research or analyses
Advanced experience with Excel, SQL and Experience with Business Intelligence applications (Cognos, Tableau, Business Objects, Microstrategy).
Excellent communication skills to share findings in an understandable and actionable manner
Proven ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment
Experience with ETL and Data Warehousing
Strong organization skills and ability to multi-task and prioritize work
Preferred Qualifications
Master’s Degree in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science or Mathematics
Experience using Tableau for dashboard creation
Experience with Amazon Redshift or other distributed computing technology.
Broad knowledge of basic statistics and statistical interpretation of quantitative data
Scripting skills to perform data manipulation (e.g., Python)
Experience leading and mentoring a team
Working with remote teams

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
About Amazon Music

DESCRIPTION

Imagine being a part of an agile team where your ideas have the potential to reach millions. Picture working on cutting-edge consumer-facing products, where every single team member is a critical voice in the decision-making process. Envision being able to leverage the resources of a Fortune-500 company within the atmosphere of a start-up. Welcome to Amazon Music, where ideas are born and come to life as Amazon Music Unlimited, Prime Music, and so much more.

Everyone on our team has a meaningful impact on product features, new directions in music streaming, and customer engagement. Come join us as we make history by launching exciting new products and feature in the coming year. Our team is focused on building a personalized, curated, and seamless music experience. We want to help our customers discover up-and-coming artists, while also having access to their favorite established musicians. We build systems that are distributed on a large scale, spanning our music apps, web player, and voice-forward audio engagement on mobile and Amazon Echo devices, powered by Alexa to support our customer base. Amazon Music offerings are available in countries around the world, and our applications support our mission of delivering music to customers in new and exciting ways that enhance their day-to-day lives.
Come innovate with the Amazon Music team!

About The Role

Love data? Love music? The Amazon Music team is looking for a brilliant, creative, and passionate Business Intelligence professional to join our Data, Insights, Science and Optimization (DISCO) team.

Our ideal candidate has a combination of strong technical skills, superb analytical capabilities, outstanding business insight, and excellent verbal and written communication skills. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to work with one of the largest and most complex data warehouses in the world to gather insights using data from across Amazon. You will work closely with the product, growth, marketing, content, and engineering teams to solve unique problems and find answers to questions that require tenacious problem solving and creativity.

Data-driven decision making is at the core of Amazon’s culture, and your work will have a direct impact on decision making and strategy for the Amazon Music Team.

Key Responsibilities
Collaborate with product, growth, engineering, marketing, and finance teams to understand their business objectives
Design and execute descriptive and inferential analyses to inform these business objectives while balancing the speed and depth of insights
Support product and growth experimentation by leading experiment design and interpretation of results
Develop and maintain Tableau dashboards and visualizations to inform critical business decisions at various levels of Amazon Music
Proactively develop new metrics and studies to quantify customer behavior contributing to product and marketing strategy
Partner with Data Engineering team to enhance data infrastructure, data availability, and broad access to customer insights

Basic Qualifications
BS degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Finance, Econometrics, or other quantitative field
3+ years of professional experience in business intelligence, analytics, data science or comparable fields
Highly skilled at querying relational databases (SQL) and ability to pull data from various sources
Proficiency with at least one analytics languages such as R, Python
In-depth experience with web analytics tools and analyzing online customer behavior
Strong critical thinking skills and attention to detail
Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Must be able to explain technical concepts and analysis implications clearly to a wide audience, including senior executives, and be able to translate business objectives into actionable analyses
Passionate about understanding customers and their behavior
Preferred Qualifications
Masters or PhD in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Operations Research, or other quantitative field
Proven experience in BI/DW as a change leader providing strategic research, recommendations, and implementation in both business and technical roles
Experience with relational database design and architecture
Music industry experience
A passion for music!
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.


Company - Amazon.com Services LLC
Job ID: A997470

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

Who we are
The EC2 Customer Success Engineering Team (CSET) protects and improves the customer experience with Compute Services, keeping our customers happy and on our services. We act as the nexus of EC2 service teams. We identify and common customer pain points across services and tackle them. We raise the bar on internal practices and alleviate operational bottlenecks that hinder forward movement on making proactive improvements for customers.

“Nothing is beyond our reach”

We operate by the slogan that “nothing is beyond our reach”. We think big. We sometimes find ourselves asking “how in in the world is there no tool or solution for this?”, or “how have we managed to operate like this for so long?”. Our response in these moments, is “well, let’s fix it”. If the idea of pioneering solutions to unsolved problems from the ground up in uncharted territory sounds exciting to you, come join us!

EC2 produces an outrageous amount of complex data. Our data is modularized across teams but still interconnected. Without a deep understanding of the EC2 data landscape, it can be near impossible to figure out what metrics mean, where to find what, and how to join data across domains. Everyone in AWS uses data every day in some form or fashion, but it isn't always easy when you aren't a data expert and are also juggling keeping the internet running smoothly and delivering awesome new features for customers.

Our organization is seeking the leadership of a confident business intelligence engineer to catalyze a new generation of more efficient data consumption. You will lead our team in eliminating operational bottlenecks caused by data inapproachability, making deeper understanding of our services feasible for all those who seek it. You will be the subject matter expert on the EC2 data landscape. You will work with engineers and data scientists to help answer some of our toughest questions about our services and customers.

Here are some qualities that will make you enjoy and be successful in this role:

You dislike Excel and the idea of making yet another dry spreadsheet report makes your skin crawl. You are looking for a job with a technically challenging edge. Excel can’t handle the amount of data you will work with. You will rely almost entirely on python and in database operations. Tableau and Quicksight dashboards will take work to make performant. Unless optimized, your queries may actually run for forever.

You learn quickly and are good at figuring things out. You have enough technical acumen to be able to understand and model complex systems in unfamiliar domains. You appreciate the challenge of deriving insight from an engineer detailing technology in jargon that mostly go above your head.

You have a ‘can do’ attitude and a helpful spirit. You genuinely really enjoy making dashboards, fact tables, and writing queries. Getting pulled into adhoc BI requests doesn’t irritate you, but rather excites you. You enjoy getting occasionally interrupted by people dropping by your desk seeking your unique expertise. You have a passion for enabling self-service analytics and automation and strive for the day you are no longer pinged for adhoc help.

Within CSET You Will

Roles and responsibilities:
Build optimized, interactive dashboards to reduce effort and time required to obtain commonly needed business metrics
Create fact tables designed to allow for low latency adhoc analytics and load from production consumers
Assist data engineers build a data lake from which to perform analytics against
Own any team resources such as Redshift clusters or production dashboards
Document databases and metric learnings from service teams
Assist data scientists with data consolidation needed for research
Within The Compute Services Organization You Will
Act as the BI resource for our organization. Advise teams on database/table design best practices
Work with service teams to determine how to blend metrics to model systems and answer business questions

Basic Qualifications
Bachelors degree in applied mathematics, software engineering, statistics or other relevant quantitive discipline
3+ years experience with Redshift and experience or familiarity with AWS solutions such as EC2, DynamoDB, S3, and Redshift Spectrum, and Glue
Advanced competency with business intelligence tools including Quicksight and Tableau
2+ years of professional experience working with hundreds of terabytes of data
3+ years development experience in python or similar scripting language for automation
Expert-level skills in writing and optimizing SQL.
Preferred Qualifications
2+ years of professional experience working with hundreds of terabytes of data
Experience with common python data manipulation and visualization libraries
Experience or familiarity with Kinesis, IOT analytics, Sagemaker, and AWS Lake Formation

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

Amazon is seeking a detail-oriented, enthusiastic, and determined Business Intelligence Engineer with a strong desire to join Amazon's Leave and Accommodation Team. The team supports the leave, disability, accommodation, and support for life events for employees within Amazon. The role will support the continued growth and success of the program, particularly focusing on the data integrity, business intelligence, metrics, automation and enabling self-service to provide program guidance on design, improvement, and outcomes. She/he will help champion the customer (employee/manager/HR) experience by building out models to support analyses and reporting on key customer experience metrics.

We are looking for an outstanding Business Intelligence Engineer who is passionate about data-driven decision making, uncompromisingly detail oriented, self-starter, smart, efficient, and driven to help our business succeed. The candidate must love working with analytic tools and write excellent SQL queries. The candidate will be an individual contributor who is comfortable with ambiguity and able to successfully drive business intelligence projects to completion. The ability to understand business goals and use available data to create metrics measuring the success of the business against its goals is essential.

Responsibilities Include
Work with business and engineering users throughout the HR services organization to determine the metrics, reports, and analyses needed to manage and act on the business
Design, architect, implement, and support key datasets that provide structured and timely access to actionable business information with the needs of the end customer always in view
Retrieve and analyze data using SQL, Excel, and other data management systems Evaluate and implement process and system improvement opportunities
Develop queries for ad hoc requests and projects, as well as ongoing reporting
Monitor existing metrics, analyze data, and partner with other internal teams (engineering, technical and operations) to identify and implement process and system improvements
Partner with customers to answer key business questions


Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related technical field from an accredited institution, and 2+ years of relevant employment experience
Advanced SQL writing and experience in data mining (SQL, ETL, data warehouse, etc.) and using databases in a business environment with complex datasets
2+ years of developing end-to-end Business Intelligence solutions: data modeling, ETL and reporting
Preferred Qualifications
Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Statistics or related discipline
Proven analytical and quantitative ability and a passion for enabling customers to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses
Strong verbal and written communication skills, including an ability to effectively lead and influence interactions with both business and technical teams
Experience with AWS technologies, Tableau

Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

title: Business Intelligence Specialist
description:
The Enterprise Data Analytics team at ICW Group is looking for a Business Intelligence Specialist to support the analysis and design of effective reporting solutions for use in decision support systems such as an Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW), ODS data marts and various vendor solutions. In this role, you will work with business leaders to provide quantitative and qualitative data analysis and reporting of patterns, insights, and business trends. This position will complete analysis of various data sources and structures in support of Business and IT teams in order to complete the structure and financial goals of the Company.

PURPOSE OF THE JOB

The purpose of this job is to work closely with business leaders and provide quantitative and qualitative data analysis and reporting of patterns, insights, and business trends. This position will complete analysis of various data sources and structures in support of Business and IT teams in order to complete the structure and financial goals of the Company.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

Collects and aggregates data from multiple internal and external sources for analyses to drive insights into business performance
Aggregates large, complex data sets from multiple databases and creates insight reports.
Transforms unstructured or ambiguous data into structured and usable data sets that can be analyzed to extract insights and improve business processes.
Collaborates with appropriate parties within the organization to integrate new data sources into our existing data infrastructure.
Delivers complex and actionable reports that show key performance indicators, identify areas of improvement into current operations, and display root cause analysis of problems.

Provides quantitative and qualitative data analysis of patterns, insights, and trends to decision-makers
Collaborates in cross-functional teams to implement analytical solutions.
Ensures data quality, adherence to departmental guidelines, profitability, business impact, and other risk-related metrics for self and members of the team.
Analyzes current business processes; makes recommendations to management for new, more efficient, workflows, and processes.
Uses and presents analytics and metrics to improve processes and provide data-driven forecasts of potential costs, risks, and profits of new business initiatives.

Provides reporting solutions and responds to report requests across multiple business areas and for complex enterprise wide projects
Collaborates with team members and leaders across the organization to identify and understand business problems and processes.
Enhances and develops analytical and reporting solutions to solve business problems and extract insights.
Enhances and supports enterprise-wide strategies, processes, and standards for business intelligence and reporting.
Delivers complex functional specifications and system design specifications for assigned projects.

Performs as a subject matter expert for the department
Trains staff on project deliverables and acts as a resource for colleagues in the department to answer questions and solve complex problems.
Conceptualizes and proposes reporting solutions to business leaders throughout the organization.
Provide training materials, documentation, and suggestions to Enterprise Data Analytics leadership staff concerning data analysis and reporting.
Ensures data quality, adherence to departmental guidelines, profitability, business impact, and other risk-related metrics for self and members of the team.
Develops functional specifications and reporting design specifications for assigned projects.
Uses and presents analytics and metrics to improve processes and provides data-driven forecasts of potential costs, risks, and profits of business initiatives.


Supervisory Responsibilities

This role does not have supervisory responsibilities.

Education And Experience

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Math, Economics, or Computer Science and 5+ years’ technical experience in analytics, data science, actuarial or equivalent quantitative field or Master’s degree in similar quantitative field required. 5+ years’ experience with SQL and SAP Business Objects BI tools (Webi, Crystal, Explorer, Dashboards, etc.) required. 3+ years experience programming in R and/or Python strongly preferred.

CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS

None required.

Knowledge And Skills

Demonstrated experience with data visualization tools, such as Tableau, is preferred. Strong analytical and problem solving skills. Ability and willingness to continuously acquire new knowledge (business domain knowledge, expertise with software, etc.). Ability to communicate effectively, especially in a cross-functional team setting. Ability to effectively present analysis to ICW staff and external audiences. Knowledge of statistical modeling and machine learning techniques preferred but not required. Familiarity with business operations in the property casualty insurance industry is preferred, but not required.

Physical Requirements

Office environment - no specific or unusual physical or environmental demands and employees are regularly required to sit, walk, stand, talk, and hear.

COMPETENCIES

This position maps to the Individual Contributor level. Additional competencies required: None.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

This position operates in an office environment and requires the frequent use of a computer, telephone, copier, and other standard office equipment.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Business Intelligence Analyst
Requisition ID:112451BR

When you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and you’ll be supported in achieving your career goals.

The Business Intelligence Analyst will support the business intelligence strategy and related initiatives that deliver a comprehensive, actionable data reporting and analysis for commercial, functional and business leadership to evaluate key performance metrics and correlate current and future actions aimed to enable self-management, increased selling time, and improve the customer experience. Experience with data Science and predictive analytics
Master’s degree in an analytical or information technology (IT) field (finance, engineering, computer sciences, data management, or similar).

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

Amazon Registry Services Inc. (“ARSI”) is a unique, greenfield opportunity at Amazon. We aim to fundamentally change the fabric of the Internet by re-imagining how generic Top Level Domains (gTLDs) are used as the core of an individual or organization’s internet presence or identity. We are currently focused on .BOT - building a community for developers, end-users, and devices that use voice and text-based chatbots. We are looking for a self-starter to work fast and help establish our data environment and help develop out unique ways of gathering and deploying data in AI environments. The ideal candidate is a highly analytical problem solver, extremely detail oriented, customer obsessed, and business savvy.

As our Business Intelligence Engineer you will roll up your sleeves and get hands on to deal with the challenges faced by a start-up opportunity within Amazon. As the subject matter expert, you will be the go to person for advice on the data and analytics needs for the business. You will design and build a scalable, predictive, and prescriptive analytics platform with a focus on the best ways to ingest, track and use data to fuel our growth. You will work closely with the ARSI marketing, product, finance, and engineering teams to accomplish this goal.

The ideal candidate is highly curious, enjoys data visualization, modeling and problem solving with large data sets, as well as having a keen interest in data science and AI. You are a strong collaborator and communicator, known for being right a lot and highly productive. You enjoy deep diving into data analysis, identifying root causes, and designing long-term solutions. You understand the importance of automation to achieve scale and have a track record of influencing at all levels.

Specific Responsibilities Include
Work with business customers, gathering requirements and delivering complete BI solutions.
Partner with product managers, marketing, and finance to write queries that improve our reporting capability, create metrics dashboards, and conduct deep dives.
Work with other technology teams to extract, transform, and load data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL (Redshift) and ability to use a major programming and scripting languages to process data for modeling
Lead customer and marketing utilization research projects to better understand how our customers are using our product.
Recognize and adopt standard methodologies in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation.
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format.
Measure user experience metrics and build conversion funnel. Propose and implement projects to improve these metrics and help to drive customer experience enhancement projects.
Communicate with various teams and external partners, raise technical and managerial issues at the right time and resolve conflicts.

Basic Qualifications
Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools
Bachelor's Degree
3+ years of experience as an analyst or engineer in the data/BI space
Experience with SQL
Bachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics, engineering, finance or other equivalent quantitative discipline
3+ years of relevant work experience in analytics as a data scientist, data engineer, business intelligence engineer, or equivalent
1+ years of relevant work experience in developing and performing statistical analysis for consumer-facing machine learning-based
Demonstrated development and application of predictive statistical procedures in languages such as R, SAS, SPS
Experience data mining, data modeling and transformation of large scale data sources using SQL, ETL, Hadoop, Spark, Hive, EMR, or other Big Data technologies
Knowledge of scripting for automation (e.g. Python, Perl, Ruby) and data manipulation
Knowledge and direct experience using business intelligence reporting/visualization tools (OBIEE, Business Objects, Cognos, Tableau, MicroStrategy, SSAS Cubes, etc.)
Experience communicating analytical outcomes through written and verbal communication
Intermediate to expert knowledge of Excel
Experience working cross-functionally, building and maintaining trust with internal stakeholders
Preferred Qualifications
3+ years of experience in consumer-facing software
Graduate degree in quantitative field, such as computer science, business, mathematics, statistics, economics, or finance
Advanced knowledge of Oracle BI tools, MySQL, Linux/UNIX
Experience with AWS solutions such as EC2, DynamoDB, S3, and Redshift
Strong active listener with solid written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work across teams, building and maintaining trust with internal partners

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

The Team: How often have you had an opportunity to be a member of a team that is tasked with solving customer needs through disruptive and innovative technology? Everyone on the team needs to be entrepreneurial, wear many hats and work in a fast-paced, ambiguous, and highly collaborative environment that’s more startup than big company. If this sounds intriguing, then we’d like to talk to you about a role on the Amazon Go team.

The Role

As a Senior Business Intelligence Engineer for Amazon GO , We are looking for high caliber talents to bring in innovation and simplicity to the space. There are no textbook solutions to the problems we are solving and very few attempts have been made to solve at Amazon's scale, which necessitates deeply analytical thinking to solve problems. To succeed in this role, you will be comfortable diving deep and making data driven decisions. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, highly analytical, and intensely detailed with a strong customer focus and perspective to drive strategy in a high-growth, fast-paced environment.

The ideal candidate is a motivated self-starter that can work independently in a fast paced, ambiguous environment with limited supervision. You must be a fast learner who can quickly absorb the nuances of Amazon's varied pricing programs and processes. You need to be analytical in your decision making, with a demonstrated ability to drive issues to completion.

Amazon is one of the world’s most trusted companies and known for its low prices. Help us keep it that way.

Role Expectations
Design, develop and maintain scaled, automated, user-friendly systems, reports, dashboards, etc. that will support our business needs.
Partner with operations/business teams/economist/ML teams to consult, develop and implement KPI’s, automated reporting/process solutions and data infrastructure improvements to meet business needs.
Apply your deep analytic and business intelligence skill to extract meaningful insight and learning from large and complicated data sets.
Serve as liaison between the Business and technical teams to achieve the goal of providing actionable insights into current business performance, and ad hoc investigations into future improvements or innovations. This will require data gathering and manipulation, synthesis and modeling, problem solving, and communication of insights and recommendations.

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
7+ Years of Data Warehouse Experience with Redshift, EMR, Spark etc.
7+ Years experience with SQL, data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing.
7+ years experience in maintaining data warehouse systems and working on large scale data transformation using AWS technologies, such as S3 and Redshift
4+ years of coding experience in at least one modern programming language (Python, Ruby, Scala, Java, etc.)
Ability to self-direct, multitask, and prioritize a constantly evolving workload.
4+ years of relevant work experience in a role requiring application of analytic skills to integrate data into operational planning/business planning or advanced degree
Advanced skills in Excel as well as any data visualization tools like Tableau or similar BI tools (familiarity with Tableau and Quicksight preferred)
Advanced ability to draw insights from data and clearly communicate them (verbal/written) to the stakeholders and senior management as required.
Be self-driven, and show ability to deliver on ambiguous projects with incomplete or dirty data.
An ability and interest in working in a fast-paced and rapidly-changing environment
Preferred Qualifications
Experience in designing and delivering cross functional custom reporting solutions.
Experience with an enterprise class BI tool like Micro Strategy, Business Objects, Tableau, Oracle Business Intelligence and familiarity with new BI tools like Domo, Looker or Superset
Excellent oral and written communication skills including the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Proven ability to meet tight deadlines, multi-task, and prioritize workload
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical individuals.
Track record for being detail-oriented with a demonstrated ability to self-motivate and follow-through on projects
A desire to work in a collaborative, intellectually curious environment.
Experience in writing and tuning SQL scripts
Experience working in very large data warehouse environments
Experience conducting large scale data analysis to support business decision making

Company - Amazon.com Services LLC
Job ID: A1046246

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Company Description
Paying the right way, getting paid what you’re worth — it’s complicated, and it matters. Compensation used to be a dark art. Not anymore. PayScale helps employers and their employees understand the right pay for every position and effectively communicate about compensation.
PayScale pioneered the use of crowd-sourced compensation data and unique matching algorithms to power the world’s most advanced compensation platform and continues to be the compensation market leader, featured in G2 Crowd's 100 Best Software Companies for 2018, based on user reviews.
We foster a working environment that generates new ideas, promotes ownership and experimentation and encourages highly motivated individuals to be truly creative. Are you forward-thinking, tenacious, and inventive? If so, PayScale may be the perfect place for you to grow your career!

Job Description
The Role:
If you are motivated by turning large quantities of data into value for customers. If you want to drive decision making at all levels of the company with data insights and visualizations. We are looking for a self-motivated Business Intelligence Analyst who will work with cross function teams across all parts of our organization to determine business requirements, establish priorities, define key performance indicators (KPI), uncover business rules, deliver insights, and create visual dashboards for the company. You will be part of the team rolling out Tableau, including supporting users in how to use Tableau as well as defining standards and best practices. As a data driven company, our data is our lifeblood, and we want someone to join us who shares this passion.

What you'll do:
A successful candidate has outstanding business insight, a restlessness to answer "why?" questions, and are passionate about using data to drive decision making. We want someone focused on the science of decision making. You have a passion for data visualization, and are a champion for standard methodologies among the company. You have a curiosity around data, and are not afraid to dive in and find the answers. You are comfortable working with small and large data sets, and working with a data warehouse.
This role will also include some administration and support for Tableau.

Qualifications
What you'll need:
A bachelor's degree with significant course work in a quantitative field, such as economics, statistics econometrics, physical sciences, or applied mathematics.
2-5 years of relevant work experience.
Strong BI tools (Tableau) & data manipulation skills.
Solid experience with SQL, especially with a data warehouse.
An obsession with cleaning, structuring and analyzing data.
Continually improve ongoing reporting and analysis processes, while automating or simplifying self-service support and access to authoritative data sets.
Excellent problem solving, critical thinking and communication skills.
Attention to detail with a good sense of organization and time management.
Experience answering complex questions quantitatively.
Able to work independently in a dynamic fast-paced environment.

Additional Information
PayScale provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. PayScale complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

Benefits We Offer:
Unlimited Paid Time Off policy
100% company paid medical/vision/dental/prescription premiums for employees (50% for eligible dependents and partners)
Four Flexible Spending Account (FSA) options for pre-tax employee allocations towards:
Medical
Dependent Care (can be used towards day care costs!)
Parking
Transit
Long Term Disability, Short Term Disability, and Company-paid Life Insurance
Maternity and Paternity Leave
10 paid holidays
Summer office closure, week of July 4th
401k with company match, vests immediately

Perks:
Casual dress code (JSS - Jeans, shorts, and sandals welcome)
Onsite lockers, showers, and clothes dryer
Bike storage
Coworkers you actually like...
Gender neutral bathrooms on most floors
Mothers' Room
Sitting-Standing ergo friendly desks
Weekly company sponsored happy hours
Fido Fridays (our canine colleagues join us on Fridays. WOOF!)

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

Since 1995, Amazon has focused on being “the world’s most customer centric company.” Our customers are worldwide, and include not just consumers, but also our suppliers. World-class retail brands and individual sellers increase their sales and reach new customers by leveraging the power of the Amazon e-commerce platform. To meet our vendor and sellers’ needs, our smart, diverse, customer-obsessed employees are constantly innovating and building on new ideas.

The Dangerous Goods team is looking for a senior business intelligence engineer. This person will work with product and risk managers, business owners, and software teams, providing analytic technologies, conducting complex data analysis, and drawing insight from large and complex sets of data. You will independently develop and drive risk models that influence project development and prioritization. You will build and maintain data models that accurately measure the short and long term impact of dangerous goods at Amazon, including, surfacing areas of opportunity and risk, and measuring the projects and programs aimed at driving the right business results in those areas.

The ideal candidate will have excellent analytical abilities, outstanding business acumen and judgment, intense curiosity, strong technical skills, and superior written and verbal communication skills. This person will have a strong bias toward data driven decision making. The candidate will be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, able to think big and be creative (while paying careful attention to detail), and will enjoy working in a fast-paced dynamic environment.

The Scope For This Role Includes The Following
Analysis of historical data to identify trends and insights.
Building prediction and risk models, including recommendations for incentives to drive supplier behavior.
Collaborate with finance and product and risk management as a leader of quantitative analysis for Dangerous Goods.
Collaborating with engineers to implement the design of the data architecture.
Identifying data needs and driving data quality improvement projects. Supporting ad-hoc data analysis requests.
Proficiency with SQL queries to retrieve and analyze data. Learn and understand a broad range of Amazon’s data resources and know how, when, and which to use.
Manage and execute entire projects or components of large projects from start to finish including project management, data gathering and manipulation, synthesis and modeling, problem solving, and communication of insights and recommendations.
Participate in periodic reviews with senior leaders at Amazon.
Think creatively: Amazon is a place that is permanently pushing the boundaries of the industry. We are not looking for someone that will just estimate models and write analyses. We want someone that will extract insights and provide business recommendations.
Generate Impact: We want someone obsessed with impact. We don’t want someone that is just interested in finding patterns in the data. We want someone that understands how to turn those discoveries into value for our customers and regulators.

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree or advanced degree in Math, Computer Science, Finance, Statistics or related discipline
5+ years of professional experience in business analytics at scale
5+ years of professional experience with ETL, Data Modeling, and Business Intelligence architecture.
Experience operating, and working with very large databases and datasets.
Proficiency in SQL and performance optimization.
Experience solving complex quantitative business challenges.
Verbal/written communication & data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with and influence both business and technical teams.
Capable of investigating, familiarizing and mastering new data sets quickly
Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills.
Ability to display complex quantitative data in a simple, intuitive format and to present findings in a clear and concise manner

Preferred Qualifications

Master’s/Ph.D/MBA degree.
Experience in data mining (SQL, ETL, data warehouse, etc.) and using databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets.
Working knowledge of SAS or R
Experience with Tableau or other BI tools
Experience relying heavily on data and analysis in driving decision making.
Ability to juggle multiple priorities and make things happen in a fast-paced, dynamic environment; strong bias for action.
Knowledge of accounting, financial, operational, and marketing principles.

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer - Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation/Age

description:
About AWS

DESCRIPTION

For more than 11 years, Amazon Web Services (“AWS”) has been the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. AWS offers over 100 fully featured services to millions of active customers around the world—including the fastest-growing startups, largest enterprises, and leading government agencies—to power their infrastructure.

The Analytics team is a small, central group in the AWS Support & Managed Services organisation. The Analytics team is responsible for pushing our Product, Process and Customer understanding and insight beyond the here and now to create value for the long-term. The team is responsible for coming up with hypotheses, uncovering key insights and developing a point of view on actions across the portfolio of our products and services.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills to articulate complex analytical requirements and findings to a broader audience

Preferred Qualifications

Druva Cloud Platform is built on AWS and offered as-a-Service; delivering globally accessible, infinitely scalable and completely autonomous enterprise data resiliency. title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

The Brand Program is a strategic initiative to improve the customer shopping experience for brands selling direct on Amazon. One of the goals of the Brand Program is to ensure that 3P Brands achieve the same customer experience as Amazon Retail. The Brand Program gives Brands access to unique benefits and tools to help them grow their business and a great CX at scale, without the manual intervention traditionally provided by Retail. As Brands become an ever-larger part of the customer experience on Amazon, our challenge is to develop scalable mechanisms to ensure that Brands offer low prices, sell their whole assortment, stay in stock, and participate in Prime.
To succeed in this vision, we need to deeply understand the data that drives Brands’ behavior, quantify the impact of our initiatives to inform the roadmap, and develop analytical tools to help Brands succeed.
This position requires excellent statistical and analytical abilities, deep knowledge of business intelligence solutions and data engineering practices, and proven ability to collaborate across teams. The ideal candidate exhibits strong ownership, a passion for the details, and the ability to identify and clearly communicate insights. We’re looking for someone who is curious, tenacious and excited to do big things.
As a BIE on the Brand Program team, you will be expected to:
Work with extremely large datasets and manipulate/mine data from database tables (Redshift)
Create automated metrics using complex databases
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
Automate reporting with a combination of SQL, Excel, and BI tools like Tableau
Develop new metrics to track our business and uncover previously unforeseen trends
Manage and execute entire projects or components of large projects from start to finish including project management, data gathering and manipulation, synthesis and modeling, problem solving, and communication of insights and recommendations
Seek opportunities to inject advanced analytical techniques into our evaluation of Brand’s CX performance
Support the development of targeted recommendations for Brands

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Engineering or a related field
3+ years of professional experience in analytics, business analysis or comparable consumer analytics position
Experience with statistical analysis, regression modeling and forecasting, time series analysis, data mining, financial analysis, and demand modeling
Experience in Statistical Software such as R, SAS, SPSS, MINITAB
Proficiency with Tableau and Microsoft Excel to include making charts, data manipulation, pivot tables, creating macros, and visual basic knowledge
Excellent communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills and an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams
Experience using one or more Python, VBA, MATLAB, Java, C++ programming languages
Experience processing, filtering, and presenting large quantities (100K to Millions of rows) of data
Proven problem-solving skills, project management skills, attention to detail, and exceptional organizational skills
Ability to deal with ambiguity and competing objectives in a fast-paced environment.
Preferred Qualifications
Masters degree Business, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or related field.
5+ years of relevant experience in a business analyst/data analyst/statistical analysis role.
Understanding of data warehousing, data modeling concept and building new DW tables
Experience with predictive modeling

description:

BA/BS in Computer Science, Information Technology, Management Information Systems is preferable. Equivalent combination of education, training, and experience will be considered.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
If you have what it takes to become part of the Vistra Energy family and would like to start a promising career with a global leader, take a look at the exciting employment opportunities that are currently available and apply online.

Overview

Job Description

The Business Intelligence team provides transactional, operational and financial insight to management by analyzing trends in sales, gains, losses and other performance metrics and by focusing on strategic and operational performance optimization. The team is also responsible for providing analytics support for the Ambit consultant sales network. The dynamic conditions associated with the deregulated electricity and gas markets across the country require a flexible marketing platform and a cutting-edge business analytics and finance function to maintain sustainable competitive advantages. It is a fast-growth, constantly evolving business that requires effective and efficient management.

Responsibilities
Deliver key operational and financial insights by uncovering root causes for trends in sales, gains and losses by type, channel, campaign, product and over time.
Analyze financial impact of trends and opportunities leveraging business metrics of success and risk such as NPV, PV/I, dollars at risk, etc. to develop financially justifiable recommendations. Partner with Pricing and Performance Management teams to build and further improve relevant business cases. Perform sensitivity analyses for key assumptions and market scenarios, as necessary.
Provide deep-dive analytical support for consultant sales channel, including campaign performance measurement as well as network performance metrics. Focus on enrollment performance optimization by analyzing current processes.
Provide reporting and deep-dive analytical support for treatment of customers approaching term expirations, including campaign and test performance measurement and channel-level driver performance to provide actionable insights.
Utilize Visualization tools such as Tableau in both reporting and analysis, as applicable.
Develop / deliver executive-level views/ presentations to communicate storylines and lead regular management discussions on strategies, tactics, and performance.
Actively participate in cross-functional team activities, offering original perspectives and challenging conventional views.
Requirements
Bachelors with 5+ years of relevant industry experience or Masters in business, analytics, engineering, economics, statistics or other quantitative field from a Top Tier Program with 2+ years of relevant industry experience
Experience in a consulting and/ or market/ financial / business analysis role
Excellent business, financial and analytical acumen
2+ years of experience in extracting, cleaning and analyzing data using SAS / SQL, macros, pivot tables, statistical functions and other large data analysis tools
Very strong Microsoft Excel analysis and modeling skills
2+ years of experience is using data visualization tools like Tableau
Working knowledge of key financial, accounting and business metrics (e.g. NPV, PV/I, ROI)
Strong analytical skills with a working knowledge of statistics
Experience in a customer-focused role and building relationships with key internal customers
Excellent inter-personal and communication skills and a strong team player
Energy industry experience within a competitive/deregulated market is a plus
Bring strong technical skill set – SAS / SQL / Python / Tableau / Excel
Very high level of initiative in terms of learning the business and designing valuable processes / analyses
On-time production of analyses and results of the highest integrity and quality
Development of clear, concise, and effective executive level reporting and presentations
Making sure procedures adhere to regulatory requirements
Job Family

Marketing

Company

TXU Retail Services Company

Locations

Irving, Texas

Texas

We are a company of people committed to: Exceeding Customer Expectations, Great People, Teamwork, Competitive Spirit and Effective Communication. If this describes you, then you will have a good career here!

If you currently work for Vistra Energy, TXU or Luminant please apply via the internal career site.

description:

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Business Intelligence Analyst
 About Beyond Finance
Beyond Finance is an exciting next generation Financial Services company with offices in Beverly MA, Chicago IL and Houston TX. We provide financial products that are simple and transparent that aim to improve people’s lives. As the consumer debt market continues to grow in the United States; we made it our objective to create a transparent and fair debt management services that are customized to the consumers’ individual circumstances.
Our Leadership team is comprised of individuals who have extensive experience and expertise in the financial services and debt management spheres. We are reinventing the market by investing in innovative technologies to better identify and target the market segment. At the same time, extensive market research also enables us to customize our products to better service our clients. Our workforce is a community made up of celebrated, diverse backgrounds working towards the common objective of developing something transformational for the debt settlement industry.
 About Accredited Debt Relief
Accredited Debt Relief is a well-established and rapidly growing FinTech/Debt Relief company planted its roots in San Diego more than 10 years ago and has recently expanded into Houston, TX. We provide Debt Relief Services that are simple and transparent that aim to improve people’s lives. We believe in providing a creative and innovated workspace that fosters a strong company culture and room for advancement. Our workforce is a community made up of celebrated, diverse backgrounds working towards the common objective of developing something transformational for the debt settlement industry. Because of this we have been voted as one of the "Best Places to Work" in San Diego for 2017, 2018, 2019.

About The Role
We are seeking Individuals who are creative, independent thinkers who are intellectually curious and have a passion for using data and technical skills to resolve key business issues and provide insight and direction to the operation.
The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for building and creating reporting and analytics to solve key business problems. This role will have a specific focus on reporting the health of various parts of the business operation. This will include the development of metrics, dashboards, and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) using various databases and reporting tools. The BI Analyst will partner closely with the operational business units to design, standardize, and produce scalable and useful reporting.

What You’ll Do
Actively participate in and influence discussions around reporting requirements, infrastructure needs and design.
Bring structure to ambiguous business problems and recommend visualization solutions that can be easily interpreted by users.
Design and build queries, reports and dashboards using business intelligence tools adhering to established frameworks and standards.
Consistently deliver high-quality business intelligence solutions and services to clients on schedule.
Serve as end user support for the organizational user base.
Provide subject matter expertise for multiple projects concurrently through all phases of the development lifecycle.
Exercise flexibility in handling multiple tasks in a fast paced FinTech/Start-up environment
Work with internal teams to deliver standard and ad hoc reports to meet the needs of the business.
Assist with other team initiatives and projects such as business process improvement and strategic initiatives.

What We Look For
Intellectually curious
Passion for solving problems using data and analytics
Experience using analytical software tools to analyze data
Exceptional problem-solving skills
Ability to summarize analysis into actionable recommendations
Desire to work in a highly collaborative fast-paced environment

Nice to haves:
Bachelor’s degree in an Analytical field – such as Economics, Statistics, Math, or Computer Science
Experience with business intelligence tools and data visualization concepts such as Cognos, Tableau, QlikView and PowerBI.
Experience with Call Center, Marketing, Finance, or Agent Performance Analytics
Experience with relational structures, structured query language (SQL), data warehouse and reporting techniques.
Experience retrieving and analyzing data from the following platforms: Salesforce, Velocify, or Five9

Why Join Us?
We are looking for great people to join a fast-paced, growing, and innovative business. We offer:
Health, dental and vision insurance
FSA programs for healthcare and dependent care
Personal Time Off day (PTO)
401(K) match
Merit advancement opportunities
Career development & training
Great company culture and casual work environment

Accredited Debt Relief and Beyond Finance are an equal opportunity employer.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Why consider AORN, Association of periOperative Registered Nurses, as the next place for your career as our Business Intelligence Analyst? Because we’re innovative and all about quality and collaboration - we’re continually seeking to enhance our offerings to allow us to better tailor to the needs of our nurse members while expanding our market position and growing revenue across our business and sales divisions.

Our mission is to promote safety and optimal outcomes for patients undergoing operative and other invasive procedures by providing practice support and professional development opportunities to perioperative nurses. We collaborate with professional and regulatory organizations, industry leaders, and other health care partners who support our mission. Our culture is one of openness, teamwork, risk taking and being at the cutting edge of our field and we only look for folks who hold those same traits.

Our Business Intelligence Analyst will serve AORN’s Business-to-Consumer (B2C) and Business-to-Business (B2B) market segments, transforming data into actionable insights for business leaders, sales, and marketing teams. You’ll need demonstrated knowledge of analyzing data and using that analysis to drive key insights and recommendations. You’ll get to conduct data analysis, help design and implement analytics programs, generate reports, and provide recommendations to drive business value and growth. Our Business Intelligence Analyst also plays an integral role in providing customer and market insights through secondary research and voice of customer initiatives. You’ll collaborate with stakeholders on measuring key metrics and discovering new ways in which the company can leverage data to expand market position and grow revenue. Leveraging data analytics, visualization, and modeling techniques, a passion for helping teams tell a more powerful story using data to drive improved decision-making and support organizational growth initiatives is needed for success in the role.

AORN is based in Denver, CO. You’ll primarily be based out of our headquarters in Denver and get to work remotely 1 day/week after onboarding and getting up to speed.

More about what you’ll get to do as our Business Intelligence Analyst
Create Tableau dashboards for standardized, automated reporting of key indicators and trends for B2C and B2B product lines; provide training to users of all levels as needed
Manage month-end dashboard updates for various product lines across multiple database systems; provide analysis and recommendations to stakeholders based on key indicators and trends
Develop customer profiling and predictive modeling solutions to enhance ROI for segments and business lines; Coordinate inputs from a range of businesses to build the forecasting and predictive analytics function
Collaborate with teams to develop consistent, repeatable methodologies, and processes to forecast product / customer sales, market share, and other KPIs
Enable high quality, objective decisions by identifying and advising on key business challenges for the organization through the development and application of insightful business and competitive analysis
Support the voice of customer and competitive intelligence efforts through primary and secondary research; Maintain knowledge of various customer and industry trends; provide recommendations accordingly
Support organizational planning with cross-functional teams to interpret market trends and forecasts and facilitate action-planning in the organization; key contributor on special projects for AORN’s strategic plan
Provide analysis and insights to key stakeholders to identify new opportunities and drive decision-making
Provide sales and marketing teams with segmented customer lists from various database systems as needed
Support internal data governance efforts by helping internal teams identify and resolve data anomalies
Must Have’s to be our Business Intelligence Analyst
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics/Finance or equivalent
3+ years of experience in business intelligence or analytics
Exceptional knowledge of Tableau
Experience in extracting data/reports from Salesforce
Experience working with and extracting information from database applications; experience with SQL queries for data analysis
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel (including pivot tables, look-up formulas) and PowerPoint
Experience with Google Analytics, preferred
Exceptional analytical, critical-thinking, and problem-solving abilities
Strong attention to detail; highly accurate and thorough in all tasks
Aptitude for working with large data sets across multiple systems; able to translate and articulate complex data problems and recommendations to business leaders
Outstanding presentation and interpersonal skills; ability to interact effectively with senior level management in formal and informal presentation settings

Hiring Company Description

AORN was recently recognized as a Great Place to Work by Becker's Hospital Review. AORN offers a progressive, friendly work environment as well as a competitive compensation & benefits package, which includes one month of paid time off and 10 holidays; health, dental, life & AD&D insurance; a 401(k) with matching contribution that is immediately vested.

Who We Are

Our mission is to promote safety and optimal outcomes for patients undergoing operative and other invasive procedures by providing practice support and professional development opportunities to perioperative nurses.

What Its Like To Work Here

We're small enough to know everyone by name, but large enough to make a difference.

AORN's diverse employee population includes all four generations. We employ a variety of professions in support of our mission, from nurses to sales and marketing, IT, creative design, and accounting and finance professionals. We are ambitious, entrepreneurial and fast-moving. Professional development, growth opportunities and work/life balance are supported and encouraged.

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

Amazon product pages are at the core of global e-commerce. Millions of customers visit our product pages every day to browse, evaluate, and purchase products ranging from groceries to refrigerators, generating petabytes of data. Our mission is to unleash this trove of data to create the world’s best buying experience for each customer for each shopping mission. To this end, we are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Business Intelligence Engineer to join the Analytics arm of the Buying Experience team to own how customers use the page and to make actionable recommendations to improve the experience.
The Team: The Buying Experience Analytics team provides transparency and insights into the customer experience on Amazon’s product pages to drive incremental business value. We achieve this by: 1) analyzing customer behavior on the product page to inform product roadmaps; 2) delivering robust, clean datasets that integrate with ML-solutions to optimize page content; and 3) tracking business levers and results to review with leadership and key stakeholders.
The Role: As the subject matter expert on product page engagement, you will own the definitive dataset to analyze the page. You will develop a framework to understand the levers that drive a successful page visit and build automated reporting with actionable insights for stakeholders to improve page performance. You will deliver in-depth analysis and recommendations to drive new feature and experience development, generating incremental business value. You will partner with the broader Consumer Experience Org Analytics community to extend the dataset both horizontally with other page-specific datasets, such as Gateway, and vertically with feature datasets, such as FMA. As the chief evangelist, you will drive adoption of your dataset and mental model across the Consumer organization.

Amazon.com is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation


Basic Qualifications
3+ years in relevant experience as data scientist, data engineer, software engineer, business intelligence engineer, or equivalent.
Experience using AWS technologies such as Redshift, S3, EC2, EMR and data pipelines
Proficiency with data querying or modeling technique with SQL
Proficiency with a scripting language (Java, Python, or R)
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Computer Information Systems, Engineering, Operations Research, Mathematics or other business/analytical disciplines or equivalent experience
A desire to work in a collaborative, intellectually curious environment.
Preferred Qualifications
5+ years in relevant experience as data scientist, data engineer, software engineer, business intelligence engineer, or equivalent.
Strong fundamentals in problem-solving, algorithm design and complexity analysis.Masters
Experience in data mining, SQL, ETL, etc. and using databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets.
Master’s degree in BI, Finance, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Finance or related field required.

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

Are you interested in engineering the metrics model that drives continuous improvement for Amazon’s global delivery operations? Do you have a solid analytical thinking, metrics driven decision making and want to solve problems with solutions that will meet the growing worldwide need? Then Sort Tech is the team for you. We are part of building the world's fastest, most reliable, and lowest cost transportation network that provides customers the most control and are looking for a top notch Business Intelligence Engineer.

As an Amazon Business Intelligence Engineer you will be working in one of the world's largest and most complex data warehouse environments. You should have deep expertise in the design, creation, management, and business use of extremely large datasets. You should have excellent business and communication skills to be able to work with business owners to develop and define key business questions, and to build data sets that answer those questions. You should be expert at designing, implementing, and operating stable, scalable, low cost solutions to flow data from production systems into the data warehouse and into end-user facing applications. You should be able to work with business customers in understanding the business requirements and implementing reporting solutions. Above all you should be passionate about bringing large datasets together to answer business questions and drive change.

Key Responsibilities
Design automated solutions for recurrent reporting (daily/weekly/monthly).
Design automated processes for in-depth analysis databases.
Design automated data control processes.
Collaborate with the software development teams to build the designed solutions.
Learn, publish, analyze and improve management information dashboards, operational business metrics decks and key performance indicators.
Improve tools, processes, scale existing solutions, create new solutions as required based on stakeholder needs.
Participate in annual budgeting and forecasting efforts.
Perform monthly variance analysis and identify risks & opportunities. Internal job description Loop competencies

Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Business Analytics, Information Systems or related field.
Experience with high-volume OLTP & OLAP database systems.
Advanced knowledge of SQL and ETL processes.
Recent experience applying visualization tools such as Cognos, PowerBI and Tableau.
Expert Data Analysis skills.
Proven ability in understanding business processes, logical data models and relational database implementations.
Proven track record of working on complex modular projects, and assuming a leading role in such projects.
Highly motivated, self-driven, capable of defining own design and test scenarios.
An ability and interest in working in a fast-paced and rapidly-changing environment.
An excellent work ethic based on a strong desire to exceed expectations. Excellent interpersonal skills, including written and oral communication skills.
Preferred Qualifications
Master’s Degree in Computer Science or related field.
Experience leading cross-functional projects with business and technical teams.
Experience with AWS services (Redshift, S3, EC2, Lambda, SNS/SQS, RDS, Aurora) preferred.
Experience with forecasting and statistical analysis High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously.
Experience with Microsoft BI technologies, e.g. SQL Server, SSIS, SSRS.
Experience with at least one scripting language, i.e. Python, C#, Java etc..

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

Do you want a unique, exciting opportunity to help build something from the ground up? We are looking for builders who are passionate about data science to join the Marketing Science team within Amazon Advertising.

Amazon is investing heavily in building a world class advertising business, and we are responsible for defining and delivering a collection of advertising products that drive discovery and sales. Our products are strategically important to our Retail and Marketplace businesses driving long term growth. We deliver billions of ad impressions and millions of clicks daily and are breaking fresh ground to create world-class products. We are highly motivated, collaborative and fun-loving with an entrepreneurial spirit and bias for action. With a broad mandate to experiment and innovate, we are growing at an unprecedented rate with a seemingly endless range of new opportunities.

As a successful business intelligence engineer on the Amazon Advertising team, you need to understand performance advertising domain knowledge and the meanings of data. You will expose and measure current Amazon Advertising performance. You will identify specific and actionable opportunities to solve existing business problems, and collaborate with engineering, research, and business teams for future innovation. 3+ years of experience as an analyst or engineer in the data/BI space
Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

DESCRIPTION

At Amazon, we're always working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. We are looking for a dynamic, organized, and customer-focused Business Intelligence Engineer (BIE) who is interested in guiding key business decisions for one of Amazon’s key business verticals, Kindle Content. We need your passion, innovative ideas, and creativity to help us continue to deliver on our ambitious goals.

The BIE will be a key member of the Kindle Content Non Fiction team, which is working to evolve the way we look at the Kindle business. The BIE will coordinate with Kindle content Analytics teams and interact with economists, ML scientists, business analysts and business intelligence engineers. This role will report into the Nonfiction arm of the Kindle Content, and is based in Seattle, WA.

This role requires an individual with excellent analytical abilities, knowledge of business intelligence solutions, as well as outstanding business acumen and the ability to work with quantitative and business teams. The successful candidate will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, an ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment, and driven by a desire to innovate in this space.

The BIE will demonstrate high judgement and business experience, be able to identify and recommend data-driven solutions and collaborate with other analytics and business team members to define the optimal marketing metrics and reporting and take ownership to drive delivery. You will have a passion to dive deep, a high level of customer focus and a track record in process improvement. The analyst will have technical skills, project management skills and the ability to multi-task and thrive in an energizing environment.

Key Responsibilities
Design, architect, implement, and support key datasets that provide structured and timely access to actionable business information with the needs of the end customer always in view.Retrieve and analyze data using SQL, Excel, and other data management systems.
Continuously evaluate and implement process and system improvement opportunities.
