title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

The Amazon Operations Finance team is looking for an analytical and technically skilled business analyst to join our team. This position will be responsible for developing metrics and reporting, conversion strategy analysis, and budgeting/costing functions for the group, including working with technical teams, legal, finance, and technical account managers to drive process improvement and track progress against goals.

As a Business Intelligence Engineer with operations finance, you will help identify opportunities and implement solutions to improve Operations and Finance facing systems and tools. You will be responsible for modeling complex/abstract problems and discovering insights through the use of statistical, data mining and visualization techniques. Further, you will help automate processes by developing deep-dive tools, UIs, metrics, and dashboards to communicate these insights in real time to the business teams. Successful members of this team collaborate effectively with internal end-users, cross-functional software development teams, and technical support/sustaining engineering teams to solve problems, and implement new solutions.

The complexity of research and skills for this role is well beyond basic data entry and research. It involves complex analysis and diving deep into key metrics based on requests, building and maintaining multiple databases, knowledge of software applications to create tools, and understanding of multiple programming languages.

The following provides some detail of the job duties and responsibilities.
Use analytical and statistical rigor to solve complex problems and drive business decisions.
Manipulate/mine data from database tables (ex. Redshift, MySQL, Oracle) using SQL.
Manipulate/mine data from log files by writing scripts (ex. PERL, Python, UNIX)
Develop analytical tools: deep-dive tools, UIs, metrics, and dashboards
Perform deep-dives and root cause analysis to answer business questions
Effectively communicate (written and verbal) solutions and methodologies to senior leadership
Work with engineering teams to enable the appropriate capture and storage of data.

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Math, Finance, Statistics or related discipline
3+ years of professional experience in web analytics, business analysis or comparable analytics position.
Experience in designing and implementing custom reporting systems by managing or guiding technical teams.
Experience with MS Excel, Access and SQL/SAS
Preferred Qualifications
Experience in the development of pricing analysis
MBA is preferred
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation/Age


Company - Amazon.com Services LLC
Job ID: A1027347

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

Amazon’s Automated Inventory Management (AIM) team is looking for a Business Intelligence Engineer (BIE) with broad analytics and modeling experience to join a team that's developing state of the art technology to understand and measure the shopping experience of every Amazon customer. The charter of the Supply Chain Optimization Technology (SCOT) group is to deliver the best possible customer experience while maximizing the return on our inventory investment, fulfillment assets, and transportation network in terms of long term free cash flow. We are never satisfied with the status quo and are convinced that there is always opportunity to innovate on behalf of customers.

Unlike brick and mortar stores where it is challenging to capture customer interest in a product unless they actually purchase the item, e-commerce offers the unique advantage of capturing customer "glance views" even if they don't convert to sales. Glance views, or GVs, are a leading indicator of potential future demand and allow us to capture a comprehensive set of data points (eg. price, delivery speed) to understand what we showed the customer and the resultant customer behavior. Amazon uses GV datasets to metricize key performance indicators for customer experience like promised delivery speed and availability. As teams across Amazon innovate to present new shopping experiences to customers via the Amazon website or mobile shopping apps, our legacy GV logging systems are reaching the limit of their capabilities. We see a huge opportunity to rethink how we capture high fidelity data to understand customer experience and make this data available to teams across Amazon in a way that's easy to consume. As a BIE on the AIM team, you will need to understand what information is valuable to our internal customers and then work closely with the software development teams to design data models that are easy for end users to interpret and provide all data points necessary to extract comprehensive business insights. Given the scale at which Amazon operates, these systems will generate thousands of records per second. We will rely on your expertise to test and validate data at scale, set up mechanisms to catch data quality issues before they impact our customers, and build prototypes to generate business insights.

You will always be challenged to think several steps ahead so that the solutions we are building today will scale well with future growth and without adding excessive operational overhead. You will need to develop deep technical and business understanding of existing system (owned by us as well as other teams across Amazon) as you will responsible for identifying synergies and minimizing investment in redundant features. You will work with supply chain operations teams, in-house scientists, other BI Engineers, and software teams to identify enhancement opportunities and new features for our data products. In partnership with our Product Managers, you will analyze potential customer and financial impacts, identify the most promising ideas, and create a cohesive roadmap that makes the best use of available resources. You will also evangelize new features to our internal customers, working to accelerate feature adoption, track the realized impacts, and communicate results.

This is a highly visible role and will require regular interaction and communication with senior leaders. You must have experience and capability to document your work for technical as well as non-technical audiences. Successful candidates should excel at diving into data in order to analyze problems and implement simple, long term solutions. You will have the opportunity to thrive in a highly collaborative, creative, analytical, and fast-paced environment oriented around building the world’s most flexible and effective supply chain management technology.

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation


Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent training/experience in Economics, Statistics, Machine Learning, Data Science, Mathematics, or a related field
3+ years experience in business intelligence engineering, statistics, or similar
Experience writing and optimizing advanced SQL queries to work with complex/large datasets
Proficient in visualizing data through tools like Tableau and MS Excel
Track record of effective data mining/report building
Experience in supply chain or knowledge of basic supply chain concepts
Proven analytical/problem solving skills and attention to detail, including the ability to recognize non-obvious patterns/predictors, with the ability to propose insightful hypotheses
Preferred Qualifications
Master's or higher degree in an analytical area such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering
6+ years experience in business intelligence engineering, statistics, or similar
Experience working in a corporate environment and evidence of positive impact on real world business decision making using statistical, machine learning, or other types of modeling techniques
Experience working closely with product managers and software engineers developing large scale data products
Clear examples of demonstrated analytical skill in prediction, data validation, and optimization problems
Experience working in or with a complex international supply chain management organization
Hands-on experience with PostgreSQL, Spark SQL, and AWS services like Redshift, SageMaker, EMR, and QuickSight
Proficiency in programming/scripting languages like R and Python
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal

Company - Amazon.com Services LLC
Job ID: A1023320

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Are you excited to use data to unlock actionable, high-value business insights? Do you love working collaboratively with teammates to identify the most critical opportunities and challenges facing a business in pursuit of growth? Are you passionate about helping people achieve their financial goals? Then you may be the Business Intelligence Analyst we’re looking for!

Our purpose at The Motley Fool is "To Make the World Smarter, Happier, and Richer", and on the Motley Fool Money Management team, we get to help pursue that goal in a very direct way, when our clients give us their money and we invest it on their behalf. As a BI analyst, you’ll be embedded in the Money Management team, building reports and answering questions that enable us to provide more people with better investing solutions. This role is best suited for a strategic thinker with the ability to understand our business and our marketing, product, and retention strategy, provide clear analysis, and leverage technical aptitude to create effective insights, analysis, and reporting.

You Might Be a Good Fit If You
Obsess over optimization: Whether it’s finding the bottlenecks in our marketing funnel, or identifying clusters of customers at risk of leaving us, you feel energized by spotting problem patterns, and finding creative ways to solve them.
Are curious and love to learn: Do you thrive when you are learning something new every day? Good! Because we’ll need you to understand our business and customers, and demonstrate the curiosity to uncover the stories buried in the data. We're looking for someone with a proven ability to craft concise, actionable analyses and reports that will help drive smart decisions in different business areas and audience segments.
Measure twice and cut once: You’ll be in a role with access to sensitive customer data, and part of the job will include ad hoc reporting and data updates as required by the business. You understand the impacts modifying data can have, and you taking the appropriate care and precautions when doing so are already second nature to you.
Collaborate and communicate effectively: We’ll be counting on you to identify opportunities and inform data-driven decisions, which means not just answering questions, but being able to present the story behind the data in a compelling way.
Think like a scientist: Whether you have a formal background in data science or just love to experiment, we're looking for someone who can transform data sets into clear, compelling analyses that unlock creative hypotheses and high-impact breakthroughs in our retention and marketing initiatives.

Technical Skills
Intermediate to advanced SQL and Excel skills required
Expertise with one or more data visualization tools (Cluvio, Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Experience with marketing analytics tools preferred (Google Analytics, HubSpot, etc.)
Background in marketing/retention analysis and multivariate testing is preferred
Prior wealth management experience is a huge BONUS!

What You’ll Be Working On
Take our data analysis and insights capability to the next level by working with tech to ensure the data is accessible, auditing existing visualization dashboards, and working with stakeholders to recommend and create new reporting.
Work with our marketing team on all aspects of campaign execution and funnel reporting, sharing insights and making recommendations for improvements.
Work with our Client Acquisition, Client Relationship, and Client Service teams to identify appropriate metrics that drive our business decisions and show us our pacing to growth goals.
Power our retention efforts with analysis and insights on our client retention metrics and trends, as well as analysis to identify clients at risk.
Dive deep into our client response data, website usage data, account transaction data, and recommend additional data sources, to uncover and define growth, retention, and optimization opportunities.
Perform data operations on application databases to keep systems running smoothly
Provide at-a-glance analysis of variances of actual results versus forecasted targets.

Sound like you? Then let's chat more!

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Business Intelligence Analyst Opportunity

Accelerate your career growth with this compelling opportunity to join us in delivering our future, developing interactive and insightful data visualizations for our clients!

You are an inquisitive and resourceful BI Analyst or Reporting Analyst with a passion for turning data into insight. A keen eye for structure, detail and design and a passion for data integrity, user interface optimization and digital aesthetics will be central to your success in this role.

In addition to UI design experience, you love telling stories with data. You not only know the right questions to ask, you know how to dig deep for the rich and insightful stories that data can tell.

Your career has been focused on BI and Reporting with 3+ years in a role developing data visualizations in tools like Domo, PowerBI, Tableau or Qlik.

While experience with healthcare data is not required, it will set you apart as a candidate. Experience writing moderately complex SQL queries will also set you apart.

You have a Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science or another related field of study with an analysis focus or equivalent experience.

Your Core Focus Will Be

As ClarisHealth’s new Business Intelligence Analyst you will be designing and developing embedded visualizations in our software product, Pareo, as we expand our use of Domo to deliver new and exciting analytics and visualizations to our customers.
Research and develop a thorough understanding of our customer’s data sets and operational nuances
Planning, organizing and executing customer interviews and workshops to determine functional needs
Using gathered requirements, develop suite of data visualizations using the Domo platform
Collaborate with internal development teams and external Domo support to ensure back-end technical requirements are met to accomplish the desired UI outcome
Create documentation and training materials for internal and external use
Train end users on the use of reports and provide support as needed
Perform ongoing maintenance, updates and optimization of existing reports

You care about accuracy and efficiency. You also care about user experience and aesthetics. You’ve always enjoyed making something easier to do. You value the impact of automation and you thrive on the insights gained from your efforts.

Although you are perfectly happy with your head down, digging through complex data sets, you are comfortable communicating with all levels of an organization and enjoy meeting with clients in order to determine their needs and provide solutions. You appreciate and leverage the capabilities and ideas of others and you enjoy working effectively with those of diverse styles, abilities and motivations.

You are looking for an opportunity to be the first! You are excited to use your BI/Data Visualization knowledge and skills to forge new developments and insights as we implement the Domo platform and bring on an exciting new analytical component to our product and services. You want to be truly supported with access to training and career development activities that will help you develop new knowledge and skills that may or may not be in your current career track.

So you are interested in contributing your talents to a growing and innovative company while learning from a team of industry experts and strong developers? You have a few years of great experience and are ready to accelerate your career growth while helping to build something new and impactful?

Given our size and rapid growth, those that want to grow their career can grow with us and gain exposure to our entire operation.

Through collaboration, trust, transparent knowledge sharing and a deliberate approach to communication through technology, we believe you will find a foundation here to grow beyond your current expectations.

Contribute Your Valued Perspective at a Rapidly Growing, Continuously Innovating Organization that Offers a Fun, Supportive Environment and a Foundation to Grow Your Career

Apply Today!

Reasons To Apply
Collaborative “Got Your Back” Company Culture

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Business Intelligence Analyst

Who We Are:

We are Crown & Caliber. We started Crown & Caliber because we saw a real lack of transparency in the pre-owned watch market. A luxury watch is not a small investment, and we treat each transaction with the care it deserves. Buying or selling a watch online shouldn’t be a scary thing, so we’re bringing trust back into the equation by being honest about our pricing, letting you in on our processes, and delivering the best experience possible.
The Basics
We are hiring a Business Intelligence Analyst that will utilize company data to drive insights and efficiencies company-wide using Domo and other data platforms. The successful candidate must be self-motivated and resourceful and will need strong business and data knowledge in order to strategically create the best ways to use, audit, maintain, and report on our data. Day-to-day tasks include setting up new reporting, auditing existing dashboards and data sets, and setting up new dashboards.
Responsibilities (50%) Maintain and create data sets, metrics, and dashboards in Domo
Create and maintain documentation for each data set and dashboard so that users can understand and use the data without having to ask for clarification
Update current dashboards, integrating any data changes that may impact reporting
Design data sets so that they are easy to use and easily integrate with data warehouse
Respond to tickets submitted through Zendesk for new reporting or reporting changes
Manage reports that are emailed or viewed through URL to ensure data remains up-to-date and links/emails stay relevant
On-board and train Domo users
Communicate to all Domo users when changes occur
Assist in maintaining clean and well documented data warehouse
Develop a deep understanding of key data sources: SugarCRM, Google Analytics, Kissmetrics, and Hubspot
Develop and maintain reports needed for key meetings: weekly manager meetings, investor meetings, quarterly reporting, etc.
(25%) Drive new insights from data
Select a department or portion of data to analyze each week and drive additional insights from what is currently displayed on dashboards
Present key-findings to stakeholders and communicate recommended action plan, if applicable
Determine how to use data for exception based-management and reporting
Discover ways to utilize resources more efficiently by using data

(15%) Assist in designing new data fields and data architecture for new data sources
Work with the Product Manager of SugarCRM to ensure new/updated fields are pulling over correctly
Speak into the necessary design of new fields/modules so that the data is easily reportable
Work closely with Data Scientist to design data sets ready for predictive analysis

(10%) Audit data being pulled into Domo to ensure that the data matches the original source
Select a portion of data and dashboards to audit each week so that all data sets and cards are audited monthly
Set up exception based reporting so that any data changes that impact reporting are caught right away


Requirements
2+ years of experience as a business analyst or other related role
Highly attentive to detail, inquisitive, and self-motivated
Experience with business intelligence tools such as Domo or Tableau
Deep understanding of relational databases, data manipulation, Excel, and SQL
Ability to tell stories with data
Strong verbal and written communication at all levels within the organization
Strong organizational and interpersonal skills

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Thank you for your interest in a career at Regions. At Regions, we believe associates deserve more than just a job. We believe in offering performance-driven individuals a place where they can build a career --- a place to expect more opportunities. If you are focused on results, dedicated to quality, strength and integrity, and possess the drive to succeed, then we are your employer of choice.

Regions is dedicated to taking appropriate steps to safeguard and protect private and personally identifiable information you submit. The information that you submit will be collected and reviewed by associates, consultants, and vendors of Regions in order to evaluate your qualifications and experience for job opportunities and will not be used for marketing purposes, sold, or shared outside of Regions unless required by law. Such information will be stored for a set period of time. You may review, modify, or update your information by visiting and logging into the careers section of the system.

Job Description

At Regions, the Business Intelligence Analyst drives business decisions by providing quantitative and qualitative data analysis and reporting of patterns, insights, and trends to decision makers. This position applies data mining techniques and conducts statistical analysis to report key findings in order to improve processes and provide data-driven forecasts of potential costs, risks, and profits of new business initiatives.

Primary Responsibilities
Collects, aggregates, and analyzes data from multiple internal and external sources to drive insights into business performance
Produces actionable reports that show key performance indicators, identify areas of improvement into current operations, and display root cause analysis of problems
Enhances data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems
Communicates complex findings and insights to stakeholders and provides business strategy recommendations for optimizing business performance
Provides reporting solutions and responds to ad-hoc report requests
Educates and/or trains business partners on operational use of reporting solutions
Participates in the design and development of business intelligence reporting tools
Acts as an enterprise data liaison for assigned business unit
This position is exempt from timekeeping requirements under the Fair Labor Standards Act and is not eligible for overtime pay.

Requirements
Bachelor's degree with six (6) years of relevant experience within the financial services industry
Preferences
Experience with application of statistical skills such as distributions, statistical testing, and regression analysis
Experience with data visualization tools such as Excel, Tableau, and QlikView
Experience with relational databases such as SQL and Oracle
Experience with query development, scripting, and programming skills such as Excel Power Pivot and Dax

Skills & Competencies
Strong listening, problem solving, and analytical skills
Ability to clearly articulate complex concepts, features, and benefits of analyses to any audience
3-5 years’ experience exploring, analyzing and extracting complex data using SAS Enterprise Guide.
1-2 years’ experience developing compelling, dynamic reporting using Microsoft Power BI.
Superior candidates will also possess experience conducting data analysis using Python and associated data analysis libraries (i.e. Pandas, NumPy, etc.).
Candidates should possess the ability to conduct business systems analysis and prepare business requirement specifications with respect to data related business processes.
Self-starter with ability to successfully plan, organize, and execute assigned initiatives with minimal guidance and direction.
Strong interpersonal skills with ability to build and leverage relationships across technical and operational environments.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Position Type
Full timeLocation DetailsLakeshore Ops CenterLocation:Birmingham, Alabama
EEO/AA/Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans

title: Business Intelligence Specialist
description:
Who is Georgia-Pacific?Watch to find out!

The Analytics and Insights Group operates as an analytics COE and is responsible for supporting the current and developing needs of Sourcing and Procurement Organization by developing data visualizations, intelligent process automation solutions, custom web applications, geospatial analytics and data science applications to turn raw data into actionable insights.  The Business Intelligence Specialist will be responsible for supporting the strategic design, development and maintenance of business intelligence applications.  The candidate will serve as a BI subject matter expertise for other Analytics and Insights members and business customers.  The ideal candidate has experience working with large data sets in a variety of enterprise business intelligence applications including Qlik Sense and Tableau with both a technical and business functional skill set.  

A Day In The Life Typically Includes:  


Acts as the day-to-day, business owner of our existing business intelligence applications built on platforms such as Qlik Sense and Tableau.


Identify and develop innovative tools for enhanced analysis or data presentation to improve decision making and performance within the organization.


Responsible for working with all levels throughout the organization in order to gather and document the organizational BI needs.


Responsible for translating high-level and detailed business requirements into concrete BI solutions that address all facets of the organizational business intelligence needs.


Responsible for delivering self-service tools and training to maximize organizational self-service and self-sufficiency.


Understands business needs and translates them into functional requirements.  Works alongside IT support to translate functional requirements into technical designs when required. 


Develops and maintains detailed documentation of the BI solutions to ensure effective development, maintenance and support.


Proactively communicates new and innovative ideas, solutions, etc. to help advance the organization.  Educates and trains team members on new technologies and BI trends.


Create adhoc queries to provide information requested by business users as needed.


Demonstrate the skills and knowledge to establish and manage timelines, project priorities and handle multiple/concurrent projects. Maintain a sense of accountability and responsibility.


Demonstrates high degree of professionalism in communication, attitude and teamwork with customers, peers and management.  
What You Will Need:

Basic Qualifications:


1+ years of experience utilizing SQL to navigate large enterprise data stores


1+years of experience developing in business intelligence tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Qlik Sense.


Previous experience with front-end design and Visualization best practices 
What Will Put You Ahead?

Preferred Qualifications: 


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Analytics or Statistical area.


Working knowledge of installation, configuration, administration, security approaches, performance tuning/optimization and process scheduling of Qlik and Tableau.


Experience with relational databases and ETL tools and techniques.


1+ years of experience working with enterprise data stores, data lakes, external data sources, APIs and data modelling concepts.


Experience in intelligent automation solutions, custom web applications and advanced analytics applications


Experience working with offshore teams across the globe.


Experience working in an analytics COE or an analytics consulting role.


Advanced skills in SQL.


Basic skills in python, R, Java, or other coding language


Experience with AWS big data technology solutions including S3, Redshift/ Spectrum and more.
 

Want to learn more about Georgia-Pacific?  

This role is not eligible for visa sponsorship.

Salary and benefits commensurate with experience.
Equal Opportunity Employer.
Except where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test.

This employer uses E-Verify. Please visit the following website for additional information: www.kochcareers.com/doc/Everify.pdf

Follow us

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

Amazon's North America Sort Center ACES (NASC ACES) team is looking for an experienced and motivated Business Intelligence Engineer with outstanding leadership skills, proven ability to develop, enhance, automate, and manage transportation network models using strong quantitative skills. The successful candidate will have strong data mining and modeling skills and is comfortable facilitating ideation and working from concept through to execution.
The position will partner and drive operational excellence with Finance, Engineering, Operations, Technology, and upstream and downstream partners to design and develop data infrastructure and visualizations that move the business forward through better informed decisions even in the absence of clear guidelines. This role will also build tools and support structures needed to analyze data, dive deep into data to determine root cause of operational issues or challenges, drive process improvements, problem solving, build KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) and metrics, un-earth opportunities and present findings and recommendations to business partners and management.

A qualified candidate must have demonstrated ability to manage medium to large-scale engineering solutions and tools that have ground-up impact on our systems and at the same time adaptable to the fast changing environment. In addition leverage statistical knowledge to explain business questions and drive growth, possess strong written and verbal communication skills, strong focus on internal customers and professional demeanor and high intellectual curiosity with ability to learn new concepts/frameworks, algorithms and technology rapidly as changes arise.

Additional Responsibilities May Include
Manipulating/mining data from databases ( SQL Server, Redshift, Oracle DW)
Create automated metrics, reports and dashboards using complex databases, data warehouses and web application technologies
Partner with operations/business teams to consult, develop and implement KPI’s, automated reporting/process solutions and data infrastructure improvements to meet business needs
Apply your deep analytic and business intelligence skill to extract meaningful insight and learning from large and complicated data sets
Collaborate with BI/Data Engineer teams and drive the collection of new data, data manipulation, synthesis and modeling, problem solving and the refinement of existing data sources to continually improve data quality and communication of insights and recommendations
Providing analytical network support to improve quality and standard work results
Root cause research to identify process breakdowns within departments and providing data through use of various skill sets to find solutions to breakdown
Foster culture of continuous engineering improvement through mentoring, feedback, and metrics

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Statistics, Finance, Logistics/Transportation or related industry experience
4+ years of relevant work experience in a role requiring application of analytic skills to integrate data into operational planning/business planning or advanced degree
Able to write SQL scripts for analysis and reporting (Redshift, Oracle, MySQL)
Experience using one or more Python, Java, C++, VBA, Matlab with scripting in PERL, Python, UNIX, VBScript.
Proficiency in any data visualizations such as Tableau, Quick sight, R Shiny and advanced skills in in Microsoft Excel etc
Preferred Qualifications
Master’s degree or higher in Engineering, Math, Finance, Statistics, Computer Science, or other technical field from an accredited university
Familiarity with the processes used in Amazon fulfillment network and supply chain operations
Experience with statistical analysis, regression modeling and forecasting, time series analysis, data mining, financial analysis, and demand modeling
Familiarity with AWS RedShift and other distributed computing technologies preferred.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. The role requires effective communication with colleagues from computer science, operations research and business backgrounds.
Experience with Amazon Quality operations and/or Standard Work
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age


Company - Amazon.com Services LLC
Job ID: A1055572

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

Shipping & Delivery Support (SDS) is a Customer Service organization enabling Amazon to become Earth’s most customer-centric transportation provider by supporting multiple customer segments including drivers, recipients, shippers, property managers, global sellers, and storage owners across a rapidly growing portfolio of logistics products and services. We leverage technology including automation, self-service, associate tools, and machine learning to resolve customer issues proactively, and when contacts are required, handle them with quality and efficiency.

As a Business Intelligence Engineer, you will work closely with other BI Engineers, Data Engineers, Product and Program Managers to generate actionable insights that guide operational excellence and product development for emerging transportation products and services, innovating on behalf of our customers. Data analysis is at the core of Amazon’s culture, and your work will have a direct impact on decision making and strategy for our team. You will be gathering customer insights, mining data, making recommendations, and helping senior leaders make key business decisions. You will have the opportunity to work with one of the largest and most complex data warehouses in the world to gather insights using data from across Amazon. Your efforts will help change the way customers receive packages, and will help to solve logistical challenges at Amazon scale.

This role requires a customer obsessed individual with excellent statistical and analytical abilities, deep knowledge of business intelligence solutions, and an outstanding business acumen. You are a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, possess a strong attention to detail, and an ability to work in a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment. You have a strong bias towards data-driven decision making, and are excited by the prospect of collaborating with internal and external teams to define and implement solutions that will yield benefits to Amazon customers around the world.

Responsibilities
Apply data mining, quantitative analysis, and statistical models to understand how our customers interact with us and identify ways to improve the customer experience and meet our goals
Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing performance metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions
Build scalable solutions and self-serve platforms that will provide insights to inform business decision making
Acquire various data sources to enable holistic analysis at a global level
Build various data visualizations to tell the story and let the data speak for itself
Recognize and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation
Proactively developing new metrics and studies to quantify customer behavior and reduce defects
Conduct written and verbal presentations to share insights and recommendations to audiences of varying levels of technical sophistication

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in finance, engineering, economics, statistics, applied mathematics, data science or equivalent experience
3+ years of relevant professional experience in business intelligence, analytics, statistics, data engineering, data science or related field
Expertise with SQL and relational database systems
Experience in designing and building data infrastructure/automated reporting tools (Tableau)
Proven track record of being able to learn, develop, innovate, and implement new technologies.
Inquisitive mindset, with proven problem solving ability, and a passion for big data
Strong critical thinking skills and attention to detail
Experience in designing and building data infrastructure / automated reporting tools
Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Must be able to explain technical concepts and analysis clearly to a diverse audience, including senior executives, and be able to translate business objectives into actionable analyses
Passionate about understanding customers and their behavior
Preferred Qualifications
Advanced degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Math, or other quantitative field.
Experience coding with scripting languages (R or Python) for data manipulation, statistical analysis, and automation.
Familiarity with AWS solutions such as EC2, DynamoDB, S3, and Redshift.
Experience using visualization packages and scripting languages to automate reporting
Experience in designing and analyzing A/B tests

Company - Amazon.com Services LLC
Job ID: A1054023

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

The Team: How often have you had an opportunity to be a member of a team that is tasked with solving customer needs through disruptive and innovative technology? Everyone on the team needs to be entrepreneurial, wear many hats and work in a fast-paced, ambiguous, and highly collaborative environment that’s more startup than big company. If this sounds intriguing, then we’d like to talk to you about a role on the Amazon Go team.

The Role

As a Business Intelligence Engineer for Amazon GO we are looking for a leader to bring in innovation and simplicity to the space. There are no textbook solutions to the problems we are solving and very few attempts have been made to solve at Amazon's scale, which necessitates deeply analytical thinking to solve problems. To succeed in this role, you will be comfortable diving deep and making data driven decisions. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, highly analytical, and intensely detailed with a strong customer focus and perspective to drive strategy in a high-growth, fast-paced environment.

The ideal candidate is a motivated self-starter that can work independently in a fast paced, ambiguous environment with limited supervision. You must be a fast learner who can quickly absorb the nuances of Amazon's varied pricing programs and processes. You need to be analytical in your decision making, with a demonstrated ability to drive issues to completion.

Amazon is one of the world’s most trusted companies and known for its low prices. Help us keep it that way.

Role Expectations
Design, develop and maintain scaled, automated, user-friendly systems, reports, dashboards, etc. that will support our business needs.
Partner with operations/business teams/economist/ML teams to consult, develop and implement KPI’s, automated reporting/process solutions and data infrastructure improvements to meet business needs.
Apply your deep analytic and business intelligence skill to extract meaningful insight and learning from large and complicated data sets.
Serve as liaison between the Business and technical teams to achieve the goal of providing actionable insights into current business performance, and ad hoc investigations into future improvements or innovations. This will require data gathering and manipulation, synthesis and modeling, problem solving, and communication of insights and recommendations.

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience with SQL, data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing.
4+ years of relevant work experience in a role requiring application of analytic skills to integrate data into operational planning/business planning or advanced degree
Advanced skills in Excel as well as any data visualization tools like Tableau or similar BI tools (familiarity with Tableau and Quicksight preferred)
Advanced ability to draw insights from data and clearly communicate them (verbal/written) to the stakeholders and senior management as required.
Be self-driven, and show ability to deliver on ambiguous projects with incomplete or dirty data.
An ability and interest in working in a fast-paced and rapidly-changing environment
Preferred Qualifications
Experience in designing and delivering cross functional custom reporting solutions.
3+ years of coding experience in at least one modern programming language (Python, Ruby, Scala, Java, etc.)
Proven ability to meet tight deadlines, multi-task, and prioritize workload.
Experience in tuning SQL scripts
Experience working in very large data warehouse environments
Experience in statistical measurement and modeling

Company - Amazon.com Services LLC
Job ID: A1030810

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Description

The Tech Deploy/Strategic Sourcing (TD&SS) Business Analytics and Decision Support (BADS) team is seeking a seasoned analyst who has demonstrated ability to utilize metrics, statistical analysis and visualization tools to dive deep into complex issues while deriving actionable results from operational and enterprise data. A successful candidate has outstanding business acumen, a restlessness to answer “why?” questions, and are passionate about using data to drive decision making.

In this role, our Business Intelligence Analyst will work with cross functional partners to determine business requirements, establish priorities, define key performance indicators (KPI), and further enhance our analytics strategy. This includes working with business operations, technology support, automation deployment and software development teams to design and document business processes, dashboards, alerts, and reports. This individual will provide critical insight and deep dive analytics into areas such as operational process improvement, supply chain logistics, resource optimization, and capacity planning to deliver on strategic business requirements.

They will be accountable for leading independent initiatives in facilitating information gathering, developing structured documentation and presenting their findings to multiple levels of management. They will conduct analyses of existing business processes and participate in the development and support of process changes for complex technology automation projects.

Key Responsibilities Include
Identify, develop, manage, and execute analyses to support problem statements and current state measurement. Design new metrics and enhance existing metrics to support the future state of business processes and ensure sustainability.
Deep dive into large data sets to answer key business questions using SQL, Excel, and other data manipulation languages.
Lead deep dive discussions into operational analysis and gap reporting to identify defects, opportunities, and efficiencies across global teams. Identify, develop and execute data analyses to monitor operational performance and customer trends to uncover areas of opportunity.
Report key insight trends, using statistical rigor to simplify and inform the larger team of noteworthy story lines.
Maintain data integrity, perform QA Audits and diligently troubleshoot issues.
Continually improve ongoing reporting and analysis processes, while automating or simplifying self-service support and access to authoritative data sets.
Own and perform individual deep dive analyses, including communicating results and implications to business leaders.
Generate daily, weekly, and monthly data reports for both internal and external business reviews.
Respond with urgency to high priority requests from senior business leaders.
Learn and understand a broad range of Amazon’s data resources and know how, when, and which to use and which not to use.
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.


Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or related field.
3+ years proven experience as a Data Analyst or Business Analyst.
3+ years of professional experience in a business analytics/intelligence role utilizing enterprise databases with large-scale, complex data sets performing data mining and deep dive analysis.
Strong statistics and analytical skills with demonstrated proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools such as Tableau and/or MS Excel.
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and structures - ability to understand and handle data quality issues and respond to detailed queries.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to convey key insights from complex analysis and ability to effectively communicate with both technical and non-technical teams.
Self-motivated and able to own workload to deliver results on self-driven deadlines.
Ability to meet deadlines and prioritize workloads/projects in a fast-paced environment.
Preferred Qualifications
Proficiency in statistical analytics tools: R, Minitab, or similar.
Understanding of Amazon data structures and architecture.
Amazon operational business understanding, including potential impact of business decisions on various internal/external stakeholders.
Demonstrated high degree of organization and ability to manage multiple, competing priorities.
Demonstrated resourcefulness and ability to find or develop compelling data given limited resources and time.
Experience in developing with Tableau or similar data visualization platform.
MS/MBA a plus.

Company - Amazon.com Services LLC
Job ID: A1032079

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

Ever wondered how you can apply your analytics skills to drive customer experience improvements for a diverse, innovative, and fun company like Amazon?
Amazon’s Customer Insights and Research team is looking for a Business Intelligence Engineer (BIE) to help do exactly that and much more! If you have a combination of experience in automation (scripting) and statistical analysis, and are interested in going deeper into data science or machine learning, this is the right opportunity for you.
Our team is responsible for conducting global NPS studies to help business teams drive strategic initiatives that advocate for the best possible customer experience. You will have the opportunity to design, collect, analyze and present customer findings to business partners. We have a diverse suite of skill sets on the team, including Business Analysts, Business Intelligence Engineers, Data Scientists, Product Managers, and Software Development Engineers.
BIEs are responsible for ingesting data through our data pipelines, automating analysis for the various surveys that the team runs, run statistical tests on the data, and presenting data through visualization tools. BIEs also continuously learn new systems, tools, and industry best practices to help design/refine studies and build products or tools that help automate and accelerate analytics.

Key Job Responsibilities
Develop/ improve metrics that provide insights into business
Ensure the output produced is accurate and thorough
Deliver under tight deadlines
Recognize and adopt best practices in reporting/ analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation
Write quality code to retrieve and analyze data
Develop pragmatic analyses and choose applicable solutions that add value to the business area
Understand data resources and know how, when and which to use (and which not to use)
Use advanced analytical techniques to solve business problems
Develop analyses for the business’ sake, not for analyses’ sake
Continue to move forward in the face of ambiguity and imperfect data. Find a solution around the problem that still maintains high analytical bar. You do not suffer from “analysis paralysis”
Ensure that decision is based on the merit of their unbiased analytical results, not the proposer. Stay “true to the data”
Communicate analysis results and techniques, both verbally and in writing, clearly and confidently to peers and business partners.

Basic Qualifications
Minimum of 4 years of experience, or Bachelor’s degree and 2 years of experience
Experience in areas such as Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Information Systems, or Statistics
4+ years of experience using SQL
4+ years as a Business Intelligence Engineer, Business Analyst, Data Engineer, or similar roles
Preferred Qualifications
Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Information Systems, Statistics or a related discipline.
Fluency with statistical analytics and experience with coding in one of the scripting languages (R or Python) to do basic data manipulations and mathematical computations.
Ability to distill problems and constraints from informal business requirements and to be comfortable dealing with ambiguity and craft analytical approaches to solving problems.
Experience using cloud-based storage/computing and data pipeline development to support dashboarding technologies such as AWS Redshift, S3, or Amazon QuickSight.
Basic knowledge and experience with statistical modeling and Machine Learning techniques such as Regression, SVMs, Random Forests, and Neural Nets.
Self-starter with flexibility to work in a fast-changing environment and ambiguous situations with a history of delivering results.
Ability to effectively communicate (verbal/written) to both tech and non-tech audience(s).
Intellectual curiosity to continually challenge the status quo to best support evolving customer and business needs.
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation


Company - Amazon.com Services LLC
Job ID: A1054904

title: Director Business Intelligence
description:
The Director of Business Intelligence (hereafter “BI”) will successfully apply their years of experience in data analysis and strategic consulting as the BI lead on any of our myriad of enterprise clients within the health and wellness industry. Paramount to this success will be the ability to utilize the many data sources at the disposal of the BI team to not only represent the business impact that our media/marketing campaigns have in the marketplace but also the ability to translate these learnings into actionable strategic recommendations for our clients.

Role Responsibilities:
While every engagement is unique, typical engagements require execution against the following tasks and deliverables:
Crafting and maintaining professional relationships with the many members of your client team(s) while being solely responsible for the consistent level of quality in communications and deliverables for the entire team that serves on the client’s behalf
Work throughout the year with internal (PHM) and external (client team, partner agencies/consulting groups) stakeholders to craft measurement plans/proposals that satisfy all client needs/objectives and address business challenges/opportunities with clearly defined goals and definitions of program success
With the above, oversee the creation of the business rules and parameters of the engagement as well as participate in conjunction with internal Finance and Operations teams in the scoping process and any necessary requests for proposal from outside vendors/data companies
As we execute on the behalf of the client, manage the many internal data sources and (where
applicable) third-party vendors/data streams that comprise our custom measurement platform
while keeping workstream on task within the established timelines and delivery dates
Synthesize the data available into insights/recommendations about the success of our programs in transforming the behavior of our target audience (most likely healthcare professionals, patients/prospects or a combination of the two) while identifying opportunities for program optimization and enhancement
Utilize the aforementioned insights/recommendations as the foundation for presentations, reports, assorted client deliverables in either a face-to-face setting or via WebEx/teleconference
Identify areas of opportunity to expand our presence through consultative selling at current clients while periodically participating in the any new business development opportunities as they arise
  Role Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree (preferably a BS in a related field) is required; Master’s Degree a strong plus 7 years of work experience in data/analytics consulting and/or quantitative marketing/analysis (healthcare, pharmaceuticals and life sciences experience a plus but not necessarily a requirement)
Depth of understanding of how clients use all aspects of their multi-channel marketing mix in reaching their customers
Superior skills with the following core competencies:
       Project Management/ Time Management
       Problem Solving Abilities
       Quantitative Skills
       Communication Abilities
       Intellectual Curiosity
Participate in the recruitment of new additions to the BI Team and management of both the career development and daily workflow of junior team members/resources
Power-user of business IT software: MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint
Literacy of business intelligence software such as MicroStrategy, Datorama, etc.
A willingness to travel as client needs dictate
While all engagements are unique, travel is normally required 10 to 15% of the time

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
The Analyst, Business Intelligence is exposed to a range of clients, projects and responsibilities. You will be working with a team of highly talented individuals in Strategy, Marketing, Media, and Creative to drive results for our clients.
     Key Responsibilities
 Knowledge
 Conduct quantitative and qualitative metric development and analysis tied to business objectives
Track results and provide data interpretation using a variety of digital analytics tools and partners
Develop insights, recommendations and optimizations in order to optimize campaign performance
Create measurement plans outlining strategy and tactics required to assess brand performance
Assist with collecting market and industry research to provide performance benchmarks, industry updates, market scans, top-line summaries, and client reports
Contribute to competitive analyses and best practices audits
Collaborate with clients to develop clear business and measurement objectives
Develop and maintain functional expertise in one or more of the following disciplines; database marketing, integrated channel marketing (including web), analytical tools, techniques, and other infrastructure requirements
  Requirements
0-2 years of business experience working in Marketing, Advertising or Consulting
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Statistics, Marketing, Math; MBA a plus
Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to be both strategic and tactical
Ability to multi-task; ability to manage time, deadlines, and prioritize work
Capacity to work independently as well as part of a team
Excellent communication skills
Knowledge of statistical modeling techniques, segmentation, research, lifetime value, ROI
Proficiency in Microsoft Office required with an emphasis on advanced-level Excel skills
Hands on experience with digital analytic tools (Google Analytics, Omniture)
Experience with SAS, SPSS or other data manipulation tools a plus
Experience in program measurement (online and/or offline), test design and financial modeling also a plus

title: Director Business Intelligence
description:
The Director of Business Intelligence (hereafter “BI”) will successfully apply their years of experience in data analysis and strategic consulting as the BI lead on any of our myriad of enterprise clients within the health and wellness industry. Paramount to this success will be the ability to utilize the many data sources at the disposal of the BI team to not only represent the business impact that our media/marketing campaigns have in the marketplace but also the ability to translate these learnings into actionable strategic recommendations for our clients.

Role Responsibilities:
While every engagement is unique, typical engagements require execution against the following tasks and deliverables:
Crafting and maintaining professional relationships with the many members of your client team(s) while being solely responsible for the consistent level of quality in communications and deliverables for the entire team that serves on the client’s behalf
Work throughout the year with internal (PHM) and external (client team, partner agencies/consulting groups) stakeholders to craft measurement plans/proposals that satisfy all client needs/objectives and address business challenges/opportunities with clearly defined goals and definitions of program success
With the above, oversee the creation of the business rules and parameters of the engagement as well as participate in conjunction with internal Finance and Operations teams in the scoping process and any necessary requests for proposal from outside vendors/data companies
As we execute on the behalf of the client, manage the many internal data sources and (where
applicable) third-party vendors/data streams that comprise our custom measurement platform
while keeping workstream on task within the established timelines and delivery dates
Synthesize the data available into insights/recommendations about the success of our programs in transforming the behavior of our target audience (most likely healthcare professionals, patients/prospects or a combination of the two) while identifying opportunities for program optimization and enhancement
Utilize the aforementioned insights/recommendations as the foundation for presentations, reports, assorted client deliverables in either a face-to-face setting or via WebEx/teleconference
Identify areas of opportunity to expand our presence through consultative selling at current clients while periodically participating in the any new business development opportunities as they arise
  Role Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree (preferably a BS in a related field) is required; Master’s Degree a strong plus 7 years of work experience in data/analytics consulting and/or quantitative marketing/analysis (healthcare, pharmaceuticals and life sciences experience a plus but not necessarily a requirement)
Depth of understanding of how clients use all aspects of their multi-channel marketing mix in reaching their customers
Superior skills with the following core competencies:
Project Management/ Time Management
Problem Solving Abilities
Quantitative Skills
Communication Abilities
Intellectual Curiosity
Participate in the recruitment of new additions to the BI Team and management of both the career development and daily workflow of junior team members/resources
Power-user of business IT software: MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint
Literacy of business intelligence software such as MicroStrategy, Datorama, etc.
A willingness to travel as client needs dictate
While all engagements are unique, travel is normally required 10 to 15% of the time

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
job_location: New York, New York, United States
description:
Business Intelligence Analyst III 

This is a contract to hire. No third party or visa restrictions

Position Summary:
Individuals within the Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst III role deliver business intelligence & reporting solutions using a set of very efficient processes. In addition, BI analysts fulfill ongoing ad-hoc request demands and look for self-service solutions. They work closely with other data, reporting and analytics units, business partners and IT leaders to identify, prioritize, execute and communicate the appropriate reporting solutions. It is essential that BI Analysts build an understanding of the organization at a level of detail that enables them to provide best in class reporting solutions. They provide data that is accurate, congruent and reliable, and ensure the information is easily available to user for direct consumption or integration with other systems.  
BI Analysts educate and train business partners and clients to use the data as an analytical tool, displaying the information in new forms and content for analysis and option exploration.
BI Analysts work with users to understand and determine business requirements, priorities, define key performance indicators (KPI), and develop BI and data warehouse (DW) strategy. They conduct analyses of functional business processes and functional business requirements and participate in the development teams to design, and document dashboards, alerts, and reports.

BI Analysts understand how data is turned into information and knowledge and how that knowledge supports and enables key business processes. They must have an in-depth understanding of the business environment and an interest in going beyond the obvious, delving into the source, the definition, philosophy, foundational roots of a data element to create information. They must work well within a team environment.

Responsibilities:
Provides on-going delivery of recurring reporting solutions
Responds timely to ongoing new ad-hoc requests and look for optimal ways to deliver
Provides automations of existing processes; using the optimal technology and processes
Works on complex and cross-functional IT and business intelligence solutions
Works on multiple tasks/projects as team member or leader or functional lead
Participates in workstream planning process including inception, technical design, development, testing and delivery o BI solutions
May participate in project management estimation process
Works with internal and external customers and IT partners to develop and analyze business intelligence needs
Provides input to business requirements for the design of solutions
Interprets business requirements and determines optimum BI solutions to meet needs
Identifies and provides input to new technology opportunities that will have an impact on the Enterprise wide BI systems
Designs Institute-wide "views" and custom reports
Perform analysis for a wide range of requests using data in different formats and from various platforms
Researches business problems and creates models that help analyze these business problems
Provides input to the development of information quality metrics
Researches tools, frameworks and mechanisms for data analytics
Interfaces with vendors to keep abreast of new technologies, pricing and customer applicability
Participates in vendor evaluations
Adheres to current standards
Provides input to standards, policies and procedures for the form, structure, and attributes of the BI tools and systems
Designs and delivers end-user training and training materials
Trains users to transform data into action-oriented information and to use correctly
Provide guidance, training, and problem-solving assistance to other team members
Coaches less-experienced individuals

Functional Skills:
Excellent knowledge of supported business functions, systems, and transactions
Familiar with technology system processes, reporting functions, and methodologies
Works effectively within a cross functional matrix environment

Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Management or specialized training / certification or equivalent work experience
Typically requires a minimum of 4-6 years of Business Analysis or related technical experience
Excellent understanding of database concepts and data warehousing concept are required
Strong experience with RDBMS; strong SQL skills required
Experience with ETL and data blending tools (Informatica, Syncsort, Alteryx)
Experience with BI and Data Visualization tools (Business Objects/Tableau/Qlikview/Cognos etc.)
Moderate to high development usage of Microsoft Access and Excel
Familiarity with Hadoop, Hive, SQL Workbench, Hue etc. preferred
Proven ability to create reports from existing databases and non-relational data sources

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST

Be a part of our success story. Launch offers talented and motivated people the opportunity to do the best work of their lives in a dynamic and growing company. Through competitive salaries, outstanding benefits, internal advancement opportunities, and recognized community involvement, you'll have the chance to create a career you can be proud of. Your new trajectory starts here at Launch.

We’re looking for a self-motivated and career driven Business Intelligence Analyst who will thrive in a challenging, dynamic environment to join our client’s team. You’ll work with both business and technical stakeholders to fully understand high-level business objectives in order to align work with those objectives while analyzing and solving problems at their root. The ideal candidate has strong knowledge of accounting systems and has experience working with Master Data management platforms.

Responsibilities
Work with business stakeholders and developers to create queries and resulting datasets based off complex business and accounting logic
Evaluate information gathered from multiple sources and reconcile conflicts
Apply data analysis and research skills to identify key indicators, test hypotheses and guide actions with respect to the dealership transaction life cycle
Understand high-level business objectives and continually align work with those objectives to meet the needs of the business
Analyze and solve problems at their root, stepping back to understand the broader context
Analyze and extract relevant information from large amounts of both structured and unstructured data to help automate and optimize key processes
Define the business problem and solution approach autonomously with limited guidance
Generate actionable insights through the development of metrics, dashboards and deep dive analyses
Partner with our business and product owners to analyze requirements, perform detailed data analysis and work with the team to transform them into data collection requirements
Partner with fellow team members to ensure that the solution offered is of highest quality standards and follow industry best practices
Maintain protocols by writing and updating procedures
Conduct gap analysis between application and stated customer requirements and collaborate with Architects and Developers to estimate project impact
Work with Development, QA, and Production Support teams to communicate, verify, and test the desired functionality changes
Build and maintain strong collaborative relationships with stakeholders, management and scrum teams
Work independently on data requests, or as part of an Agile team


Required Experience/Qualifications
Strong working knowledge of accounting systems, general ledger transactions, and financial statements
Solution analysis and design, spanning legacy Data environments and Cloud (Azure preferred)
Experience working within Master Data Management platforms (Profisee preferred)
Strong understanding and hands-on experience with data conversion, extraction and migration processes
Oriented with DevOps, including environment management and build processes
Experience with planning and executing data requests/projects
A self-starter that works independently, without the need for day-to-day guidance
Expertise with Azure DevOps (ADO) preferred, Jira, Rally, or similar is also acceptable
Advanced MS Office Product Suite skills, specifically Excel
3-5+ years of experience in a Data related role
4-year degree from an accredited university
Problem solving and analytical skills
Quickly learn new business domains and corresponding data
Excellent communication and documentation skills
Strong SQL skills


We are Navigators in the Age of Transformation.

We use sophisticated technology to transform clients to the digital age, but our positive impact on the human experience is our top priority. We ease anxiety and fear around digital transformation and replace it with opportunity.

Qualified applicants, please respond to inquire@launchcg.com with your full name, resume, and a brief description of how your skills match the requirements above. Please refer to job #3490

Launch Consulting is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer.

title: Business Intelligence Manager
description:
BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE MANAGER

Be a part of our success story. Launch offers talented and motivated people the opportunity to do the best work of their lives in a dynamic and growing company. Through competitive salaries, outstanding benefits, internal advancement opportunities, and recognized community involvement, you'll have the chance to create a career you can be proud of. Your new trajectory starts here at Launch.

We are seeking a Business Intelligence Manager to take the lead, serving as the principle and personnel manager for all of our client’s Data & BI Production Services. You’ll ensure continuity, own all Data & BI issues, and perform product planning while tracking development. The ideal candidate has past experience working within an ITIL organization and has a fundamental understanding of data conversion, extraction and migration processes.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
The Sacramento Kings organization is an engaging, fast-paced, and fun Sports and Entertainment Franchise. As a member of our team, you'll be given the opportunity to impact the Sacramento region both on and off the court. Combining a collaborative and innovative work environment with a talented and diverse staff, we've created a workforce in which every team member has the tools to reach their full potential.

Focus heavily on projects supporting organizational priorities including:
Fan development initiatives
Retention strategies
Identifying new areas of revenue growth
Support execution and reporting of sales and marketing campaigns across multiple channels.

Create engaging visualizations and dashboards that assist management in their day-to-day decision making.

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Description

The Amazon FreeTime team is looking for a passionate and solution oriented Business Intelligence Engineer to run analytical solutions that deepen our collective understanding of customers, influence innovation, and deliver actionable insights. Amazon.com has a culture of data-driven decision-making and demands insights and recommendations that are timely, accurate, and actionable. At Amazon, you will be working in one of the world's largest and most complex data environments.

The ideal candidate has outstanding business acumen, a restlessness to answer “why?” questions, excellent technical skills, strong analytical abilities, superior written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to influence and lead cross-functional teams. He/she will be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, able to think big (while paying careful attention to detail), and will enjoy working in a fast-paced dynamic environment. He/she will work closely with product managers, marketing, and finance to help drive business results.

The Ideal Candidate Will
Build scalable solutions/self-serve platforms that will provide data/KPIs to inform business decison making
Investigate data sources across Amazon and expand existing device data infrastructure
Identify, develop, manage, and execute analyses to uncover areas of opportunity and present written business recommendations that will help shape the device customer engagement, sales and marketing roadmap.
Develop a thorough understanding of customer behavior, competitive product trends, and business drivers to inform decision making
Analyze key insight trends and build models that predict customer behavior, using statistical rigor to simplify and provide thought leadership to device product and marketing groups
Collaborate with finance and product management as a leader of ongoing analytical support

Basic Qualifications
BS/BA Computer Sciences, Math, Statistics or related field.
5+ years of professional experience in data modeling / advanced business analytics
Advanced knowledge of SQL and experience with efficient processing of large data sets is a must
Experience in designing and building data infrastructure/automated reporting tools
Experience in advanced business/customer analytics
Top notch written and verbal communication skills to convey key insights from complex analysis in summarized business terms
Preferred Qualifications
Experience in predictive modeling/statistics/econometrics
Demonstrated experience delivering actionable insight for a consumer business
Experience with Big Data solutions
Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and senior management to collect requirements, describe software product features, technical designs, and product strategy

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:

The Amazon Books Fraud & Abuse team is looking for a highly driven, customer-obsessed Business Intelligence Engineer who will be responsible for building BI tools and performing analysis that will support or drive key decision making across the group. You’ll analyze large amounts of data, discover and solve real world problems, build metrics and business cases around key projects and, most of all, be an integral part of creating a better customer and author experience.

You have to be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail and passion for data, and an ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment. It's a big ask, and we're excited to talk to those up to the challenge!

Reactively and proactively developing and executing analyses that provide important insight into business and program health
Working closely with engineering and science teams to discover and automate data analytics
Monitoring existing metrics and partnering with internal teams to identify process and system improvement opportunities
