title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
About Us

Slingshot is a Utah based start-up recently recognized by Inc Magazine as one of America's fastest growing companies (#146!!!). Our headquarters is located in Orem, Utah, with At Home Slingers located across Utah as well as select surrounding states. We believe in a world where conversations matter, where technology enhances human interaction instead of replacing it, and where people can effortlessly connect with service providers that help home feel like home.

Learn More At

The gig:

Slingshot is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to support finance, operations, sales, marketing & company leadership teams with insights gained from analyzing company data. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization. They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with leaders to improve business outcomes.

Requirements

What you'll do:
Work with leaders throughout the organization to identify requirements and opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions and ensuring the validation and verification of data used.
Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques, financial models and business strategies.
Provide support to end users on standardized and ad hoc reports.
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
Use predictive modelling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes.
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.


What You Need To Have
Bachelors degree in a business related discipline or mathematics
2+ years of experience in an analytical role and experience with large data sets
At least one year of experience in architecting, building, and maintaining BI environments
Expert SQL query writing, especially across multiple databases and servers
Experience with setting up and maintaining BI analytics tools, such as Tableau, Power BI, Domo, Klipfolio, Qlik, etc
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Significant work experience with SQL and report building
Advanced Excel skills
Strong communication skills


Benefits

What you’ll gain :
Experience in a fun, fast-paced startup environment.
A generous PTO allotment gives you the freedom to build the underground crime empire you’ve always dreamed of.
Health Care: Hang-gliding accident? Flesh-eating bacteria? We got you covered.
Data-Driven Workplace: Dashboards. Pie graphs. Acronyms. We’ve got it all.
Growth Opportunities: We’re growing. Like a fungus. You can be a fungus too.
401(k) Match: We’ll help you prepare for your future with the manic energy of a squirrel caching acorns.
Gym Membership & On-site Gym: Let Slingshot subsidize your quest to get fit/swole/jacked/yolked.
Fast-Paced Environment: Set up shop at the corner of amazing growth and exquisite chaos.
Stocked Breakroom, Cafeteria on-site: Never an excuse to be hangry here.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
University of Virginia Community Credit Union Members deserve the best, which is why we seek to engage talented and enthusiastic people who have a passion for excellence and a commitment to the credit union ideal of service and financial education. Be a part of something special – a not-for-profit financial cooperative with the social purpose of ‘people helping people.’

IS Business Intelligence Analyst – FULL TIME – Charlottesville

SUMMARY:

The IS Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for ongoing data mining and reporting to produce actionable insights. The incumbent will be responsible for the overall management and maintenance of data reporting tools, platforms and data warehouse while supporting the organization’s need to measure product and promotion effectiveness to inform broader strategic decisions. The successful applicant will provide an exceptional level of attention to detail and be able to translate user needs to a well thought out work product.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

· In direct support of organizational leaders, define data needs and provide guidance to meet business objectives and optimize reporting practices.

· Collaborate with Marketing and Product Management teams to report on product trends, opportunities, and performance.

· Develop dashboards to provide data focused on Corporate Goal Tracking and Marketing Performance.

· Serve as the subject matter expert for the organization’s data, both in structure and meaning.

· Create data models, visualizations, charts, tables, and other reports for consumption and use by non-technical users. This will be completed by utilizing tools such as Structured Query Language (SQL, Query3k, Suprtool, Visimage), Prism Reporting, Raddon, Java Script, Excel, and other reporting tools.

· Perform data analysis with appropriate programming and analytic methodologies; present data or reports in a meaningful fashion; work collaboratively with teams and leadership; formulate thoughtful recommendations.

· Provide expertise in writing and editing queries that read, manipulate, and analyze data from business intelligence, relational databases, and data warehouses.

· Maintain business intelligence solutions such as data warehouse, Prism Analytics, and Raddon Integrator to ensure daily, weekly, and monthly cycles are handled reliably.

· Design and build ‘extract, transform, load’ (ETL) workflows resulting in either a systems integration and/or business intelligence source table for multiple data sources.

· Provide detailed analysis, design, tuning, testing, implementation, and documentation of the business intelligence system and data warehouse, as well as make recommendations as necessary to evolve the reporting infrastructure.

· Provide support for and implement data driven technologies and platforms such as workflow and CRM tools.

QUALIFICATIONS:

· 5 or more years of experience synthesizing complex data.

· 3 years of experience managing a data warehouse or CRM/MCIF system. Preference will be given to candidates with experience performing this work in a Financial Institution setting.

· Bachelor’s degree in Technology, Analytics, Economics, or other related field. Commiserate experience may be considered in lieu of degree.

· Strong analytical skills, and ability to gather end user business requirements for reporting and data extraction.

· Expert-level proficiency with Microsoft Excel

An attractive suite of benefits is offered to full time employees including: health, dental, vision, paid time off starting with an 18 day accrual annually and 10 company paid holidays, as well as a 10% company retirement plan contribution after the first year of employment and an HSA company contribution starting at $1,200.

Equal Employment Opportunity has been, and will continue to be, a fundamental principle at the University of Virginia Community Credit Union, where employment is based upon personal capabilities and qualifications without regard to race, color, gender, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, disability, age, genetic information, marital status, amnesty or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
About The Role

As a Business Intelligence Analyst for TQL, you’ll be joining the team that is responsible for delivering critical report and data solutions, for the largest privately held company in Cincinnati. Our Analysts work directly with internal teams to assess their needs and develop highly intuitive insights via SQL queries, database views, SSRS reports, Pivot Tables, and PerformancePoint dashboards. This opportunity gives you the chance to work with the latest BI technologies and make a real impact within a $3B organization that is changing the future of the logistics industry.

What’s In It For You
Competitive compensation, benefit package, and company perks
Advancement opportunities with aggressive and structured career paths
Flexible work hours and work-from-home options
Access to the latest emerging technologies
Reimbursement for continuous education and technical training


What You’ll Be Doing
Consult with end users across multiple departments to understand reporting needs and challenges
Translate user requirements into SQL queries, SSRS reports, Excel pivot tables, and PerformancePoint dashboard solutions using the latest Microsoft technologies
Take ownership of reporting projects from inception to completion, providing follow-up communication, and deliverables until requirements are met
Design and develop solutions for enterprise and departmental business intelligence (BI), data warehousing, and reporting procedures
Deliver results with accuracy and urgency on multiple projects
Provide quality customer service to a diverse group of internal customers


What You Need
Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or related
1-3 years of professional IT experience (internships/co-ops qualify)
Exceptional aptitude for applied mathematics, statistics, and computer programming
Experience writing T-SQL queries against a SQL database using SQL Management Studio
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Solid understanding of database concepts such as normalization and OLTP vs OLAP
Experience using pivot tables in Excel
Exposure to data visualization concepts and techniques
SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) experience is preferred
Exposure to SharePoint, PerformancePoint and SQL Analysis Services is a plus
Data Mart and Data Warehouse experience is desired
Basic understanding of database administration

Total Quality Logistics is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, genetic information, disability or protected veteran status.

If you are unable to apply online due to a disability, contact recruiting at recruiting@tql.com.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
You will leverage Business Intelligence and Data Analytic best practices to deliver relevant, timely and insightful information to the business.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Solve complex analytical problems and provide actionable insights
Develop reports and dashboards for all departments within the company
Work with business leaders to determine data and reporting needs
Provide ad-hoc reports in a fast-paced environment with very short deadlines
Develop creative solutions to facilitate decision making within the business
Analyze client’s business and data requirements and convert them into reporting solutions
Create reports that are both accurate and usable while ensuring these are delivered in a timely manner
Troubleshoots data issues and validates result sets
Recommends and implements process improvements
Optimizes existing SQL queries and suggests improvements to other team members.
Serve as a subject matter expert for BI end user solutions, including sharing skills with technically inclined business users
Utilize and master third-party tools, such as Excel, SSRS, Power BI and SQL Server
Create and maintain automated reporting services that combine data from various sources and produce reports within Microsoft Reporting Services environment
Develop, maintain and support Business Intelligence (BI) activities within Microsoft Reporting Services environment


REQUIREMENTS
B.S. Computer Science/MIS or its equivalent
The ability to receive, prioritize and complete tasks from multiple sources with minimal supervision
Advanced knowledge of SQL Server
Expertise with SSRS
Knowledge of relational databases
Possesses strong attention to detail
Ability to work successfully and independently in an atmosphere of multiple projects, shifting priorities, and deadline pressures.
Experience creating and optimizing stored procedures
A strong desire to learn new technologies and improve your skills
Proven experience and strong background with Microsoft SQL Server, SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), and T-SQL for writing stored procedures
Strong report/dashboard design and code development skills required, MS Power BI, excel PowerPivot experience a plus
Troubleshoot existing BI solutions including ETL, cube processing and reporting errors
Review, recommend and implement changes for existing T-SQL code and stored procedures to improve performance
Strong knowledge of Excel, including formulas and macros
Ability to receive, prioritize and complete tasks from multiple sources with minimal supervision
Write complex T-SQL code and stored procedures to be utilized by applications, ETL and reports
Ability to receive, prioritize and complete tasks from multiple sources with minimal supervision
Works well in a team environment
Ability to think creatively and solve problems
Knowledge of DAX preferred, but not required
Experience with a language such as R or Python is a plus


The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Business Intelligence Engineer - Risk Intelligence
description:
Description

Amazon’s Transportation Risk & Compliance (TRC) team is responsible for keeping our customers and partners safe, and ensuring we maintain WW compliance. To support the business, our primary mission is to perform continuous, independent and objective, risk-based assessments of Amazon business partners’ activities and related controls with the goal of improving operations, compliance, risk management and overall success of the program. We build scalable solutions that grow with the Amazon business. TRC collects Terabytes of data from hundreds of data sources inside and outside Amazon. We provide interfaces for our internal customers to access and query the data hundreds of thousands of times per day, using technologies like Amazon Web Service’s (AWS) Redshift, Hive, and Spark.
TRC is growing, and the data processing landscape is shifting. Our data is consumed by teams across Amazon including Research Scientists, Machine Learning Specialists, Business Analysts, and Data Engineers. We are seeking an outstanding Business Intelligence Engineer (BIE) to join TRC. Amazon has culture of data-driven decision-making, and demands business intelligence that is timely, accurate, and actionable. If you join the TRC team, your work will have an immediate influence on day-to-day decision making at Amazon.
As an Amazon BIE, you will be working in one of the world's largest cloud-based data lakes. You should be skilled in the architecture of data warehouse solutions for the Enterprise using multiple platforms (EMR, RDBMS, Columnar, Cloud). You should have extensive experience in the design, creation, management, and business use of extremely large datasets. You should have excellent business and communication skills to be able to work with business owners to develop and define key business questions, and to build data sets that answer those questions. Above all you should be passionate about working with huge data sets and someone who loves to bring datasets together to answer business questions and drive change.

As a BIE on TRC, you will design, develop, implement, test, document, and operate large-scale, high-volume, high-performance data structures for analytics and deep learning. Implement data ingestion routines both real time and batch using best practices in data modeling, ETL/ELT processes leveraging AWS technologies and Big data tools. Gather business and functional requirements and translate these requirements into robust, scalable, operable solutions that work well within the overall data architecture. Analyze source data systems and drive best practices in source teams. Participate in the full development life cycle, end-to-end, from design, implementation and testing, to documentation, delivery, support, and maintenance. Produce comprehensive, usable dataset documentation and metadata. You will work closely with the broader HS3C-Compliance data technologies and Transportation data technologies teams to evaluate and make decisions around dataset implementations designed and proposed by peer data engineers and scientists. Evaluate and make decisions around the use of new or existing software products and tools. Mentor junior BIEs.


Basic Qualifications
A desire to work in a collaborative, intellectually curious environment.
Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field and 4-5+ years industry experience
At least three years of experience in the following skill(s):
Developing and operating large-scale data structures for business intelligence analytics using: ETL/ELT processes; OLAP technologies; data modeling; SQL;
Experience with at least one relational database technology such as Redshift, Oracle, MySQL or MS SQL
Experience with at least one massively parallel processing data technology such as Redshift, Spark, or Hadoop based big data solutions
Coding proficiency in at least one modern programming language (Python, Ruby, Java, etc)
Experience in gathering requirements and formulating business metrics for reporting
Experience with AWS technologies
Preferred Qualifications
Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
Industry experience as a BIE or related specialty (e.g., Data Engineer, Software Engineer, Data Scientist) with a track record of manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large datasets.
Coding proficiency in at least one modern programming language (Python, Ruby, Java, etc)
Experience building/operating highly available, distributed systems of data extraction, ingestion, and processing of large data sets
Experience building data products incrementally and integrating and managing datasets from multiple sources
Query performance tuning skills using Unix profiling tools and SQL
Experience leading large-scale data warehousing and analytics projects, including using AWS technologies – Redshift, Redshift Spectrum, Athena, S3, Step Functions, Glue, EC2, Data-pipeline and other big data technologies
Experience providing technical leadership and mentor other engineers for the best practices on the data engineering space
Linux/UNIX knowledge, including to process large data sets.
Expertise with AWS technologies (especially Redshift and Glue preferred)
US: Amazon is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age.
Global: Amazon is an equal opportunity employer.


Company - Amazon.com Services LLC
Job ID: A1032467

title: Manager, Business Intelligence
description:
Description

We need a BI Leader! Prime and Global Marketing Finance enjoys a unique vantage point into everything happening within Amazon. This role will lead a team that is responsible for managing the data stores and generating data insights across three of the most impactful and high visibility areas within Amazon: The Prime Membership program, Lifecycle Engagement, and Global Marketing.

The BI Manager will partner with teams across finance, marketing, research, etc. to design and develop frameworks enabling insightful analysis of the business to key stakeholders across the entire Prime and Lifecycle Engagement organizations. Your team will push traditionally accepted process boundaries and engineer automated scalable solutions leveraging Amazon Web Services (AWS) to seamlessly integrate BI tools including but not limited to Tableau, QuickSight, Cradle, R etc.

The data flowing through our platform directly contributes to decision-making by leaders at all levels of organizational leadership throughout AMZN. If you’re passionate about building tools that enhance productivity, drive decision making, and operate at a scale that is unique even within Amazon, you're looking at the right posting!

Responsibilities Of This Position Include
Strong leadership, vision and passion to build and drive a Business Intelligence team to create changes in business partnerships, analytics, and metrics/reporting.
Drive the design, development and implementation of our analytics platform to provide stakeholders with structured access to data.
Champion proper adoption of self-service analytic tools and reporting environments.
Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, and dashboards that monitor and drive key business decisions.
Promote best practices and mentor your team.

Basic Qualifications
7+ years of professional experience in business intelligence and analytics.
5+ years of successful business intelligence or analytics team management experience, including employee development, performance management, and delivering results.
Experience using SQL, ETL, and big data technologies in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets.
Minimum education required: Bachelor's Degree.
Preferred Qualifications
Deep experience in a fast-paced environment and/or a blue-chip company, preferably in Business Intelligence and/or Reporting.
AWS Platform Development experience (Redshift)
Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Business or other related discipline.
An excellent knowledge of data warehouse principles and reporting.
Experience gathering business requirements, using industry standard business intelligence tools to extract data, formulate metrics, and build reports.
Proven track record of successful communication of analytical outcomes through written communication, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams. The ability to communicate complex information clearly and concisely through big data analysis.
Highly organized and able to prioritize and work to tight deadlines.
Able to build positive business relationships and work collaboratively across organizational boundaries. Able to coach and lead others effectively.
Passionate about scalable and future-proof processes, systems and data analytics.
Able to simplify and improve inefficient or unnecessarily complex processes.
Experience with statistics or Machine Learning methodologies a plus.
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation


Company - Amazon.com Services LLC
Job ID: A1028915

title: Manager, Business Intelligence
Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Working under the supervision the Director of Quality Improvement & Performance Management, the Business Intelligence Analyst provides analytic expertise and creates tools focused on a range of operational, management and performance reports and analyses drawing on internal sources of data as well as extracts provided by our public agency partners.

myEvolv is the agency’s Electronic Health Record and enterprise-wide data system. The Business Intelligence Analyst must be able to conceptualize, query, analyze, build analytic products, and apply data tools from this system as well as all of our available data sources using the agency’s toolkit, including Qlik, Celonis, SQL, TOAD, Informatica and Python.
Hold project management responsibilities for a range of analytic or evaluation initiatives assigned to QPC.
Support on-going quality assurance and quality improvement initiatives in the following areas:
Validate performance data provided by our public partners by comparing to systems of record data as well as internal data
Create/apply data quality tools and support Data Management staff in utilizing them
Perform trend analyses
Build dashboard visualizations
Apply statistical methods to model relationships in the data, particularly to inform factors related to desired results
Assume a lead role working with IT and Program to develop relevant operational and management reports drawing upon available data sources and support implementation with program level users.
Write/document tools/analytic products in a format that is comprehensive and accessible to end user to facilitate the use of the tools.
Utilize data analytics/reporting tools (e.g. Qlik) to produce dashboards and other analytic tools to support the information needs of management and help drive a performance environment.
Provide technical assistance in terms of analytic and quantitative methods and other relevant needs both within QPC and to relevant staff of other divisions.
Respond to ad hoc request for data and analysis from senior leadership, program staff or other critical stakeholders.
Represent the agency and QPC in internal and external meetings and forums.
Provide and/or support training needs of organization in relevant areas (e.g. data tools, analytic methods, reporting).
Regular and punctual time and attendance, and adherence to The Foundling’s and your department’s specific time and attendance policies and protocol.
Consistent demonstrated commitment to The Foundling’s BHAG, mission, vision and values (Compassion, Dignity, Family and Community, Diversity, Excellence).
Adherence to The Foundling’s employee policies, Code of Conduct and applicable rules, laws, regulations or bargaining agreements.

minimum BA/BS with Master's preferred, experience querying and/or developing databases, defining report/dashboards' requirements, developing reports/dashboards, performing data analysis, modeling relationships in data using quantitative methods, working collaboratively with program and operations stakeholders

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Responsibilities
Vary by project but may include:
• Identifies client’s business needs for systems development, performing requirement analysis, documentation of requirements and partners with developers to ensure appropriate solutions are designed
• Work with our clients to understand their needs (fixing a broken process, converting outdated systems, complying with new regulations, etc.), and represent those needs to technology teams who build solutions
• Provide advice and education in the usage and interpretation of business data relevant to the business unit
• Document work flow using Business Process Modeling tools
• Instill best practices and assists users at all levels within the company on how to leverage BI capabilities for accurate reporting and analysis
• Build relationships with key client stakeholders to understand their business structure, policies, and operations and to ensure the project maintains compliance
• Analyze, specify, model, and document stakeholder needs throughout the project to ensure they are specific, complete, and realistic
• Facilitate change management and obtain necessary support to implement improved business processes
• Facilitate the development of training and implementation material and post-implementation support
• Understand data elements in the warehouse at a very detailed grain to support any form of user needs from research to adhoc querying to managing large information projects
•Query large datasets and tables comfortably to provide information requested by business users



Qualifications
Our best Business Intelligence Analysts possess most of the following:
•4+ years’ relevant technical or business work experience
•Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Management, Finance, Economics, or similar required
•Strong attention to detail with a focus on end-user (stakeholder) needs
•Analytical mindset focused on process and data analysis
•Strong knowledge in SQL/Query
•Basic Word, intermediate Excel skills
•Ability to quickly adapt to new methods, work under tight deadlines and stressful conditions
•Ability to take complex data and processes and highlight useful information, identify gaps, propose solutions, and support decision making
•Client service mindset – must possess positive attitude and do whatever it takes to ensure the project meets client needs
•Strong work ethic – willing to work the hardest and go the extra mile to achieve project success and client satisfaction
•Ability to influence others and lead without authority
•Strong written, presentation, and verbal communication, including clear structure and main point communication
•Excels in ambiguous environments, where quick learning and rapid decision making are important
•Creative problem solver able to take multiple approaches to a single problem
•Has the ability to bridge the gap between vague and abstract ideas and produce clear, concise documentation and verbal explanations for any business need

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
BI Engineer
Appleton, WI
Remote within the state of Wisconsin
1 year contract with possibility of extension
  Are you data/technically driven, insightful and have a continuous improvement mindset? This team thrives on building positive relationships with our cross functional business partners and teams. If that resonates with you, consider joining our client's team.
  As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will be responsible for obtaining, developing and analyzing data, prove/disprove hypotheses, and develop insights for the Annuity Insurance product line. In this role, you will be expected to consult with customers to develop business requirements and provide possible solutions and approaches to their analytic needs to maintain the financial strength and competitiveness of the product. You will be expected to obtain, validate, and analyze data to determine facts and develop insights for the product line. Communicate those insights, create and update reports, and assist with rate changes. While supervision is provided by the Director, the role is expected to exhibit a significant amount of independence.
                    Job Duties and Responsibilities
Collaborates with the business, IT and customers to ensure that the design, execution, presentation, and distribution of actionable insights or data streams can be readily implemented and meets management requirements.
Partner with the Annuity Insurance team and others to develop actionable insights that can be readily implemented.
Builds and maintains moderately complex spreadsheets to help validate annuity insurance rates and illustrations.
Produce and maintain models and data using a variety of corporate software tools.
Obtain data by conducting queries and by receiving relevant data from business partners and validate that data.
Work with information technology and subject matter experts to understand the data environment and data quality issues and drive the resolution of discrepancies.
Organize and prepare data for analysis and reporting.
Analyze data, develop insights, and communicate findings.
Create reports that communicate relevant information and prepare reports for regular distribution.
  Job Requirements and Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, statistics, business, information systems, actuarial science, or related field; or equivalent experience
Multi-dimensional Data Modeling
ETL
3+ years of experience in financial services and/or research and analytics or 2+ years of experience in the actuarial field
Intermediate skills using MS Excel
Intermediate skills using analytics tools (such as SAS, SAS-EG, etc.) in a corporate environment

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Goldberg Segalla LLP, a dynamic and rapidly growing law firm with a national and international practice, seeks a highly motivated and organized individual to join its team as a Business Intelligence Analyst based in Albany, NY

The Business Intelligence Analyst will primarily be responsible to conduct background research on a variety of companies and organizations while liaising with other members of the Client Relations team and firm as required. The position requires knowledge of research resources and tools, a strong ability to analyze information collected and an understanding of the use of information compiled in a number of the firm’s business processes. A candidate must be able to multi-task effectively and balance working on multiple requests and projects on a daily basis.

Job Description
Conduct in-depth research and analysis of companies, individuals, and industries to uncover key, actionable information and summarize into concise deliverables.
Interpret and analyze research data and news developments, and distill them into concise, understandable summaries and graphic format
Proactively monitor a variety of publications and resources to develop knowledge pipelines
Collection and maintenance of data and documentation
Understand and appropriately follow firm processes and utilize firm systems
Completion of reports on a daily, weekly, monthly or as-needed basis
Provide administrative and project assistance
Requirements/Skills
A minimum of three years experience in business, marketing or equivalent
Ability to manage multiple projects while prioritizing work assignments in a fast-paced environment
Bachelor's degree (B.A. or B.S.) from an accredited college or university
Proficient in all aspects of Microsoft Office
Excellent organizational skills
Excellent attention to detail
The use of good judgment and good interpersonal communication skills
Well-developed analytical and problem-solving skills
Works harmoniously and effectively with others as part of a team
Exercises confidentiality and discretion
Goldberg Segalla is one of the largest and fastest-growing law firms headquartered in the United States, with a footprint that reaches from Los Angeles to London. Its more than 400 attorneys serve regional, national, and international clients from over 20 offices, with teams based in New York, Chicago, Philadelphia, Miami, St. Louis, and other major business and economic centers across 10 states. We look to hire only those people who are excellent at what they do and are dedicated to the pursuit of client service and quality representation within a Best Practices framework. We value team-spiritedness, collegiality, and interpersonal harmony within our working community. We are a firm that believes in diversity in the workplace and we offer a professional and positive work environment to each and every member of our team.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
In an environment of continuous quality improvement, the Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for developing, preparing, and monitoring data used for financial analyses, financial projections, financial modeling, and reports used by system management in decision making via computer software applications and programming that supports decision making, strategy, performance improvement, and other key operational goals. Additionally, this role is responsible for consistent evaluation of data for timeliness and reliability. Exhibits the MHS Standards of Excellence and exercises strict confidentiality at all times.

Job Requirement

Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Information Services, or healthcare related field required

Will consider Associate's Degree with qualifying experience in lieu of education on case by case basis

Minimum of 3 years of work experience in healthcare or related field preferred

Knowledge of hospital, clinic, and physician office operations

Strong interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills

Ability to problem solve and facilitate resolution to issues

Demonstrates ability to handle multiple priorities

Ability to make independent decisions

Proficient with Tableau Software

Job Functions
Performs extensive data gathering/mining, abstracting and analytics of financial and clinical information from various decision support tools.
Gathers data and performs measurement and benchmarking of business operations in relation to best business practices for the healthcare service industry and internal business objectives.
Presents performance indicator reports and benchmark narratives.
Analyzes and implements the functionality and operations of systems to determine standard and ad hoc reporting capabilities per organizational needs.
Maintains initial data, solves data integrity issues as they arise, and oversees the addition of new data to analytics and reporting systems.
Create customized reports using data requested by senior management and conducts ad hoc analyses where needed.
Assists in the preparation and distribution of regular reports from internal and external data sources.
Utilizes database tools and applications to provide support and maintenance of reports/and databases/systems for Performance Analytics.
Develops queries to extract data and prepare reports from our VARIOUS systems.
Provides reporting analysis, programming and problem resolution to facilitate reporting process improvement of complex systems.
Cross-coordinates the design of data collection tools with appropriate clinical and/or business content coordinators to ensure that the data needed to populate reports is being collected within the system.
Assumes all other duties and responsibilities as necessary.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Job Role: Business Intelligence Analyst
Duration: 6+ Months
Location: San Francisco, CA

This consultant role will support the F&S Finance Intelligence team in project related tasks. The ideal candidate thrives in fast paced, dynamic business environments and is detail oriented with a customer oriented attitude. The candidate is comfortable working with executives in FP&A and IT depts.

Description / Responsibilities
Understanding financial processes and uses them to run its business
Developing and Maintaining project related spreadsheets in Excel, Gdoc, SmartSheet
Conducting/managing UATs
Creating project calendar and timeline estimates
Communicating with business users on project related topics
Collaborate with Finance PMO on FP&A projects deliverables.
Behaviors
Service/customer-oriented attitude
Comfortable with changing requirements, priorities, and ambiguity
Demonstrates ownership/accountability
Detail oriented
Desired Experience/Skills
Bachelor’s Degree
3+ Strong Excel skills required (formulas, pivot tables. VBA is not required but strongly preferred)
PowerPoint
Familiarity with EPM systems (Hyperion, Cognos etc.) strongly preferred
3+ Knowledge of at least one programming language required
3+ Experience with SQL required
Google Docs (spreadsheets and presentations)
Experience in project management preferred

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
AmeriSave Mortgage is currently seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst in Scottsdale, AZ. This Business Intelligence Analyst will analyze and prepare the distribution of key business reporting data and work directly with the President to ensure valuable information is being provided to relevant parties. This individual will be tasked with turning vast amounts of data into organized information and presenting this information in a way that enables quick informed decisions. The BI Analyst will use a broad spectrum of analytical skills including tracking data, data mining, filtering data, and reverse engineering. The goal of this role is to ensure that Sr. Leadership has all the information needed to make informed business decisions. Turning insights into action is the key to the success role.

Working closely with Executive leadership, the BI Analyst will play a critical role in planning and process improvements impacting overall organizational growth and success.

As our organization expands and we continue to grow, we are looking to empower leadership with dashboards and reports that will enable them to measure and understand easily where their team’s performance is and where opportunities lie. Qualified candidates will possess advanced Business Intelligence (BI) development, data modeling, and database design experience.

We offer a fun, casual, team-oriented work environment with advancement opportunities.

Founded in 2002, AmeriSave is a well-known, industry respected mortgage lender with top lender rankings on Lending Tree, Consumer Affairs, Bankrate and Zillow.

Responsibilities
Work with Executive leadership to gather and refine business requirements for various projects. Collect, analyze, and summarize information and trends.
Work with executive leadership to translate business requirements into systems development tasks
Coordinate with Developers to ensure development tasks are implemented
Lead ongoing reviews of business processes and develop optimization strategies
Define project requirements and monitor/track progress
Create informative, actionable reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement. Document and communicate results.
Ensure solutions meet business needs and requirements
Assist in prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements

Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in business or related field
Minimum 2 years in business intelligence or a related field
2+ years SQL experience
Excellent Microsoft excel proficiency
Excellent communication skills
Excellent analytical abilities, documentation, and presentation skills (PowerPoint, etc.)
Experience developing presentation layer content using Power BI or similar tools preferred
Financial services and/or mortgage experience a plus
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Ability to work well under pressure in a fast paced environment
Must be independent, self-motivated and organized

AmeriSave Mortgage Corporation is considered one of the leading retail mortgage lenders in the country, with hundreds of employees serving consumers in 48 states and DC. Our goal is to provide affordable rates with expert customer service to every applicant.

Amerisave.com was designed to make shopping for mortgages easy and straight forward. You can shop, apply and request your rate lock in minimal time.
AmeriSave Mortgage Corporation offers a wide array of mortgage products, including VA, USDA, Non Conforming and FHA.

AmeriSave Mortgage Corporation offers in-house processing, underwriting, closing, and funding, so that we can better serve our customers personally and minimize delays.

title: Business Intelligence Lead
description:
Job # 540284

What You’ll Be Doing...

Be a part of the team that identifies opportunities for using data analysis to enhance the Verizon Internal Audit team’s role. The team is designed to add value and improve operations within Verizon’s Internal Audit department to provide data analytics, data mining, and continuous auditing strategies and tactics.
Provide both advisory and analytical support by identifying, developing, documenting, or executing analytics during all relevant stages of an audit.
Assist the Audit Committee of the Board of Directors and Verizon management in accomplishing their objectives.
Bring a systematic and disciplined approach to evaluate and improve the effectiveness of the overall control environment, risk management, and governance processes.
Gain extensive exposure to diverse aspects of Verizon's business through audit assist and stand-alone projects, including reporting dashboards, process automations, continuous auditing/ monitoring and risk assessment models.
Performing audit assignments including the increasing levels of responsibilities and presentations to senior management, making the team an excellent place to succeed.

You’ll Need To Have

What we’re looking for...
Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.
Four or more years of relevant work experience.
Willingness to travel up to approximately 25% of the time.

Even Better If You Have
A degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Accounting or any other relevant discipline.
Knowledge of predictive and prescriptive analytics, data mining and machine learning (Python and R).
Business analytical skills with the ability to apply business logic to design and implement data mining techniques on large data sets.
Project experience of Creative and Critical thinking.
Knowledge of Data Warehousing.
Experience in the use of Teradata SQL, MS SQL server, and Oracle SQL.
Experience with Data Visualization, particularly creating dashboards and executive reporting (Tableau or other).
Experience designing, developing, implementing and maintaining a database and programs to manage data analysis efforts.
Experience with data warehousing or analytics in a cloud environment such as AWS.
Knowledge of working with self-serve analytics tools for business users.
Knowledge of the tools, technologies and practices needed to perform in-depth analysis of both structured transactional data, and semi-structured or unstructured data.
Ability to work independently and within a team in a fast changing environment with changing priorities and changing time constraints.
Interpersonal skills and ability to multi-task.
Ability to interpret business requests and communicate findings in an intelligible manner.
Ability to communicate technical findings to non-technical audiences.
Knowledge of risk management methodology and factors.
Experience working with an audit team.
When you join Verizon...

You’ll have the power to go beyond - doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, join our team of the best and brightest. We offer great pay, amazing benefits and opportunity to learn and grow in every role. Together we’ll go far.

Equal Employment Opportunity

We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. Different makes us better.

Job Family: DSBI

Business Unit: STDBU

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Job Description

Job Summary:

The Business Intelligence Analyst acts as a subject matter expert of the data repositories available within the organization by obtaining an in-depth understanding of each source system. The BI Analyst is primarily focused on the creation, management, and availability of structured analytics. This role requires the ability to understand source data, conduct data mining and analysis, report information in a format and way understandable to end-users, and deliver reports as requested.

Essential Functions, Duties, And Responsibilities
Senior technical capability with demonstrated experience implementing and utilizing cloud-based data solutions supporting structured and unstructured data, with organization-wide data and user interaction.
Conducts data mining and analysis.
Creates reports in a format understandable to and accessible by end-users.
Aligns with partner organization solution architects to ensure that the Business Intelligence team delivers uniform results providing a consistent and supportable view of data across the organization.
Closely aligns with and supports departmental superuser and Informatics staff to proactively identify improvements to processes.
Supports senior leadership and department managers in gathering and defining business requirements to properly design solutions for business users’ need for advanced analytic capability.
Supports implemented BI solutions by: monitoring and tuning queries and data loads, addressing user questions concerning data integrity, monitoring performance and communicating functional and technical issues.

Additional Responsibilities
Maintains flexibility to adapt to a variety of workload assignments and changing priorities.
Job requires the ability to present to and teach groups of people.
Maintain working relationships cross-departmentally to assure appropriate levels of support and services.
Provides recommendations for strategies and resource allocation needed to meet system related goals.
Monitors quality improvement and auditing to ensure full compliance with federal and state guidelines.

Qualifications

Qualifications (required):
Bachelor’s degree required, emphasis in Information Science, mathematics, business management or related discipline preferred.
Experience in healthcare analytics/informatics and report development experience.
Experience with visualization tools (Qlik, Tableau, MS BI).
Expertise with desktop data analytics tools (Excel, Access).

Additional Desirable Qualifications
Knowledge of Content and structure of a Health systems Charge master.
Knowledge of Hospital reimbursement systems.
Knowledge of database structure and queries.
Working knowledge of SQL or other relational database management system and Visual Basic preferred.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
The Wright Center for Clinical and Translational Research is a leader in providing Informatics support for clinical research. The Business Intelligence Analyst role works with business subject matter experts to translate business requirements and processes into technical specifications. This role works directly with technical teams to ensure the functional business requirements are integrated into the workflow management for the technical resources. The results of the technical developments require this role to conduct a quality assurance evaluation to ensure conformance to the business requirements prior to attaining approval by a project sponsor. This role will produce and manage the entire life cycle of documents related to systems development and deployment. The production of required documentation will involve communication with subject matter experts and will include independent research so documentation specific to a phase within the systems development and deployment process can be effectively communicated and completed per the approved specifications. Responsibilities with a deployment will include continued support through versioning and end user support. Logistical reasoning will be used throughout the systems development and deployment life cycle to provide recommendations for enhancements or to identify risks to a successful deployment. A strong sense of personal initiative is required due to the need to produce results that originate from a highly complex and multifaceted organization.

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Public Administration, Health Administration, Business Administration, Industrial Engineering, Information Systems, Social Sciences or a related field of study or a combination of equivalent education, training, and experience ?Three years of experience in any combination of the following: project management, management analysis, industrial engineering, process engineering, systems development, business analysis, policy analysis, employee training, strategic planning, operations management and/or management consulting ?Demonstrated skills in project planning, requirements gathering, business analysis, business process mapping, procedural writing, process engineering, problem-solving, active listening, negotiation, conflict resolution, group visitation, written and oral communication, organization and time management, and presentation skills ?Ability to manage tasks and projects without supervision ?Ability to work collaboratively and creatively with analysts, managers and interdisciplinary teams ?Ability to conduct interviews, capture, analyze and organize information, create requirements specifications and use cases, manage information technology projects ?Demonstrated experience working in and fostering a diverse faculty, staff and student environment or commitment to do so as a staff member at VCU
Preferred Qualifications

Special Requirements

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
TechTarget is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to join its Data Analytics team. In this role, you will work with the team to build out reporting solutions (learning the business needs, documenting requirements, developing and releasing dashboards and related reporting tools) for internal stakeholders. Your projects will cross multiple departments and products, including web traffic, email marketing, branding, and account-based marketing, among others. You will support core business objectives, work to ensure the overall integrity of the data going into reports, and help the business become more data driven and efficient.

Essential Job Functions
Create dashboards, scorecards, and reports in Tableau and GoodData and incubate new reports with other reporting tools.
Use SQL to generate ad-hoc reporting for various business units.
Assist with analysis and data interpretation of raw data or statistical output.
Work with other Analysts on report automation and the overall data strategy to support future reporting needs.
Assist Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to foster relationships with business owners and develop an in-depth understanding of their needs.
Provide training and documentation for solutions released to the business.


Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Required
Bachelor’s Degree in business Intelligence, Data Science, Computer Science or another quantitative field.
1-3 years related experience in analytics and reporting.
Strong Interest in Data Visualization and experience working with Tableau, GoodData or similar Business Intelligence/ Reporting Tools preferred.
Experience with SQL and relational databases. Oracle SQL and PL/SQL skills a plus.
Ability to work and communicate with core stakeholders, with varying levels of data literacy and comfort using data.
Demonstrated ability to analyze and communicate findings in non-technical terms.
Collaborative, curious and solutions oriented with a passion for communicating stories with Data.
Ability to quickly build an understanding of TechTarget’s Business and develop technical skills/knowledge.


TechTarget, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. TechTarget strictly prohibits and does not tolerate discrimination against employees, applicants, or any other covered persons because of race, color, sex (including pregnancy), age, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, religion, creed, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, training, promotion, discipline, compensation, benefits, and termination of employment. TechTarget complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), as amended by the ADA Amendments Act, and all applicable state or local law.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Thank you for your interest in our company! To apply, click on the button above. You will be required to create an account (or sign in with an existing account). Your account will provide you access to your application information. You may review, modify, or update your information by visiting and logging into your account.

Job Function / Summary

Apply architectural concepts to design technological solutions that meet customer, operational and reporting requirements, leveraging existing technologies when possible, and ensure that new solutions are designed for optimal usefulness. Assist in the definition, creation, and distribution of enterprise business intelligence reporting. Maintain knowledge of current BI tools, methods and best practices, and recommend and implement process improvements. Support current and future information and reporting needs, distributed via electronically or paper-based, at various levels of the organization. Assist in the development and automation of efficient reporting processes and information retrieval/distribution. Actively participate in consistent development, testing, and release cycles for promotion of new information/reports to production environments.

Essential Duties

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
Translates business issues into analyses and designs appropriate systems extracts, files, and reports to address business issues.
Supports current and future Profitability Reporting, including organizational, line of business, customer, officer, and other segments, and ensure timely delivery.
Determine any trends, either positive or negative, in the loan and deposit portfolios and researches the reason and implications of such changes(s).
Implements the overall strategy for implementation of complex requests for data, including loan and deposit portfolio analytical reports.
Continuously works towards maintaining and improving business intelligence capabilities & systems resources including the OFSAA information repository, credit analytics, MCIF system, and other systems as available.
Reports template maintenance and updating for package/information delivery.
Executes automation reporting strategy.
Assists in development, roll-out, and maintenance of dashboards, for both executive and management reporting, across the enterprise.
Develops customer, product, segment, and line of business reports and business intelligence analysis.
Executes business intelligence development and release cycle, with intake and priority review, and communicates to business and end-user community.
Works with data management team to identify and document data gaps necessary for information requests and enhancements, and assists in validation once delivered.
Additional Duties:
Performs other duties and special projects as assigned by Senior Management.
Incumbent is required to comply with all applicable federal, state, and local banking and industry related laws and regulations including but not limited to the Bank Secrecy Act.

Minimum Required Education, Experience, & Knowledge
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, or related field required; master’s degree preferred
At least 1 - 3 years experience in bank reporting and profitability systems
An equivalent combination of education, training, and experience may be considered
Understanding of banking, financial services, and/or investment industry
Advanced understanding of financial reporting and analytics
Understanding of reporting tools and platforms, specifically but not limited to Financial Reporting Studio, Oracle Business Intelligence, and Hyperion Essbase SmartView, among others
Experience in development and execution through project framework for Business Intelligence and enterprise Informational Delivery strategy
Ability to understand complex financial statistics and reports
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office products including Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, and SharePoint

Essential Mental & Physical Requirements

Ability to lift/move/carry approximately 25 pounds if required to perform the essential job functions. If the employee is unable to lift/move/carry this weight and can be accommodated without causing the department/division an “undue hardship” then the employee must be accommodated; hence omitting lifting/moving/carrying as a physical requirement.

DISCLAIMER
This job description is only valid as of the date it was revised. Please contact the HR Compensation Department to obtain the latest version. Information contained herein should be treated as confidential to Hancock Whitney.
NOTHING IN THIS JOB DESCRIPTION RESTRICTS MANAGEMENT'S RIGHT TO ASSIGN OR REASSIGN DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES TO THE JOB AT ANY TIME.

Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religious beliefs, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age, physical or mental disability or history of disability, genetic information, status as a protected veteran, disabled veteran, or other protected characteristics as required by federal, state and local laws.

title: Director, Business Intelligence
description:
The customer journey starts with a question. And consumers expect answers. Yext puts businesses in control of their facts online with brand-verified answers in search. By serving accurate, consistent, brand-verified answers to consumer questions, Yext delivers authoritative information straight from the source — the business itself — no matter where or how customers are searching. Taco Bell, Marriott, Jaguar Land Rover, and businesses around the globe use the Yext platform to capture consumer intent and drive digital discovery, engagement, and revenue — all from a single source of truth. Yext’s mission is to provide perfect answers everywhere.
Yext is seeking a Director of Business Intelligence to join our Go-to-Market (GTM) Strategy team. Key responsibilities will include building out the reporting and dashboard capabilities of the GTM Strategy team and delivering valuable insights to the revenue executive team. This person must be a strong communicator and will collaborate cross-functionally with teams across multiple departments including Sales Operations, Corporate Engineering, Sales Finance, Marketing, and Product Strategy. The ideal candidate has a very strong work ethic and is both excited and comfortable solving new, complex materials.

Responsibilities

Provide strategic and operational leadership in the design, development and implementation of Go-to-market analytics
Collaborate with teams across Revenue, Finance, and Marketing to surface, explain and solve complex business problems that require deep analysis of revenue data
Leverage, manipulate and analyze revenue data to drive business decisions
Develop predictive models of revenue growth and attrition to create actionable and creative GTM strategies
Work closely with Corporate Engineering to deploy and support revenue analytics
Validate and integrate disparate large datasets
Build and maintain reports, dashboards, and metrics and monitor the integrity and validity of the reported data
Streamline workflows to craft efficiencies and actively develop ways to improve reporting, analysis and operational support

Minimum Requirements

Bachelor’s degree or similar college level education required in related field. Advanced degree in an area related to Data Analytics strongly preferred
Minimum of 7+ years of business experience in building statistical models and translating and communicating insights into actionable business recommendations
Excellent communication and cross functional collaboration skills
Experience storytelling through data
Significant experience in data, reporting, analytics and strategy
Expertise in Tableau or Looker, relational databases and SQL
Proven experience partnering with teams to drive data driven decisions
Experience using multivariate linear and logistic regression models, and knowledge of other advanced analytics methodologies
Superior analytical, quantitative and data modeling skills
Ability to develop and manage projects or process change.

Compensation, Benefits & Perks

Yext offers the following exceptional benefits: competitive compensation, 401k, unlimited snacks, daily meal allowance, flexible hours/paid time off, and excellent health/dental/vision insurance. We treat our employees well and offer tremendous growth opportunities. Challenging work pushes our people to be creative in a casual environment that is caring, fun, and collaborative. We believe that when you have smart, happy people working together you can produce something special.

About

Yext has been named a Best Place to Work by Fortune and Great Place to Work®, as well as a Best Workplace for Women. Yext is headquartered in New York City with offices in Amsterdam, Berlin, Chicago, Dallas, Geneva, London, Miami, Milan, Paris, San Francisco, Shanghai, Tokyo and the Washington, D.C. area.
Yext is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, genetics, sex, pregnancy or childbirth, sexual orientation, gender (including gender identity or nonbinary or nonconformity and/or status as a trans individual), age, physical or mental disability, citizenship, marital, parental and/or familial status, past, current or prospective service in the uniformed services, or any characteristic protected under applicable law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

description:

Position Type Full Time

Position Location Fort Bragg, NC

Tracking Code 00741

Daily Responsibilities
We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team! As a Business Intelligence Analyst you will collaborate with all other departments of our organization to include, Knowledge Management, Operations, Budget and Finance, Human Resources, Manpower, the Command Team and many more.
You will collaborate with end users to identify needs and opportunities for improved data management and delivery. Improve and streamline processes regarding data flow and data quality to improve data accuracy, viability and value.
Provide ongoing development and maintenance of a business intelligence architecture that enables fact‐based decision making and ad-hoc analysis and insight generation.

Job Profile
Business Intelligence Analysts are responsible for gathering organizational data through the USASOC data warehouse, and other information systems and platforms to include MS SharePoint, MS CRM, SQL Server and data created at the user level.
With the data collected, the Business Intelligence Analyst is expected to help develop a picture of the organization’s overall operational readiness, efficiency, or capability.
Accordingly, they are expected to be able to recommend solutions for improvement in these areas based on the data presented.

3+ years’ experience

Four-year college degree required; Computer Science, Information Technology, Finance or similar (Preferred)

Provide reports, processes and dashboards

Analyze organizational data to identify opportunities to improve outcomes through data analytics

Provide ongoing development and maintenance of an operational data store and enterprise data warehouse using BI best practices, relational structures, dimensional data modeling, structured query language skills, data warehouse and reporting techniques.

Requirements

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to contribute both independently and as part of a team
Excellent listening, communication, interpersonal and presentation skills

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
job_location: New York, New York, United States
description:
BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST - MARKETING
NEW YORK, NEW YORK
$100,000 - $120,000

*US CITIZENS OR GREEN CARD HOLDERS ONLY*

Are you a BI Analyst looking to change the e-commerce industry? If so, this opportunity with a growing SaaS company is the one for you.

THE COMPANY
This rapidly growing e-commerce, digital marketing company is looking for a young, tech-savvy, skilled BI analyst to join their team in the heart of New York! You will have the opportunity to work in a fun-fast paced environment at this SaaS company and work closely with their teams from all over the world.

THE ROLE – BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST
Working with a vibrant team in the heart of New York, you will be challenged in the right way and work with some incredibly bright colleagues that will encourage your work and provide stimulating commercial discussions. You will have the opportunity to work on many different components that influence consumer interactions and experiences online.

As a BI Analyst, your responsibilities will include:
Utilize data visualization tools to promote the use of data driven decision making
Meeting and working with stakeholders to understand business needs
Pulling data from Redshift in an AWS environment using SQL
Creating pipelines and dashboards in tableau

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
You will need:
Educated to a degree level in a numerate discipline (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering)
Proven experience with a Business Intelligence Tool
Advanced SQL experience
Proven commercial experience with tableau
Advanced experience with sales and marketing data

HOW TO APPLY
Please register your interest by sending your CV to Caroline Schlueter via the Apply link on this page.

KEYWORDS
Analyst, Business Intelligence, SQL, Data Visualization, Tableau, QlikView, Sales, Marketing, SAAS

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
At ServiceSource, we strive to find and grow exceptional people like you.

Working at ServiceSource, you will be a part of an engaging, energetic, and entrepreneurial work environment while having the stability and influence of a nearly 20-year industry leader behind you.

ServiceSource is a place where you can GROW, both personally and professionally, while expanding your skills in sales, customer success and people management.

The Business Intelligence Analyst will lead business decisions for customers and/or stakeholders by developing and providing thorough data analysis and by creating reports of patterns, insights and trends. This role will independently mine data from a variety of data sources in order to design impactful recommendations to internal and/or external stakeholders. These insights will help solve moderately complex business problems, implement best practices and optimize business performance. The Business Analyst will create specifications for reports and analysis based on in-depth assessment and understanding of business needs and data available. The role will ensure processes are followed and any fall out are addressed properly by using high level of independent judgement and decision making. The Analyst will receive mentorship on highly complex issues from more senior staff and/or management as needed. The position requires an expanded knowledge of analysis solutions/tools and domain languages. May need to be proficient in Customer Relationship Management (CRM) databases and/or Business Intelligence (BI) Tools.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Our Phoenix client is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst interested in Power BI reporting and design, SQL, and visualization to join their progressive team. 

This position is currently unable to provide sponsorship.

You'll have experience working as a business intelligence developer. This means developing reports, ETL Processes, Unit Testing, Documentation and Production Support.

Qualifications
1 - 5 years’ experience as a Business Intelligence Developer or Analyst
Hands-on technical experience developing reports and dashboards using Power BI.
Hands-on technical experience with MS SQL Server developing SQL Views and Stored Procedures.
Excellent verbal communication skills, including the ability to ask clear questions to understand requirements.
Attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to complete work on a timely basis in an Agile environment.
Experience with any of the following is preferred: SQL Reporting Services (SSRS), SQL Integration Services (SSIS), Azure SQL, Azure Data Factory, Azure Analysis Services, best practices in data visualization, Azure Data Bricks.

Key Areas of Responsibility
Report Developmentor Design
ETL Development
Responding to Production Support Issues
Working for the BI Team in an Agile environment

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Founded in Tokyo in 2012, SmartNews has quickly become the go-to source of news for millions of users around the world, and a leading news aggregation mobile app. Our mission is bigger than simply aggregating news, we are working to break through the filter bubble and deliver the world’s quality information to the people who need it.

We have big problems and challenges to solve in order to achieve our mission. We are looking for someone with an insatiable curiosity to deeply understand user experiences and content consumption, and a passion to build a world-class, data-driven product. As a Business Intelligence (BI) analyst, you will be in charge of managing all SmartNews data for all regular key reporting. You will be partnering with Data Engineers to build the fundamental data solutions by designing customer friendly dashboards, reporting structures, data models and schemas, as well as data warehouse architecture to facilitate the data-driven decision-making process at SmartNews.

Responsibilities
Work closely with data scientists, data engineers, and product managers, who are improving our product and user satisfaction in a data-driven way
Own and lead the design and implementation of dashboards end to end based on deep understanding of user requirements
Surface metrics and data insights via dashboards and reports for both internal and external use
Cooperate with data scientists and product managers to calculate KPIs and share them across the company
Own and improve data pipelines that feed into dashboards and reports (while cooperating with data engineers)
Own dashboarding tools and ensure they are being used in an efficient and organized way across the company
Execute ad hoc data pulls as a SQL expert
Perform benchmark analyses to help stakeholders understand trends

Requirements
Technical / quantitative university degree or equivalent experience
3+ years experience as a BI analyst or Data Analyst
Advanced SQL and experience writing complex queries
Advanced data visualization skills and experience with dashboarding tools such as Tableau or Chartio
Good communication skills with an ability to tell stories using dashboards and provide actionable insights

Nice to Haves
Experience related to mobile apps or websites
Programming experience (Python, R, Java, etc.), and experience with Unix
Experience with data workflow tools like Azkaban or Airflow

title: Director, Business Intelligence
description:
The customer journey starts with a question. And consumers expect answers. Yext puts businesses in control of their facts online with brand-verified answers in search. By serving accurate, consistent, brand-verified answers to consumer questions, Yext delivers authoritative information straight from the source — the business itself — no matter where or how customers are searching. Taco Bell, Marriott, Jaguar Land Rover, and businesses around the globe use the Yext platform to capture consumer intent and drive digital discovery, engagement, and revenue — all from a single source of truth. Yext’s mission is to provide perfect answers everywhere.

Yext is seeking a Director of Business Intelligence to join our Go-to-Market (GTM) Strategy team. Key responsibilities will include building out the reporting and dashboard capabilities of the GTM Strategy team and delivering valuable insights to the revenue executive team. This person must be a strong communicator and will collaborate cross-functionally with teams across multiple departments including Sales Operations, Corporate Engineering, Sales Finance, Marketing, and Product Strategy. The ideal candidate has a very strong work ethic and is both excited and comfortable solving new, complex materials.

Responsibilities
Provide strategic and operational leadership in the design, development and implementation of Go-to-market analytics
Collaborate with teams across Revenue, Finance, and Marketing to surface, explain and solve complex business problems that require deep analysis of revenue data
Leverage, manipulate and analyze revenue data to drive business decisions
Develop predictive models of revenue growth and attrition to create actionable and creative GTM strategies
Work closely with Corporate Engineering to deploy and support revenue analytics
Validate and integrate disparate large datasets
Build and maintain reports, dashboards, and metrics and monitor the integrity and validity of the reported data
Streamline workflows to craft efficiencies and actively develop ways to improve reporting, analysis and operational support


Minimum Requirements
Bachelor’s degree or similar college level education required in related field. Advanced degree in an area related to Data Analytics strongly preferred
Minimum of 7+ years of business experience in building statistical models and translating and communicating insights into actionable business recommendations
Excellent communication and cross functional collaboration skills
Experience storytelling through data
Significant experience in data, reporting, analytics and strategy
Expertise in Tableau or Looker, relational databases and SQL
Proven experience partnering with teams to drive data driven decisions
Experience using multivariate linear and logistic regression models, and knowledge of other advanced analytics methodologies
Superior analytical, quantitative and data modeling skills
Ability to develop and manage projects or process change.


Compensation, Benefits & Perks

Yext offers the following exceptional benefits: competitive compensation, 401k, unlimited snacks, daily meal allowance, flexible hours/paid time off, and excellent health/dental/vision insurance. We treat our employees well and offer tremendous growth opportunities. Challenging work pushes our people to be creative in a casual environment that is caring, fun, and collaborative. We believe that when you have smart, happy people working together you can produce something special.

About

Yext has been named a Best Place to Work by Fortune and Great Place to Work®, as well as a Best Workplace for Women. Yext is headquartered in New York City with offices in Amsterdam, Berlin, Chicago, Dallas, Geneva, London, Miami, Milan, Paris, San Francisco, Shanghai, Tokyo and the Washington, D.C. area.

Yext is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, genetics, sex, pregnancy or childbirth, sexual orientation, gender (including gender identity or nonbinary or nonconformity and/or status as a trans individual), age, physical or mental disability, citizenship, marital, parental and/or familial status, past, current or prospective service in the uniformed services, or any characteristic protected under applicable law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Category

Information Technology

Dulles, VA
