Position Type

Full-Time/Regular

CALIBRE Systems, Inc., an employee-owned Management Consulting and Digital Transformation company, is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to work full-time out in Dulles,VA. Candidate must possess an active TS/SCI with full scope poly security clearance to be eligible for this role.

The successful candidate will work with customers and within a small to medium team to design and develop business intelligence reports and products to analyze success metrics to evaluate and recommend enhancements to existing and new business processes. Analysis of existing customer requirements with attention on understanding the full picture will be critical to the success of this position. The applicant should have experience in various business intelligence and reporting platforms such as Cognos, Tableau, and SharePoint. Proven experience developing business performance reports and summaries is required.

The candidate is expected to actively participate in requirements capture and definition meetings with the client, and may be responsible for designing and executing reporting strategies as well as producing professional presentations and reports to be consumed at the executive level. Additionally, the candidate must be equally comfortable working independently or with a team, be self-motivated, exhibit exceptional problem-solving skills, and have an aptitude for learning new information and methodologies. The position is located in Northern Virginia, but exact location may vary. Up to 10% local travel is required.

Required Skills
Must hold an active Top Secret/SCI clearance with polygraph
Experience with business intelligence tools such as Cognos, Tableau, SharePoint
Strong analytical and comprehension skills
Excellent interpersonal, communication, and organization skills
Self-motivated, responsible, organized, detail oriented, quick learner, and a team player
Must possess a high attention to detail


Required Experience
A minimum of 5 years of business intelligence reporting experience
Two years of demonstrated Cognos, Tableau, or SharePoint reporting experience
Experience with business data analysis and reporting
Ability to multi-task and coordinate and prioritize multiple work streams
Two years in secure US Government environments (preferred)


Education Requirement
Bachelor's Degree in IT field is preferred. (Other education, commensurate experience and demonstrated ability of individual may be substituted.)


CALIBRE and its subsidiaries are an Equal Opportunity Employer and supports transitioning service members, veterans and individuals with disabilities. We offer a competitive salary and full benefits package. To be considered, please apply via our website at www.calibresys.com. Come join our dynamic team. #CALIBRECareers #SPEARCareers

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Eastman is a global specialty materials company that produces a broad range of products found in items people use every day. With the purpose of enhancing the quality of life in a material way, Eastman works with customers to deliver innovative products and solutions while maintaining a commitment to safety and sustainability. The company’s innovation-driven growth model takes advantage of world-class technology platforms, deep customer engagement, and differentiated application development to grow its leading positions in attractive end-markets such as transportation, building and construction, and consumables. As a globally inclusive and diverse company, Eastman employs approximately 14,500 people around the world and serves customers in more than 100 countries. The company had 2018 revenues of approximately $10 billion and is headquartered in Kingsport, Tennessee, USA. For more information, visit www.eastman.com.

Positions available in both ST. LOUIS, MO and KINGSPORT, TN

As a Business Intelligence Analyst in Eastman’s EIM (Enterprise Information Management) organization, you design, develop, and implement information systems integrating operational and business data to generate insight and improve finance, supply chain, and enterprise performance. You work collaboratively with various functional units, business, information technology, and data science teams to understand needs, capabilities, and gaps and then create solutions that help us increase productivity, improve quality, and meet customer demand reliably and cost-effectively. And you do so in a collaborative workspace where creativity is the core of your success.

We are looking for a curious and creative person who loves to learn and relishes problem-solving. You are not a back-office order taker, but rather want to engage the clients of your work and iterate between their needs and your deliverables to produce highly functional products. You can prioritize work, handle multiple tasks, achieve goals and deliver timely and accurate results. You constantly look for ways to improve things, not only for yourself and your workgroup, but also for your clients. You must be good team player who work collaboratively in small teams to improve the operations of immediate work group by offering ideas, identifying issues, and respecting team members.

Job Requirements / Qualifications
Bachelor's degree required, preferably in computer science but will consider another technical degree where you can also demonstrate strong computer science skills learned in some other setting
For internal candidates, relevant experience is a big plus, but we’re also willing to allow for some on-the-job development if you’ve got a track record of learning quickly. The more of the following areas of expertise you have, the better you fit what we are looking for:
Data integration – data modeling, extract/transform/load, job automation/orchestration
Relational databases and SQL – Microsoft SQL Server is a plus
Visual analytics, especially with Microsoft PowerBI and SQL Server Reporting Service
Understanding of SAP modules like SD and PA is a plus

Eastman Chemical Company is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other characteristics protected by law.

Eastman is committed to creating a powerfully diverse workforce and a broadly inclusive workplace, where everyone can contribute to their fullest potential each day.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will work with stakeholders in Revenue Management and Pricing, Finance, Sales and Marketing, as well as your colleagues in Engineering to gather, analyze and visualize data; use it to tell a story, identify opportunities and better inform our strategy.
We are looking for an individual with the right mix of technical, analytical and communication skills. You will need to be able to take requirements from the business and rapidly translate them into the steps necessary to meet a minimum viable product. This will require an in-depth knowledge of our business model, our data warehouse and various other data sources, internal and external alike.

Responsibilities
Expert cleaning, transforming and testing of data and assumptions
Interpretation and analysis of results using statistical techniques
Presentation of Tableau dashboards to management and the business
Requirements
This is a highly visible position located in our Fort Lauderdale office
4+ years' experience in business analysis, data analysis, consulting
Demonstrable experience designing and delivering dashboards in Tableau
Reasonable fluency in SQL
Familiarity with data modelling
Excellent communication skills
Bachelor's degree in analytical fields such as Engineering, CS, Mathematics, Physics preferred
Python or other scripting a major plus for getting access to data and automating your product

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
The Business Intelligence Analyst will work as part of the technical data management team, supporting the needs of the organization. They will work with business units and development departments to deliver data aggregations to executives to assist in strategic decision making. The role will be at the forefront of the information quality and contribute to end to end data quality across the company.

Collects, analyzes, and interprets information from multiple data sources identifying actionable insights that create efficiencies and generate revenue
Provide the tools for executives to make strategic decisions
Provide the information for executives to make strong business decisions.
Completes ad hoc analysis to measure benefits and risks of company level initiatives.
Partners with key stakeholders to plan, coordinate, and facilitate company level reporting.
Translate business requirements into data models that are easy to understand and used by different disciplines across the company.
Provides insight to financial and operational analyses and business impact.
Develops reports and/or presentations leveraging data visualization tools that clearly and concisely communicate analytical findings and recommendations to key stakeholders
Completes ad hoc projects as requested
Provides root/cause analysis to support decision-making by effectively communicating and translating the results into business insights and actions
Collaborates with analytics and business teams to improve data models that feed business intelligence tools, increasing data accessibility and fostering data-driven decision making across the organization.
Implements processes and systems to monitor data quality, ensuring production data is always accurate and available for key stakeholders and business processes that depend on it.
Performs data analysis required to troubleshoot data related issues and assist in the resolution of data issues
Works closely with all business units and engineering teams to develop strategy for long term data platform architecture.
Performs all other duties as assigned
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or other relevant disciplines understanding relational databases and experience with data mining
3+ years’ experience with software &/or data quality assurance required
Demonstrated proficiency with SQL for creating/modifying queries
Experience in data mining, analysis and reporting
Key attention to detail
Analytical thinker with business acumen
Possesses comprehensive technical knowledge of Retail Operations
Performs work under minimal supervision
May provide leadership, coaching, and/or mentoring to subordinate analyst(s)
Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills
Process oriented with great documentation skills
Ability to network and establish cross-functional relationships to work effectively with cross-functional teams to acquire knowledge, and drive system solutions
Excellent oral and written communication skills with a keen sense of customer service

title: Business Intelligence Specialist
description:
Join our Winning Team as a Business Intelligence Specialist
When was the last time you bragged about where you work? At CARFAX, we do it every day. Why? Because we're proud to work for a company with a strong mission and trusted brand. We're proud to work with like-minded people who care about what they do and work hard every day to deliver their best. We've created the type of company culture where the term, "work- hard play- hard" is taken to new heights. Everything from annual company outings, to monthly new hire happy hours and being a dog friendly work place. And don't forget about the gear! Every day you will see CARFAXers walking around the office sporting CARFAX t-shirts, hats, backpacks and more. Are you looking to join a company you'll be proud to show off? If so, take a detour from the daily grind and apply today!
As a Business Intelligence Specialist you will help provide trusted reporting, data, and analytics for CARFAX to demonstrate value across business channels, assess product performance and influence direction, and support internal business operations.

As a Business Intelligence Specialist You Will
Partner with CARFAX departments and establish relationships with internal clients to provide information to help make strong, informed business decisions.
Work closely with members of the BI team to develop solutions to business challenges
Be an integral part of process improvement to continuously increase efficiencies
Have opportunities to think creatively and to learn new tools and technologies
To Be Considered For This Role, You Will Need
2-5 years' of experience in report development, business analytics, business intelligence or comparable data engineering role, including a solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, i.e. date modeling and use of business intelligence tools, techniques and technology
Strong SQL skills are required. Must have the ability to write complex, highly-optimized queries across large volumes of data
A strong business acumen and the ability to work directly with business users to understand requirements and develop effective reporting solutions
Ability to develop reports, dashboards, and analysis utilizing one or more commercial BI suite of tools, such as Microstrategy, Power BI, Tableau or equivalent
To develop technical documentation to support ongoing maintenance of reporting and data solutions
Experience working with cross-functional teams including business clients, business analysts, data modelers, testers, and other developers in design, development, implementation, and support of new and existing solutions
To champion data quality, integrity, and reliability by designing and promoting best practices
Experience with Agile Frameworks, JIRA and Confluence a plus

description:
Manager Business Intelligence

Responsibilities

OPPD’s Business Technology group is looking for a BI Manager. In this role you will be leading our BI Solution Development team responsible for business intelligence planning, development, maintenance and service operations in order to ensure the highest quality of enterprise data and business intelligence services. Under your leadership, the BI Solution team will execute BI and Enterprise Data Management strategies related to data integration, data warehousing, IoT and Big Data solutioning. Furthermore, your activities will include governance of BI standards, policies and procedures as well as consultation and presentation of complex data solutions. You will collaborate with the Business Technology leadership team and interact with peers across OPPD business units to ensure alignment with OPPD’s objectives and strategic initiatives to strengthen OPPD as an industry leader, employer of choice, and community partner. You will be accountable for the management, successful implementation and realization of assigned tactical and operational plans.
Build and maintain a competent/capable team of staff in alignment with OPPD’s Accountable Management System (AMS) guidelines.
Lead and manage an agile business intelligence team
Effectively apply OPPD’s Managerial Leadership Practices (MLPs) (i.e.: Management Accountabilities, Talent Inventory, Succession Planning, Organizational Performance Planning, Clarity Building, etc.) for assigned staff.
Develop and implement Individual Development Plans (IDPs) for all direct reports targeting: specific performance gaps necessary to fulfill the work of the Role, any currently assigned Key Accountabilities (KAs), or any special assignments designed to enhance the effectiveness of Role, Department, Division (Completed Annually)
Develop and maintain a set of staff performance metrics.
Accountable to develop and implement plans and programs (1-2 years in scope) to achieve OPPD and Business Technology and Building Services (BTBS) strategic objectives and to deliver desired outputs/assigned KAs.
Serve as the direct leader of business intelligence professionals in relation to the engineering, design, development and maintenance of the District’s business intelligence technology, the BI related agreements/contracts with external entities and the collaboration/coordination across business units and functional IT areas.
Inspire understanding of OPPD’s vision consistent with Core Values and team culture. Create a collaborative and inclusive team environment and develop team members through coaching, training, and ongoing performance feedback. Conduct performance reviews, champion employee engagement and encourage employee development.
Collaborate with all Business Technology leadership and teams and serve as an initiator and driver of continuous improvement and agile principles.
Model what Good looks like
Ensure and promote team practices for ongoing development of BI expertise, skill mastery and innovation
Ensure adherence to best practices in SDLC management, agile work management, operational safety standards and OPPD code of conduct.
Participate in, and provide guidance and leadership on BT strategic initiatives such as the enablement of Self-Service Business Intelligence, Data Governance, Intelligent grid modernizations, and other initiatives as identified through strategic planning.
Lead and influence the design, integration and ownership of all end-to-end processes, policies, and practices utilized within assigned scope of control.
Develop and maintain a set performance metrics. Monitor, adjust as needed, track, and develop reporting and analysis as scheduled.
Manage on-call rotations and schedules and define escalation policies that meet departments business continuity requirements.
Required

Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering or related field.
Minimum of 5 years of experience managing/leading BI solution teams.
Minimum of 10 years of BI and/or Application development experience.
Experience managing 24x7 IT operations with a service orientation.
Ability to synthesize large quantities of information, create linkages, and express complex concepts in a concise and audience-relevant manner.
Persuasive, effective communicator - via excellent written or oral communications skills.
Demonstrated previous work experience effectively overseeing the coordination and execution of BI projects.
Demonstrates good understanding of business and financial aspects of IT.
Must be able to partner effectively across all level of the organization
A good familiarity with other IT technologies such as storage area networks (SAN), RDBMS, and core Microsoft technologies including but not limited to Windows Servers, Active Directory, VMWARE, and VDI.
Desired
Master’s Degree with a technology focus or MBA.
ITIL or COBIT certification.
Certifications in Microsoft or Oracle technologies.
PMP Certification (Project Management Professional).
Time Demands
This position is considered an “essential position” meaning when business necessity and continuity needs are emergent, this position will be required to report to work and may be required to work hours beyond an employee’s normal shift.
Must maintain 24-hour availability for technical and professional assistance, emergency response, and directing remedial action in response to such emergencies, as well as maintain availability as required for on call duty.

S8

Midpoint: $141,577
Org Marketing Statement
EOE: Protected Veterans/Disability

title: Business Intelligence - Lead
description:
Job Req ID: 231139

Position Number: 00154477

Employment Type: Full Time

Shift: Variable/On Call

Shift Details: M-F, 1st Shift

Standard Hours: 40.00

Department Name: IAS Care Delivery Analytics

Location: Corporate Operations

Location Details: 2709 Water Ridge Pkwy

Carolinas HealthCare System is Atrium Health. Our mission remains the same: to improve health, elevate hope and advance healing - for all. The name Atrium Health allows us to grow beyond our current walls and geographical borders to impact as many lives as possible and deliver solutions that help communities thrive. For more information, please visit carolinashealthcare.org/AtriumHealth

Job Summary

Manages and facilitates significant analytic initiatives in support System strategic, operational and quality projects. Coordinates with facility team members and translates the business needs into analytic and reporting strategies through the development, execution, and resourcing of routine and project specific plans for analytics delivery.

Essential Functions
Leads the evaluation of the request for service to understand business and technical open issues to be clarified with the client.
Coordinates with client to thoroughly understand the business needs, project scope, and anticipated deliverable associated with the request for service.
Recommends to the client processes to balance the data needs for the project against the urgency and requirements for action.
Translates the defined business needs to a set of meaningful metrics and analytics.
Provides value added analysis and recommended follow-up action in support of the business needs.
Leads the process to integrate data from multiple sources to a single dataset for analysis.
Leads the review and validation of complex, custom datasets specific to the project.
Recommends to the client a method of delivering results from the project to meet current and on-going needs.

Physical Requirements

Works in an environment, sitting at a desk, working with a computer, talking on the telephone, and preparing reports and other statistical data. Some of the time is spent in meetings at a variety of facilities, making presentation and offering advice to System executives. Must be able to stand, walk, and travel in personal car to other facilities occasionally. Must be able to carry up to 25 lbs of materials. Requires the ability to work rapidly and accurately under pressure, to work in a safe and effective manner, and to handle different issues and priorities simultaneously.

Education, Experience And Certifications

Bachelors Degree required; Masters Degree preferred. 5 to 7 years of experience in a healthcare or business analytics setting. Experience with Business Intelligence tools required. Thoroughly understands the elements of the Data Models relevant to assigned projects and identifies data integrity issues using complex analysis of the data. Must be able to work rapidly and accurately under pressure to work in a safe and effective manner and to handle different issues and priorities simultaneously.

At Atrium Health, formerly Carolinas HealthCare System, our patients, communities and teammates are at the center of everything we do. Our commitment to diversity and inclusion allows us to deliver care that is superior in quality and compassion across our network of more than 900 care locations.

As a leading, innovative health system, we promote an environment where differences are valued and integrated into our workforce. Our culture of inclusion and cultural competence allows us to achieve our goals and deliver the best possible experience to patients and the communities we serve.

Posting Notes: Not Applicable

Carolinas HealthCare System is an EOE/AA Employer

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Responsibilities

Vary by project but may include:

Identifies clients business needs for systems development, performing requirement analysis, documentation of requirements and partners with developers to ensure appropriate solutions are designed

Work with our clients to understand their needs (fixing a broken process, converting outdated systems, complying with new regulations, etc.), and represent those needs to technology teams who build solutions

Provide advice and education in the usage and interpretation of business data relevant to the business unit

Document work flow using Business Process Modeling tools

Instill best practices and assists users at all levels within the company on how to leverage BI capabilities for accurate reporting and analysis

Build relationships with key client stakeholders to understand their business structure, policies, and operations and to ensure the project maintains compliance

Analyze, specify, model, and document stakeholder needs throughout the project to ensure they are specific, complete, and realistic

Facilitate change management and obtain necessary support to implement improved business processes

Facilitate the development of training and implementation material and post-implementation support

Understand data elements in the warehouse at a very detailed grain to support any form of user needs from research to adhoc querying to managing large information projects
Query large datasets and tables comfortably to provide information requested by business users

Qualifications

Our best Business Intelligence Analysts possess most of the following:

4+ years relevant technical or business work experience

Bachelors Degree in Business, Management, Finance, Economics, or similar required

Strong attention to detail with a focus on end-user (stakeholder) needs

Analytical mindset focused on process and data analysis

Strong knowledge in SQL/Query

Basic Word, intermediate Excel skills
Ability to quickly adapt to new methods, work under tight deadlines and stressful conditions

Ability to take complex data and processes and highlight useful information, identify gaps, propose solutions, and support decision making

Client service mindset must possess positive attitude and do whatever it takes to ensure the project meets client needs

Strong work ethic willing to work the hardest and go the extra mile to achieve project success and client satisfaction

Ability to influence others and lead without authority

Strong written, presentation, and verbal communication, including clear structure and main point communication

Excels in ambiguous environments, where quick learning and rapid decision making are important

Creative problem solver able to take multiple approaches to a single problem

Has the ability to bridge the gap between vague and abstract ideas and produce clear, concise documentation and verbal explanations for any business need

title: Director of Business Intelligence
company_name: The University of Texas at Dallas
description:
# Posting Details
## Job Summary
The Director of Business Intelligence will coordinate and manage the activities of a team technical staff, both employees and consultants, in the design, development and delivery of Data Warehouse, OBIEE, and Business Intelligence solutions to produce high-quality and reliable business intelligence output to support strategic University initiatives. This position will partner with a diverse community of stakeholders system-wide to evaluate business needs and ensure these needs have been met successfully by directing the activities of technical staff.
## Minimum Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree and 10 years of related experience
5 years of experience managing direct reports
## Preferred Education and Experience
A minimum of ten years of IT enterprise related experience.
A Bachelor’s degree in computer science, management information systems, business, or related field. A Master’s Degree is preferred.
Experience with PeopleSoft Enterprise Resource Planning applications.
Familiarity with current architectural directions and industry standards related to development of business intelligence platforms and data warehouse.
Proven ability to supervise, train and motivate staff with emphasis on supervising the work of others including reviewing work and ensuring quality standards.
Ability to demonstrate self-initiative as well as work as a member of a team.
Experience with a higher education institution.
Experience in cloud computing technologies such as AWS.
Experience with data analytics technologies/projects.
Experience with building a data warehouse to support ERP systems.
Experience with Data Governance and supporting data quality initiatives.
Strong organizational skills to manage multiple assignments and priorities.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to communicate effectively, both orally and written, with technical and non-technical users, managers, vendors, and consultants.
Experience working in producing quality deliverables and meeting project schedules.
Ability to demonstrate tact and diplomacy, and to maintain a high level of confidentiality.
Ability to demonstrate self-initiative as well as to work well as a team.
Demonstrated sensitivity to diverse user backgrounds and needs.
## Essential Duties and Responsibilities
55% Provides strategic planning, operational planning, implementation oversight, leadership, and management of all activities to support business intelligence, ETL/data modeling, data warehousing, and OBIEE.
5% Implements best practices in business intelligence and expands the capabilities of BI technologies that deliver enterprise-wide reporting, analytics, and data warehousing solutions.
5% Works collaboratively with service offices and administrators throughout the University System to successfully support the use of data for improved decision making.
10% Human Resources & Staffing: Oversee recruiting, hiring, evaluations and disciplinary actions. Ensure staff adhere to established standards for completion of their work. Review staff training plans to ensure that plans align with current technologies and needs. Provide input into performance goals and evaluations to measure and affect the strategic goals of UT SIS.
10% Financial management and planning. Project short- and long-term acquisitions related to development of business intelligence platforms and data warehouse that support industry standards. Work closely with business services to ensure financial stability of technology services. Identify new ways to support financial goals.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Business Intelligence Analyst 
The Business Intelligence Analyst (BI Analyst) understands business strategy and designs reporting to provide actionable information to support strategic decision-making. This position also facilitates development of reporting solutions to meet the operational data needs of business areas across the organization. This position analyzes, visualizes, and provides analytics on large amounts of diverse data to tell a story and produce executive reports for the senior leadership team. The BI Analyst is also responsible for gathering requirements and designing reporting applications working closely with business users and developers. 

Job-Specific Requirements
Must have a Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, and Information Systems).
Must have at least three years of experience in data extraction and analysis using BI tools.
Must have at least three years of experience in designing BI dashboards and reporting applications.
Strong proficiency in data visualization and reporting is required.
Must have the ability to manipulate large data sets and identify trends using BI tools.
Must be proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, Visio and PowerPoint.
Must have strong communications skills in relating complex subject matter to senior management.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills are required.
  Success Factors
Personal characteristics that would contribute to the incumbent’s ability to excel within this position are:
Ability to communicate complex ideas and analytical concepts clearly both in written and verbal formats.
Ability to quickly comprehend business needs and translate them to requirements.
Ability to interpret and visualize data.
Ability to identify trends in the data and tell the story.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Founded in Tokyo in 2012, SmartNews has quickly become the go-to source of news for millions of users around the world, and a leading news aggregation mobile app. Our mission is bigger than simply aggregating news, we are working to break through the filter bubble and deliver the world’s quality information to the people who need it. We have big problems and challenges to solve in order to achieve our mission. We are looking for someone with an insatiable curiosity to deeply understand user experiences and content consumption, and a passion to build a world-class, data-driven product. As a Business Intelligence (BI) analyst, you will be in charge of managing all SmartNews data for all regular key reporting. You will be partnering with Data Engineers to build the fundamental data solutions by designing customer friendly dashboards, reporting structures, data models and schemas, as well as data warehouse architecture to facilitate the data-driven decision-making process at SmartNews. title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Chenoa is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst for our direct client!
Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Location: Holmdel, NJ, Bethlehem, PA or New York, NY
Duration: Contract to hire
Interview mode: Phone and In person

Position Summary

Individuals within the Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst role deliver business intelligence & reporting solutions using a set of very efficient processes. In addition, BI analysts fulfill ongoing ad-hoc request demands and look for self-service solutions. They work closely with other CGM data, reporting and analytics units, business partners and IT leaders to identify, prioritize, execute and communicate the appropriate reporting solutions. It is essential that BI Analysts build an understanding of the CGM organization at a level of detail that enables them to provide best in class reporting solutions. They provide data that is accurate, congruent and reliable, and ensure the information is easily available to user for direct consumption or integration with other systems. BI Analysts educate and train business partners and clients to use the data as an analytical tool, displaying the information in new forms and content for analysis and option exploration.
BI Analysts work with users to understand and determine business requirements, priorities, define key performance indicators (KPI), and develop BI and data warehouse (DW) strategy. They conduct analyses of functional business processes and functional business requirements and participate in the development teams to design, and document dashboards, alerts, and reports.
BI Analysts understand how data is turned into information and knowledge and how that knowledge supports and enables key business processes. They must have an in-depth understanding of the business environment and an interest in going beyond the obvious, delving into the source, the definition, philosophy, foundational roots of a data element to create information. They must work well within a team environment.

Responsibilities

Provides on-going delivery of recurring reporting solutions
Responds timely to ongoing new ad-hoc requests and look for optimal ways to deliver
Provides automations of existing processes; using the optimal technology and processes
Works on complex and cross-functional IT and business intelligence solutions
Works on multiple tasks/projects as team member or leader or functional lead
Participates in workstream planning process including inception, technical design, development, testing and delivery o BI solutions
May participate in project management estimation process
Works with internal and external customers and IT partners to develop and analyze business intelligence needs
Provides input to business requirements for the design of solutions
Interprets business requirements and determines optimum BI solutions to meet needs
Identifies and provides input to new technology opportunities that will have an impact on the Enterprise wide BI systems
Designs Institute-wide "views" and custom reports
Perform analysis for a wide range of requests using data in different formats and from various platforms
Researches business problems and creates models that help analyze these business problems
Provides input to the development of information quality metrics
Researches tools, frameworks and mechanisms for data analytics
Interfaces with vendors to keep abreast of new technologies, pricing and customer applicability
Participates in vendor evaluations
Adheres to current standards
Provides input to standards, policies and procedures for the form, structure, and attributes of the BI tools and systems
Designs and delivers end-user training and training materials
Trains users to transform data into action-oriented information and to use correctly
Provide guidance, training, and problem-solving assistance to other team members
Coaches less-experienced individuals
This position reports to the Director-Business Intelligence Delivery, who in turn, reports to the VP, CGM Data Reporting & Business Analytics

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Management or specialized training / certification or equivalent work experience
Typically requires a minimum of 4-6 years of Business Analysis or related technical experience
Excellent understanding of database concepts and data warehousing concept are required
Strong experience with RDBMS; strong SQL skills required
Experience with ETL and data blending tools (Informatica, Syncsort, Alteryx)
Experience with BI and Data Visualization tools (Business Objects/Tableau/Qlikview/Cognos etc.)
Moderate to high development usage of Microsoft Access and Excel
Familiarity with Hadoop, Hive, SQL Workbench, Hue etc. preferred
Proven ability to create reports from existing databases and non-relational data sources
Candidates interested in this position, please click on the Quick Apply button or send your resume to dgohel (at) chenoainc (dot) com with your expected hourly rate.
Reach out to Dhiren Gohel at 908-409-6256 with any questions.
provided by Dice
Pandologic. Keywords: Business Intelligence Director, Location: Bethlehem, PA - 18018
